X_7kce7IEW2D9-9ROuRTIQ.text: Just celebrated my birthday with dinner at Gallagher's.  Yes it was really good. We were seated close to the kitchen and boy did I have a big reminder of what hard work restaurant work is!!!   I mostly wanted to comment on the service. It was exceptional. Bryan was our server and Mikey was his helper(?). They were so nice and friendly. Came around just enough.  We're local so don't know when we will return. There are so many more steak houses we need to try!! Thanks Bryan and Mikey for singing "Happy Birthday"

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Pq62mMZY5-6MF2Nk6oE-tg.text: Not bad of a place...atmosphere is loud and lively, ordered their famous dry aged rib eye and the flavor was great and cooked perfectly but the meat itself was a bit on the chewy side.  Hubby got the porterhouse which was more tender than the rib eye so it was pretty yummy.  Portion was a good amount...we definitely could have shared one steak.  Service was great so overall a good experience.

mdf9UrNmkvuWTM17f885ig.text: Really excellent place. Our server was attentive and made fantastic suggestions. I told him I was going to order a filet and to bring me a glass of whatever wine he thought would pair best. He chose a Pinot Noir that was indeed a great pairing.   Onto the food... My filet was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. My dining partner went with the dry aged NY strip and it was gigantic. Two inches thick at least. He carved every shred of meat from the bone and when he was done, pointed to the bone and said "I'm gonna miss you."  I've eaten a lot of steaks with this guy and that was definitely a first. I almost thought he would start tearing up over it.   We also got a Caesar salad, Brussels sprouts with bacon, and the side on special that night, mashed cheesy potatoes with bacon. I get Caesar salads everywhere because I love them, but this one will be skipped next time. It was just meh. For $9 I don't need a meh salad. The sprouts were excellent. And the potatoes. Oh, the potatoes. They are easily the best mashed potatoes I've ever had. I could've eaten the entire shareable portion myself.   It was a pricey place but that's what can be expected for a nice steakhouse on the Vegas strip. All in all, totally worth it.

jJ7SVaYN_DN9RcR4jzGokg.text: My family and I have been visiting this restaurant for years. Sammy always takes care of us. He's a great waiter and provides fantastic customer service to his guests here. The food is of course so incredibly delicious too. My most recent visit was over labor day weekend last year. We ordered the filet minion, mashed potatoes, asparagus and a bottle of red wine. The filet was juicy and delicious, the mashed potatoes were warm and buttery, and the asparagus was juicy and crisp as well. I love taking a photo at the restaurant too - it's a nice romantic touch or a great way to capture a group memory. I'll continue dining at the restaurant - 15 years and counting...!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vino
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes bread &amp; asparagus

j4f2IfLF0FKAv6MkrGbRKQ.text: Gallagher's was great! We had a Cesar salad to split for starts, we then split a plate of surf n turf, he had the aged new york steak and I have the 10 oz. lobster tail, we also ordered a huge baked potato on the side, it was a little dry. We got a free dessert from a couple we met from Michigan that was super sweet. Over all great atmosphere, nice staff and pretty decent food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty drinks
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bread pudding, OMG

TQ-gR_-iyenkwanmchHPuQ.text: Awesome food and service. Their signature NY strip steak is the best steak hands down. Too bad it's pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for. Come here and you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature NY strip steak with peppercorn sauce.

c2l0ejrlEE4CkugvB_ITiA.text: I've been dying to try this place out for over 5 years, no lie I got pictures to prove it haha. So finally decided to give it a try, my wife and I went and I got the dry aged new York strip, loved the way they treat you there, the way they take care of you so once I order the steak I was excited, 5 years of want, 5 years of leaving and not getting a taste, this was finally the moment, D DAY ( HUGE steak lover as you can see ) and it arrives...i cut thru it like a old lady cutting traffic...lift off and straight to my mouth...5 years of excitement went down the drain pretty quick...streak didn't seem to be seasoned and it didn't seem to be worth the price I paid ( forgot ) wasn't a happy camper. I've had better steak from a mom and pops restaurant for way less. I still ate it and paid the bill but really killed my expectations. I still give it a 4 star as the rest of the food was great and drinks were on point.

XGaQI7tY8PLaQ7Ej7gthzw.text: My daughter and I were on this end of the strip looking for a nice place for dinner...This is an upscale restaurant inside New York New York. The food is good and the service was wonderful but I thought the tables were too close together and the price is way too high for what you get. The ambiance is nice and romantic but there are many places in Vegas where you can get upscale food and not break the bank. We ordered one steak (cheapest on the menu at $48), a market price fish at $45 and an order of asparagus (6 pieces for $10)...so our total came to $103 without tip! I'm not opposed to paying for good quality- I just didn't feel like this was anything special or that I need to come back for- I have plenty of that style of food right where I live. There are other places that are unique to Vegas and I'd go to those.

GKNK9K8aIH3BbdRGwytnow.text: Amazing steak! My hubby and I both had the filet minion  and it was perfect. So soft I could cut it with my fork. Mac and cheese was yummy too and the drinks were delicious. Todd was our waiter, he was very helpful and informative of the items. And the atmosphere was nice, not loud and bright. The topper was the photographer they have there. Seconds before she walked up my husband and I were talking about how we never have good pictures of us together, and it took all of five minutes for her to capture us perfectly. We bought everything she printed. Definitely will be coming back here when we return to Vegas. Thank you for the amazing food and great service!!

3fyw5s7zTbE0KAlLb0Jobg.text: My wife and I had dinner at Gallagher's last nite. The service was great. The steaks were ok. Both of our steaks were charred on the outside. The burnt taste took away from the flavor. We won't be coming back.

loZYL0b9v99dQPDgZGcz2Q.text: Was rushed experience, steaks were fine, but classic overpriced middle of the road fair

-ojN0rPjJnBw259qRXEglg.text: I had an amazing time. It was my girlfriend's birthday and we wanted to go somewhere special.  Our server made sure we were taken care of. I had a filet mignon and it was amazing. My girlfriend had the chicken and she loved it. Our desert was a keylime pie and I was so sad when it was finished, i just wanted more and more. Thank you so much for the good time.

rf7iA3Wg0JXnc8bb0aixvg.text: We arrived here pm8:30 Monday. Luckily we didn't wait at all. Aged steak was nice but I enjoyed its taste too much to have all of them. I should have come here without lunch. I felt it huge! Aged steak,two beer, shared caramari and Caesar salad were  880$ .-/person.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aged steak

M2K-O3renl4o6Bl8Pjt5hw.text: Cool place on a strip of the New York New York hotel that feels just like being in Manhattan. For years I've been stopping by this hotel (and I even stayed here once in college), but always completely missed this Manhattan-like strip.  There were several restaurants, bars and delis that had that New York feel (sort of like you get in the Paris hotel for Paris).   We got to hang around and grab a beer here, but we had already eaten dinner. The staff was friendly (and funny) and they had an epic all glass meat refrigerator out front that made me wish I could have grabbed a steak here.  We got to sit "outside" in the "street" and people watch. Fun times.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2nq0yCL9gMXrzWENT1HecQ.text: Impeccable !!!!!!! Our night out to Gallagher's was utterly fantastic. Promptly seated in the reserved table. Our waiter Todd was fantastic. Helped the ladies pick out the perfect entree and how to share the plates for the just right amount. Our busboy Antonio was on the spot all night. He was great and he and Todd made a great team. The food was the best we had in our 5 day stay. Every steak was spot on perfect.  And we had an awesome photographer, Roxanne, who doesn't work for them, just takes awesome pictures.  This was a great experience.

sZ7aFw-kGBWd8s0VLmoU5Q.text: I've raved before via Yelp about my birth right and taste buds from being raised as a Texan and what that means for all things beef, tex-mex and overall unhealthy. That being said, the Filet Mignon I experienced at this restaurant was in my top 3 steak experiences. Yum!!! Seriously, don't waste your time with Cut or the other over-hyped steakhouses in Vegas. True, old-world, New York City style dining in the glorious (and super sparkly) New York, New York Casino - this restaurant is a must. My steak was a perfectly cooked Medium accompanied by the macaroni & cheese (yes to the bacon flavor!) and mashed potatoes (low on over flavoring - which matches the steak perfectly). Pro-tip: don't get sauces for the steak. It's perfectly seasoned. We were obviously looking for a waist-line friendly meal. (Ha!)   We also enjoyed the Pinot Noir from Santa Barbara wine country (started with a B but can't remember the name). The entire table split a bottle and everyone was pleased by the smooth taste (with a $48 price tag - not too shabby). Calamari for the appetizer (standard) and a Cesar Salad (it was ok but nothing special). The waiter was incredibly accommodating (my gf spilled her full glass of wine all over the table and my newly placed plate of above mentioned meal and they re-plated and replaced the sides immediately) and the overall ambiance was nice.   Needless to say we walked into Zumanity in a food coma which was oh, so worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon medium with macaroni &amp; cheese and mashed potatoes.

lRjHpKhIvtNbzMkERUEhZw.text: Decided to try this steakhouse on a Saturday night as it's in NY NY where Zumanity is.  We made a reservation and was seated upon arrival.  Our waiter and other staff were very attentive.  Our rib-eye steaks were tender, flavorful and cooked perfectly.  For sides we had creamed spinach and the mac-n-cheese and a side Caesar salad.  Everything was good.  For dessert we had the toffee bread pudding which was delicious!!  I would definitely come back.

JaDAfoZOKG6glr6dj-qnXw.text: When I'm at the New York, New York Hotel & Casino, I use to always walk by Gallagher's Steakhouse and marvel at the row of rib eyes that dropped along the top of their dry-age coolers. I promised myself that the next time I return, I'll throw a ridiculous bet on the hardway's with a couple of black chips in hopes the dice will hit the 10-1.  Haha, well don't get too excited cause it didn't happen, yet, that is...BUT instead I scored something just as good as I was kidnapped to celebrate a quick birthday overnighter in Sin City and to finally try one of Gallagher's steaks.   So why this place...? Dry-Aged beef is what we're talkin' bout peeps...that's right, not sticking a piece of meat in a vacuum-sealed bag that apparently also "ages" faster and in hopes to trim and reduce its water weight, hence the controversy of why very many steakhouses don't use the classical dry-aged process. As we all know time is money. Catch my drift...?   At Gallagher's, its old school "aging'...We're talking countless hours and days of beef being stored in a special dry-aging cooler where a complex chemical reaction process that involves an intricate equilibrium of time, temperature, and the right humidity so that the beef's enzymes begins to break down and tenderize the meat. In return, Gallagher's delivers to you one of the utmost tender and most flavorful steak you'll ever eat. BOOM!   The Eats: Main Course: Dry-Aged New York Sirloin $43  Cowboy Rib-Eye Steak $45     slightly burnt edges (-.5) Sauteed Wild Mushrooms and Carmelized Onions $2 each Yukon Gold Potato Puree $8  meh. (-.5)  Ambiance: Dim lighting, tranquil noise level, semi-formal attire (Sported a Hawaiian shirt =P)  Customer Service: Product Knowledgeable, Friendly and Professional.  Tip: Make reservations. Its packed!  Peace!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 15 days aged
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye

2o1ibx0sYxJtcXwzda-BJA.text: Late night run for steak and this steakhouse did not disappoint.  Staff was extremely  friendly and attentive. I will definitely be recommending family and friends to enjoy the rib eye steak.

bJGRP_UbxJmrX4qdemWIhg.text: Steak snob alert!  When you approach the restaurant you will see a sizable glass display showing off several large cuts of steak being dry aged.   There is a sign next to it that explains all of the steaks served at Gallagher's is first wet aged for x amount of time and then dry aged for x amount of time.  I assume most passersby are doubly impressed by this.   My reaction however, was that - 1. The marbling on these steaks are not impressive   2.  They wet age first then dry age?  Why not just do dry aging for the entire process? Why even advertise this when it actually shows that you've gone the "cheap" route?  So, I order the Dry aged New York which came out overcooked.  I ordered medium rare and it came out medium.  Not only was the steak overcooked but it was DRY.  It was actually unbelievable as even when I half-heartedly cook sub-prime steak it doesn't come out dry     My friend's steak also came out overcooked.  I sent the steak back and got a new one....it was cooked correctly this time.   The actual flavor of the steak was not that great which i guess is ultimately the REAL problem.  It had an odd gamey flavor to it that is sometimes apparently in dry aged steak but never really in this unappetizing way.  The sides and appetizers were all unexciting and the service was sub par.  Our actual waitress was decent but the bus boys were pushy and seemed like they were in a hurry the whole time.    They just dropped the plates in front of us and constantly tried to take our plates away even though we weren't finished yet.   It's like they were in a hurry to get us the hell out of there.  Overall, I would say this place is below average in the world of "Fine Steakhouses"  I would recommend Mastro's Ocean Club if you wanted steak in Las Vegas

01_TPBb9GZAG6XD3qFCizA.text: Insanely delicious!  We have dined here a dozen times and it is always amazing. Friends have recommended ( and we've tried) other steakhouses and they always fall short. The service is impeccable and the steak is perfect. Looking forward to our next meal!

c2uSBVUDg36xRdNkVghEgQ.text: First off, haven't been here in a while, last time I was here was like over 10 years ago, I had the ribeye but I  messed up and ordered it medium well when I should of got it rare, wifey to be got the filet- was excellent, especially in the middle, very pleasant ambiance, service was great, all and all a nice dinner.

axme2W3_SAJ3yIgi9hnfGg.text: Great steak and salads.  Steak was tender and great portioned. For two people, I recommend sharing one steak and one salad and maybe one side.  Recommend: Forest Mushroom Salad $9. Delicious. I love the warm mushrooms and the vinagrette they used. Absolutely wonderful.  Dry Aged New York Sirloin $40 (Our Signature House-Aged Bone-In Sirloin). Tender and tasty.  Porterhouse Steak $48. Surprisingly tender. I think this was even more tender than the sirloin. However, this piece was huge and had bone in middle.   I really enjoyed it and especially sharing one big meal is good enough deal. Makes it a better deal for the buck.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eg0a3_XfFRnCTs48O_nELw.text: This place should really decide whether or not it wants to be an Outback Steakhouse or a premium steak house as advertised.  First things first, the service here was top notch from everyone from the hostess the busers, the waiter and the manager.  They were attentive without  being annoying, fast, and pleasant to deal with.  In regards to the food, the wife and I shared an appetizer of shrimp and cheesy grits which were both cooked and season perfectly.  For the main dish I had their signature dry aged steak and my wife had the fillet.  Both steaks were cooked to our request and tasted great.  The wife's fillet was so tender that it almost melted in your mouth.  Here is the con.  The resturant advertised itself as high end charging premium prices.  Their website stated that the dress was business casual.  When I pay 195 bucks for two people to eat I expect great food, great service, and great atmosphere.  And the last thing is the reason I can't give it five stars.  I have nothing against tee shirts and cargo shorts, in fact that's how I dress normally...just not when I go to a place with a dress code.  They allowed guest to come in wearing torn t-shirts and baseball caps and people that were so drunk they couldn't stand without assistance.  I'm all good with that...if I'm eating at an outback steak house.

5WvRK47XlCDEYEo6l0GJOg.text: If you want a steak as tough as leather you have come to the right place. We ordered the cowboy ribeye medium rare and it must have been the toughest piece of meat I have ever eaten in a steakhouse. I was actually afraid of choking between the grizzle and the toughness that I cut the pieces much smaller than I ever would otherwise. I have eaten at steakhouses across the country and the meat quality here is shameful.   Service you ask? Wait, there is no server anywhere! We waited 20 minutes for bread after asking for some 4 times. Finally the bus boy was nice enough to get us some, not the waiter, not the manager... The service was just terrible. You don't expect to spend 70 bucks a person minimum and have to get up and find someone to refill your drink all night.    Clearly, I would not recommend this place, what a waste of money. I would rate the quality of food here way below that of Outback Steakhouse. To be peddling this in any hotel on the Las Vegas strip is shameful.

_2TbKmR4rik7dtFNIlfVew.text: Lobster and steak were both cold and manager said dessert on him don't believe this was worth food being cold

uqumZuUJh78nFQRHJrseVg.text: It was my first time in Vegas, so I'm not quite used to having to walk through a busy, smoky casino to get to a nice restaurant. That being said, the food itself was just alright. I expect a good steak to need nothing additional, but my ribeye came with some type of sauce drizzled over it. I accidentally ordered mine medium well, when I meant medium/medium rare. They were more than willing to take mine back and re-make it, but I can't bear to waste a "good" steak.   Experience overall wasn't worth the pricey items, so I doubt ill visit again if I'm ever in the area.

4oUER1Ys_vwDoVUadjn0vg.text: Had a wonderful dinner last night at Galkaghers. My ribeye was so tender and the clam chowder soup was amazing. A shout out to Todd as a great waiter who went out of his way to go and make tarter sauce for my friend. Gio his assistant was always on top of you needed a refill or plates cleared. Outstanding service and a wonderful meal.  Thanks for a great experience.

i65Rw1hDXteoRbbrq8syVw.text: This steak was delicious! I ordered the fillet mignon with mushrooms and completely demolished the entire meal. We had booked the restaurant for four people earlier in the day via Open Table and I noted that it was also to celebrate a birthday. The service was fast and friendly - and we had a surprise little cake at the the end of the dinner.  I'm always a bit wary of eating around the Strip as it sometimes seems like you have to pay astronomical prices for a decent dinner. But this was a great meal, with well cooked steaks,  yummy sides and a good wine list. Would definitely recommend.

lGr8rN5rLOhIApXfYmbx4A.text: If this place was not in the middle of a casino I would give it 5 stars. Service was wonderful. I recommend one of their dry aged steaks, they are so tender and delicious! Order a side of Brussel Sprouts, my husband say they were the best he has ever had.

rn5yap6Lq8heSRlEUc-h7w.text: A friend recommended Gallagher's as it is one of his favorite places. Well... I discovered we have different ideas about great steak restaurants.   The atmosphere ------ L-O-U-D!!!   Service was fine.. nothing amazing... or over the top. The guy taking care of us did a nice job.   The food....  We had the shrimp and grits appetizer.  It was good.. not amazing... just good.   My wife, who isn't a steak fan, had the chicken.  Again... it was fine... but.. Nothing amazing.   I had the cowboy rib eye.  It was slightly over cooked.. not tough, but not melt-in-your mouth.....amazing.  Lacked seasoning...  and if I'm 100% honest... I've made rib eyes at home that were as good or better...   the Bearnaise helped along with the onion strips.   All in all...  the bill was $165 .. not a huge amount but the meal and experience didn't live up to the bill. Not even close... it was a mediocre experience at best.   My advice... either cook a great cut of steak at home the way you love it... or make reservations at other steak houses in Las Vegas.  This place just didn't do it for us... it didn't live up to the hype IMO.  FYI  *** the only steak they dry age.... is the Dry-Aged New York Sirloin***   the other steaks are not dry aged per the guy serving us.   Frank

495qro4Jkb3UKckt54a7Ig.text: I came here for my out of town friend's birthday celebration. Everyone in our party was excited for a nice steak dinner.   I wasn't in the mood for steak, so I ordered the lamb and so did one of my friends. The lamb was the only thing that salvaged this review from being 1-star. The lamb was cooked exactly as we requested. The steaks on the other hand were ALL totally off the mark. Two of my friends ordered their filets medium. One came out totally overcooked, like a hockey puck, the other "medium" steak was practically raw. I'm a fan of the medium-rare preparation, but this was extreme. When my friend asked for it to be cooked a little more, they sent it in and it still came back undercooked. He again had to request they cook it a little longer. The third time it came out overcooked, shocker.  This whole debacle was really disappointing. The birthday boy said he wishes he had just gone to Outback Steakhouse.

MSedF8MDTKhabS4pSli7aQ.text: Wonderful service and a friendly, helpful staff. Overall my family was pleased with the food we ordered, but we were let down in some areas. The strip steak, which is their specialty dish, was underwhelming, with minimal seasoning and an overall un-special flavor. I ordered the roasted chicken cooked with a butter sauce, but it was so plain and unflavored. We also ordered the creamed spinach side dish, which we found to be too sweet. The mac and cheese side was to die for, and the dessert was lovely. Next time I think we'll order the prime rib. Hopefully we have a better experience next time!

54sXdKMpj20g3Q9vtGOg3Q.text: Excellent steakhouse.  Ordered the ribeye which was cooked to perfection along with the crab cakes.  Service was fantastic.  Highly recommend.

YCI9IkeA6WP4CcPV9FxWIQ.text: We have been coming back to the outdoor bar for 3 years now. Every trip to Vegas we make it a point to visit Fernando, the bartender, he makes some very delicious drinks. Strong enough to enjoy a few and jus the right amount of fruitiness without being overwhelming.  He's very attentive and service with a smile.  Hard to find good service in a busy town such as Vegas.

W6mLyyltHpjSy-RubnCIVg.text: I came here on Labor Day weekend with a reservation to celebrate a friend's birthday. The meal was delicious as expected, but they went above and beyond to fulfill my dumb request which was fantastic.  The birthday boy is a big Superman fan and while filling out my reservation online I had asked for an autographed picture from Supe.  When we arrived at our table there was a photo of Superman wishing him a happy birthday and autographed by the man himself (I'm sure, lol).  While I wouldn't expect every request to be fulfilled this was just a pleasant surprise that jolted our night from good to great fun.

9yPq0Dh6GXNehvBCLvr_Mg.text: A trip to Vegas is not a trip to Vegas without a stop to Gallagher's.  I make it a habit to always come to this place to eat exceptional food.  the staff here is excellent, and the service is great, really on top of their game.  I would highly recommend eating here if you want a quality meal at a good price...

vElmxm54eTIBke7WeD-pqw.text: My four brothers & I had dinner there on 2/5/17  We enjoyed excellent service, the wine list was great, plus they offered Lagunitas IPA! Two of us had the cowboy ribeye, one had a porterhouse, another had the filet, & the oldest brother had rack of lamb. All was delicious, the filet was one of the best steaks I've ever tasted. The wedge salad & ceasar salads were good. We had oyster Rockefeller for appetizers, along with raw oysters on the half shell. All was excellent!

7TaRjcPNafvlzR0-hfVfEw.text: Last meal on earth...Gallagher's Dry Aged NY steak.  Every time we go to Vegas this is our "special meal" and it is always amazing. I typically get the aged NY steak, this time I went with the surf and turf. I wasn't disappointed. My steaks are always cooked to perfection and the flavors are ones I'm constantly comparing other steak houses to. It is very expensive but for special occasions it's well worth it. The service has always been top notch, there isn't anything I'd change about Gallagher's.

rlkkCoae9xyCMc5s69-tmw.text: I have been to the original One in NYC. Which puts the one here in Vegas to shame. The service was very rushed. I order the filet med rare. It was very dry. It's sad to say that between my boyfriend and I the beet salad was the best thing we ate. Such a disappointment compared to our experience in NY.

F7hOft7gFGzP460lwcplwg.text: After reviewing several reviews we decided to go to dinner at Gallaghers Steakhouse and boy were we disappointed. It started with a distracted waiter who took forever to take our drinks and meal order.  A table that arrive after us actually had their order taken before ours. It was kind of surreal but with all the great reviews we thought it would be worth the wait. Well, it wasn't! Our sirloin steak was bland and rather fatty. The spinach was way too salty and disgusting. Highlights of the evening was the mashed potatoes but this does not save their rating. This was a pricey adventure and one that won't be repeated. I don't have a steakhouse recommendation for Las Vegas visitors but if you are ever in Chicago and want to taste an excellent aged steak, check out Joes Seafood, Prime Steak &Stone Crab...mmmmmmm!

sG4M3vRLumEte4F17ypAlw.text: Had their "signature" dry aged NY strip. Not very special. Go for the rib eye or Prime rib. Service was great, but for the price the food could be much better.

FGAV4MYexjxC6Y7uvuKJvw.text: Amazing dry-aged beef!  Do not go anywhere else if you know what good beef tastes like.  Great for any occasion.  Delicious roasted garlic garnish with all of the steaks.  Do not pass this up.

h_2akGlvaG3huKPxJfPFoA.text: This is a must when i go to vegas.... service and ambiance is excellent.. cant wait to go back! and yes the steak is the star.. the bar is actually excellent.. had the best cucumber martinis there!

LjodFy7Auh9CAPvy_Dv8jw.text: We went here for my bachelor party. I wasn't drunk when I ate, so I can say that I'm able to write an honest review.  I ordered the dry aged NY sirloin. The portions are huge, and it was cooked perfectly. I tried my friend's porterhouse, and that was even larger, but well cooked. We ordered some sides, including mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, and mac & cheese. Overall, service was really good as well.  If you want to finish your steak comfortably, I recommend skipping the bread they give you at the beginning.  By the way, we ate in the other room, and it was all guys - not a single girl in the room. I wonder if that's the all guys' party room.

OHoGjyZdh46lXwBFH72eRA.text: As much as I loved my food, something kept me from 5 stars. Maybe it was simply the expense.  Hubby had the filet, and I had the rib-eye. I wanted to try their aged sirloin, but to me it just isn't a steak if it isn't a rib eye.  I don't understand why they don't age any other cut of meat.  Service was beyond impeccable, and the house wines were both good.  We shared a Caesar salad with large strips of Spanish Anchovies (not as salty as others), and that plus our two entrees and a baked potato that we also shared, plus 2 wines and 1 iced tea came to $130.00. Add tip to that.  If we were big eaters and had an appetizer, another salad or soup, another of their yummy sounding sides, and maybe a drink or two, plus dessert and coffee, we could easily have spent over $200 per person.  Not for the faint of wallet.

fLru3RQmLpLG_MsXDpozjw.text: Hard to add much new to the reviews other than if you want a good NY style steak at the NY NY casino this is the place.  Good service, well made drinks and of course expensive but what NY style steak house is not?  Have been here several times, never had anything other than steak so cannot comment on the few other choices.

ETR9LytaH7WempcMbjCpaA.text: Really love this restaurant. Not as expensive as other "top notch" steakhouses in LV. Got the same excellent steps of service and tasty food for about $100 less compared to others (craft steak, etc). Both husband and I ordered rib-eye and shared jalapeno mashed potatoes (special), mushrooms, and creamed spinach. DELICIOUS! The choices of bottles of wine are very reasonable. Prices range anywhere from $50 to $600. Overall, a wonderful experience. We will definitely return.

6CreMUgLvt3HsFtXgkmVeQ.text: This is really about a New Years Eve experience, and lack of organization. There are dozens of high end Steakhouses to choose from in Las Vegas, but most serve a set menu on NYE. I had called ahead to see if the entire menu was available at Gallagers I was assured it was, so that's were I chose to eat. have often eaten at the one in NYC on NYE and it was great.  I made a reservation for 7:15. We weren't seated until 7:45. Then were told we had to choose from a limited menu- and no substitutions on sides. And each steak came with something different. I was told by the manager that we had been given wrong information. We should have left then, but it was getting late and we had tickets to a show.. Then the food took 50 minutes to arrive!! We had to rush through a very expensive meal, and asked for the check before we were even done. Everyone in the restaurant was very upset as they were dealing with the same issues. The food finally arrived, and it was very good, but overall such a bad experience I don't think I will come back. We have often eaten at the restaurant in NYC on NYE, and it was very organized and delicious. This place was chaos. It's probably fine on regular evenings, but this was a very disappointing dining experience.

nssnGQzU7nC_gL-sXOnc2w.text: Very expensive, but worth every penny. The steaks are huge and cooked exactly how we asked them to be. Try the french green beans (order is enough for two). We paid maybe $150 for two of us and it was nice atmosphere for dining. Inside the busy NYNY Resort but the restuarant is pretty quiet.

fhYyjEvSzJ6cINJMnQyV0Q.text: I have to say I was disappointed.  This was our "splurge" dinner, and I would choose another place to go next time. Our server Bobby and busser Juan were excellent as were the oysters Rockefeller, tomato soup and baby beet salad we began with. The house chardonnay was wonderful.  Then the meal went downhill. The broccoli side was ok, the four cheese macaroni was not awful, but not worth more than two bites.  My husband's age-dried steak had one tough string (sorry I don't know the name of the wide white ribbon of fiber) but mine had two. The steak knifes looked wonderful but both mine and my husband's were very dull, making it difficult to cut through the fiber.  The six or seven bites of meat I had without the fiber were very tender and well seasoned.  We shared an excellent key lime pie for dessert, but the coffee my husband ordered was really weak-he ordered an espresso and poured it into his coffee to make it drinkable.  To top it all off, the place was very noisy.  We both began to loose our voices by the end of the meal from having to almost yell and repeat things. A few highs points balanced out by low..

lAa-XocxUa3UT74QqKBBAA.text: Had my birthday dinner at Gallaghers.  What a great experience. Had a reservation but they were able to seat us when we got there 1/2 an hour prior. The customer service was phenomal, our waiter was so attentive and checked on us frequently (but not stalker frequently).  He was really knowledable about the steaks (I wanted to know which was the softest.)  I ordered a lemond drop which was the most fabulous lemon drop I've ever had.  I ordred a New York steak, my husband ordered the Cowboy Sirloin or something like that.  I should technically have given them 4 starts since they mixed my medium with his medium rare, but that being said within minutes of us letting them know, the manager was at our table apologizing for the mistake (they took my m.rare and cooked it to med) and he offered us each a dessert on the house!! Like I said, phenominal customer service.  I would definitely go back to this place.  Great drink, great food, great people!  One recommendation to those who havent been there: The steaks are enormous!  I would recommend sharing the steak with someone, unless you want to carry around the take-out box as you walk the strip.

zZ55ijyj5mx0UucOF2ctUg.text: i had a proper sit down meal.  perfect wait staff .  had to try the uncommon aged steak--it had no fat, had a great flavor all by itself, but the bleu cheese complimented nicely. i can't complain about portions.  four cheese macaroni was good.  shiraz wine delicious.  we were dressed casually & not treated like hobos.  upon leaving, couldn't believe how the restaurant was at max occupancy 7pm monday .  we got whatever we wanted & the bill was approx $100.  i'll return

D_KitLOtWE3wc9ctPnwvNw.text: Go for the filet mignon. I took my girlfriend here for dinner. My filet mignon was outstanding. She got their signature cut, the New York strip, and wasn't too impressed. It was aged and cooked well, but wasn't seasoned especially well. Service was mediocre.

fCldPUfjOpNJguYrXnJM9g.text: This is my second time coming here just to make sure that my first experience wasn't a fluke. Low and behold sadly it  consistenly was the same BAD in every sense of the word. First the service was slow, unattentive, inconsiderate, and most importantly was rushed. The bus boy was more present than our waiter. The steak was certainly not dry aged it tasted like the steak from smiths, and it was marinated, can you believe that. Seriously , this restaurant marinates their steak to make it tasteful.I thought it was dry aged??how can they get away with this travesty. Do the majority of the public fall for this False dry age mumbo jumbo. Ppl save ur money and just go buy some steak at smiths., if you don't believe me then go throw away your money on this pretentious dry age B.S.

u402ZsWk0fjgCyBjn5lThg.text: We had the dry aged sirloin, after all the first time at any restaurant one must try the signature dish.  Greatly disappointed, not very tender, lots of tough connective tissue, medium rare was closer to medium.  We ask the waiter what grade of meat was used and he answered "choice."  The lack of marbeling was more like select.  Steak flavor was good.  Overall, not worth the $43.00 each.  Baked potato was like rubber, siting in the warmer too long.  The salads were excellent.

wXDUyGYk7o4gVHh_M_Fm7g.text: A pleasant surprise, considering it's Las Vegas. We were seated promptly, with a reservation, and really enjoyed the loud, boisterous atmosphere. (This is not the place for an intimate dinner or quiet conversation). Our waiter was a kick and generally added to the fun. The steaks were great and the side-dishes decent. My only complaint: Does everything need to be "super sized?" Most of us were unable to finish even half of our steaks, they were so large, and it just felt plain wasteful - especially since our puppy couldn't make the trip to Vegas with us. :) It would have been nice to see some "petit cuts," for those who have a more reasonable appetite. In any event, highly recommended for a fun evening and a good steak.

7bPEmYZ-9a74g3tvrJrHdQ.text: Attempted to have a great steak dinner on 3/24/09.  Served 2 types of cold bread with slabs of rock hard butter, to start.  Had 2 chopped salads. Very bland vinaigrette dressing.  I ordered a medium filet mignon. After I cut open the steak I found that it was served substantially raw. Despite my asking the bus boy 2 times to find our waiter, I waited for 6-7 min for him to appear (big, bald german). They recooked the steak and forced all of the juices out through the incision I created. My guest's ribeye was also undercooked; but he declined to send it back. After my second bite of steak I noticed that the restaurant was filling up with smoke. This continued  until the smoke became so thick that it was difficult to see across the restaurant. The line cooks were all cracking up over their broken ventilators. The restaurant cooks over coal or wood, so the smoke was noxious. Management did nothing proactively. They were content to watch all of their guests sit in a toxic cloud. Not being one to sit back and be taken advantage of, I told our waiter that we wished to leave immediately. He soon returned with a $0 check. 95% of my dried out steak was left uneaten.

RtWupG63IV_uGGYlRMq56w.text: Wife and I went last night, went all out with drinks, appetizer, bread, salad, entrees, sides and wine.  Our drinks were good, $10. The crab cake (3) appetizer was fantastic, fresh and almost completely crab. The bread was fresh and complimentary, would've liked it better served warm.  We had the wedge salad  presented nicely with heart of palm and baby tomatoes, blue cheese dressing was good. I had the dry-aged, bone-in New York sirloin.  It was perfectly cooked medium rare, averagely tender.  It is served with a sauce on it, which I could've done with out.  I feel a steak should speak for itself, and if it needs a sauce then it's not a great steak. My wife had the pork chops, and we didn't eat them.  They were very tough with almost no flavor, very disappointing! The mushroom medley was terrific, and the colossal baked potato was definitely that!   The best part of the dinner was the staff.  Very professional, attentive and friendly.  We were given the opportunity to replace the pork chops, but we were so full we declined.  So thanks to Roberto and Mike! Great job guys!

44ZGVHXJZVCi-QTFTi85mA.text: We had reservations for New Years Eve and , having dined there several times in the past , we had never had a bad meal.  So we were really disappointed when our dinner was not real good and took nearly 3 hours. We had wine and appetizers to start, a "seafood celebration" that everyone loved ( $38.00 per person but worth it) and then we ordered our main courses. We all had steaks and it took nearly 45 minutes from when we ordered them to when they showed up.. The restaurant had cleared out so it wasn't an issue of being overly busy, when the steaks arrived they were all barely lukewarm and the sides were basically cold. It was pretty obvious that they had somehow sat for a period of time before being brought to our table. I mentioned to the manager on duty and his solution after having to "think it over " was to first offer us new meals ( it was past midnight by then so no one was much interested in waiting around for another round) and then offered to bring us some desserts and after dinner drinks ( more food and drink but not offering to do anything about getting a lousy meal) .. Our bill for 4 people was $620.00 and , although we are completely ok paying that for a special night, what we got was such a downer it would be hard to not remember this the next time we visit Las Vegas ..

_SsQJrncZjXWVFLQKnL4qA.text: I think this place is above average as far as steak house go.  The service was good and the food was on point!  One of the best cuts of lamb and ribeye I've ever had!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iM4PAIzU3DbNZxzoeVoWzA.text: Dining here is always an excellent experience.  My issue is too many changes with the new chef.   They took our favorites off the menu which where considered a family diner staple.   One of which is their famous shrimp scampi.   Put it back ! Regardless if you can "still make it."   The sauce isn't the same and we all want to order one of the best parts of our dining experience there.   There are too many places to dine in Vegas.  There is a reason we continue to go there.  Don't change this for us.  Bring the scampi back.

F_vowbVPCNgdHjaFXdMTlg.text: My hair stand and I had such an amazing meal! He had the soup of the day which was a corn chowder, the New York strip, and mushroom whiskey Demi glaze sauce. I got the Caesar salad, filet mignon, and the bernaise sauce. We shared the onion rings and the maceroni and cheese. We ended with the creme brulee. Everything was absolutely amazing. A little word to the wise - they don't tell you how many ounces things are... we totally could have shared one steak! We would totally recommend this restaurant.

cYC6Qnh-K1mph9J85Rdk2Q.text: My wife and I have eaten here many time.  The latest was this Saturday night.  We both ordered the Prime rib (medium rare), oysters and mashed potatoes. All excellent. The wait staff is terrific and the atmosphere is great.  Great, Great, Great old time steak house.

J0LxUf_q5wdKIHGVhxcoJQ.text: Pretty reasonable priced steaks. The old age steak was pretty big and cooked to perfection. The prime rib steak was also cooked very well the very tender. The only thing that knocked a star off is the steaks needed more salt and pepper and would prefer the bread to be a little warmer, especially the butter was cold and hard to spread on the bread.

PaexISmPRMA8AnJfBre52A.text: This steakhouse has the most amazing steaks! We ordered the Cowboy Ribeye and it's the best steak I ever ate! I was wondering why they didn't bring us steak knives and only saw butter knives on our table. The reason is because the steak is so tenuous can cut it with a butter knife! Unbelievable........

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8IrYEjmNc7Qgc3mEbIXUWg.text: The 3 stars is mostly for the service/server. He was definitely top notch.  So the food wasn't bad at all. It was pretty good but not for those pieces. I've seriously had better steak in New Braunfels, TX. If you're gonna charge more than Ruth Chris you better be the same or better as RCs and they're just not.

F7TO0tR5IcGUb-0517iGQw.text: Ordered their signature aged New York strop and it did not disappoint. Order it med rare and it was cooked to perfection. Also had grilled onions and mushrooms as well as a spinach salad. The sides were just OK for the price nothing remarkable for such a nice place. Had the lemon drop, cucumber and the blueberry martini and they were made perfect and I highly recommend them all. Will go back for the steak and martinis however will be very selective on the sides.

iegQR1nfJuC9TALZot8N7g.text: Not much I can said that is negative for this place other than.... I am not there eating a steak right now. I will definitely be back whenever I go back to Vegas.   The food I feel was the star of the show, and I got one of the best steaks that I have ever had here. I tried the Cowboy Ribeye, with the waiters recommendation, and it really was the best steak I have ever had, bar none. Don't let the prices fool you, and though the cost is a bit eye opening, it is well worth the price due to the quality and the flavor of the steak. I recommend any steak due to the fact that it is both wet and dry aged, and then it is cooked with an unmistakable mesquite flavor. My mouth is watering just writing this review.  The service and ambience were a close second to the food, and how much I raved about the steak, both the service and the ambience are no slouches. Service was very attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. The ambience was great, clatter and chatter of restaurant patrons coupled with the charm of the restaurant makes this a different and upscale experience, than I can definitely say I haven't had the pleasure of enjoying of this level until now.   I highly recommend this place if you want a good steak and a fabulous experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky toffee pudding. The perfect end to the perfect meal.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aging steak in the window at the front of the restaurant
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special little birthday gift from the restaurant

IuGV7Zkgn_IOyyz7Km_xEw.text: The dry-rub steak was great. Nice sides, great service. The place knows what they are doing and we loved the food.  The photographer wants to take your photos and then bring you all kinds of prints to sell you. Unless you want 80s soft focus Glamour Shots stuff, just say no.

x61-_ebO1XG3S48FR6PbSA.text: Happened on this place after an evening exploring Vegas.  We arrived near closing and we were seated immediately.  She ordered wine and I ordered a beer.  Two types of delicious bread arrived with our drinks.  We both ordered steaks, hers the New York strip and mine being the Cowboy Ribeye. Both steaks were cooked to perfection!  So delicious!  Baked potato and Four cheese macaroni rounded out our meal.  Very attentive staff that made our dinner that much more delightful.  Highly recommend for anyone looking for fine dining in Vegas.

wN-4umrSd7TFgVhMGiNdbA.text: I have let this place sink into my bones for 3 months... I am not a local and cannot go here whenever I want to... but I miss it :) I have had a lot of steaks being from a meat and potato family... this was up there with one of the best I have ever had. It may have been the best I have ever had. And I lived in Calgary, Alberta (beef-land) for 3 years so that is saying something. It was a special night in April 2017 and we made sure we were going to make it in by reserving a spot for 5pm. The hostess for that Saturday needed an attitude adjustment and did not set the tone very well for the evening but the rest of the night made up for her. Never forget her though and her welcoming snarkiness! Maybe she was just having a bad day. Our waiter was professional and our busser was hilarious. "BADABOOMBADABING!"! Will never forget him either! The filet special steak was melt in your mouth good. Thick, juicy, perfectly rare and expensive. This is Vegas, ya gotta open your wallet at a steak house. Worth every penny as were the sides. Who knew, I grew up to like brussel sprouts! I am a sucker for potatoes (loaded mashed). Delicious. I loved the clam chowder. I wanted to bathe in it - then I wanted to swim in my potatoes! The calamari was pretty good, standard. He loved his porterhouse steak too. The kind of thankful bites where you close your eyes and chew. Because you cannot get up and do the happy dance. Maybe next time! The place was jumping/getting loud as the evening wore on at NY NY but we were luckily seated in a pretty decent spot. Romantic lighting. Kitchen action. The restrooms were way across the space and out into a gloomy hallway - not unusual for this town but, meh. Not ideal. There are so many steakhouses in Vegas but I cannot stop thinking about this place and will be heading back there as soon as our wheels hit the strip. It was that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare! Perfect filet special
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded mashed 5/5
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet special with baby Brussels and puree

nlmRnx7zHX-5OAGZSpAPAA.text: Yummy.....I love a good steak! Would definitely go back.  My husband and I yelped reviews before making a decision on our 10 year anniversary....I mean who really wants to spend $200+ dollars and not like the food.   The atmosphere was nice but a bit loud....but I couldn't expect nothing less be I g I'm Vegas. The server was great and I love that fresh linnens are put on after each meal. All are very attentive to your needs.... I Love it, no need to flag anyone down.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bbMGlX7G0iR0-dC9JTQpLQ.text: We had dinner reservations on NYE. They had a  Nye menu which was basically their normal menu but $20 added to all prices. Unfortunate for our wallet but we'd do it again!  Meal and experience worth every penny. We were seated on time. Our server was excellent. Great personality and took good care of us. We had dirty martinis, roasted oysters, lobster bisque, wedge salad, porterhouse (ordered medium and cooked perfectly)  with the double baked potato and creamed spinach. All delicious!!! I wish I had pictures to share. Visit them. You won't be disappointed.

I12qARq4RH8zMbYuOHpbvQ.text: I took my parents out on Sunday for their vacation and it was he worst decision I've ever made. It tasted the WORLD worst steak I've ever ever had. I'm so furious that I spent over 500 dollars here  The steaks were all burnt  Lobster tail was completely dry  One ribeye steak was so burnt outside but inside was completely red and cold!!! Have you ever had a cold steak inside before? The best was the clam chowder  I'm warning everybody not to come here because it seriously will be the worst decision ever

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I asked for medium rare yet it was worse than rare and was cold
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All burnt blacked too charred outside inside is so rare! Worst steak ever

DLp_m-PqV27aqwmiGwA45A.text: We were a Party of 6 the service was excellent the stakes were great except the aged New York strip had some nerve but still tasty. The sides were good but the Cheesy mashed potatoes was a disaster they said it was Asiago Cheese except that asiago cheese tasted like cheap Parmesan overpowering the entire dish and we had two orders. Overall would of still been ok but most got sick that night or feeling the effects now. I just wanted our bill was approx 294.00 and 201.00 why split that way I haven't a clue. We paid 600.00 not bad but you really are killing my night and my time in Vegas the next day. I love the old Gallagher's from Atlantic City inside Resorts casino White it's nostalgia and history it was one of my favorite steak places to take my mother and we went to AC for a trip, She's gone now and I guess so our you.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy Potato top of picture of the real offender

636Mh0lcwlC9GsZWCzsOtA.text: Stopped in for late night dinner. Friendly service. Great food! I had the scallop appetizer and that was yummy. The filet was good too.

iIF72bfClsgNyhSvz9NUyg.text: I will start by saying the service and the ambience are wonderful. The crab legs were superlative. My disappointment? Yikes...it was the steak (hence the two stars). I'm a huge fan of dry aged steak. Saw the aging steak in the window at the front of the restaurant and made some assumptions I shouldn't have. Misleading and tantalizing as the image of dry aging steak was, I admit that the sign on the wall clearly says that the bone in NY strip is only dry aged 15 days and then wet aged. Which, of course, means the steak isn't at all dry aged in the sense that those of us who are fans of dry aged steaks understand it: 4-6 weeks for dry aged taste and 6- 8+ weeks for the next level in flavor and aroma. Shame on me for not reading the sign.  Ordered the "dry aged" bone in NY strip. Took that first bite expecting the flavor of a dry aged steak that I love so much. And then despair and disappointment...a steak I could have gotten just about anywhere. Suggestion to restaurant: either really serve a dry aged steak or don't create the illusion.

FCYRw5f4zoKQioCJjDSKiA.text: We have eaten at Gallagher's over the years and we will not be returning. The quality of the food has diminished as well as the service standards. Aside from our busser/ assistant our experience was less than stellar. When you are paying 250 plus dollars for dinner. It should be a great experience. The lack of training in simple etiquette of the service staff shows the level of detail forgotten here.   Treat every table with the same respect. Don't assume because we have a teenage daughter with us that we aren't good tippers. We were neglected from the moment we got there. The food was subpar for what we paid.  We ordered 3 filets mid rare. All came out different temps and varying quality. Our sides were the same. The creamed spinach was a milky texture. The garlic mash potatoes were thin and looked like they were out of a bag.   I do not recommend eating here anymore. I have eaten at Gallagher's for the last 12 years. From celebrating birthdays etc. Disappointing visit all the way around.

OZ8Rg19H0U4CGScmBPfnvQ.text: The service is great! Price doesn't scare me away and normally guarantees an amazing steak. I thought I was eating a steak at Denny's! Lobster tail was not worth it either, over cooked! Very disappointing! But hey the mashed potatoes were good.

K4LLgrpOlJOZdJP_EgSDKw.text: My husband and I dined at Gallagher's the other night. The service was excellent and so was the food. Let it be known that the steakhouse does not serve USDA prime. But nonetheless the steaks are excellently prepared.  We were served all of the preliminaries (ex water, bread) promptly. To start out the hubby orders clam chowder, which he says was very good but, not as good as Chart House's. I order the spinach salad which contained sliced strawberries, watermelon, nuts, bleu cheese, and a very light dressing--too light, almost non-existent. I do not recommend this salad.   With our entrees we ordered a very nice Pinot Noir by Macmurry Ranch. Our entrees were a filet mignon and a surf and turf (6oz filet and 1lb. of split king crab legs). Our sides included a sauce of shallots and Beaujolais and asparagus. Everything was amazing. Unfortunately we were so full we didn't have any room for dessert. We really wanted to try the bread pudding too! Next time!  I highly recommend this restaurant but I do wish they served USDA prime. IMO they're just that much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet, filet w/king crab, shallot/Beaujolais sauce, asparagus, a Sauvignon blanc, and the awesome MacMurray Ranch Pinot noir.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach salad, not recommended

f1rn55bQ30DiV2tlSYceyw.text: Located inside New York, NY, this place looks a little less upscale in passing by, but the ambiance comes alive when you go inside. The waitstaff is professional, attentive and formal, which helped to raise the the classy vibe of the place.   Don't fill up on the bread (delicious as it was)-- you're going to need to save all the stomach space you can for the fantastic cut of meat that will soon be coming your way. It's been about a week and I think I'm still full from this dinner.  The Prime Rib of Beef was fabulous. Our server told me it was a "Queen Cut", which is about an inch thick. This is the thickest prime rib I've ever seen! It could have easily been split between 2 people. Toward the end of dinner, I was completely full and just had to sit there and stare at it for a good 10 minutes to convince myself I had enough room for another few bites.  The texture was great. At first bite, I thought the flavor was good. After pouring the au jus all over it, I was in love. The au jus had a beef or vegetable broth flavor to it. It was very unique in comparison to other au jus I've had in the past. I'm not a huge fan of fat on my meat/steak, but the fat was very tender and melt-in-your-mouth good.   The mac n cheese was good from the few bites I had of it. I was more focused on trying to take down my giant cut of Prime Rib.    Added bonus: $10 cocktails! Score! Good price for Vegas hotel restaurant/bar. Another bonus-- This restaurant is right by the Zumanity theatre-- very convenient if you're trying to catch a nice dinner before the show. Reservations definitely recommended.

DmbCzKbLbDeEDQMuKXmNbA.text: Best NY steak. I usually go to NY NY hotel in Vegas and always see the aging steaks. I finally decided to try this restaurant, which does compare to Gordon Ramsey New York Steak House.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diver&#39;s scallops were very delicious. $18
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meal for 2 people. Sides come in large portions.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porter house $56

pFAn7IqL70iUjoMCE6JgoA.text: I love everything here. You seriously can't go wrong with anything. My husband loves the prime rib, I love all the salads and the vegetable sides. The cocktails are awesome. I real like the pomegranate lemon drop.. It's very tasty.    Come for a nice dinner here you won't be disappointed!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled green beans
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled asparagus
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heirloom tomato &amp; hearts of Palm salad.

cOY73rKJcfYr45StMeFyQQ.text: Great NY strip steak.  It was large enough to share with a baked potato, green beans and spinach.  Wish I lived closer to come back more often.

FIDBgSEcTTmUV0FwX0CEVw.text: My tastebuds are begging for more! Nothing tops this restaurant!! Started with soup and salad, which was a clam chowder and Caesar salad. Chowder was to die for I enjoyed every bite. Salad was good too. Next was crab cakes with shrimp scampi on the side. Delicious!!! I had a glass of white wine, which really brought all the flavors together. Last was the New York strip steak, huge portion(s) and a side of asparagus. Never had anything as good as this place. Will be a place I come to every time im here.   Service was very nice also, everyone very polite.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whats left of my steak.

6jj1vWREjK5lJZTfHJi9vw.text: Good but not great.  Waiter put in the wrong order and steaks were a bit overcooked.  Yukon gold whipped potatoes and creamed corn sides were quite good.  Portions were decent.

wlTNn0peqYeZmrzCPrtREg.text: Dined at Gallagher's while staying at New York New York  Service was great food was great  Had ribeye cooked to a perfect medium rare  Side potatoes was good as was the beet salad   Will go back next time we r in vegas

sOkyexkL_hJvvviEODfVOw.text: We came here for a celebratory birthday dinner. The atmosphere is not intimate if that is what you are looking for, but it is nice. The service is spot on, the busboy was on top of everything.   The food is good, no complaints. This is a True steakhouse, how you order your steak is exactly how it comes. Some chain restaurants tend to overcook the meat slightly, so be aware, medium rare here is medium rare.   We started with a stuffed portobello mushroom. It was tasty, to be honest it tasted like the ones I cook at home. Perhaps they were peeking in my kitchen.   We each ordered a filet mignon and shared a side of asparagus between the two of us. I believe this is the way to go at this restaurant. It was plenty of food. Everything is a la carte. Both of our steaks were cooked exactly to order as mentioned above. They were good steaks, but not wow I've never had a steak this good.. good.   We finished with a creme brulee. My favorite. It was creamy in the middle with a perfect crust on top, just as it should be.   We went with two other couples. With gratuity included (party of 6 or more), our bill per couple was slightly over 200. Not bad. Of course we had a beer each and an after dinner drink. I think the food served was worth the price, based on quality cuts of meat and the skill at which it was cooked. However, I think for the price I may be able to find something with more of a wow factor for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of asparagus. Tasty. Crisp tender.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare filet mignon

GFwIelLGMMkf-0PRtfy-Xw.text: My family will tell you, that I refuse to eat at a restaurant where I could produce the same product myself. Gallagher steakhouse absolutely made me eat my words! Whether it be the amount of mesquite wood they are using to cook their steaks on the open flame or their drying process but I'll tell you what this was one of the best steaks I've ever eaten at any restaurant in any part of the world hands down!It is a bit of a maze to find going through the New York New York hotel but it is absolutely worth it!

b4FYKbtZVrvC1MW-1CaIXw.text: The hubby and I spent our Valentine's Day in the sin city Las Vegas. We made dinner reservations at NY-NY Gallagher's Steakhouse. From the beginning we were greeted by a friendly hostess and did not have to wait due to our reservation. Once seated, we were welcomed by a courteous, friendly and informative waiter. We asked for recommendations on the drinks, appetizers, and the steaks. Some were taken and others were not. I ordered the raspberry lemon drop martini, rimmed with sugar, the drink was delightful and hubby ordered his normal drink of an old-fashion with Jim Beam. Our appetizer, a waiter recommendation, was the oyster rockefeller, this appetizer was so good, it came with six sweet oysters topped with a spinach bread crumple and delicious cheese. We squeezed some lemon on top and they were gone before we blinked, great recommendation.   Our second round of drinks, I ordered the Moscow mule, I'm a big fan of the floral notes and ginger beer in mules and the hubby ordered a blue moon. I ordered the pear& walnut salad, this was good but not great, plating and presentation could be better. My other half had the Caesar salad, same thoughts. Our main meals included petite filets and Australian lobster topped with crab. Our streaks were cook to our specifications, flavorful and tender but the star of the night was the lobster, so fluffy white and buttery...melt in ur mouth good! For the dessert we ordered the dessert of the evening, chocolate and red velvet heart pastries, a sweet finish to a great intimate dinner with my loved one.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Valentine&#39;s Day dessert
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet with Australian lobster
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscow mule with Oyster rockefeller

JIhNh0l63i1h1mQ43n9tKA.text: Terrible dry steak and over buttered everything else. Although service was fantastic and the wine was delicious! Otherwise save your money for something else

zRcMQwtJr2y3FAA2OEJ0JQ.text: This was a great place with friendly staff i had grilled sea bass with lobster and asparagras risotto and sweetpotato puree omg yummy my hubby had filet and lobster. What a wonderfull dinner for our new years eve anniversary! We will be back agian!

d_9TkGj7O4WqTJNROx9UXw.text: If price is a concern,  don't come here. But if great food, exceptional service, And great atmosphere is important then this is the place for you. Large portions on the ala cart menu fill even the stomach of the hearty eater.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib, kings cut
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great bread basket.

cpVlKrg3LFUq7VefNQTtCg.text: A five, a five, and another five. So many fives. Gallagher's is so good. Simply put, probably the best steak I've ever eaten.  The menu claimed that the aged Strip was their trademark, but I went ahead and ordered a filet mignon. A few moments after I regretted my decision, but after taking a bite, I was really glad that I ordered what I did. The filet mignon has an incredible crust on the outside, and my steak was cooked just about as I ordered it (medium rare) on the inside. I say "just about" because parts of mine were a bit rare, but not raw, so I wasn't at all picky about it. I also opted to get their chowder as an appetizer, had a side of green beans with my steak, and tried the calamari -- which was my first time ever having it. Oh yeah, I also had some mac and cheese.  All really excellent. If you haven't eaten calamari, I'll just tell you that (at least in this case) it's a very mild almost nonexistent flavored flavor with a slightly chewy but tender texture to it. The appearance of tentacles may gross you out if you order it, but trust me, it's good eats. The mac and cheese was also great and had a nice little bitterness to it to keep the already rich cheese from being over the top. I often tend to much prefer baked mac and cheese, but Gallagher's is some of the best non-baked mac and cheese I've had. The chowder was delicious as well, and was probably my favorite I've ever had until I wound up having some in Seattle, but that's for another review. I really liked the fact that it was a bit on the thinner side, because super thick chowders just aren't my thing. I didn't get much of a bacon flavor, but I did get a bacon smokiness which was fantastic.  Gallagher's is expensive. If you couldn't guess that by it being a steakhouse in Vegas, you'd hopefully guess it based on the look of the place. I will tell you that everything about Gallagher's is phenomenal. It was a bit too warm for comfort sitting next to the kitchen, but everything about it was awesome. I'd like to try another "fancy" restaurant the next time in Vegas, but it'd be hard for me to go somewhere other than Gallagher's when I know it's so damn delicious.

ozTWJqtUE7iCxBsjvVMvXQ.text: Didn't love this place as much as I wanted to :( the steaks are OK, I just feel as though if you're going to pay $200 for dinner for 2, it needs to be impeccable. Will not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake appetizer was AMAZZZING !
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar view
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmm

M09ABdBeMSIhGvFtzxtaXg.text: This was our first time at Gallagher's and we weren't sure what to expect. But we were vary pleased with everything. The meal was good (steak cooked perfect) and our service was great ( thanks Mikey). If there was one knock it's that it's loud, but I guess that's to be expected being we were having dinner at 10am in a casino.

E3NCC6SY_u8cStEfWiDfRA.text: Service was horrible except for the water boy who comes around every like three minutes. Ended up waiting an hour for food to arrive so if you have a show or anything on your schedule I would recommend at least two hours ahead for this place. I'm from Texas and I will say I had much better marbled steaks for much cheaper. I tried this place specifically for the "dry" aged steak which is supposed to bring out the steak flavor or enhance it in its own way, but it did not. On top of that they do not put any spices on their steaks. Not even salt or pepper. For the price I wouldn't suggest it. If your looking to spend cash on sub-par food then go here

XzNugSP-rLfn5dllqvC6Mw.text: We're big on eating yummy steaks!! And although my boyfriend didn't quite enjoy his (prime rib), I on the other hand, really enjoyed and, may I add, finished mine (Porterhouse)!!! It was juicy and just cooked well. For our sides: mac&cheese which was gone within 5 minutes compliments to my boyfriend. Also we got a baked potatoe which was dry and bland. Nothing too special.  I would have given 5 stars, but one reason I didnt is because our waiter was probably never seen. He took our order and that was the last of him. We reached out to him for our check and after we paid we left. He never came to check on us. It was actually another gentleman, not sure if he was a busboy or cook but he was wearing all white, whom was helping us make sauces for our steaks and actually came to pack up my boyfriend's leftovers.  Another reason for not giving 5 stars, they don't have any bathrooms inside the restaurant. You actually have to go outside of restaurant and share a bathroom with the rest of NewYork NewYork. Mind you there was a huuuge line and super inconvenient.

kgrHqBVtGATeIhZGZmBUuw.text: This was the wife and I's second time eating here for an anniversary. This time was even better than the last and probably the best meal of my life! Truly exceptional. We booked in advance using opentable.com (which was super easy) and were seated as quick as they could set up the table. We ordered the mac and cheese, asparagus, avocado microgreens salad, and split the Dry Aged New York steak. The microgreens salad came out first and to say this thing was delicious would be an understatement. It was bursting with flavor. Then, when I thought it couldn't get much better, the steak came out. Wow! Dry aged is 100% the way to go and I am definitely a changed man after consuming that steak. It was cooked to perfection, tender, and absolutely delicious. Oh and if your wife isn't a big meat eater like mine, this steak was perfect for the both of us. I cut off probably a 4-6oz edge for her and we both left VERY full. Service was great and it was a perfect start to the night.

xjTwY6kCwg734dVEkRnDVQ.text: I'd actually give them 3.5 stars. We showed up right on time for our reservation but still had to wait 10 minutes for our table. There was no room at the bar so we just had to wait around. The place was packed on a Friday night so I'm sure a reservation is necessary.  My wife's heirloom tomato salad really wasn't as the menu described it. My caesar was good. Both of our entrees were wonderful. My prime rib was bigger than advertised and full of flavor. Her filet and lobster were both to her liking. The lobster was especially good.  The reason for taking a star away was the overall service. My wife's water glass was frequently empty and we rarely saw our server. Our bread basket was empty and just left on the small 2 top table after the salads were delivered and then taken away.  Either take it away or ask us if we want more. I was never asked if I wanted another drink either, and by the end we figured we'd just head out to the casino to get another one.  The food was great but even on a busy night neither of us felt like we had a great overall experience, and when we're paying these prices, we simply expect better service, and they fell short.

OaZbNoW7AP00-0IURLUn4g.text: The steaks here are excellent! The service is good too. A great steak won't cost you $50+ here either. This is my Favorite Steakhouse in LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AiBcxqgsW-rwdm-h3HyAKw.text: decent grub, prices are simply too high for what you get, but its vegas. Tried their house special steak and lobster tail they shelled on the table. Lobster was tasty but not near as soft as it should be couldnt chew parts. As for the aged-steak, tasted heavenly, but again, so many  unchewable areas left me looking for room to put chewed unswallowable chunks of meat. Too much fat was left on and it was blended all over the meat you cant just cut a part and the fat is out. Best part of meal, an incredible, best of the best warm spinach salad, hands down the most memorable and best salad ive had in 34 years. Definately not worth returning for the price, but they comped my ass since I'm a table freak, so a $20 tip didnt seem that bad. Good service, mixed food, 100% not worth the price except that darn salad still salivating over it---ORDER IT

WfVIoQsg2saGtQKxoV7_EQ.text: My food was 4 stars might i say,  filet mignon steak cooked just like i wanted. Green beans and lobster tail- about 4 stars as well.  But here's why i give them 2 stars.  The waiter fails to mention that the salad he would be bringing, was a hunk of a slice of lettuce with miscellaneous items thrown over it, thus making it a salad! On top of that my lobster tail was twice the price of my steak. Last but not least, me and the boyfriend became severely sick.  The worst stomach ache and diarrhea known to man.  This was the last thing we needed to end our Vegas trip! We spent our last night taking turns on the ivory throne, pooping our lives away. We couldn't point out if it was the lobster or the steak.  The next day after having peptol bismol our stomachs settled and i had leftovers,  my boyfriend decided to take a chance with the steak again,  whaddaya know,  he's pooping his brains out once again.  Very bad experience and i don't think we will ever visit again.  Thanks for the overly priced laxative though.

F0-5c0zCHWSha79juevheA.text: Definetely a great steakhouse. Went there with husbands family and we were all satisfied (besides the lil one... not so much of a kids place). You can dress casual or go all out and dress up nice... we seen alot of people dressed up in business attire, some were casual. The food was great. I ordered the salmon. Small portion, but filling! Our waiter was awesome and came by every few minutes to make sure everything was okay. In other words... I would definetely recommend this place.

arpo8_qtqCqx2AVlKlmCMQ.text: Gallagher's is home to the best steak meal I have ever had and also one of the worst.  The first time my man and I dined here we ordered a dry aged filet for him and the steak and lobster special for me...long story short, my plate was $200 of pure, unadulterated goodness (In related news, you should probably ask how much Market Price is...now we know) containing a 20-ounce sirloin AND a WHOLE LOBSTER (Seriously.  Not the tail.  THE WHOLE THING.) that was cracked at the table for me.  It was amazing and continues to reign supreme as the most expensive thing I have ever eaten.  The second time we came, I was still in awe of my last trip and expected the same glorious experience to happen again (this time with less steak and lobster).  The second time around, however, I spent a ton of money on an overcooked, dry, and tasteless steak.  How a restaurant can deliver such opposing meals makes it hard to want to come here for a third try.  I want to go again, especially when staying at NYNY, but I'm afraid the consistency just isn't there...OR I can go with the knowledge that I will have to be that guy and send my steak back (which I NEVER do) because for the money I am paying, the steak should blow my mind.

7cYhXqLSyeRrrbO2JjWgpg.text: Man.. we went to Gallaghers with a very high expectation.  That was mistake #1.  We went there without reservations (mistake #2), but happily waited 1.5hrs.  Then we ordered our steaks (Filet Mignon and the their signature, aged sirloin) cooked medium... big mistake.. huge (mistake #3).  I asked the server how they cook their meat.. medium = pink all the way through?  The server said confidently yes.  We trusted him.  I had wrongly assumed that steakhouses tend to undercook their meat (order medium = get medium rare..).  Our steak was dry.  Both of ours.  The filet was medium well.  Some parts were cooked all the way through.  We should've complained.  But we didn't.  I almost choked on some parts of the meat.  My wife kept telling me that I cook a better steak at home.  The appetizer (oysters) were ok, but they were nothing special at $3 per piece.  The soup (chowder) and the caesar salad was pretty good.  Up until the steaks came out we were very happy.  Then the steaks just disappointed us.  Man.. I really really love steaks and I had high hopes.    We were there with 2 little kids.  They gave us a booth and we did ok.  I always feel bad about taking little kids to nice restaurants.  It could be annoying to others there.  It would've been worth all the trouble taking little ones to a good restaurant if the meat was good.    Now, forever I'll wonder what if I ordered the steaks medium rare.. or even rare... forever.  Service was good, but not excellent.  Atmosphere was ok.  it's an upscale, busy restaurant.  If you're gonna go here, make sure to get a reservation and order steaks rare.  I would've given them 2 stars but because it was us who ordered medium.. 3 stars for what it could've been.

Xl_aZ92Aplh6505m7LIdZw.text: Gallagher's remains the place where I had the best steak of my life. I had the cowboy steak which is a ribeye cut with the whole rib bone left in. It was cooked perfectly and was so big I couldn't finish it in the time I usually do. Every dish is presented beautifully. The sides are even great. I can't wait to visit LV again to stop by Gallagher's. It is expensive but worth the money. It is a little hard to get the attention of the staff sometimes but whatever. The wait for a table can be a bit much so make reservations.

Bb1ndJEzf7fdtQW9BGLKtg.text: Best steak ever. Filet mignon cooked to absolute perfection. Sides were great too - mac and cheese (not your typical mac and cheese) and creamed spinach. Service was excellent. Prices are are about $40-50 per person without alcohol but you pay that much in Las Vegas for a buffet. Excellent meal.

zwEJqrMAm885V1zQYSbJww.text: Best steak ever; you have to try their signature dry aged meat!  Their steaks come with this grilled garlic bulb that compliments the steak, but be ready for stinky breathe!

kXurYNNfJK2ClWPCI69tcA.text: Love this place. Come here every Vegas trip. The cowboy ribeye is my favorite. Service is great. Everything you expect from a steakhouse.

UVcCok2dqDL51sKN4BwgTg.text: Less than zero quality for service and food. Sunday evening sometime around 7PM.
