Party of four, two appetizers, two $40 bottles of wine, their signature dry-aged NY strips for all of us. We were seated fairly quickly. Three menus for four of us. Wrong apps the first time, waiter argued and told us what he brought was correct. FAIL! Bread finally came, not fresh. FAIL! Yeah, I know it's not a bakery. First bottle finished. No entrees. Second bottle ordered. 3/4 bottle completed. Entrees arrive. I appreciate dry-aged beef flavor and texture, ordered rare and medium rare. Their meat quality leaves much to be desired. Argumentative service doesn't garner any points. Room acoustics are abysmal. Large parties should now share the same small dining area with quiet intimate tables.

tSMmBFYqPuKeuc3AplIzDA.text: The best steak ever. Period! Most expensive steak I've bought. Period! Glad I had good luck at the Black Jack tables to help finance the dinner.

iB_HR_mS0ATH3S2apXKwfQ.text: My husband, my friend and I  wanted to enjoy our  New Year's Eve dinner at this restaurant since we've heard great things.  Unfortunately, it was all but great.  None of the personnel, with exception of the water waiter, was carrying a smile on their faces. We placed our orders and realized that our waiter named Aris never asked my husband how he wanted his $63 file minion done, not to mention that it arrived in a very pathetic looking form... it was dry and tasteless and we almost thought we are the wrong place.  He also very arrogantly replied to our question when we asked to share an entry - saying that it is the busiest night of the year and guests must order full entries.  When he brought our wine and mineral water for spritzers, he literally said: "here you go, please mix it yourself, because I don't know how you want it".  Not to mention that we felt very rushed as they were taking our plates away.  And then, we did something we have never done before:  we tipped the water waiter and told him that he was the only nice person in the restaurant and we left zero tip on a $207 bill for Aris.  I hope the Gallagher's management reads this review and does something to improve...in the meantime, we will continue going back to the CircusCircus Steakhouse that never failed us.

g7cBPcgiGkCeGRM5HRr5qg.text: The best aged rib eye on the bone I've tasted.  Service was great, wine list superb. You like steak with old fashion genuine service? This is the place in Vegas. Tip. Do the in house casino roller coaster before dinner rather than after. It is equally as good.

tq-z-Gv0sPmGIB2csyRYRA.text: My wife and I cames here for our 3rd but this time it was for my b-day and I ate like I've never had steak before in my life.  This place is so good and when you are in there it doesn't even seem like you are in the middle of a busy casino ..l highly recommend this place.. Oh and take your special someone.

suqKNBe9PyXT_dsnPXQREw.text: It's Vegas. I'm a SoCal native and Vegas is ALWAYS a weekend option especially since it's only a few hour drive away. Minus all the obvious reasons one of the big attractions for me has always been food. Whether it's finding the next best buffet, a unique cuisine or just some top notch high end restaurants all concentrated into a small area. One thing I try to always do when getting into Vegas is to find a new steakhouse. Well this time around I was recommended to Gallagher's.   First off it's a welcome change to enter a steakhouse not feeling out of place with everyone dressed up as if they were going ballroom dancing. We were seated for a table of eight. It was quite early and we had a 8PM dinner reservation. We are all meat eaters so our table had center cut filets, new york sirloin, queen cut prime rib and for myself the cowboy ribeye steak. Minutes later they came back to tell us they ran out of prime rib. I mean it's barely a quarter past 8pm. Whatever they proceeded to change their order to a steak instead.   But back to my steak. I like it "Black and Blue." Now there are some places that I will make sure they know what I'm talking about but these type of high end restaurants with this high of a rating I would imagine they would know. Also my server took my preference without skipping a beat. Normally if the case I will be asked for an explanation if they don't know. When brought out of course it was clearly not black and blue but it was rare. I told the server that this was not "Black and Blue" and that it was rare. She proceeded to tell me "That is how OUR black and blue is." What the hell does that mean? Now I can eat my steak medium rare (normally cheaper or skinnier steaks) and I can eat it rare also but it's my least choice. The funny thing was that she didn't even offer to send it back to have it redone, she instead stared at me with a long pause as though to say, just eat the damn thing. I hate sending food back, possibly fear from the movie "Waiting" and stories from friends. So I just kept it. It tasted like wet beef. It's almost as if they kept it in a bucket of water overnight threw on the grill and slapped it on my plate. For my side I had creamed spinach which was more cream then there was spinach. This is a first also, I did not finish my steak. Blasphemy!!! It was simply that bad. You might be thinking hey you got it rare, well shoot I've had it rare many places and have loved it.   The highlight of the night was simply the spirits menu which was a lit up menu that at first I thought it was a touch screen but it wasn't. The wine was excellent that was chosen by the server but do not remember the name, simply because I was so upset about my meal. Everyone else had similar opinions being average but nothing spectacular.   When it comes down to it the food was not even ok. I'm surprised this place is still here with so many steakhouses popping up in Vegas now you can easily walk down the street and find another prime steakhouse. The two stars is almost out of sympathy since the only reason the second star is there is my wine and scotch. Either way it's hard to want to give this place a second chance again since there are so many other options available. Maybe once I've exhausted all other places and I make my rounds again I might give this place a try if I'm stuck at NYNY or have won a few black chips while at the table.

T0OWE_t_HfmfQl4XMB-ZrQ.text: Top notch steak house..have their aged NY Sirlion never disappoints..the Wedge Salad for starters and the cheese cake for desert.. Very professional service..wonderful steakhouse atmosphere ..on par with their other restaurants in NYC and Atlantic City

vGXdvkMq17pIPBAHFcvYXg.text: Been to this place once, the steaks are good, the house aged sirloin  was big, dry, hard and tasted great, good flavor. But again, it was hard and dry. I guess they have not perfected their dry aging process. Sides dishes were top notch and, big enough to share. I also tried their ribeye, very good, but it didn't make my jaw drop like the steaks at Strip steak, or the 9.

j9fGWn_BJqd4KILzoJxm1w.text: Was there on 2/6 for dinner. Service was very good. Very loud inside. Food was very good although the steak - New York Strip -didn't really wow me and was kinda tough. I was hoping to be more impressed after all the good reviews

2bIWPRL9TWNRLZiejki-WQ.text: I LOVE GALLANGHER'S STEAKHOUSE.  This was the first restaurant I went back to when I came back to visit Las Vegas.   If I had to choose one favorite restaurant in Vegas, this might be it. I've been to many steakhouses in other locations as well like Mastro's Steakhouse, Lawry's. But I have to say this is my favorite out of all. The price is definitely affordable and the food is just AMAZING.   My favorite on the menu is definitely shrimp scampi for appetizer and colossal baked potato for the side. I only tried their dry aged new york steak, and I love it. Even the bread they give you on the side was really good, One minor miss for me was the desert section. I wish they had more to choose from, since there were only a few to choose from.   One thing on the menu that I would definitely NOT recommend however, is their caesar salad. It was really not that great. I would defiantly order something else on the menu.   Give this place a shot if you are at Vegas and want to have good steak.

jZ9r6-C6YVDn-rKz0FiKxw.text: This is our go to steak house in LV, superb food and excellent service. This last visit we had a blip in the system, my husbands NY was over cooked.  Our server didn't even hesitate she took his plate and had a new one made in less than 10 minutes.  As always the shrimp cocktail was on point as well as the prime rib.  The creamy horseradish is awesome too.  Save room for the sticky toffee pudding, best dessert in the world! Great music too old school Italian classics... Good ol Blue Eyes!

-gSBRm6WSf98U8uAedt7_A.text: Food was amazing. Be prepared for an expensive meal though.    Considering my husband and I are bad service magnets, the service wasn't too bad.  The waiter did get a little pissy with us when I had to send my steak back.  It was supposed to be medium rare and it was bordering well done.  But he brought it back and seemed to want me to assure him repeatedly that all was ok.  Other than that, it was great.  I would go back for sure.  The clam chowder is amazing.

2cBMpqystpR1Wjiv0JRfIg.text: One of the beat steaks we have ever had. Husband had the prime rib and it was super tender the knife cut through it like butter. I had the NY aged steak which we both agreed was better than his prime rib. We've always seen the windows with the dry aged and yes they are as good as they look!! For sides we ha the four cheese macaroni which was super creamy and cheesy. Along with the sauteed spinach which was very tasty. Great overall experience, waiter was a little snobby but he gave great suggestions.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged steak AMazing

kpWtQ3h4lrv66rCX-mzzCw.text: Very good service, even for sitting in the back corner. We ordered a ribeye and fillet, both were good I would compare the steak to one I can get at a salt grass steak house. The potatoes sides were the real bread winner that gave us the wow factor.

BoinbeKgac7GvQu-zfHm7A.text: This is a two part rating. I am rating this restaurant for food & service when we came in on 3 occasions. First occasion was last 2011,  Thanksgiving 2012 & on Dec 30, 2012. On all occasions service & food were great!!! No problem even without reservations. And there were one time even though we have reservation we had to wait for 15 mins. Still we were ok with it. Dec 30, my BF ordered Prime Rib, medium rare. Everyone thinks its more rare than usual, but it is still ok. Split a Ribeye with sis, and they split it for us. Correctly seasoned and service were attentive. We thought ok, we know this is a good steak resto, reasonably priced and good customer service. We can come back again and again.  Now, the updated version:   We tried coming in again on Dec 31, the next day. We were staying at the hotel. So we just came down from our room and tried getting in.   1st Receptionist: How many on your party? Me: 2 2nd Receptionist (one next to 1st receptionist): Sorry, but we are fully over booked tonight if you dont have a reservation.  My issue with that conversation was that why ask how many in the party when you are going to say that they have to turn us away. They could've said right then and there do you have a reservation? And not ask how many on your party and then turn us away with a flimsy excuse of saying they are FULLY OVER BOOKED. Like in NO CHANCE IN HELL will we let you in.

FQFT0y1asdw4iYiyZPCz4A.text: Had the roasted beet salad, filet mignon, bone in New York steak, baked potatoe, and dessert. Everything was excellent except the New York steak was very difficult to cut and chew. Lots of fat and gristle.   Service was out of this world.

FxgxT6ucm87Vq29eYRDwLw.text: I used to look forward to their great tasting steaks but from now on I will pass. It was a hundred and ten outside and I tried to get a table with a sleeveless shirt on. They refused my business and said If I bought a t-shirt with sleeves I could get in. So I go to the new hersheys store and grab a t-shirt and they let me in. While I am eating my meal they seat a sleeveless man right next to me! Wtf? Discrimination? Your call. We complained and they comped me ONE drink. Less than the cost of my t-shirt. Will never go again!

y_Rv4CBdJWPTFNUbXeb7ZA.text: Must have picked an off night because I had one of the worst steaks of my life. The bartenders were great. I see a lot of positives on here, so I'll just chalk it up to a bad night. Haven't left my room since, if you catch my drift.

CeFVy0Et0rskkiTPiTKiVQ.text: Contact Meat sweats.    Urban Dictionary describes meat sweats as:  To consume an obsene amount of meat resulting in perfuse sweating.  I got the meat sweats just watching an insane amount of meat being consumed.  One King Cut Prime Rib, about the size of a small dinosaur, landed with a thud on our table.  It was then I understood why my friend didn't order any sides.  This steak was  going to be a challenge.    Another challenge unfortunately, was understanding the price tag.  I get it.  Fine dining atmosphere, dry aged beef and fresh seafood.  To me it was a fluffed up steakhouse.  Not bad, but not outstanding enough to shell out that kind of dough again.    Located inside the New York New York Hotel and Casino right near the main entrance.  The restaurant is completely open facing the commotion of the casino passers by.  The bar wraps around so you can have a drink while waiting for a table.  It's decorated with photos of famous New York alumni covering the walls.  You can take a look at the steak they use in a window outside, dry aging under bright lights.  Looks like something out of Dexter.  We made an Open Table Reservation and we were seated right on time.  It took a few minutes to be acknowledged after we sat down, but our waiter was pleasant and fun once he arrived.    I ordered the Filet and my boyfriend ordered the Dry Aged New York Sirloin.  Both our steaks were the wrong temperature.  I don't normally eat meat, so an under cooked steak is cringe-worthy to me.  I toughed through it because we needed to be at a concert.  The soup I ordered was a beer cheese soup and it was probably the highlight of my meal, along with the side of mushrooms I ordered.  The asparagus tasted like pure butter and they were cold.  Then a family sat down next to us and we watched a little kid eat a filet with ketchup.. oh boy.  It was cute that the waiter cut the steak for him though.  Man Vs. Food challenge:  Food wins!  Defeated my friend Geno, but made a homeless man on the bridge grin from ear to ear.  He was eating good that night.

_OryDLucwNt8mjQChUlEOQ.text: Very disappointing, if you know good beef, skip this place.  The filet was tough and grisly ---my husband's signature bone in strip was chewy and grisly as well.  This is not prime beef.  You are better off getting a steak from Walmart and cooking it in your microwave.  The atmosphere and service only made the experience worse.  Never again

djhtG0-gH-xFBbAG7sln2A.text: Went to Gallagher's for a Birthday Dinner. Atmosphere is lively and service is absolutely amazing. For appetizers we had the Clams Casino and the Tomatoes and Mozzarella, which were great choices. I had the Dry Aged NY Sirloin which was cooked to perfection, I ordered it medium rare. Lots of good sides to choose from. There are a lot more expensive steak houses in town but I honestly don't think they are any better than the food that we had. The meal was delicious!  For great service, quality of food, and price- you can't go wrong with Gallagher's!

lo7eYZ1WI6VLYVM8Nqg4QQ.text: The highlight of my dinner was the Dry-Aged New York Strip which is probably one of the best steaks I've ever had, and big enough to share for two.  Got the special side which was the garlic and cheddar mashed potatoes and it was delicious, and the seasonal mushroom medley was great too!!

UfCJVwRyF-NlLmOWO8zbpA.text: The restaurant has excellent meats and large portions. The Filet was cooked to perfection and the meat melts in your mouth, The rack of lamb 8 ribs was excellent also has some vegis on the side.  Cream of spinach was excellent.  The Bread was NY texture.  The restaurant had excellent service But we were seated in a room full of large parties.  It was louder than a subway station, there was a large bachelor 's party,  which made it impossible to  enjoy the meal.  We made a comment to the waiter and was resigned to tough it out since it was a Sat night and packed. The manager come over after a few minutes and offered us a move to a different section.  "WOW"  This is amazing and he also bought our dessert Cheesecake .  The the Cheesecake is creamy and smooth so it left a sweet taste in our mouth for the restaurant. I feel bad that I gave the a 4 star, but the restaurant accoustics needs a little work.  Kudo's to management for going out of their way to make things right.

VYf2UV2o-alv4VoM6_zsOg.text: This is our favorite steakhouse.  Amazing service and wonderful food.  We split the prime rib and the server was great about cutting it and plating it for both of us.  Try the New England clam chowder it is incredible.

WjEOOCrgSvnI85NmDGDLXw.text: Went last night, the aging steak display was killing my boyfriend! We started off with the tuna tartare which was melt-in-your mouth delish. He got their signature sirloin dry and wet aged steak and I had the filet. We both cleaned our plates and walked out ridiculously stuffed.  Our waiter was great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartare - absolutely delish!

Tfv3_HkgMViY7CHpu0nCJQ.text: came here for my boyfriend's 25th birthday over 4th of july weekend & we had a great time! they accommodated our large group of 15 right away & service was incredible. their steak is absolutely amazing. the atmosphere is old school & classic. pretty decently priced too for a las vegas steakhouse.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. amazing AND delicious

qYg1yHSoJ9A0DGY2SrRZVw.text: Came here for my sister's 21st birhday. Service was good and the steaks were delish. I can't remember our servers name, but he was very polite. We got a complimentary dessert to help celebrate my sis' bday. I always appreciate when restaurants do that.  I've been to Morton's, DK Steakhouse, and Ruth's Chris in Hawaii and I thought the quality of the meat was good. I'll go back if I'm in town again.

621ZIVmku5YMJqog3rtvJA.text: I don't even know what to say to explain how good the ribeye was. My wife got the filet mignon which was also mouth-watering. We got mushrooms and mashed potatoes as sides. We both left full and happy. The service was spot on and the ambiance was sophisticated but lively. I will definitely visit again.

VcmAE01vpWZEdez8Evm_rw.text: We decided to try out Gallagher's Steakhouse since we were staying at the NYNY Hotel.  It is a wonderful restaurant with better prices than many other steakhouses & I was very happy with our meal.  The bf & I decided to both start with the clam chowder, get macaroni w/cheese and the mashed potatoes with garlic & herb.  We also wanted to split an entree since I don't think either of us would have been capable of eating so much meat on our own.  We decided on the the king cut prime rib...and soon found out that we should have chosen the queen cut to split.  =)  The Food: -Clam chowder = heaven!  This is REALLY good clam chowder.  It's a giant bowl of rich, creamy chowder full of clams and potatoes.  I absolutely loved it even though it seemed pretty heavy on the clams (more so than most places)  -Macaroni & cheese = disappointment; this was honestly the low point of the meal.  I like mac n' cheese to be smooth and creamy but this was clumpy and solid (not saucy).  There were 2 little pieces of bacon in it but we didn't care for this much at all.  -Garlic & herb mashed potatoes = delicious!  I loved these super creamy mashed potatoes...the garlic flavor was perfect.  It was a special for the night but if they make it available to you, you should order it!  -King cut prime rib = ginormous slab of beef!  It was quite good but in my mind, I wasn't expecting it to be so large.  It's bone-in and I'd say about two or two & a half inches thick at least.  The meat was really juicy and tender...you could probably cut through it without a knife.  Had a nice, earthy beef flavor to it & I thought it was great.  The bf thought it could have used a little more seasoning to it but if you're one of those people that really like the flavor of the meat to come through then you'll be very happy.  **We split the king cut & there is no cost to do a split = awesome!  I know a lot of other restaurants charge some sort of fee but it's really wonderful that here it's not a problem.  Our dining experience was wonderful - our server was very attentive, cheery and helpful to us.  The total came out to around $76 for the two of us which is very, very good in my opinion for this type of restaurant.  Gallagher's is known for their dry-aged steaks and I saw many order this...and I would have ordered it as well but it looked like too much for me to eat.  I say definitely give this place a try...the NYNY Hotel is sort of loud but inside the restaurant it's actually very quiet.  It's small so I'd make a reservation.  =)

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2nd half of king cut prime rib (28 oz. bone-in)
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 of king cut prime rib
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. garlic &amp; herb mashed potatoes

CtErrj2uY6ioMcOFXf25eA.text: 8:30pm Sunday night, Mother's day.  Wandered into Gallagher's after Zumanity for some NY Cheesecake.  Hostess told us they won't seat us for dessert only.  Granted, it's Mother's day but the place is only 30% full and is winding down for the evening.  Had to get a manager to make an exception.   Cut to dessert, the cheesecake is... well... not NY Cheesecake.  It's about the size of a twinkie with two small piles of graham cracker crumbles on either side.  Kudos to the manager for seating us and our excellent server but Arin but I don't think we will be back after this.   We're locals too.

CePCk7MkoYY_5m8BrpHiGQ.text: Buyer Beware!!! Just bc it is expensive doesn't mean it is good.   Ordered the bone in sirloin, their signature steak, medium rare. Wife ordered the filet mignon. Got the steaks and mine was bloody, way below medium rare. So we sent it back. It comes back out, a little more cooked, but then as I cut to the meat, it get tougher and tougher. I even exchanged knives with my wife and still couldn't cut. My wife's steak was excellent.  After complaining,!the Manager comes over and gives us a huge discount on my meal.   But lesson learned. I will stick with Ruth Chris or Shula's from now on

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is not medium rare and I couldn&#39;t cut it with a knife

jjeMbVPfJri_02_-iG58Zw.text: The Gallager's Steak House in Las Vegas does not live up to the name of the original in NYC. The service we received was great and what we have come to expect from the Gallager's brand. Our steak was another story. We ordered medium-rare, as we always do, and got charred black on the outside and rare on the inside. Correct me if I'm wrong, but this is a steak house, how do you not know how to cook a steak. Also, odd thing, the manager walked thru the dining room and asked the tables on either side of us how they were doing, how their food was but walked right past us like she knew something was off but didn't want to hear from us. What a waste of money, we will never go back to this location again and will advise others to stay away as well.

9iiJ9vxwv7avyrAka6f8Tg.text: Wow! I happened upon this steakhouse by accident since I was staying for a night at NYNY, a place I had never visited before. I was not interested in leaving the casino after a long day, and so I decided to give this place a try. I had the most enjoyable steakhouse experience I've had in Las Vegas, which is saying a lot since I've hit all the majors (Bavette, Capital Grille, Circus Circus).   Why was it so good? First, the gin martini was perfect and not overpriced like at most Vegas eateries these days. Second, the warm spinach salad was fresh and well-balanced. Third, the filet and creamed corn were just delightful in everything from presentation to taste. It was all so good that I ordered a cheesecake, which I never do. That was good too. After the meal, even though I had eaten more than usual, I did not feel weighed down or sluggish, which is the sign of good ingredients.   Another great thing about this restaurant is they have a very comfortable and well-laid out bar, so you can eat at the bar without feeling like you are in the middle of the server workflow. Lighting and ambience are also good. Five well-earned stars for Gallagher's.

HYSXDJKBBvIm9fslVJrH7w.text: I have visited a number of steakhouses in Las Vegas and this one has all of the others beat hands down. Our waiter was excellent and knowledgeable about the menu and the portion sizes. Example, the baked potato is the size of a small football and is meant to be shared. He really catered to us.  The atmosphere was old school.  Warm and welcoming. It was my birthday and they had a small note and two pieces of candy there for me when we were seated.   I had the center cut filet mignon which I swear could have cut without my knife. I asked about the king crab oscar and seeing my apprehension about a sauce which I wasn't sure about, Bobby said he would have the sauce on the side with the crab on top of the steak. Oh my goodness wonderful. The other three people ordered the special cowboy rib eye. It looked wonderful and all really enjoyed their meals. We had sides, potatoes, mushrooms and green beans.   I almost forgot we ordered salads that were large enough we split 2 among the 4 of us. Fresh.   I felt the prices were below those of Delmonico and the service so much better. Phil's Steakhouse at Treasure Island isn't even on the same level as Gallagher's but their prices are higher and their wait staff is the worse.  Part of going to a nice place is the food, the price, the atmosphere and the wait staff. Gallagher's nailed it all. This will be my good to place.

vYh5Nef49iKjI616Xe1JMA.text: This place is exactly what my husband and I were looking for when we craved a traditional and fantastic steak oriented restaurant. Gallagher's has a history of serving fine steaks, and excellent service along with it. I had the ribeye and my husband had the New York strip. We also loved our truffle fries and creamed spinach. It will be hard to not return to Gallagher's during our next getaway weekend to Vegas.

7Wb4kXEXzeAxnd-DBKTB3w.text: One of fine steak restaurant in Las Vegas I found this year which I think it can compete with with stake house in Circus circus I think best steak house in Vegas. Service is nice which she serve in good timing with giving good detail on the food since it was first time for me. I order 10oz filet minion steak with medium cooked.  It came out really will and meat was tender as you can see in the outside of store how meat is aging and they are serving well aged meat. Only my regret was I should make it cook the surface and make it rare inside if they have this good steak. Side of special which mashed potato with red pepper was also really good which I was getting blared with regular potato food so it was surprising food for me. I order cheese cake which was ok since kind a too sweet for me for my taste. I strongly recommends his restaurant if you are looking for good restaurant in Las Vegas strip and I will definitely will go to try my rare filet!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2lzidsMRGhBKd5UK_8dk_w.text: This is in the average column for great steakhouses.  This is the only time I have eaten there.  The problem with the visit was I took my dad for his birthday and he said he can BBQ a better steak anytime that would put this to shame and for a quarter of the cost.  Unfortunately I agreed with him, he is a fantastic cook.    While we see the meat aging, it didn't have the luxurious feeling in my mouth, you know that aged fat providing all that flavor?  There are so many steakhouses in Las Vegas from which to chose, that the meal has to be top notch to have come-back customers.  I am happy we tried it but I'm not sure I will go back unless I'm close and hungry.  Manga

rr4UGkpXnp5shE36bj-oWA.text: One of the worst food and customer service experience that I've ever experienced!    So I don't typically review my restaurant visits, but I felt overwhelming compelled to review my dinner experience here last night.    On our vacation in Vegas, we really wanted to enjoy a nice steak dinner, so we decided to come try Gallagher's Steak house. Bad idea...  The beginning started off pretty good. We were seated rather quickly (5 minutes).  After being seated, we were greeted by our server for drinks. We ordered some alcohol but only a glass of beer and wine. The server was rather prompt with our drinks and taking our order. We decided to order 2 steak dinners (approx $50-$60each) with a side of asparagus ($11). Little did we know this would be the beginning to a long wait... After we ordered, we had to wait approx. 45 minutes - 1 hour for our food to come out.  During that time, my 5 year old fell asleep on my shoulder, we were NEVER apologized to, nor even approached by our server.  The other tables in our area were complaining because of the wait, and they were the ones that were being apologized to.  I guess the loud, squeaky wheel gets the grease!!  When we finally got our food. My steak (filet mignon) was definitely not worth the price and our asparagus was super cold. We sent it back and they recooked it (or re-warmed it) and it was a little better. We ate our food quickly because we were starving and just wanted to get out of there.  While we sat there and ate, I noticed the manager going up to the other tables and "taking care of them" but she, again, NEVER came to us. Our server was apologetic but that was as far as his apologies went.  We finished and got the bill and were shocked.  They offered no compensation for our lengthy wait. Not even a free coffee or dessert. Plus, they still charged us for the terrible asparagus. So disappointing!!  Needless to say, we will NEVER be dining at this restaurant again!! A terrible experience and a terrible waste of money!!

DGUzF0ORA2os-9LPmXRdCg.text: So I had reservation for Monday night and happened to be that rodeo was in town. First I didn't like is that the restaurant allowed people to wear their baseball caps inside and so called cowboys with their hats. The food was cooked wrong ordered medium well with touch of pink inside received  rare all pink inside, gave ribeye to the manager so they can recook it.

U4EynH0b4nmbKyC73axHSQ.text: Perfect spot for a date night and to enjoy a proper steak meal! Hubby took me for my birthday and I couldn't ask for anything more! Steaks made to perfection and sides where great too!  Delicious meal and great service!  Hubby got the signature dry aged New York strip steak, and I got the cowboy rib eye both amazing!! This is a very affordable steakhouse compared to others on the strip which is also a giant plus! Would recommend to others and definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese was ok
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect rib eye steak!

8-ndjpaIGris3xBrIWAk7Q.text: My fiance & I had dinner here last week for our 10 year anniversary. Very nice place. We started off getting me a wine & him an old-fashioned. The Moscato d'Asti was AMAZING. Seriously the best I've ever tried. Wish I remember the actual name. Then he ordered a steak. I don't remember exactly what he got, but it was absolutely the best steak that either of us have ever put into our faces. The meat just freaking melts in yr mouth. It was so tender, I thought I was dreaming. Just absolutely the best thing I've ever tried. I ordered 2 sides bc there would have been no way I could've eaten all of that meat anyway. I got the Mac & cheese & the baked potato. Both were good also, though nothing compared to the steak. We got our photos taken at dinner by a really nice lady that worked at the hotel. The first semi-professional photos we've ever taken. Lol. We shared a dessert, I'm pretty sure it was the Vanilla Cream Creme Brulee or something along those lines. It was just perfect & the only thing I thought to take a picture of. Highly recommend this place even if it's just to order a steak. It will definitely be one of the top 10 best things you've ever tried. 10/10 would recommend. I think this was the most expensive dinner we've ever had, just the 2 of us. No regrets. Just so good. Also, the waiter, wish I remembered his name. Super attentive & just wonderful service.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Creme Brûlée  So good you could cry.

1VpQb8uX3z4mw5nr4D3wMw.text: Overrated. We were a table of 6. Ave ticket $100 per person. We were seated in front of the kitchen. Service was slow. When you pay $100 per person ave in any upscale Vegas restaurant, the service has to be great at least. However part of the problem for us was the location of our table. It seemed as we were sitting on a street corner. Food was average at best.

WIwSK6Jyf_LVdUDcquQL6w.text: Second time at Gallagher's and enjoyed it every bit as much as the first time.   Our part of 4 sat at the bar on the outside of the restaurant.  Bartender/server was a bit of a wise guy at first but with help from others got the job done.  Fair drinks poured, with a couple of Bulleit Rye's a great start to dinner.   I had a terrific ribeye that had perfect crust on the edges and was cooked perfectly throughout.  The wedge salad I started with was o.k.  Mushrooms with the steak were tasty as well.  Before my trip I looked at many different steak places as I knew I'd visit one but in the end was happy to have made a repeat trip to Gallagher's.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That is how a ribeye should taste!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I know, a picture of a drink doesn&#39;t say much about a restaurant, but it sure was good!

I9NdqirSRr3XwpOU4HDDJQ.text: After being bookmarked for years I finally got the opportunity to give gallagher's a try. Came in with my brothers on Saturday night and were able to get seated pretty quick. Our server John was excellent. He was very informative, attentive and friendly. Our food however was not the best. We all ordered the Dry aged New York medium rare and every one of ours were very undercooked. To be a steakhouse and go 0-5 in cooking a steak medium rare is an issue. I under stand it's a thick steak and not the easiest to cook but I'd rather wait a little longer to get it cooked right rather than have it under cooked. Our sides were very good as we had the potato puree, Mac n cheese, and creamed corn. With all the other steakhouses in LV i'd be hesitant to return though after our experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ordered 5 New York&#39;s medium rare and this is how they all came out.

EPmqB9ZUE5ECz1ZQWJoPzg.text: Had dinner last night here. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar, we received excellent service. I forgot our bartenders name but he was a younger guy with blond-ish hair. Everyone behind the bar was very attentive. I ordered the dry age New York strip. It was incredible! Charred outside, juicy and flavorful inside. My boyfriend had the Filet and enjoyed that very much as well. The Mac N Cheese was amazing! All in all, our experience here was quite pleasant, spent over $300 here and don't regret it a bit!!

AChlOoXJYORe2M3dIL12Hw.text: Ok it's not the 52nd St location.. but a great place to sit at the bar and enjoy a few drinks and eat your steak of choice. Great Memories with my special girl.. #VegasStrong

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

om6tS42g2E75_UTn-QvIEA.text: Amazing steak (after adding a bit of salt). The waiter was perfect, showed up at the exact moment I needed him and seemed to anticipate every need.

BoG62LH1Mfp9NMy9g9BEhA.text: Let me tell you. First and for most the food is good but of course. My friends and I wouldn't have gone their if it wasn't I didn't need to check yell either. But from the beginning to the end, our waiter SAM my God, what a delightful person. A bunch of young kids could get the attention of a elder gentleman, we had such a blast and he was mostly part of the reason. Sam thanks for the good time I hope you remember us cause we won't forget you!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6tdlQgW9kPORfn9igXLGqg.text: The food was excellent and the restaurant did all of the little things right.  I ordered the aged NY Strip which is usually what you see in the pictures.  They cook it over a mesquite grill that makes the charred parts outside burst with flavor while still being medium rare on the inside.  I don't think you'll have any problems with any of the selections.  Might not be the best you've ever had, but you won't be disappointed.  I also got the clam chowder, very nice texture and flavor.  It's hard to get that balance right.  And the mac & cheese, which for some reason I didn't hold the bacon on.  I'm kind of getting tired of bacon.  The steak was $50, the other items were abound $8 each, total bill was just over $71.  I drank water only.  After the meal I kept noticing how the staff seemed to know when to come/interact and when to give me peace.  I went alone and spent a lot of time reading on my iPad, and they seemed to know when to jump in.  Other times they would refill my water without saying anything.  Hard to describe, but too many places talk too much and others stay away too much.  Very friendly, down-to-earth staff.  Nice decor; hard to believe you're in the middle of a casino.  I went mid-week and probably could have walked up, but when I called to ask some questions they made a reservation for me for 30 minutes later.  I wore jeans, their only real policy is no tank tops for guys.  TIP:  I received a $150 food credit with my reservation at Monte Carlo.  Since NYNY and Monte Carlo are both owned by the MGM Grand, I was able to use the credit to pay for the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu from February 2018
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wTnnxVgYdDWpMvj5Mj7uzA.text: Great steak place to eat dry aged beef.  This place wasn't that crowded on a week night so getting a table was quick.  The server was great but the (drink man/bread man/food server)was even better.  They were all very polite and very efficient.  Even when it came to boxing up the leftovers at the tableside clean fast and efficient and they even give utensils to go. To full to even think of ordering dessert so that was out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged new york (with the bone cut out)

aZq2Sj3o91Vmky_con1Kvw.text: I have eaten here numerous times and loved it. However this last time left a bad taste in my mouth. My steak was over done, the waiter didn't believe me until I cut the steak in front of him, the second steak I got was over seasoned, and the steak fries were raw in the middle.   I have made a point to come to this restaurant every time I am in Vegas. However, now I don't ever plan on going back.

WkXdHrSgi3ndrp2mGG432Q.text: One of my favorite places to eat in Vegas.  Pricey but with high standards.  Service is top notch with only the best cuts available.  A must when your in Vegas

TBwEb678wb1p1tLedTby6w.text: By far the best steak I've had at a restaurant! The meal and the service were both excellent. I highly recommend this restaurant if you are going to be on the Strip. 5 stars for sure!

hoxHxO0LtT_2biipavHTlg.text: The servers were great but the food wasn't up to par. The steak my boyfriend got was extra chewy. The sides made up for it but if you want fries, this is not the place. You'll get potato wedges more like. We got truffle fries and that was like eating 1 full potato. It was cut in fours and some oil, I'm assuming it should be truffle oil but I barely tasted any. I was disappointed because that was my boyfriend's first trip to Vegas and I wanted to celebrate his birthday at a nice steakhouse. He chose this one because someone had recommended to him. They were at this place like years ago so it would be reasonable to say that the quality had gone down.

R8MHCOc-7J5a4dpguVdSmQ.text: I was not impressed with this restaurant. I hardly ever give a bad review. I ordered the rib eye cooked medium and it was burnt, tough and chewy. Also, the service was not good. Our waiter hardly came to check in with us. My husband made reservations here to celebrate my birthday. He told the host as well as the waiter that it's my birthday. They didn't do anything about it. Usually higher end restaurants serve a complimentary dessert, but not this restaurant. When my husband asked, they said their manager decided to no longer serve complimentary desserts on birthdays. My husband and I were very disappointed and I definitely don't recommend this restaurant especially if you're celebrating something special.

xfwmTPpkWdGUGTJzmYZYOw.text: Had a great steak dinner- got the ribeye- totally worth it.  Sides are huge and meant to be shared between at least two people.  Good service.

bOjgNDsZ9jltXqeKWu7P4g.text: Fantastic. Great service! Highly recommend the Caesar salad! The fillets were the best I've ever had. This is coming from a person who worked at a steakhouse for 2 years. This was the best meal we had in Vegas. Melt in your mouth steak with an enormous baked potato was exactly what I needed. Can't wait to come again.

0xPbdiQc1HPQqHLrUaO2_Q.text: Dry-Aged New York Steak & Roasted Rack of Lamb (9/10) After hearing the rumors and reviews of being one of the top steak houses, i came out to try this aged steak. It was beautifully refrigerated on display outside the stop. Just by looking at it, I started to salivate. I must say the steak lived up to my expectation, the picture cannot do it justice. The tenderness of the meat was perfect with being too overcooked. Getting medium-rare sab f meat had its own unique taste which complimented the seasoning really well. Each bit was like getting a massage on my palate by the juice that sprayed out. It was quite MOOving if I may say. The lamb rack was less spectacular as it was just average with a bit of tenderness in the middle but the outsides were a bit hard, probably because it was ordered as medium (who even does that).  Definitely would recommend this place as a stop after making some money from the casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry-Aged New York Steak &amp; Roasted Rack of Lamb (9/10)

qr12mPhRQtNXfcNvvGpEdQ.text: A friend had recommended this place...went to dinner here..i ordered the seared diver scallops..it had a delicious sauce on the plate i wish there was more of it but scallops were cooked perfect..i ordered the prime rib..omgosh it was huge! Cooked a perfect medium rare..i also got creamed spinach as a side dish..yumm...dessert i tried the sticky toffee pudding with ice cream as recommended by a handsome dude in a suit i assumed he was the manager..i hope lol..but it was delicious...overall food was great..service great..very happy with my dining experience here

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steeeeak!!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely decor

7pBUMpO7BQDjM-aI5T7NBA.text: Incredible service!! We had their signature Dry Aged New York Strips, cooked perfect Medium Rare, but overall not good. The Onion Rings were big and tasty and salads perfect. Tuna appetizer was pedestrian. Wanted to love this place, but the steaks were poor.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks awesome was meh

5H9lki7vvfMCp_iKwG77PA.text: Awesome... best prime rib I've had. Juicy, tender and not so much seasoning that it covers up the awesome flavor of the beef itself. Served with au jus and horseradish and horseradish crema. Their horseradish is extra hot! Scallops - cooked to perfection, delicious flavor, but not too overpowering. Soup of the day was split pea and ham - amazing! Service was phenomenal, quick and friendly. Caesar salad slightly above average. Had the "All That Razz" to drink and it was yummy. Finished off the meal with creme brulee which was absolutely fantastic. Atmosphere was beautiful as we got the opportunity to sit near the kitchen to watch the chefs cook on the woodfire grills. Would absolutely recommend! It is pricy... but I'm more than happy to pay for amazing food!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nothing like finishing a big meal with a delicious creme brulee
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib - awesome!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib medium rare,  creamed spinach and mashed Yukon gold potatoes

0blhEsDhK69Q7mbigkRbGw.text: Relatively good service. My husband had NY strip, I had filet.  We both thought our steak knives were dull.  Strip was far from tender and we have grilled better tasting & melt in your mouth tender filets at home. We were unpleasantly surprised at the poor flavor & toughness of these aged steaks. Based upon how busy this restaurant was, we can only guess it's a tourist trap without much repeat business. We are from Orlando - if anyone comes to the area, try Linda's LaCantina - you will see why Gallagher's doesn't rate!

VU6jj4Wd72DRcqpRrSkUvw.text: I've wanted to get a steak here since I first saw the steaks aging in their glass case. I once had an aged steak at the Nines' steakhouse in Portland and it was delicious. Anyway, my husband and I got the shrimp cocktail for an appetizer. It was good. Then I got the aged NY cooked medium made Oscar style with a side of green beans. My husband got the prime rib and baked potato. He loved the baked potato and said his prime rib was good. I though the flavor of my NY steak was good once I got to the center of it. Around the edges it was cooked pretty well done and it was kind of tough to cut and chew. The crab on top was ok, I got shell pieces in almost every bite so that wasn't pleasant. The green beans were cooked perfectly, but it tasted like they cook them in Lipton onion soup mix. I would rather have has them plain. Overall, I'm glad we went and had a nice dinner. Service was really good. We probably won't go back, but I don't regret eating here at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l7mPThbgOpz52y0ZbdE2Ew.text: The best filet I've ever had!  I will return to this restaurant in the near future!  Highly recommended!

EXrxUKdZI8OBf_32kfMIIw.text: Im leaving one star because of the service. I've never had such a rude server in my life. He was a old man. I have no idea why but he was all friendly and smiling to the table right next to us and checks up on them like couple times and never came to us and when he took our order or we asked something you could tell on his face that he didnt like us. Maybe because we are asian and thinks we dont tip well or maybe its because we "shared" an entree and appetizer and a salad??? but that is NOT a reason to treat us that way. And plus it was still too much food for us. I usually tip very well (over 20%) but only tipped 10% and left a note on the back. I was very annoyed and felt discriminated. The food was good but overpriced for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3WQCjCe7nwdHutaRmurbbw.text: Decided to go out for a nice dinner for the last night in Vegas. Two of us had the ribeye with the king crab Oscar topping and the other had the bone in New York. We got the Yukon potatoes, baked potato, and asparagus to share. It was all absolutely perfect. Steaks cooked to perfection. The portions were large and super filling. The drinks were good and not weak. Our waitress was knowledgeable and very quick to get us whatever we needed. Checked on us but we never felt bothered or rushed. All in all it was an amazing dinner and I will recommend it to anyone I know who's headed to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy Ribeye with King Crab Oscar

UiFXAcS9ta9iNxQzhQTL8w.text: An excellent way to splurge while in Vegas. The dry aged New York strip is everything I hoped it would be and the rest of the meal was excellent as well. Will do it again next time I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wHqinXyyG1qvePzHkLvHaw.text: Looking to spend a lot for good taste then this is the place. I feel like we could have had the same result with faster service elsewhere but it still tasted good

dnfRHtVuxkpiP2yhuFhumg.text: Very good steak, cooked exactly as you like it with great sides like asparagus, mac and cheese, creamed spinach, etc.   I debated between the Filet and the Porterhouse and finally opted for the later, it was a great choice.  My steak was a large beautiful piece of meat cooked to perfection.  As always, I save the filet side for last and it was so tender and flavorful the opposite side was fantastic as well but the filet stole the show.  Service was pretty good, not exactly what I would expect at a place like this.  Prices are substantial but a relatively good value considering the quality of the food.

TDa1fc0CfbXtoQOnoZNFpQ.text: What a wonderful experience I had at Gallaghers Steakhouse.   First of all, you have to make a reservation. This is one of those places that gets booked fast. I don't think you have to necessarily book months in advance but definitely call ahead if you're planning to eat that day.   Came here for New Years and while the prices were generally $20+ more than usual, everything was simply delicious. We ordered the rib eye, prime rib, lamb chops, signature aged steak, Alaskan halibut, the seafood celebration and a salad. ($650+)  Every dish was super tasty, but I personally preferred the rib eye. it was literally melt in your mouth delicious I went to heaven status. The rub on that meat was amazing and it was just done very well. Then I would rank the rest in this order: chops, aged signature and the prime rib. The prime rib is a huge chunk of meat, and I ranked it last (although it's pretty neck in neck) because it didn't taste anything too remarkable, not to say that it wasn't tasty. It's also probably the cheapest because they cook a huge chunk of meat and then slice into portions as opposed to say the rib eye, where they have to cook each cut individually. The rib eye was just spectacular and memorable. Take my advice and order this if you're stuck wanting to order everything, you'll thank me later.  Another note, don't order the signature aged steak in medium, we made the mistake of doing so and it turned out just a bit toooo dry for our liking.   Our waiter was also superb, putting up with my family's desire to take a hundred family photos before we can even begin eating. What a great restaurant, every pennies worth.

au5vfPgrglmjEC8Ew6zv7w.text: Came here for our 25th anniversary dinner, and it was outstanding. My wife and I frequent high end steakhouses all over the US and Gallagher's held it's own. I had the Cowboy Ribeye and she had the filet.  Both were delicious and cooked exactly to our specifications. Sam the waiter really went out of his way to make our meal special.  The prices are actually quite reasonable for the quality you get,  especially when you realize that everything costs more in Vegas.  We will visit Gallagher's again.

Gmb7UQI2CcaKcXqxNRkfGQ.text: I rate this 5 star due to the amazing service and we had calamari which was tender n marinara sauce was zesty...baby spinach salad was perfect, but the fillet was so flavorful and crab legs were 8 huge legs..I only could eat 4 lol. A la carte sides and potato was humungous! Lol..so stuffed!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vkxlbM3Wuitc1RO6c4Xb0g.text: Had a great dinner with an amazing wait staff. Water glass was never past 1/2 full before it was refreshed. Every item that was ordered was cooked to perfection.  The only downside was that we saw the desserts but we're too full to eat any more!

wWqezv1cDKejmel2VghZNQ.text: The steak and service are top notch.  The sides are alright.  I would give this 4.5 stars if I could.  Get the porterhouse.

662eJwVDO7OMfZ978QpQtw.text: On average it will cost a person about $100 to eat here. The service was pretty good. The steak is huge. Two people can definitely share one steak. Nothing special about how they prepared the steak. The ambiance is so so. If you are looking for something like iron chef you will be disappointed.

UolhzBNMDjrrEnNITmQ_vA.text: My 5 star is based on the seafood, drinks and service only. I have not yet had the pleasure of eating the steaks yet which I'm truly looking forward to. The service at the bar is A+ and our bartender Fernado was extremely on point. I felt like family from his service and was completely informed of what I was ordering food and drink wise. We ordered the seafood platter both the cold and the hot. Both were amazing, I enjoined the hot a little better because the crab cakes and calamary were so delicious that I could have eaten that as a main course had there been enough. The shrimp scampi was also very good, huge shrimp with very good flavoring. You also get bread while ordering the smaller dishes which was good for us being that we wanted something more on the light side before a show but something to soak up the drinks so that we could enjoy the rest if the evening. I will for sure be back here and go all out with a full course dinner.

eWq4K_8_3bJWSaXuTkB4FQ.text: Service and food were superb. The New York bone in had so much flavor and was very tender. The bacon mashed potatoes were to die for! Highly recommend!

GeYzM7HQngI3RXPT4ZkpdQ.text: The food here is just great - but this time, I want to review the service. My husband and I were seated at a small table in the farthest room (which was fine). In the middle of the room was a large party that was a tad loud. Not stupid loud (but loud),... just some 40-somethings (males/females) having a good time in Vegas cuttin' lose away from the kids and the boss. We could care less (truth be told they were actually quite funny), but I could see if you were on a date, or just wanted a relaxing dining experience how this might ruining your nite. The manager discretely came to our table and without drawing attention or placing blame on other guests, simply asked if we would be more comfortable in another room of the restaurant. I thought that was considerate and showed diligence and attention on the part of the management staff.   But we declined - we are a large law enforcement family and felt strangely comfortable. We did thank the manager for his consideration. Food is important, but service and attentiveness is too.  P.S. - The potato puree will make you cry... its that good.

SSEdVquJKjxMZ1r6D8MOHw.text: The bone in NY steak was absolutely divine. Full lobster was so good too. We also had the bruschetta, calamari and ceasar salads all of which were equally as delicious. Recommend the sides of spinach and broccoli with cheese. Staff was very courteous but also fun!!

rlKbAVAdIV9uP2HzHK3-4A.text: My wife and I go to NYNY once a year and always try to eat a meal at Gallagher's. On our resent trip I had the BEST port chop I have ever tasted. Bar none. Not sure if it was the porterhouse cut or the warm apple dipping sauce, but this thing was pure food heaven. My wife's filet was perfect as always. Top notch service. Great green beans. Easily our favorite Vegas eatery. Five stars every time!

1_GF3iShaSIzKjtfS_3fkg.text: We had the signature aged steak medium rare and it was perfectly cooked.  The steak was about 12oz so my husband and I shared it. With the delicious sides, we had more than enough food to eat.

-0hcO0aMc8xD9eNVUEndCQ.text: This restaurant was great. The service was wonderful and the price was reasonable. Our waiter was very attentive and so was the person who kept our glasses full. We both had the filet with a side of Yukon gold mashed potatoes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our anniversary cheesecake dessert.

JuzWIq4Sy1Z9rYaxPv20bQ.text: The food here was amazing. The atmosphere was good but for the price it could've been a little better, the tables were a little too close and the restaurant was pretty loud, definitely hard to have a conversation with the person sitting right across from you at the same table. But the positive is the food was great, the steaks are huge and cooked perfectly how I ordered it. And it's also great that you can make reservations online and through Yelp! I highly recommend this restaurant to anybody who's gonna be passing or staying in Vegas. Next time and every time I go to Vegas this will be a restaurant I will be going to every time.

yLSDJ875s7e57d18R4nehw.text: Go big or go home! Gallagher's portion of meat is huge, and quality of meat is great. I had the dry aged New York steak (delicious) with mashed and wedge salad. My boyfriend had Porterhouse (delicious) with Caesar salad, and mushrooms. We both drank Cabernet along with our dinner and wish there was room for dessert. This is the 2nd time I ever had fine dining, so I wasn't really surprise about the price for 2 which came down about $160. Overall experience, we were satisfied.  P.S. If you get the wedge salad, you have to expect a wedge of lettuce with little dressings on it. I didn't expect it to look that way, but soon I cut them into pieces and toss them with a Thousand Island dressing. It was quite fresh and crispy, I must admit.

XlV3o3GVntoCBnACKQ9ouw.text: Dined there on a Saturday night.  It was crowded but I was able to make a reservation about an hour and a half prior to arriving which can be tough sometimes in Vegas.  The meal was great.  Had the Ribeye and the group shared sides.  The steak was cooked perfectly.  The service was on-par with a top notch steakhouse.  The decor needs a little improvement but you do get that steakhouse feel.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends and would visit again.

VogwenPZcbAIAO4jDsNBlQ.text: Been here every Vegas trip for the last 5 years. Always wonderful food, nice quiet atmosphere. Service is very attentive but not too intrusive. All in all one of my husband and my favorite places to go!!

6fU1RIWqMT6CvZFzudOr4Q.text: I have been here 4 times and it never disappoints!  The steaks are awesome!  I always order either the Cowboy Rib Eye or the Dry Age Steak which can't be beat.  Service is excellent as usual.

sI9NAiYT0vgM-b1977P0qg.text: Wonderful service and amazing food. Thank god my wife and I split the bone-in rib eye-it was huge. We will be back. IMHO, better than Joe's Seafood Prime Steak & Stone Crab in Caesars Palace.

WIG9orLu4PRHTMGGS-sTnQ.text: After eating this steak, I was in a happy steak-coma of which ti was hard to 'rouse myself from. Good thing the elevator to my room was right next door. Best steak I've ever had in life. t's hard to type this because my mouth is watering and I am too far from that steak now. It ruined me for other steaks.

zpGhw50bU-dr2Baq6y3V_w.text: Absolutely amazing!  We went here to experience some good food while we were in Vegas and we accomplished just that! We started with the grilled artichoke, which was beyond this world.  There are no words to describe how perfectly cooked this was.  It came paired with an aioli and a chipotle sauce.  As a lover of artichoke, this was an experience I will not soon forget, as it was such an amazing starter. We followed this up with a little surf and turf and the Porterhouse.  I am extremely picky about my steaks and prefer to have them Chicago blue, which they accomplished perfectly.  The lobster was HUGE and oh, so delicious!  If only my pocketbook allowed me to eat here everyday, I would. This was a dinner I will not soon forget.  I can not wait to go back, if only for the grilled artichoke...

bf1WSzsIn0JgH9McVBe-aA.text: Hard to narrow it down further, but this place is definitely in my top 3 steakhouses in Las Vegas.  Went here for a birthday dinner with my roommate and friends, and nobody left disappointed.

KM3HvChl7e9P6cwuVkOZ9g.text: Dry aged steak was over-rated!  I had heard about Gallagher's famous dry aged steak and had high hopes of savoring the meat. When the moment of truth came, I just could not give high marks for it. Don't get me wrong! It's good. It's actually very good, and the service was excellent. But for a place like Vegas, where the world's GREATEST foods are suppose to be prevalent.... well, you get my drift.  If this place was in my home town, I would have definitely given 4 stars, but the fact that it's in Vegas, I expect a little more. So expect to get very good steaks.... just don't push that bar too high - maybe that was my problem.

NJphP9gaGe_0b7riHz1l-w.text: Good steak and very nice staff but I think it was a little over priced for the quality of meat. I have no problem paying $60 for a great ribeye but it was not that great. Did not blow my socks off, they are still on.

qYTTlBQ5ilXvhJSpiRI7Ww.text: Excellent attentive service and extensive food and wine menu. Steaks are typically huge, my wife and I shared a 8oz Filet and left room for dessert.  Good value for money for a posh eating experience in LV.

UlgNfSQj4zg5S9fiIfhpeQ.text: MUCH better meal than the night earlier at the Venetian.  Like others we went here before the Zumanity show (eh, as far as I am concerned).  Got reservations the day of, had a lovely table and wonderful meal.  Wine & water were poured for us more than the night before as well. And a wine list with a Nice variety of styles & price ranges.  Probably only snafu was ordering a bottle of wine to have "with our food" come out as soon as we ordered it - a LOVELY Malbec.  No wow factors here, typical steakhouse fare, although I will say the sides have some extra seasonings which are nice.

ytpIDFgl50MAA1JB1WHciQ.text: Just enjoyed a fabulous meal tonight. Sam was a fantastic waiter. Truly the best service we've experienced in a very long time. The food was delicious.  Well worth the money.

ZUinqJEmlu2qzNaKfWRvng.text: I'm a HUGE steak fan & I've eaten at many of the top-end chop houses.  This place was GREAT....and well worth the price.  It's a NY style chop house so the interior is more old school vs some of the fancy places in vegas.  The steak is probably the best steak I've ever had....and I"m not too easy to please.

2eY9F9GQ25YLEblubRrVaQ.text: Steak = Great -- Service and atmosphere - AWFUL This place is Very crowded, and noisy - not fun noisy - people yelling and talking loud type noisy- Not what you want to experience when you are paying $40 for a steak.    The salad was soggy, the asparagus was overdone, and the steak was good. The service was slow, they appeared very unorganized. For the prices that you have to pay to eat here- go somewhere else.

MI2LKoJqHjtOQEBxXzF80g.text: We took a newly wed couple to dinner. Their food was great but our food was less than good. The porterhouse was tough and chewy. Not to embarrass our guests I did not complain. However, dinner for four, $350.00 for a meal I could not finish. Worst steak I ever had. There are better meals to be had in Vegas. As a local, you have lost a supporter. And I will not recommend this to anyone. Sorry

5k1d3-zlu2kXyHWyHRpg7g.text: Can we say ......."RIB EYE to die for"........ my mouth is watering as I write this... the food is fantastic.  The service even better....  The bartenders are to sexy to believe and just plain ole boy next door hot.    I had a Rib eye.  It was cooked to perfection.  I am so sad since I was unable to eat the whole thing.  My friend had the Prime rib... she never eats the whole thing and she did and I swear I think she had orgasms while she ate it... she was mmmmmmmmmmm and ahhhhhhhhhhh and ohhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh god with ever bite.  Broccoli Au Gratin now that's some good shit... baked potato with everything now that is even some finer shit......

_RPIFgLePu0OT-5_SAZj8w.text: When it comes of writing reviews usually I stay off.... But not this time.  Was here twice. This is the place when I had 2 different extreme experiences. My first experience was good, enough to come back 2nd time.  Last weeks experience was the opposite. I will never ever enter that restaurant in my life and no people around me will be recommended to dine there.  It's an expensive place, and they think they're serving a "great" food.  1.Price is very high 2. Preparation of food takes loooong time ( more than an hour to cook) 3. When their " polite" servers bring your food to your table it is already not warm enough, even cold. 4. Their manager doesn't have a managerial skills at all. 5.And last, c'mon it's a Vegas- there are plenty other great places to dine not that fake "fine" diner.  Very, very disappointed at their service and food.

-D0Gz5VoyVaCxavPdy2rfw.text: Consistently Excellent. I've eaten here at least 10 times, every time it was just splendid.  I can't pick a clear favorite here, the porterhouse is magnificent, the prime rib is just devine.. everything here is prepared very well - among the best steakhouses in Vegas.   If you order the prime rib, request an additional side of "atomic" horseradish, and mix it with some of the regular stuff. It'll whoop your ass. Clam chowder here is really good too, not too thick, not thin, just a bowl of goodness.  For dessert get STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING. For a while it was a secret menu item, but now it's more well known. Either way, get it, it's awesome.   The service is very good, if you can't get a table (or forgot to make reservations because you were too drunk), you can have dinner at the bar. The bar staff is awesome - and make one of the best Long Island Ice Tea around.   The case of meat is a welcome sight to celebrate vegas winnings, or to comfort a horrible run at the tables.. either way - make it a point to stop here for a steak dinner! 5 stars well earned.

2gX1Q-O6h7LPGwZvAlQh8w.text: Ate there yesterday for my fiance's birthday.  The service was superb & I can't speak highly enough of how great they cooked their steaks! Best part too is that the portions are not small either (helps take the sting off the price). I would recommend this restaurant to anybody who would love to eat an outstanding steak.

I8WMEQ8VmpEGo8CJXkMqEg.text: Great service! Amazing steaks! Hands down the best steak I've ever had. It's nothing but dry aging for this girl from now on. A definite must visit if you love steak.

eZ7YARlqVEhoBXKQNkpA2g.text: be sure to bring your appetite!!  =)  this was THE BEST PRIME RIB i've ever had to date.  WOW..  i got the queen's cut of prime rib medium rare.  it was HUGE and cooked to perfection.  there was a choice of creamy or straight horseradish.  i had the straight -- the strongest, best horseradish.  see the theme??  THE APPETIZERS MARYLAND CRABCAKES delish!!  3 crabcakes with real crabmeat drizzled with mayonnaise chipotle.  GRILLED ARTICHOKE an artichoke cut in half.  there were two kinds of mayonnaise to dip the artichoke in -- garlic or chipotle.  thoroughly enjoyed this appetizer.  THE SIDES CREAMED SPINACH -- good but not spectacular MASHED POTATOES -- would have been better if they were garlic-flavor or horseradish flavored, etc.  just plain.  THE MEAT COWBOY RIB EYE -- HUGE cut of meat.  i tried some but my love is prime rib... QUEEN'S CUT PRIME RIB -- the BEST PRIME RIB i've ever had.  medium rare is the way to go if you are a meat lover like me.  i REALLY REALLY ADORE my meat.  and yes, i did finish the WHOLE thing.  boo...on not having ANY appetite for dessert.  i wanted to try dessert but so could not.  in fact, i had overeaten to the point where i could not gamble either.  LOL..  MY ADVICE: prime rib lovers get the prime rib.  you can share the king's cut between two people.  i would go with appetizers vs. the sides.  and of course, bring a GIGANTIC appetite cuz you'll need it!!!  ENJOY..   PRIME RIB!!  PRIME RIB!!  PRIME RIB!!!  =)

qWnbIwQcEJJYLm9vvDxqow.text: So we're in Vegas on St. Patrick's Day and made reservations at Gallagher's.  For what it is, it's pretty damn good.  Steak in Vegas is just ridiculous now.  With so many to choose from and rising prices, the days of $9.99 steak dinners are fading fast away.  (Then again, it's probably a good thing those days are fading fast away.  I remember one being less tender than the wood of my desk and tasting worse that I imagine my desk tasting.)    So my girlfriend and I got two steaks (the dry aged bone-in sirloin), two glasses of wine, a couple of cocktails, a Caesar salad and a side of asparagus was $120.  That's pretty damn reasonable.    The steaks were very good - beefy, stronger flavored than your average piece of meat and firm to the texture without much excess juice - typical of dry-aged beef.    I got mine medium-rare and asked for medium char.  The waitress said they can't do "medium char" - only "regular" or "charred."  Don't get charred.  Although the waitress said that they don't put on a heavy char, my steak came out looking black.  The funny thing was, it didn't taste bitter like a charred steak does.  A little strange because of that, but the inside meat was good.  I didn't bother to send it back because I was with a date and didn't want her to have to wait for another one to come out.  And the steak was huge.  Easily 16oz.  And at under $40 (I believe it was actually $34), it's a relative bargain in Vegas.  The wine list is standard for Vegas - over priced and not inspiring.  But the wines by the glass were reasonable and of decent quality.  The Caesar salad was decent except for too much dressing.  Thick, good asparagus were used for the side.    Service was friendly and professional.  Just don't ask for their opinion of getting your steak "charred."    But do get drinks from the bar there.  The shots are filled to the rim and the bartenders are great.  Three stars.

VgBmZgX6QCOew445jLXreQ.text: I really love this place. I've been here a lot, though not recently I must admit. The decor is classic NY steakhouse, with wooden panels and waistaff in black and white.  I usually stick with the NY Steak and it generally comes perfectly cooked to order. I've dined with people who have also had the porterhouse and cowboy steak (both good for sharing ... actually, they're all good sizes for sharing except maybe the filets).   The appetizers, salads, and sides are not spectacular and is classic steakhouse fare (e.g., shrimp cocktail, iceberg lettuce wedge, creamed spinach, sauteed haricot verts, asparagus). I do enjoy the spinach salad. That's not to say they don't taste good, but just not beyond all levels of deliciousness. The sides don't really bother me because the focus is on the STEAK! (please see update below re mac n cheese!)  For dessert, I like to get their sticky toffee pudding. It's very moist, sticky, and delicious. Some restaurants who serve this classic dessert tends to somehow make the cake dry. The rest of their dessert menu is very standard types of desserts and not special (though, again, they taste just fine). But if you're in the casino, you might want to poke on over to Il Fornaio for one of their desserts!  I can also count on the waitstaff for excellent service. I've never felt forgetten at this restaurant. The bartenders are also excellent and know what they're doing! Ask for a chocolate martini ... trust.  UPDATE 8/17/2009: Went back recently and they had a new mac n cheese side. It is HEAVENLY! You must try it! Also, a few people told us a story about the sticky toffee pudding. Apparently, it was the recipe of the original chef and though he has left the restaurant, customers loved it so much that they asked him to allow them to keep the recipe. :)  UPDATE 12/15/2016: Food is still wonderful and service is still amazing. Caroline was really helpful and kind! The sticky toffee pudding was still a hit at our table!

RFvZUwegfGFJsGBqNLji0w.text: Fantastic food - very friendly and helpful staff. After  an accident (by us) that resulted in the table to jolt forward and drench everything in wine and water - including me! - the waitstaff jumped into action and had everything cleaned up in no time. The manager saw my wife was very upset and ensured we received new meals and took care of our check because it was a special night (New Year's Eve) and he wanted it to be nice for us - not a disaster!   Their steaks are great - the time before we had the surf and turf and that was also fantastic. Nice setting and a pleasant escape from the casino.

NTQk_w5z8bon0DcHPRzYsw.text: Best Value for a top notch steak on the strip.  I will be back, which is tough to say in Vegas, where it's fun to consistently try new places.  Grades are compared with many Vegas steakhouses from Bally's to Prime. I had the Ribeye. B+.  My girl had the Surf & Turf.  A+.  Both steaks cooked to perfection.  Professional service.  Total bill for 2 with appetizer (calamari B+), wine, best entrees available, and a couple deserts was only around $200.  I've paid way more in Vegas and I can't say I've even been as pleased.  And this is right after a $2k downswing at the tables so it may be even better than I remembered if you go for "free" after a win.

mBndHMObwRgKhU-vurkx3Q.text: The best Steak Ive ever had. Ive tried steak from just about every place known for great steak and the Rib eye here is completely unbelievable. Charred just right but still perfectly medium, it was lightly flavored with pepper and salt thus letting the flavor of the meat shine through.   For the four of us we had three entrees,  Lamb- pretty good but I have had better Prime rib- incredible but I have had better Au jus, though the cut and the meat was excellent.  The portions were so big though that four people couldn't finish it all (we always share so that we can get the maximum variety of tastes)

G5th-LQeMt3WwtsigwB70w.text: Service was terrible. We were seated, then waited for service. A guy came and poured us water but didn't ask if we wanted drinks. Someone else came and dropped off bread. We waited and waited and finally left. We ended up going to the Italian restaurant next door. service was impeccable there.

v0ZW_fuJq4thc01HqWH5IQ.text: Probably the place I enjoyed eating at most in Vegas, though also likely some of the worst service I had.  Let's hit the bullet points. Steakhouse in NY-NY. Pricey, but not excessively so (especially for Vegas).  Great food, meh atmosphere, and while I personally had poor service, my impression was that in general, the service is very good.  My dinner partner and I both had filet mignon - very, very good.  We also split a side of mac and cheese.  Not only was it enough to share (though probably not so much that you'd be a pig if you ate the whole thing yourself), but it was absolutely amazing.  Served in a metal pot, with some kind of crust baked on top... I enjoyed it as much as the steak, and I love steak, and it was a good steak.  The meat also came with one giant potato chip, which I thought was unique, if weird.  Also, not the best potato chip I've ever had, but then, I'm partial to pringles.  My one real gripe was that we asked our waiter for information on the size of the steak - and we were told 20 ounces, with a large bone.  This seemed odd to us, and, indeed, when our neighbor's  waiter came by, he gave a spiel going through the whole menu, the specials, the sizes of the steaks,etc, and it was an 8 ounce cut of meat, which seemed to make a bit more sense.  I wouldn't have minded the nice menu rundown.  I totally had waiter envy.  Also, while fantastic, the meal was over a hundred dollars.  Not terrible, I guess, but we didn't have drinks, desserts, appetizers... even separate sides.  And the atmosphere isn't what I would expect for that.  It's dark, but not especially romantic, and at least where we were sitting it was hard to forget we were in the middle of a casino.  I'd prefer to have had a little more of an escape.  So, possibility for a great steak, and based on the mac & cheese, the other dishes are likely quite good as well, but not the place to go if you want to be frugal or want to have a special dining experience.  But sometimes, it's just all about that great steak, isn't it?

Clq3zX8kTmJOPH4tD9EltA.text: Horrible experience!!! We were looking forward to this dinner date. Ate there before steak and lobster dinner special, but this time was awful. Steak was almost raw, and the service was good, but we were not offered a replacement, or a credit, even after the manager got involved.  Never ever going back, and definitely would not recommend the place after this.

KGTAeZDSBkhZfFL_TH9-Sg.text: Best meal I had on my trip!  The Prime Rib was excellent and the horseradish was very fresh.  Service was excellent.

aRPHvHwPpgO-uvIggmZW4g.text: Husband and I went their on a recommendation from a friend because we wanted to have a good steak during our first trip to LAS. We were completely infatuated with the porterhouse at Ruth's Chris and have decided to try other steakhouses to see if they offer a fabulously prepared porterhouse as well. Gallagher's was ok... it was dry. I guess I'm just not into dry aged because it does just that, leave it dry. My husband wasn't too impressed with the prime rib either. Don't think we'll be going there again.

QVbHrMvy8WeqQzlrH6vxKw.text: Took a friend here for his birthday. Everything was to be expected from a higher-end steakhouse quick and prompt service no send backs and the servings are large. For starters we had the shrimp cocktail and crab cakes both were good nothing out of the ordinary. I had the sirloin for my entree and it was tasty and tender. An unexpected treat was the roasted garlic bulb that I added to the steak and it was brilliant. My friend got the Surf and Turf fillet and Aussie lobster, very succulent and not over done for the lobster. We got the four cheese and Mac, Au Gratin Broccoli and Sauteed green beans were all tasty.
