Nice atmosphere inside like many steakhouses I've been to white walls and medium shades of wood with pictures of stars. It's All good!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged steaks

vVy6LBOEm9nExgDSmACwyQ.text: We walked by this restaurant twice a year for last five years but never had a chance to try their meat. Finally we made plans to go over there Monday night and were able to just walk right in no reservation. I have ordered dry aged nee York strip and my brother ordered bone in rib eye. Both of our steaks were over done, very tough to chew and not much flavor. Our waiter never bothered to ask how we liked our food. Never agai. On the other hand Gordon Ramsey's steak house at Paris was unbelievable.

JFHu3oGmQCMQ0TM6iZGP3A.text: THE ORDER Shrimp scampi Calamari Dry aged new york steak 4 cheese macaroni Buttermilk breaded onion rings  YIPPEEE Steaks delicious & huge Shrimp delicious & huge (but u only get 3 for $14 hmmmmm)  BOOOO Mac & Cheese nice texture but flavorless Same goes for the onion rings               Boring               but what do i expect they r onion rings So basically what I'm saying DONT GO FOR THE SIDES stick w the protein

Vf0hL14fF4EIC1Iu8wnWHw.text: I was not expecting to find a good steakhouse at NY NY, but I was pleasantly surprised.  Well, actually, it was more like a shock.  I definitely recommend this place.    The aged bone-in rib eye was really good and the taste is authentic.  If you like steak and you always hit a steakhouse on your Vegas trip... then you should definitely try this place.  The taste is Very Unique, Very Gallagher. ;)  The wine list is also decent (I say decent because they only list the winery and not the vintage) and they offer a good selection by the glass.  I was surprised to find Justin Obtuse on the dessert wine menu.  (Not too many restaurants carry this one...)  The price isn't outrageous compared to other Vegas steakhouses.  The food is awesome but the decor is outdated.

RHM8WCy8tdfHz2-4ZarX_Q.text: Had a really good time here. The staff were friendly and the steak was good. Only thing stopping this from being a 5 is the slight conveyor belt feel of the large Las Vegas restaurants.

Ku2hWCMWMmcJQL5eUMTE1g.text: I enjoyed the bar here twice and dinner once.  Gallagher's is probably the best thing about NY NY.  The bar is covered in a stainless steel top and adorned with a chalkboard denoting the specials.  Fernando, the bar tender, warned me away from the special, a Green Mountain, because it was a girlie drink.  More so, it was probably a good warning because the co-worker I was with doesn't pull any punches and looks for the opportunities to take the shots.  The bar was well stocked, Fernando was skilled and they had Newcastle Brown (and a few others) on tap.  The next night, our dinner reservations got mysteriously canceled and again, protracted negotiations got our party of 15 drinks at the bar and the table in the back room.  The back room was especially cool, with photos and painting of pinup girls and starlets on the walls and a bar dedicated to that room (read super-fast).  It was a steak house menu - sure there were a few chicken and fish dishes for the people who will live longer, but the steak was to die for.  The waiter suggested sharing sides and we ended up delegating the selection to him!  The macaroni and cheese is great and the hot and cold appetizer sampler was excelllent - lobster, shrimp, crab cakes and more.  Mmm.  I had a filet, cooked perfectly medium-rare, topped with crab and bernaise sauce.  It was delicious.  I think that three other people had the same and others were jealous.  We had tickets to a show and only had an hour and a half to devote to dinner and we got out of there on time, surprisingly.  For me, the reason to come to Las Vegas is the good food, people watching and the good food.  Gallagher's is the place for it.

ATMGgax9ALk6K2oO8GyI3g.text: I really do enjoy this place, great food, wonderful staff. The food selection is what you would expect, nothing but 5 Stars here, from the moment you are seated to the time you leave.

Oh1w_Vg7EJU4SxpnhfUsCg.text: In Vegas for a mini vacation and decided to try this place to see what everyone is raving about. Sadly, it was a fail. Not sure if expectations were too high from friends recommendations/yelp reviews, but this was one sad expensive meal. We made it right around 4 pm which is when dinner time starts. I will say that the service from the bus boys was impeccable and very friendly. Waiter was nice at first but after he brought entrees hardly checked on our party. Appetizer was ordered. Minutes later waiter comes back saying how they are out of clams. Should have taken this as a sign and gone somewhere else. Went with second choice calamari. It was just ok, have had same or better else where and portion was huge. Ordered 2 of the specialty steaks ( aged NY steak), Mac and cheese and potato wedges.  We both asked for medium rare. When stakes came out, 1 was almost burned and way over cooked. The other one almost raw. Took first bite and was trying to taste the flavor...again I have had way better many times for a whole lot cheaper. The meat was not tendered, it was hard to chew and swallow. The Mac and cheese was good and potato wedges....well they were just potato wedges ( go with something else, husband was just in the mood for steak and potatoes). We were so underwhelmed, tried to eat as much as we could without feeling guilty for throwing food in the trash. Best thing of the meal was the cucumber jalapeno margarita. Next time we want steak , will try another place.

DpCZ5JXy7-4Sja2S_zpw0Q.text: It was the first day of our Las Vegas strip trip and we still had our money-So we decided to go to Gallagher's before blowing our money at the Craps table. The food here is good. I'm not much of a steak person, but my boyfriend is. He ordered the dry-aged New York Strip, claiming it was cooked well, full of flavor and not tough!  I ordered the maize-fed chicken. The chicken was oven-roasted, moist and overall well seasoned with roasted veggies. As far as their sides, we  ordered their calamari, which was a bit too soggy for my taste. The other side we ordered (Asiago mashed potatoes) seemed to be a bit too TGIF type for the place. Overall it was a pleasant experience. Their staff was friendly and knowledgeable on their wines, but my biggest complain is the location of their restroom. (it's outside the restaurant in the casino) and the tacky decor of the restaurant...

DCyWu2c4AescSuwebSCcVg.text: My boyfriend and I were so excited to finally eat at Gallaghers! The meat dry aging in the window lured us in! Unfortunately we did not have the 'OMG this is so good eyes rolling to the back of the head' experience that we were expecting. I ordered the snapper, which was the special that evening. I was expecting to cut it with my fork! Instead I had to saw through it with my super dull steak knife. Clearly this piece of snapper was not cooked to order. It seemed as if it was cooked hours prior and left in a warming tray until it made it out to the table.  Yuck! My boyfriend ordered the Cowboy Ribeye cooked medium. It came out undercooked yet very dry. It was a very mediocre experience as nothing was what we were hoping it would be. We paid $195. And some change for 2 cocktails, 2 entrees, 1 salad and 1 side to share. Very disappointing!

OLXORK_-hGshPYx5iHTbpQ.text: The King Cut Prime Rib is amazing. The sides are good, too. The fries are these honkin' huge slices of potato. I also liked my iceberg salad wedge.  This is not a place for the birds. You get what you pay for and the portions are just huge. Not Claim Jumper obscene, but don't come here after you had the Bellagio buffet or something. Come here hungry and order carefully.  Don't be afraid to try the sauces... they are excellent.

qqXJaRUbHrLRSKA072pl7g.text: Pros:    One of the best Prime Ribs I've ever eaten (Better than Lawry's, Arnie Morton's and Ruth's Chris)    Nice Decor    Friendly Service Cons:    A Bit Pricey, but what you get what you pay for

frB7Gu80wez7jYJmcWTZfg.text: Make reservations if you don't want to wait!   I called in a couple days before my Vegas trip for my boyfriend's surprise birthday dinner. He's was eying this place the last time we came so I knew this was the perfect place. I mentioned that it was his birthday and they offered if I wanted to pre-order a dessert and they can put a candle on it. Yes!   The day of, we were greeted by the friendly staff and our table was ready to go. It was a Saturday night, it was packed, and people who didn't make reservations were waiting outside. Thank goodness for calling in!   We were assisted by the waiter, John, who tended to our every need. Our glasses of water were consistently filled and never did we have to ask for more, even at half full! While waiting, a lady was coming by to take pictures to purchase if you like.   We both ordered the Cowboy Rib-eye, medium well, and sides of asparagus and mushrooms. They were cooked to perfection and the taste was HEAVEN! The pieces melted as you bit into them. I would have to say this place tops Ruth's Chris if you've tried them before. If the portions weren't so large, I would have attempted to finish it right there on the spot. The asparagus had a light amount of cream sauce on top and was very tender. The mushrooms were sauteed and was nicely seasoned.   After our meal was packaged, they brought out the creme brulee that I ordered and that just topped the night off. The top was had a nice thick crust and inside was very creamy and smooth. There were also a couple of seasonal berries on top.   The experience was wonderful, the food was excellent, and we were treated with such great service by the staff. The cost of the dinner is well worth the whole experience and definitely a birthday to remember!

51Jxp5MKUS23rz6l8jrDHw.text: Gallaghers is a definite go-to in Las Vegas for a great steak. The service is top notch, and the ambiance is nice. The only down side is it is pricey and can get very noisy. Either way I find myself here nearly every time I am in Las Vegas.

b6PC4GD7K28TD0610hglDg.text: Every casino has a fancy steakhouse.  My bucket list is to try them all.  My favorite cut is the Ribeye due to it's correct fat to meat ratio making it tasty and tender.  I couldn't wait to try this place.  Nice and fancy.  They display their cuts and specializes in aged beef.  Unfortunately, the service was horrible. Not only it was slow, they got our orders wrong twice in one night.  On top of that, my cut was overcooked, which is just wrong.  Sending it back corrected it, but it wasn't tender.  I don't mind paying a high price for steak, but it must be great, and mine wasn't.  The whole table agreed that they wouldn't come back.  The sides were small yet good and the staff was friendly.  Unfortunately that won't get me back to this place.

Jcu1N7-lJeGbDKyw3HvLow.text: We came here for our anniversary.  The steaks were amazing!  The portions are HUGE.  We ended up taking more than half home.  The service was wonderful.  My only complaint would be that the tables are bit close together.  We could hear every word the tables around us were saying.  Didn't make it very intimate or romantic for us.  The prices are good for what you get.  Would we go back, definitely.

qOUicG21COGq9FmA85iAyA.text: My husband and I are so happy to have made reservations here tonight! Our dinner was amazing and the server John was a tad more amazing!!! So personable and knowledgable about the menu! He definitely made the price tag on the food easier to swallow LOL! We knew we were coming for a high end meal and got what we paid for and then some!

v7iz2SIIoXlLKSbNUZSVlw.text: I was pretty disappointed with the quality of steaks at this steakhouse. I ordered the "signature" dry-aged New York Sirloin and my girlfriend ordered the cowboy ribeye. My steak was entirely unimpressive other than being slightly larger than I expected. It was seasoned well but it was hardly tender at all. I could barely taste the unique flavor that dry aging imparts on beef. Not bad enough to send back, though.  My girlfriend's Cowboy ribeye was poorly prepared. It's impressive size couldn't offset the fact that it was a tough, overcooked piece of beef jerky. The seasoning (salt, pepper, butter?) was spot on but I noticed something was off when i saw my girlfriend trying to cut through it like she was using a wood saw. I politely offered to cut it for her and this is when i realized that it was an awful steak. I tried a piece and was stuck chewing it for a good 2 mins. At that point I was tried to convince her that she should send it back. She has very little experience with steak and didn't realize how bad it was especially considering the $42 price tag...just for the steak. She decided to keep eating the dry rubber because it still tasted good but quickly became defeated after her jaw got tired...about halfway through the steak. You might imagine how frustrating it is to watch a server clear away twenty dollars worth of steak.   We also ordered a side of mushrooms for our steaks that were very tasty. The two things that saved the night from being a complete disappointment -and subsequently earning them a single star rating- was the service and the crabcake appetizers.   The crabcakes were amazing. EXPENSIVE but amazing ($20 for 3 small cakes). Moist, delicious, and piping hot. Seasoned to perfection. Probably the best crabcakes i've ever had. Seriously.  The service was very impressive as well. Super courteous and very informed. It was almost comical how aware the waitstaff was of the dining area. I accidentally dropped my one of my forks and - being the neanderthal that i am - was just going to wipe it off and keep using it. Before i could even reach to pick it up I had two waiters rushing to my side with a clean one. I saw this happen at another table later that night. They also scrape the crumbs off of the table using a barbershop-style straight edge. Good work guys!  Ultimately, I walked away very disappointed. After a generous tip I had spent nearly $200 for two people and felt a little cheated by the quality of their beef. Not recommended for steak. Everything else was okay.

JWBVIm5sZgyDndwQC1Rhrg.text: Their famous dry-aged steak was decent, as in kinda good, nothing more. The meat portions are huge so that made up for it's price of $45ish.   The lobster tail was quite dry and lacked a lot more natural flavor than it should've and the reddish seasoning on top didn't help at all.  It cost me 75 bucks alone!! Yes, it was a big lobster tail, but it sucked.  In hindsight, I should've said that it sucked to see if my server would remove it from our check.  However, he didn't ask how the food was, and I felt generous that night or something.   The mac and cheese side dish was bland as hell. Chef Boyardee could put out a better dish, which is really, really saying something.    The best part was the green beans which were very well seasoned and very tasty but way overpriced for what they were.  The portion was modest at best but cost us something in the teens.  I must admit that if it wasn't for their lavish display of the process of dry-aging steaks in the glass enclosure right outside their restaurant, I wouldn't have felt tempted to eat there.

bYf0k9-DY5JFBHrzy_z2Kg.text: Gallagher's Steakhouse was the only restaurant open after we missed out Craftsteak reservation due to the Fox rent-a-car debacle (see review below). My buddies and I decided that the night is too young to hit the casino floor and we were somewhat hungry so off we went to New York New York to try Gallagher's infamous dry aged steak.   All of us were alluded to the 21-day, dry aged New York cut, that raw steak dry aging outside of the restaurant was just speaking to us. We had mashers and Steamed Asparagus w/ Hollandaise for sides. When the steak was revealed, I was surprised how big a New York cut can be, it was almost like a Porterhouse cut from some steakhouses! My steak was perfectly made (medium), and upon first bite the flavor form being dry-aged 21 days is absolutely present. And the presence of that flavor is still apparent up to the middle of the meat, unheard off especially on less fatty cuts of steak. I guess one trade off with have a wonderfully flavored steak is toughness. Yes, this New York cut is tougher than the usual New York cuts I have had from other restaurants. That's some tradeoff because for me, texture is equally important as flavor in steaks. Also their steamed asparagus were overcooked, less apparent (but still overcooked) when our server exchanged it for a new one. The machers were simply delicious.  Combined with my buddy's uber expensive Caymus prime red wine, our dining experience at Gallagher's was awesome. Yes, I would probably come back to check out the rest of their cuts, all of their cuts are aged (well, the rest are wet-aged) anyhow.

ZzHynimQ6u2CO7oahLITmg.text: Had the chance to check out this place over the weekend and I'm so glad I did. Gallagher's is an awesome steakhouse. It definitely ranks on my top 5 on best steakhouses. We ordered the following items:   Cowboy Rib-Eye Steak 38- (5 stars) OMG, this steak was HUGE, bone in and all had to call for some back up!!! This was definitely a bite out of heaven. It was extremely tender and grilled to perfection. I was definitely a happy camper.   Queen Cut Prime Rib of Beef 32-(5 stars) Originally, we were eyeing the King Cut but that was WAY too much cow. The Queen Cut is a pretty generous portion. I was able to sample it and I was pleasantly surprised. It was actually tasty and extremely tender.   Sides:  Loaded Mashed Potatoes 8 - (3 stars) This consisted of Yukon Gold Mashed potatoes with sour cream, butter, chives and cheese. It was OK, I've tasted better.   Fresh Steamed Asparagus 9 -(3 stars) Cooked just right but didn't care for the hollandaise sauce that it was topped with.   Dessert:  English Toffee Pudding Cake 8- (4stars) This sticky toffee and moist cake was superb!   Creme Brulee 8 - (4 stars) This was made just right, not too sweet and the right texture.   Nice atmosphere and great staff. Great value for your money for this dining experience . This place is a must see.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queen Cut Prime Rib
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy Ribeye

cIQj9I3qe5AIV-SkDRcDBg.text: My husband and I found this place on accident. We had been walking around trying to find the perfect place to have our first Vegas meal. We were not disappointed. The aged New York strip, the forest mushroom salad and sauteed spinach were all done very well. I especially loved the light but flavorful mushroom salad. The mushrooms are sauteed and served on field greens. Loved it.

2Q7CvmZFtbCNpXF_VicI6g.text: For the hefty price you do get a big piece of meat. However, the New York Strip steak was not very tender, very chewy, and I only ate about 25% of it. My wife had the Fillet Minon and that was delicious. Don't listen to the experts and get your meat cooked at least medium as they are so thick the inside will be bloody medium rare.

vXO9MMJG7Z7nJNJ74lYAUg.text: Simple.  Best ribeye I ever had.   Evvvverrrrrr.  great service.   only thing bad i had to say is...  i cant go back to cheap steak anymore.  its not the same.  and i think im addicted to their rib eyes.  been craving badly.  withdrawals must go back to vegas.

8MqaKh62UTXsrxvsUdvPZg.text: We had a fabulous time and great service! Five of us shared two entrees and two sides. There were no leftovers but we were all satisfied!  The lobster was amazing, we also order the porterhouse. Everything was delicious! We will go again

DJx9nR9AVN_NtFe4Tul_YA.text: If I could give this restaurant more stars, I definitely would. Went on a Saturday night and was thinking we would have to wait forever for a table since we did not have a reservation. We were seated within literally minutes and the New York strip was amazing. I've never had dry aged before and it was definitely a delight. The highlight though was not the food, but the staff. We were served promptly, treated with patience, and the staff was very attentive without being overbearing. Kana was our waiter and seemed as if he wants to earn our business, and simply not just a tip. I was surprised too at the fact that even the manager came by, Randy. He and Kana were on the same page and we appreciated the recommendations they both offered, without trying to sell us on the most expensive items. They made it seem genuine. Randy even created conversation with us and made it a personal experience. My experience with this establishment has been shared to my friends and family and it will definitely see me return to the restaurant again. Thank you Kana, and Randy for the great experience.

tHi66Xap5ZjDqW3WpdZUKQ.text: Second time eating at this top notch steakhouse in the NYNY casino. Service quality drops throughout dinner, but initially they are refilling water, folding napkins if you walk away to wash hands,etc.  Clam Chowder was chunky and well prepared.  Steaks are some of the best I have ever eaten.  French Fries are not plain steak fries as listed, but are well seasoned well fried and served with a steak sauce infused ketchup. Asparagus makes another fine side.  Desserts are "ok" and coffee refills are somewhat slow, but steaks are awesome.  Also had the Australian Lobster tail in '08 and it was great.

Rh9ujjpXZ_nrqYEp270uHg.text: We came here for birthday dinner. The preserved New York steak is not as good, but the  Ribeye is much better,

7jxhaZJmw457WXbAcxkWbQ.text: This restaurant has really changed since eating there last. First thing was added additional tables so way over crowded and very loud where you couldn't even hear people at your own table. Then to food, it was just ok..... Service and waiter did a great job!

0Lx-agcwqjNhS4JtCVqkHQ.text: The surf and turf here was one of the best I've had.  Filet mignon and lobster tail was very good.  i generally dont think the food in Vegas is great, but after being dissappointed on many occasions, I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of our meal.  Thanks to the Taste, i was lured to this restaurant only to find that it is a somehat hidden jewel in New York New York close to the sometimes obnoxious piana bar time square.    The side of green beans were delish and the potatos are just meh.  For desert they  served an extremely delicious lemon pudding which taste more tart than pudding....it was fabulous.  I think Gallaghers is good for couples, groups, and even kids.

FYADLhGNBGMYrTg0f_poDQ.text: I had the aged NY strip, which was excellent. The mixed seasonal mushrooms were also great. Service was just OK. Prices were reasonable.

pGcXNJAsFN-OTpjsSQN0Fg.text: Outstanding!! Best ribeye I've had in days!! Great service!! Thanks Donna. Will be back.

glW1dtoPa4iSx3mWEF68GA.text: I do not understand why a restaurant would go to the trouble of wet and dry aging a steak to serve it smothered in a sauce?  Our appetizer, bruchetta was ok, nothing great.  The wedge salad was very good, excellent blue cheese dressing.  We ordered the 4 Cheese Mac and Cheese and Broccoli au Gratin.  The Mac and Cheese was pretty good but not outstanding.  The Broccoli au Gratin was just broccoli with a cheese sauce,  we expected a baked broccoli and cheese dish.  The steaks were not good at all.  The first steaks they brought out were barely warm, I was very disappointed to see they both had been smothered in a brown gravy like sauce.   The waiter took them back to reheat them and when he brought them back they were basically the same.  He took those back and brought two new ones out about 10 minutes later, these were hotter but still not what I would expect for a 35-50 dollar steak.  If I had known the steaks were sauced/gravied here I would have never eaten here.  This should be disclosed on the menu.

bvvXnRgmv1tBhJfhr0Nq2g.text: Can't really go wrong with high-end steak houses.  Nice touch with the dry-aged steaks hanging in the window, but a bit misleading since there was only one dry-aged option on the menu.  Coincidentally, it happened to be the featured item on the menu.  All other options were wet-aged, which I'm not a huge fan of.  Wine selection is somewhat limited.  Sides were what you can expect from a joint like this.  The four stars is mainly for the quality of beef and perfectly grilled to order.  This is a convenient spot for a nice dinner if you're staying in the hotel.  Availability shouldn't be a problem since it's nearly always empty.  But, if you're looking to go big and willing to travel. . . there are much better steak joints on the strip at the same price point.

XndMyhSQAn0l8hcCNFm2Tw.text: Great steak! The signature NY STRIP with bone was HUG and with lots of flavor!! Shared the steak! Definitely a must try! Service and atmosphere was top notch!! Planning to visit again soon!!!

0a_j8SlN1LVbQIoBEO6dEA.text: The food here is a 5 out of 5. Very, very delicious. I got the New York Strip along with the fries. The steak was tender and cooked just right. The ketchup they gave me with my fries was amazing. Had a lil spicy kick to it, I highly recommend it. Got the cheesecake for a dessert. It was one of the best pieces I've had.  Excellent food there.   The service here though was terrible. Actually, I'll change that to our waiter was terrible. He was trying to be very sneaky and add extra charges to our bill to make it higher. Then when I asked him about these extras charges, he would start talking under his breath so I couldn't understand him, maybe thinking I'd leave the situation alone. I don't believe at all that this is a representation of the other members of the staff here. I think this is just one lone ranger trying to be slick to get an extra few bucks. The higher the bill, the higher the tip usually. It didn't happen for this guy.   The food here would bring me back when I come back to visit Las Vegas. However, if I see the server we had coming towards our table, I know what I'll be asking for first... A new waiter.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip with fries

E1j0cAxWKoX_D_iB1C6x1g.text: I wanted to give this place 5 stars but service wasn't impressive considering it's a higher end restaurant. I gotta say their management seem to be a problem. Our poor server had the whole area of 10 tables all by himself. Two other servers did come to ease some of the rush but our server was the main server. Tables were setup very close to each other. Strange.   As for the food, I wanted to order some appetizers first but we were rushed into ordering main entree. But it all worked out because I could enjoy my cowboy ribeye fully. The steak had good flavor to it and I didn't feel completely bloated even though I ate two third of the steak. The steak had a light spice on it.  As for dessert, their dessert menu lights up like an iPad. I tried their dark chocolate. That was nice and smooth.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Death by chocolate
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key lime pie
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu

_z_J3TZi8wQzFySo4ojxvw.text: Nope never again .. ordered my steak medium.. came out rare.. they said they would fix it .. they took it back to their little oven.. charred the outside so I get burned steak on the outside and still rare on the inside .. never ever again what a waste of money

srKD47JBG2_Aay_B0cbZoQ.text: Came here with a friend who'd had a recent positive experience dining here. Unfortunately, I was sorely disappointed. First off, this is not a cheap off strip restaurant so I was really surprised when our server a full robot mode on when she finally came to our table. Didn't even make eye contact. It was only after telling her that it was my first visit that she bothered to mention their signature dish: The dry aged drip which I wound up ordering. When my $50 al a carte slab'o beef arrived I was shocked that my steak had about 4-5 ounces of gristle. It was so tough that I actually checked my knife to see if it was dull. The server came by only once during the meal and caught me with a full mouth so I couldn't ask if this was the norm. Last time I saw her until she came by with desert menus. By then I was able to flag down a passing manager who left me feeling as though it was my fault for not telling the waitress.  Left me feeling like I was just another one time customer and that I really didn't matter. (This despite dining with an M-Life Gold level member).  Obviously the manager took a moment to tell the server my concern as her parting shot as she dropped the check was a curt, "I'm glad you enjoyed your dinner.  Really sad because they lost my business and that of a regular guest.  Next time I'll go back to Delmonico's where they have never disappointed.

sqmkT93tu-xmDPJuctpUUg.text: I went to Gallagher's with a bachelor party. I've been to other steakhouses like Cut or Delmonico's and while those were slightly better they were double the price. For half the price I think Gallagher's is almost as good which in real world terms means I would pick this over those on any day especially those when I am paying for the meal. Our party of 7 was extremely happy with the food. I had the NY strip steak which was huge. I was sorry I ordered appetizers because I was so full afterwards. I enjoyed the hearts of palm and heirloom salad I ordered. I would definitely go back here.

JedYeZk7zwQ5CRGioqbREg.text: First time dining with this restaurant and it so disappointing that we will not be returning again.  How do you expect customers to sit for about 25 mins to get your appetizers....as in wedge salad?  Giving us a cold plate of fried calamari for free does not excuse the long wait.  On top of that, it took us over 60 mins to get our entrees and if we didn't mention we have a 930pm show to attend, I doubt we will get our food 15 mins before the show.  Do you seriously think we can eat our steaks in 15 mins? The rib eye steak was so tough to chew when we ordered medium rare and the filet was burnt on the outside being medium rare too.  Totally not worth the time AND money.

TmOo1OWW5_4sEx7w986o_w.text: Let me start by saying that me and my girlfriend were given a recommendation by one of her co-workers. I came in with great excitement after seeing their dry aged steaks in the window. Pricing appeared at a first glance to be on par for a great evening meal.  We started off with a soup that was delightful according to my girlfriend. If that was the only part of the meal I would probably have given it a 4/5.   We ordered a Filet Mignon, and the Aged New York Strip. The first cut in my Filet Mignon visually indicated a perfect medium rare, however, the first bite turned out to be a lackluster tasteless piece of meat. The omission of any flavour absolutely infuriated me. The steak was on the colder side (medium rare should not be cold in the centre, this was pretty damn close).  Much to my disappointment, I have prepared better dinner by purchasing a decent cut at my local butcher in San Francisco or even Whole foods. My girlfriend's New York Strip didn't fair much better. Tough meat that was was not worth the effort.  I don't think of myself as a food snob, but after today I question how I was served such a disaster. If I can make a dish better without sincere effort I feel cheated and therefore have to give a rather disappointing one star.  I sincerly hope some of the other reviewers received something nicer than what we received. If you enjoy steak, please don't go here. You will be so severely disappointed.

40OCfziNWoUT7CsqtzUZXQ.text: Gallagher's is a very nice place to have good meal with friends the staff are  really nice a and friendly make sure you book before going to avoid disappointment the place gets busy we got there early so we sat at the bar had a few drinks . over all its must go to if you like a well managed steakhouse house

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yuasy9fDNmmZE8SP98amXQ.text: The most disappointing service of our trip and on my actual Birthday of course. I gave it 3 stars because my salmon was good. But, the waiter said it came on creamer spinach and it was spinach leaves like in a salad. I'd give zero stars for the wait time of our food. Took 2hr 10mins to get our meals after we had salad. We had to ask 2 times for bread. My husband's steak was ok. Not exciting at all. I wouldn't go back.

GgxuCbSaCxArmD-nIZNIzA.text: My first time here and great services, steaks and wine selections. Will defiantly be back next time we are in town.

2z80BCKbd_vfG9HFc1FkeQ.text: This would probably be the low-tier of the steakhouses I've been to. Service was great and all but the steaks weren't that great. Even though dry-age steak that was placed in front of the store wasn't that special.  It's probably a 2.5 in my mind but I guess I would admit this was probably one of my least favorite steak houses i've been to in terms of their steaks.   Bread was served cold and you are given sour dough and raisin/nut bread. I prefer the raisin/nut bread.   Prime rib : quite expensive for 45? dollars. I might as well go to summit house and get a $30 prime rib and they are known for it and it is bigger. It tasted so-so.   Filet mignon - To me, it was just a meh steak. I don't know how to describe it to you if you had better steaks before. It didn't stand out and the sauces that you pay for just covers the meat taste to it.  Dry-age rib eye- the best one but still didn't stand it. It's not as tender as other steaks as it is a rib eye given that you get a better taste to the meat. Would recommend it if you do choose to dine at Gallagher.  The sides- Mac and cheese was terrible, didn't have a good taste to it and was a bit too cheesy in a weird way and really overwhelm your palette.   Mushroom - my friend and I both thought it tasted bitter which was really odd to us...   Potato puree- it was decent. I feel like you can't really messed up it too much. Obviously steak and potato puree is usually a must.   Cream spinach - my favorite one. I don't know what they did with it but I actually really like the taste to it. I guess they add some kind of heavy cream that made it better to my tasting?  Regardless, I would take my money to OBVIOUSLY Craft steak at MGM or SW at Wynn. The service was still great and he was really helpful and kind towards our party.   I would kinda rank Gallagher and Prime in the same tier in a way just cause Prime is way too expensive but I'm sorry Gallagher you be getting 2 from me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4yTSXmGqhPCgBECWmO38cw.text: Located inside NYNY at the entrance to the village. Good meal and excellent service. $155 before tip for family of 4 with wine. No kids menu or kid size food which my kiddos were thrilled about so they stuffed their  cute little faces with bread and butter, split a calamari appetizer, Mac n cheese side, and I shared my New York Strip since it was large enough to share. Husband had the Cowboy cut. Both came out medium rare as ordered. Both ordered the Stillman blue cheese and it was enough for two. Should have just went with one of those. Loved the baked garlic with mine. Service was quick and friendly. Our water glasses filled promptly and table cleared off as soon as needed. Only downside,  they no longer carry one of the wines listed on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged New York Strip with Mac n cheese.

EzfVR0eCBCUcWQYaZmnaGA.text: This is located around the strips. Went to vegas with the older folks and they wanted to dine fancy and so I got to try this place once. The steaks were on the pricey side about $50 bucks each. It wasn't the best steak I've tried. Average~

QSDEaYsr2ongFzvILrr4Uw.text: My wife and I went here about a year and a half ago because it had good reviews and it it was located on the strip. I don't eat at expensive steakhouses unless I'm on vacation, so I usually just eat at local steakhouses in the Atlanta area. This was the best ribeye I've ever eaten at a steakhouse. It was cooked right and delicious. I noticed one review about the Gallaghers in New York being so much better, but I couldn't imagine how the steak that I ate could have been any better in New York. I'm going back in 2 months and I can't wait to go back to this restaurant. I love this place

ABkyH1408hBbg_PBD6VSDg.text: This time around on my yearly visit I more then enjoyed he service and the decode of Gallagher's, two years ago I came across this restaurant and I'm more then starting to become a regular here whenever I visit Las Vegas. My most recent visit included Shrimp Scampi, and the Irish Organic Salmon. The shrimp scampi easily set the bar for any scampi I have tried in Nevada/Las Vegas. Onto the next thing that I truly want to talk about; the Irish Organic Salmon, me myself being salmon lover, I have tried many different restaurants takes on how it should be prepared.. and shouldn't be prepared. I would absolutely recommend anyone who enters this restaurant to consider this menu item.  This creamy, soft, delectable salmon that was prepared for me set my bar for my trip as of November second of 2017. It was defiantly the best meal I've had in a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi

yV6muaHWJiU37unf1gFTEw.text: Great steaks and service! I had the filet and it was cooked perfectly with a nice crispy crust. Husband loved his huge New York. Asparagus and mashed potato sides were wonderful as well. Would definitely recommend! Also pretty reasonable for the strip. Our bill was around $140 for steaks, sides, salad and wine/beer.

8wqwsU6W78XfofeMb6hulg.text: The steak here is wonderful! Comes with roasted garlic which is super delicious. Staff also comes around to take your picture. They actually come out quite professional and I did buy a couple shots!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4xNsEYMViC2wro5xY220ng.text: Way overpriced for average food.  This was the consensus vote from a party of 7 people I was with and this restaurant acts like they are some 5* fancy world famed place.  Your talking $32 for the cheapest item for some over cooked Salmon. The steak will break you at $50+. I would highly suggest buying your own steaks and cooking them!  The only plus is that it is located in the casino so I could walk out while waiting and drown my sorrows away at the slot machine.

sdlfTvmCCBwvZOqmArRldA.text: Very disapointed.  The other 2 diners ordered medium rare steaks theirs were good. I asked for med. Well, my steak was half as thick as theirs and very tough, so much so my daughter insisted I send it back. The second steak was a little better but still very tough and thin.  The baked potato was retched. Previously cooked and cooled and reheated a dark gelatinous mess. That was supposed to be my splurge since I've been doing low carb.  For a $100 dinner I could have several great steaks from Savemart. Won't be choosing this place again

Gmxi0F7tFdhk7mrumq14zQ.text: .had the best time bkz of the staff and of course the food!  The waiters and servers were the absolute best I've EVER experienced and I've gone to other chains and it doesnt even compare! The food was above and beyond....I couldn't even eat it all! Had the cowboy steak...mmmmm good with mushrooms, salad and scallops. They melt in your mouth! Will be coming back!!!! Mostly bkz of the staff...they dont mess around!

D7BfPfQqDcUypwOyhPVy-g.text: My husband and I have visited Gallagher's a couple times now and each time I was satisfied with my meal and the service.  The steaks are cooked perfectly. Not the best steak I've ever had, but definitely worth the price. The service is up to par and they congratulated us on our anniversary, which was sweet. Make a reservation for popular times and nights. A nice place to go when staying at NYNY.

oWkkqCij_kZ-2qmCOYMnHA.text: I normally am not one to take pictures of my food but this is one the cases where my Prime Rib was so beautiful I had to!  We started with a couple of drinks, I had the scotch old fashioned and loved it so much I had to have a second!  A very clean tasting old fashioned.  My wife had the the All That Razz which was a fun take on a cosmopolitan.  The complimentary bread was delicious.  I had the Prime Rib cooked rare and it is some of the best Prime I have ever had.  Our server Dereck offered raw horseradish and my love for horseradish I said of course.  They warned me the horseradish was the real deal and they were so correct!  I cried twice, went into a coughing fit once, and had clear sinuses after the horseradish.  My kind of stuff!  Wife had the Filet cooked medium and it was surprisingly a little over cooked which she normally likes so it was all good!  Our buddy that was with us had the Cowboy Ribeye and the taste he gave me was incredible!  For sides we got mushrooms which were good but the winner was the side of the day which was a cheddar cheese and jalapeno mashed potato.  Was also fun to experience our first earth quake while eating there!  Another great Steakhouse in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gallagher&#39;s rare Prime Rib.

AyWv1-iKxjTFXujMvsZoGA.text: We had our 14 year anniversary dinner here!  We wanted to try their dry aged steak so we ordered their New York Strip along with their seared scallops, asparagus, and baked potatoes.  Steak was cooked well and so was the scallops.  The potatoes and asparagus were good as well.  Service was pleasant and the complimentary bread was as expected.  I'm giving it a 3 star because nothing blew my mind away in terms of the food.  I'm terms of steak I personally prefer Strip Steak at Mandalay Bay now that I have tried both places.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9-rIJXlocIVENkiHYJfiig.text: The ambiance is more Texas Roadhouse with a tie.  The food is okay they need to figure out how to make steaks.  Medium has a pink center. The bread was so stale you could Hardly chew it  the service was good the food took a little long to bring out. The drinks are great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry steak
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stale bread

lCGAVmKXRDXd4eSptSEhLw.text: To be honest this Steakhouse was pretty great. I had the cowboy ribeye and it's probably been the best ribeye I've had. The meat would melt in your mouth. My girlfriend had their NY strip which was their signature cut and we both thought it wasnt that great which is the only reason that we didnt give this review a 5 star review. For our sides we had the wild mushrooms which were delicious and the creamed spinach which was bland. The service was amazing. The servers were very attentive and friendly and ready to take care of any need you may have had.

C38NsJXdGFPKp3eHuYHMDA.text: Amazing dinner, drinks and service at Gallagher's! We started with the calamari - on point, delicious and flavorful! I had the NY steak and the hubs had the filet mignon, and we shared the bacon mac & cheese as well as the creme brulee for dessert...all of it just phenomenal. The service was simply outstanding; waters were filled constantly. We really didn't wait for anything the entire evening. 10/10.

0BTp6dRTWuOa4-okuHqNJg.text: We had Christmas eve dinner here using Opentable for a reservation. We were seated on time. Service was attentive and obliging. We ordered some appetizers and a ribeye to split. The calamari and bruschetta were ok - not terrific, but not bad either. Bruschetta leaned a little too much to the sweet side, as well as their marinara sauce for the calamari. The steak was cooked as per order and was really good. Great marbling on the ribeye and very juicy and tender. We topped off the meal with the creme brulee which was fine. Similar to the appetizers, not phenomenal, but definitely passable.  I would skip on the cocktails next time. Not to my own subjective liking. Would rather save that money and hop on over to The Chandelier in Cosmo if I want a post- (or pre-) dinner drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1wkj8r050ShXeiI09QpRdw.text: This place is an excellent place to dine in with DELICIOUS food.  The service is awesome, the meat cuts are HUGE, cooked to your liking, good wine selection and staff is very attentive. It is clean, has a dress code of business casual, but there where people with shorts and t-shirts. I prefer to dress and dine for a nice restaurant. You can make a reservation or walk up and wait if they are busy. Dinner for two will cost you for the great service and food, so don't be cheap, treat yourself and that special other person.   They have a simple menu. You get a basket of a cranberry bread and sourdough. We had the tasty Fried Pork Belly for the appetizer. The main entree was a 18-20 oz Pork Chop and the 22-25 oz Porter House with garlic green beans and garlic veggies . Yes, those are roughly the sizes of these beasts. A carnivores playground on an empty stomach. I only ate half and took the other half back to the room for a midnight snack.   Definitely a regular stop when in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We had the Bone-in New York Strip Steak (15-18 oz) and  Porter house (22-25 oz) with garlic green beans and veggies.  EXCELLENT &amp; DELICIOUS!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Which one do you want?

gwGVkBPkj3ZDOJ9J6-AwDw.text: Probably the best steak house hands down in Nevada! Best dry aged steak I've had yet!

uYlTvjLANBLKOeGSxdEOWA.text: Definitely a solid bet if you're looking to have a nice steak on a friday night in Vegas. We did not have to wait to be seated and we came in at about 6:30 PM. Our waiter was very nice and polite. The steak itself was about what you would expect for $51 (Filet Mignon) and was not anything exceptional to write home about. I ordered mine medium well and would definitely order medium instead if I ever go back, as mine was a little too well done. Also had a side of asparagus which was phenomenal, serving size was 5 spears. The only complaint that I have about Gallagher's was that the bathroom was located outside of the restaurant itself. It was a little strange that I had to walk out the back door into the main casino bathroom and had to walk around to the front of the restaurant again to return to my table. Back door locks by a code. Otherwise, a solid experience!

z_-NKKeBcTaW6ijiq2-uyQ.text: LOVE the ambiance! I ordered the crabcakes appetizer and they were DELICIOUS! My filet was disappointing, but everything else was above average. The service was very good and the drinks, though a bit expensive, were strong and creative. We will certainly be making Gallagher's one of our favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All That Razz..

ckbvFvGl0wTMR9ldDLchaQ.text: If one goes to a steakhouse one should order steak, right? So I ordered the filet medium. They cooked it the way I ordered, but I almost choked on the first bite. There was so much pepper on it it, it was inedible. The waiter was very apologetic and took it back. The second one was cooked so rare.... you guessed it, back it went. They threw it back in the broiler, this time burning the outside. As everyone else at our table was ready for dessert, I made the best of it, trimming off the burnt portions, which left me with about half of what I ordered!  Compared to several of the high end steak chains, this place was pitiful.  Doesn't matter how long you age a steak if you don't know how to cook it!! The only reason I gave this place two stars was because of the wait staff. If you want a good steak go elsewhere.

lgQLWFaL4J7u4CJOrhHXsA.text: Love love love this place.  The steak is very tasty and the lobster is delicious.  We tried their combo plate at "mp." It was a shock but well worth it. Wine selections are great and reservations are recommended to save you some time.

m2eWM8lalbJd6GtnVY3t9Q.text: Great impromptu dinner!  We had the cowboy ribeye, prime rib, asparagus and garlic mashed potatoes. Delicious! For dessert the strawberry cheesecake.  Our server was very nice, and the gentlemen who refilled our water was very attentive.   We arrived on a late Friday night without reservations, and only waited 15 minutes for a table for 2.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry cheesecake
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy rib eye, with fixings!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy rib eye, prime rib, garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus.

LG5HU__YBhA-arHRcn-aAw.text: This is a amazing steakhouse located inside of the New York New York casino on the corner of Las Vegas blvd and Tropicana.  Now that the T-Mobile arena is conveniently located right now the to this casino...I find myself here a lot more than what I used to be.    When I go to Golden Knights games or a couple shows I find myself here for dinner and it's great.    The have a great selection of meats and sides. They also have great prices and impeccable customer service.    I highly recommended the bone-in ribeye and the prime rib.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uvyDpoRafJMubInVjbKSqw.text: Chicken had no flavor.  The truffle tries had no flavor. The new York aged had no marbling. Not impressed with the price they charge. Service was great though.

BGa8iUcASIPNvSL2yiTnRQ.text: This place feels like an old school New York steakhouse. All of the wonderful old pictures of jockeys with horses, long ago sports stars, movie stars and other notorious characters really gives this place a great feel. I kept looking around for a crime boss. I've dined at Gallagher's several times and I have loved it every time. Whether I'm with a group at a table or traveling alone eating at the bar, it has always been worth the trip.  This last time I ate at the bar. I started with a Martini then moved on to a dry aged New York strip with asparagus. I added a glass of Australian Shiraz and then all was right with the world. If you like your steak with a good char and earthy, beefy dry aged flavor you cannot go wrong at Gallagher's.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h3X8Qk1BYBHK3LdyFwWt-Q.text: Anytime I am in LV I go to Gallagher's and I have never been disappointed!  The service is excellent and the steak is superb. The side orders are incredible. I've tried other LV steak houses and I always come back to Gallagher's. Enjoy

3f_4xHhUq668-tpoelFBAw.text: 2 stars because I double checked the name of this place again and I do see the word  "Steakhouse" !!! My steak is burned and bitter on the outside and guess what....I ordered a RARE steak !!! And we ordered 4 of the exact same steak for the table and all came out inconsistent, some super rare and almost cold in the middle, one is like like medium well (too cooked) and mine again is burned....

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BURNED !!!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy ribeye steak....

m8-uFGaNNDyOhoM6qpzy5w.text: Amazing prime rib and portobello mushroom, seriously the best piece of meat you will ever get.

56Kew6nFw6e9x3yrC_6uzQ.text: Ribeye steak ordered med-rare is awesome. Definitely the best steak house in Vegas so far.  Seating is casual and slightly cramped. Should be better for the price you pay. That's the reason I don't give it 5 stars.

Coom1BSW4sYrZXy-cImyWA.text: The moment we passed by the aged beef, I knew my BF was going to want steak for his Bday dinner. Dinner was awesome well when we finally got it. It took at least an hour to get our food which is ok, but when you go very very hungry by the time you get your food you don't want it. That's what happened to my BF he had 4 bites of his New York Strip and didn't want any more. That was the best steak ever. We will go back. I am not sure of the correct name for them ( bust guys) they were great our table was clean when we were done with dishes and our water never ended. We have him a separate tip.

EbdWj-yPT9V5WsrYmXDoaQ.text: A-FREAKIN-MAZING! Came here for a Friday night dinner with my boys for my bachelor party. We were a group of 7 all had steaks of course. The service was a bit dissapointing as it took us almost 30 min. For our waiter to take our order. But they made up for it by having two waiters wait on us. But the food itself made up for it all! I had a porterhouse steak with a baked potatoe and  side of sauteed spinach. The steak I ordered medium rare and it was cooked to perfection. The seasoning on the steak was perfect, the portions are humongous. I'm a 300 pound 31 year old man and I could not finish that steak. worth every penny and the drinks we're just as good I ordered and Irish mule and the bartender knew what he was doing because it was made exactly how I like them the right way! if you guys are looking for a steakhouse with huge portions, reasonably priced and delicious food then look no further trust me you will not regret it, the guys and I didnt. The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because of the 30 minute wait for our waiter other than that everything was on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse steak and that thing in the background is the filet mignon my buddy ordered

r2RIIn6EsJmtyKCmAR1HBQ.text: My wife and I came in without a reservation but were able to be seated in short time. The waitress (Caroline) was awesome. She recommended the cowboy cut ribeye, three cheese mashed potatoes, We also ordered calamari. The calamari was excellent I love stripped calamari. The steak was perfect (rare). It some times is hard to get a rare steak cooked perfectly but the chef did. Seared outside slightly warm inside. The three cheese mash was too cheesy for me but Caroline changed it out for regular mash with out any issue. Very professional.

3jkcoXHqoTaz_pPVe7Rp-A.text: My husband and I eat at Gallagher`s in March and it was one of the Best steaks we have ever had!! The service was excellent and the food so yummy. Can`t wait for your next trip to Vegas we will be back :)

M7Rtfes9KS8GyriEJPiSsQ.text: I know steak quality, and I am extremely disappointed that this Las Vegas location uses Gallagher's name yet serves only USDA Choice Grade steak!!  This is unacceptable!!!  Gallagher's assumes that its Las Vegas clientele are too stupid to understand that they're paying for the very best Prime+ but are being served Sizzler-quality USDA Choice Grade steak.  Yes, the ambiance and service -- and even the side dishes and desserts -- are excellent, but nothing makes up for misleading customers.    :(

-olqSJVSgtSWHK42STVtzg.text: My husband and I had dinner and the food was absolutely great. To top it off the service we received was different then we have had before. That is in a very complimentary way. Our server was fun, outgoing and so pleasant. We have dined here at least four or five other times and it is consistently great. We excited to have a even better experience than the previous times. We did stay at New York New York casino. Our experience in every contact we had with staff was pleasant and warm. We have stayed at several high end casinos and the team by far goes above to make you feel great. I would recommend to everyone.

uvRTRu9ew2C1lEsa4Rusew.text: We sat in the bar area for a quick early lunch. Since the bar was the only area open at that time, it was a perfect solution. I had the steak salad which was soooooo good and really reasonably priced.

5-24yR1QHEebwRxhUyirEA.text: Good solid food. The Caesar salad was okay and the veal chop was worth the trip. I mostly skipped the sauce that came with it and enjoyed the thick juicy chop. If in NY-NY and looking for local steak, go.

OMS5DAqvIqWsZTvs1cA07A.text: Great Dry Aged NY Strip was as tender as my wife's Fillet... Both were wonderful along with the sides.  Both steaks cook to our perfect temperature (mine a Black and Blue Pittsburgh which is something I've found most steak places don't seem to do correctly).  A bit loud, but not louder than other steak houses we've been.  Prices were in line with other well know steak house and quality as good if not better.  Great waiters and staff.  Would highly recommend the mushroom salad along with the NY Strip steak (I'm normally a Fillet guy, but had to try the dry aged strip).    Overall I would say this is a wonderful place go get a great steak.  A bit noisy and a bit cramped if it's crowded, but well worth it.  One suggestion if getting the Dry Aged Steak... don't go past Medium Rare as it's been drying for a month and doesn't have much "juice" to surrender if you go to Medium and beyond and can easily become dry/tough...

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Wife&#39;s Filet with the mushroom side... So tender and juicy!!!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip steak cooked Pittsburg Style... just the way I like it.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip steak being dry aged in glass case in front of Gallagher&#39;s... YUMMY!

DcJKO80Z_UwanMW03L58fg.text: The only good thing was the excellent serving staff.  We went for a wedding reception. We aren't young pup's, have all been to 5 star restaurants before and the food here really ruined the wedding couples entire celebration. I ordered pork and returned it. It was tough and dry and totally inedible. My fiance and another woman at our table had the new york strip steak. They struggled so hard to cut the steak that their fingers were sore. It was 75% inedible, tons of fat and hardly any good meat.  When I asked to speak to the manager in private (didn't want to damper the reception), the young manager came to the table and proceeded to get into an argument with us. He said it was our fault and that most of the steak was eaten. He even went so far as to say we didn't know our steaks and should have ordered a filet instead. After 10 minutes of trying to discuss this away from the table, he said he would comp one of the steaks. But when the bill came, he didn't.  In the day when there are tons of restaurants to choose from, times are tough, he should have been more accommodating to his customers who were spending almost $2000 on a meal for a special occasion. He was abrasive, rude and demeaning to customers. will never go there again.

fZYMaeMjllc1BYjskhxnlg.text: We dine here every time we're in Vegas! We dined here for Valentine's Day dinner. We ordered the surf and turf to share. They cooked our filets to our different and individual liking, the lobsters weren't their usual huge lobsters, but good nonetheless. We had a couple of mojitos, which are always good here! Love this place!

_Z9WViiSoQ4-SJ1syMXDGg.text: The best service I've ever received! Our New York strip & lobster tail was exceptional!!!

H_g4ASym8tk1EaYWxbRHOg.text: Dry age New York strip is good, but not the best I have had.  On the veggie side, their fig and apple salad is a must try.   The kids loved their Mac and cheese.

sJ5a9jJ-xQc5aeQvp4db2Q.text: I was born and bred on red meat, 5 days a week, with my father being a butcher for 43 years. I rarely eat steak at restaurants, especially if A1 is on the table, because few can prepare a steak the way it should be. I've been here twice now and their aged New York (cooked rare) is something VERY special. My wife had the ribeye twice, and it was also good, but not as wonderful as mine. Service was very attentive and they certainly under charge for this piece of heaven!

cmb0DJObj3ruYtmxtozIoQ.text: Its making my mouth water right now. Seriously one of the best steak dinners I have had in a very long time. Everything was cooked perfectly and the sides were great compliments to the main dish.   The staff was very polite and there was no wait for a table (given we went to dinner on a Wednesday night, but still..).  The only down side may be the location of the bathroom facilities. You have to walk out a door on the side of the dining room to get to the restrooms and then walk back around to re-enter the restaurant. Needless to say, I got lost for a few minutes, but I eventually made my way back in.  Nevertheless, a great dining experience!

KfDnpa1FNFbh2LF5HjptiQ.text: "I must. I must. I must INCREASE MY BUST!" And I squeeezed. And I flexed. And I waited. And I waited... 18 I was (3 years ago...ok fine, 4...and then some), and the twin peaks were like small mounds. The other girls were wearing big bountiful lacy things and I still hadn't outgrown my sports bra. They had told me that I must do my exercises. So exercise I did...religiously. ( youtube.com/watch?v=T3TZ... ) The only thing the Bust Song and dance ever accomplished was a deflated ego and an increase in my pectoral muscles. When the realization came that I was gonna need a bro instead of a bra, ( youtube.com/watch?v=wfON... ) the insanity stopped. Naive much? Yes. ENTER: Gallagher's Steakhouse's beautifully dry aged, bright scarlet, marbled beef displayed in a sealed glass case for all passersby to admire. It's like that gorgeous girl you had your eyes on but just wanted to look at, not really converse with. Why? Because she just didn't taste as good as she looked. Wait. I'm still talking about the cow. Right. The Signature New York Steak is dry aged for 21 days in order to allow the flavors to seep in. Although somewhat flavorful, it's rather tough even when served medium rare. Try it with the accompanied sauces ($3 each). We liked the Brandied Peppercorn served in a gravy boat. The peppercorn provides that perfect kick along with the brandy reduction. Although the restaurant advertises the signature steaks displayed in their case, it's really nothing more than a good marketing ploy. The mystery of dry aged beef to be more wonderful in flavor is as appealing as ExtenZe for Men. In the end, it's nothing more than a stiff wind. The True star of the evening was the 18 oz Cowboy Ribeye. Sure, it was bigger than my face, but I rode that cowboy like any good cowgirl would...right into the sunset. Each bite exploded with flavor. It was tender, robust, and served with crispy string onions which was the perfect accompaniment. Service was very attentive and friendly, which earned them an extra star. Overall, a decent steakhouse though a bit gimmicky. When Suzanne Somers told me that I could have buns of steel, I took a beating with the Thigh Master. When the Shake Weight promised to revolutionize the way I tone my arms and shoulders, I ended up looking like I was JACKING. SOMEONE. OFF. Yes, I fall for gimmicks as much as the guy who bought that Snuggie to free his hands for the remote (as well as "other" activities - notably after popping his ExtenZe pill). Gallagher's may not have really lived up to the hype, but its marketing genius keeps people like me coming in, in hopes that the product really will deliver. Every now and then, it's good to keep the hope alive for us infomercial-suckers. Perhaps one day, I will learn that The Clapper cannot clap off an idiot. That my ChiaPet will not play fetch. That I may not "increase my bust" by squeezing my arms across my chest... But like my breastesses, these hopes and dreams, though late to bloom, would one day become reality...however small and humble. You just gotta believe...preferably with a Visa or MasterCard ready in hand.

mv70207a06nNwboZwu32cA.text: If i were to be reviewing this solely on my experience, I would probably give Gallagher's 5 stars. Alas, not everyone at my table enjoyed their food, so I shall proceed with the 4 star rating.  Steak was great and the restaurant was accommodating since we pushed back our reservation an hour. The rib eye was huge, (18 oz.) and I was glad with my decision to share it. I always order my steaks medium- rare and more often then not they come out on the medium side instead of the rare side. Gallagher's however, did a great job at nailing the perfect medium-rare. For sides we ordered creamed spinach, broccoli au gratin and mac n cheese. All were fantastic but if you have an aversion to bacon for whatever reason, they put it in their mac. I however, love bacon and thoroughly enjoyed it.  My friend ordered the sea bass, which was their special and it came out quite overdone. We informed the waiter and he took it back immediately, but then shortly after proceeded to tell us thats how ALL the sea bass were coming out. We found this a bit odd but she settled on some salmon and he brought her an extra side of mac to make up for it.  In conclusion, Gallagher's is a very good steakhouse. Is it the best? Likely not, but I'll have to investigate a bit further to find out...

77SCswrh5y5QZgOUYgR6Rg.text: The food was delicious!! We ordered Cesar salads nice presentation and perfect portion. Steaks we ordered were filet minion and ribeye. Both cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth. The sides we tried were 4 cheese macaroni and special of the day which was Yukon gold potatoes with caramelized onions and bacon both very delicious. Service was wonderful and prompt. We definitely will be dinning there again when we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet minion 8oz
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye 22oz
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 cheese macaroni and Yukon gold potatoes with caramelized onions  and bacon. Yummm

R2VcdleXGcXLgMD9ySzrVQ.text: My husband and I went to dinner while on a quick trip to Vegas last week.  We have vistited a few different steakhouse's and know what we like.  Where to start.....  We had a last minute reservation for 7:15, and were seated promptly in the very back room, tables packed in and noise level was like a bar.  We could barely have a conversation, which really detracts from any sort of dinner.  Our server was nice enough, but the guy filling the water and bringing out the bread had a really bad attitude.  He threw the bread on our table, knocking one of the knives off the bread plate.  Brought our water, when I said "thank you" he just walked away, he appeared to be like that with every table around us.  Then a lady taking pictures came over and asked if we wanted our photo taken for a fee.....um no.  I don't like being solicited while at a dinner that is going to cost upwards of $200, the first time she came around I was polite, but then she came around again, that time I was not so polite.  If I want a pic taken I can get out my phone or camera for free!  I ordered a couple of cocktails, they were fine, but could have had a little more alcohol in them.  I am paying $11 for a drink, I expect to taste the booze!  We had the king crab cocktail which was good.  My husband ordered the Cowboy steak medium rare, it came out almost raw in spots.  He likes them very pink and bloody, but this was just plain raw, he gave me a piece and I could not even eat it, he found a piece I could try and it wasn't even that good.  I ordered the fish they had that night, I think it was snapper and that was good.  After tasting his steak I was so glad I got the fish instead!  I have a general rule that if I am at a steakhouse I order steak, but in this case, I think I made the right choice.   For sides we got the broccoli with cheese sauce which was good, but for the amount of sauce that was on them I should have just ordered the plain broccoli as there was hardly any sauce on them.  We also got the mashed potatoes which were good.     I wish we would have just gone to Delmonico, which in my opinion cannot be beat and is our go to steakhouse while in Vegas, or even The Palm which you can count on for good service and food.  Needless to say, we won't be going back the Gallagher's, which we only went to because he happened to be staying at NY NY.

mCVUaruLPFb7PMyUfUYDTw.text: My boyfriend introduced me to this place last year and I've been comparing all other steakhouses to it. Love the Cowboy steak! Took my mom here this past Monday night when I was in Vegas for a conference, she tagged along. She got the  Queen Prime Rib and she thought it was amazing too! And for dessert, creme brulee! Price is what's expected. Only comes second to Maestros in my opinion.

WatamZlCH46sV76lHRA8aw.text: Wow.. everything I had here was delicious!! My friends and I started w/ the calamari (the best calamari I've ever had - the marinara sauce was equally delish!) then split the rib eye and new york, which actually ended up being more than enough food for the three of us. The two sides we went w/ were the yukon potato puree and the wild mushrooms. I was really amazed by the service and taste of everything. The only thing I wasn't too impressed w/ was the appetizer bread selection. The olive bread was just a bit too much, but aside from that everything was great!  I'm definitely going there again!!

gJN29Gi53F2-TWeheOwkgw.text: Some of the best food I've eaten. The wife and I can't say enough about the amazing food and service. To begin, Chef Franco was splendid. A lively and personable man who proved his worth around the kitchen. He displayed a full and delicate understanding of the foods he could prepare for us. We were enamored by his genuine care for his work and his results showed no less. Seafood for the spouse and steak for myself. Separate yet Chef Franco made them equally grand. He is a man of True talent.  Next, the waiter. A cordial and wonderful man who demonstrated rare and marvelous traits. A mind for the menu, he knew it without flaw. He easily articulated the intricacies of the food and made the best of choices for each of our pallets. One step better, he perfectly suited the best of wines to our meal. Overall, a marvelous production from the floor to the kitchen. This restaurant holds an unassuming appearance with mesmerizing appeal. I've eaten great food from  Napa Valley to Boston and from Seoul, Korea, to Dubai, UAE, and I would place this establishment among the best. We can't wait to return!

4yX_jIgH6I-3yP7s5D_Bkw.text: I don't want to say our server wasn't excellent, but he was more involved with a party he knew and kind of left us to fend for ourselves.  My wine wasn't served until I was half done with my entre, but he was very apologetic and did not charge for the sauce for the steak.  Our meals were all delicious and the recommendations for sides by our server were more than enough and all very good.  Our steaks were cooked slightly more done than requested, but still delicious.  With a bit more effort, the ratings could have been excellent.  Restaurants in this category and price range should be nothing less than excellent!

4wMxnuxOFHgMJBE0YaCBWw.text: Great atmosphere, great service, great food. Overall, a good value compared to Jean George which was ridiculously expensive and barely average in every other regard.

Q747UU2PKhPxZ109GqdnDA.text: Came again to enjoy a excellent steak. I had the cowboy ribeye, which was just fabulous, tender and so flavorful. My sister had the dry aged sirloin, which she liked, but was comparable to the other steaks, we didn't see any major difference flavor or tenderness wise, except that it was more lean. For sides we had mashed potato's, asparagus and creamed spinach. Everything was great except the creamed spinach which had way too much nutmeg. Probably the best steak I've had since the last time I was here, which was over two years ago!

IUmqEi38iZXhzuHah4MpqA.text: We showed up 15 mins early for our reservation but they happily sat us down. I ordered the clam chowder and husband ordered a caesar salad. Clam chowder was good but salad was salad. I ordered the filet and husband ordered new york steak. He said my filet was better tasting than his. Steaks were seasoned well. Service was good. Glad didn't have to dress up to go here.

2H7Nx9mp1eSECzRhqMKRUA.text: I've had many steaks in my time. Two places in Chicago come to mind that had the best in the world steaks. But after my first visit to Vegas, specifically New York New York's Gallagher's Steakhouse, totally blew previous steaks out the water. I had the Aged Steak that was on display on front, and it was the juiciest best steak I've had. The waiter was quick to greet and take our order, as well as giving us a quick review of the meals and answering any questions we had. Refills were quickly refilled, waiter made sure to swing by to make sure we are satisfied. Dishes looked amazing, the setting of the restaurant is great, and you can see the chefs making your food. Overall a very awesome experience. Can't wait to go back to try the other dishes.

qnJ1pl8dqXalMfBwpcQX4A.text: I have visited Gallagher's a number of times over the years.  One of the great steakhouses in Las Vegas.  Service is great, drinks are strong and the steaks done to perfection.

A0faoUL_DOW33lUS5MwnLg.text: There are more than enough steakhouses to chose from when visiting Las Vegas strip, but I have never had the need to try the others since Gallagher delivers every time we visit this restaurant. The service is impeccable, and the meat choices never fail.

e_dq0d3mT2Z4B8U3a-g73g.text: I had the best Cowboy Ribeye I have ever had in my life here, about $38, but I ate everything except the bone.  Great service and cozy atmosphere, worth saving your dinner money for this place!  Kind of a bummer you have to pay for sides, like aspargus.  But man I loved this place.

-FKPfroWyqwT3b-LHodG_A.text: I had the spinach salad and filet. My husband had the tomato mozzarella salad, aged sirloin, and we shared the Mac and cheese. Everything was delicious. For dessert we shared the ice wine and toffee pudding. Both were amazing!! Our server Linda was one of the best I've ever had. My only complaint is that we were in and out in an hour. I would have liked some time in between each course.

4E0j20__IzT6Z_iW4dC6zw.text: Giving this place 5 stars.  The food was awesome, the price was not even that bad considering the food and the fact that it's Vegas.  I was totally amazed actually, how isolated they managed to make the place feel.  Even though there was a crazy Saturday night dance party pumping loud beats on the main floor of the casino, I could barely hear it at all in there, which allowed us to enjoy a classy steak dinner in a nice, calm atmosphere before heading out into the jungle.  Plus it's open way later than a lot of nice restaurants on the strip.  I recommend this 100%

v5Tfg80NP4nXXMJ7z4X20Q.text: Awesome food. Prime rib was one of the best I've ever eaten. And it was huge and cooked perfect. Tight place so no room to move around.

e2YEmdx0Lvxv4gUEPgPnkw.text: Being a statehouse specialist, not worth it. My ribeye was so chewy and I could not taste anything but black peppers. There are better and cheap steaks available around strip.

WKMKTnBAHUtthWfYXTMujA.text: LOL!! i would give this 7 stars but i cant!..forget the food!...what about the hottie of a waiter! ;) hahaha..his back was turned against our table taking the other tables order..i kept looking at his ass! ahhaha..ok ok enough of that..! but to be honest with u..the FOOD WAS MOREE THAN AMAAZZZINGGG!!!...i ordered the cowboy ribeye w/ a side of bleu cheese sauce..super big..could not finish it. the asparagus with holladaise was cooked to perfection. although we didnt get the booth we requested, they gave us free drinks and our anniversary dessert. =] would definitely go back here!

rfZDsyoXAuiVvPx_-vMy_A.text: We wanted to try a new steak house this time in Vegas, without just paying for a view. Read great reviews, so we stopped in last night. We didnt have reservations, was about 8 pm, it looked busy, but we got a seat asap! The server was with us right away. The entire visit was very quick, but we never felt rushed, everything was right on time!  The waiter recommended a wonderful cabernet for me, which was in my budget, and was very courteous about it.  I was felt like I was staring at everyone's meat on their tables! All looked perfect! Started off with a wedge salad. Very classic, best blue cheese, and great fresh tomatoes.  My husband ordered the filet, and I ordered the lamb chops (both medium rare). I've never had lamb, so was nervous ordering away form the norm. But both were cooked perfect and seasoned perfect! Nice char on the outside, pink and warm in the middle! Would recommend if looking for a perfect steak of any kind! For sides, we shared some mushrooms, very fresh and seasoned well. The brocolli au gratin was delicious as well. Sauce was fulll of flavor, but not too heavy! I have to try to make this one at home! Dessert..... no room left, I didn't even look at the menu unfortunatly.  The prices were fair as well. I mean, you'll pay for a good steak, but  nothing outrageous. Total bill with tip was still under $200, 2 people and drinks.

n37jmGU4CgKhUJtjpz8e7w.text: Stopped in to Gallaghers before our Cirque du Soliel show at the N.Y N.Y. We started the meal with a shrimp scampi app.  My husband had the Cesar and I had the gazpacho, which was amazing.  We also had the shrimp scampi for an app. It had a delicious warm spicy sauce..not your usual butter scampi sauce...  I ordered the queen cut prime rib, and Ben had the surf and turf with the hugest lobster I've ever seen.  I hardly put a dent in my prime rib..It was huge. I wish I could have taken it with me.  We also had the lobster mashed potatoes and creamed spinach, both were awesome but we could not finish.  The servings here are HUGE. The food was excellent for the money (I think this meal would have cost me more at home in S.F.)  I think our total was around $200 before tip..not bad.. The highlight of our meal was our server Norman.  Norman's service was phenomenal. I hope he is working  next time we are visiting.

lX6PFjXJ-Tl3dMnPowfG0w.text: I have enjoyed many a steak in this great town known as Las Vegas, and each and every one was delicious beyond belief.
