It really (for me) boils down to the consumer experience. You're paying a premium price you should expect premium service. And the team behind the bar at Gallaghers did not disappoint. More specifically Shaun. The man, a tall drink of water and was without a shadow of a doubt sculpted in the likeness of Michaelangelo's David. The Adonis of a man stands about 6'6 with a personality that was larger than life. His initial greeting was warmer than Phoenix in July, and I felt as if I just stepped into the house of an old friend. He oozed personality and always had a poignant point about anything that was topical. Weather it be the latest sports scores, current events, or 9/11 conspiracies, Shaun was always on point and informative. Some might call him a "jack of all trades" or a "renaissance man" if you will, me (after the one visit), I call him a friend.  Let's not forget the other two fine gentlemen behind the bar. Diminutive in stature but not "short" on personality either. I think the shortest of the twos name was Gary. Standing (what seemed to be) a mere 4'11 was surely channeling his personal idol with his Gomer Pyle hair cut. And the man only known by a letter G stood a towering 5'2. He seemed to be the strong silent type.  This was by far the best experience I've ever had at a bar, steak house, or Vegas all together. This is by far the best experience I've ever had and I will definitely be back.

Clef1inq9gN5iuNKngidFw.text: Such tasty food here! And the ambiance is very casual and comfortable. Nothing fancy nothing new. The filet mignon that we had was absolutely juicy and had a zesty kick at the end of each bite. Outstanding taste for me yet! Everything about this place is well worth the price as it would be for a moderate priced steak house. Every dish has a particular signature touch like the Parmesan steak fries that were delicious and hefty. The dessert was so scrumptious. I had the key lime pie, which was a little too tangy, but great to refresh the palate.   Service however was nothing outstanding. The server could use some oomph but he did his job, so no complaints.

3sKxXaJ8Pjy7NSXp8hWpMQ.text: Very friendly and knowledgeable wait staff. Made us very comfortable even though the service kind of slow. Will be back again. HQ food as several friends recommended.

Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RKFucg7WjyPWC14U2nJmwg.text: First off, I am rarely a window-licker. When we arrived and the New York New York hotel, I saw the aging NY Strips in the window cooler, I was one at that time. That sells the steak (for most). I thought it looked awesome but it turned my wife's stomach. We had to find out that only the NY Strip was aged like that. The filet, etc, are not. That made it acceptable to Miss Picky.  So, I did get the NY Strip, it was tops in my quest for steak. Thick cut, bone in = pure magic.  Whenever I go back to Vegas, This place is a must.

ZFrvIu1Ss56Gc8bxMl13vw.text: I had the tradition of going here every time I go to Vegas so several times per year. Sadly this was the last time.... I ordered the porterhouse medium well it was not even medium rare I had part of the steak straight up raw. When I spend $60 for a steak that's no sides I expect the restaurant to have someone capable of cooking it correctly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HT4S2WApHegPXdm65_RX6w.text: First time I have been to this restaurant! The service was friendly ! We had some sides and  had the cowboy ripeye! what a great steak! it was cooked just as i ordered! it was on of best i havd had. i will be back!

RWV7G5KVNKj2_zvYQG3-Ww.text: My husband, his coworker and I ventured in on the Monday before Valentine's Day fully expecting to wait due to our lack of a reservation. To our surprise we were immediately seated. While I did not love sitting near the kitchen there was a table that was in close proximity so I sucked it up.   Everything was perfect! Our server was phenomenal. He answered any questions we had and made great suggestions. Our food was ah-mazing. My husband and his coworker requested the NY strip. While prepared differently they both were tender and flavorful. I ordered the salmon. It was cooked to perfection. Ironically, I came to appreciate the view of the kitchen while my husband and his coworker discussed work matters.   It was the perfect meal and setting. We all left satisfied. I only wish I had gotten dessert!

TeQ35biVNgkXsiv_lumzVA.text: Lots of steak houses in Vegas and I like to try a new one everytime I come. The menu is good and prices are very fair for a steak house.  Wine menu is average and typically priced.  I had the ribeye with some asparagus and side Caesar salad.  Salad was good, steak was cooked right, medium rare, but the asparagus was a little bland.  Desert was good but I was disappointed with the 30yr old old port, tasted more like 5yr old.  All in all a good experience, wait staff was very good and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes its half eaten...oooops

TXefRoKLcEKCF0Bi-mClZA.text: Dry-aged NY Strip was the selection. Waiter explained that it was the only dry aged cut on the menu and is what Gallagher's is famous for. Steak wasn't evenly cooked and a little tougher than I expected but it was very tasty nonetheless.  Considering the increasingly excessive Vegas strip mark-up, the quality and price were likely appropriately matched.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GSA9bLJVpmdgDPuNsevqJg.text: CLOSES AT 11:00pm !!! Wanted my order in at 10:45 no later according to management.. arrived with full party slightly after 10:40 and was willing to pay an efficient tip for trouble. (Said out loud "will tip for late services")  Management came out saying " we are not sizzler, we're not in and out: we're fine dining " implying we were not capable of their services. We ended up at toms urban great service great ppl .. unless you have time to waste want to try an aged steak that I've heard got some people sick before I guess come here an 1hr early so you get good service!! If they too busy toms will take care of you..

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_9vJZBBk-N3mQyTWwSGJxg.text: Every time I come to Vegas and crave steak this is the first place that comes to mind. If you are looking for a more casual atmosphere without have to put on a suit and tie and get charge an arm and a leg for some well season steak then this the place for you.  Now it is Vegas so paying around $50 for the piece of meat should be expected.  I recommend the bond in rib eye or always perfectly cooks prime rib.  Both come generous portions.  The warm chef choice appetizers consisting of a jumbo shrimp scampi, fried calamari and crab cake is not to be miss.  I have been to the restaurant for about 7 times now and that is always something I order for myself and the party I'm with.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vO9jzCehLALOcaIqoOxjYQ.text: Filet mignon was great! Garlic mash was awesome. The service was great! Loved everything about this place. We had the lollipop lamb chops for an appetizer, only complaint is, you only get 3.

CcoViVqONpIaCqdbhvMW_A.text: Some pretty good steaks! On the pricey side but worth it. I had the New Zealand lamb lollipops, spectacular, tuna tartar, pretty great, cowboy ribeye, holy cow.  Definitely will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboys ribeye.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Zealand lamb lollipops.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tartar

VXjftZeRbZ2GKesHapE6eg.text: Just dining here was itself an experience. Service was attentive from the beginning to the end, and the I didn't have to wait too long for my NY strip. It is definitely not cheap, but the steak you get is huge, probably even enough to share between two people. The taste and texture were on point, and although I realize that having the bone in is what makes this a classic, the tendons in mine were quite stringy and made the meat harder to separate in some parts. So I'd probably say the price is more for the amount of steak that you get rather than the quality of the cut (maybe this isn't as True for other items). Assuming you don't mind using your hands a bit, you can probably get more of the meat than with just using your knife and fork. I'd probably prefer to pay a bit less for a smaller and easier to eat cut of steak though.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry-aged NY strip steak

vlmK4-uPozHFiDfmoWQlnw.text: This place did a great job. The serves was great food was excellent the best dish of our whole trip was the bone in filet mignon unbelievable if you are a steak eater you have to try this everything was great

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and aged New York so good
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was so good lobster, bone in filet mignon which we have never heard of and so the best dish of our trip, mac and chesse

Xei9lPlBdUxuvo340Uu8jg.text: Always a must when we are in Vegas! We have had intimate dinners just my hubby and I, and we have brought several family members here to dine.   Food is incredible, and the staff is great!   We are never disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family dining at Gallagher&#39;s!

dQmVCd8szfOu0L0fzxLwqA.text: By far one of the best steaks I've had in las Vegas the jumbo king crab legs are a must but the only thing its kinda pricey but well  worth it i highly recommend this place to anyone if your staying at NYNY hotel and casino I recommend reservations for parties more than 4

QKTfSJY-rWncQOXt9LtpCQ.text: Nice steak in dry-age flavor! We missed on NYE but get it today with 5 stars experience

kJP_6mZrpwBN7MWth6vtXg.text: We went to this restaurant because it got decent ratings and we wanted to try something new. I found this restaurant just average and for the price, I could have had excellent.  The service was really good. We ordered lamb and steak. The portions were massive! I found the steak way too tough and the lamb rack 1 out of 3 pieces was excellent and the other 2 very tough and impossible to eat. This restaurant has great potential but I am not drawn back

3n5v4h34anpbO6oj1NKiig.text: Location: Inside the New York, New York Casino.   Service: Very attentive, top notch service.   Food: I had the prime rib with bearnaise sauce and lobster tail, some asparagus spears and let me say it was all heaven. I am making it a mandatory stop during all Vegas trips. The lobster tail was alright, but the real game winner was the prime rib, it was on par with Lawry's in Beverly hills. Their bearnaise sauce I was dipping fingers in it because it was so on point.   Wait: We had reservation, so none.   Atmosphere: Your run of the mill New York Steakhouse.  Overall: If you want a good steak, I recommend it highly, if you feel like spoiling yourself a bit, come on down...don't worry about the money, you will gorge yourself so bad you'll just go back to your suite and say fuck the tables. I need a nap. That's what I did. The best time to play the tables is at 3am anyways when every dumb fuck is gone to the club or passed out in their room in their own vomit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U3vS4WukNtizUlNwhVaoGQ.text: great steaks, but a service was a little lacking. but we did get there right after a big table (over 15 people) so they were busy getting their orders, etc. but 2.5 hour dinner is a bit much for me. but the steak was awesome.,. kind of pricey though.

IBVlwGYzTbP_bx2xnV9vng.text: Before we saw Zumanity my date suggested we dine at Gallagher's and she made a great call. The seating is a bit tight, but the atmosphere is fun and bustling. Our calamari appetizer was prepared well (not rubbery) and the dipping sauce was zesty, but not overpowering. I had the tuna medium rare and my date had her steak prepared medium. Her steak was very tender and flavorful. My tuna was quite good and the plating was excellent (even those dining nearby commented at the excellent presentation). I wish I had taken the suggestion of the server and had the tuna rare, but you live and learn. The highlight of our meal was the sticky toffee pudding, which was the perfect end to a superb meal. The staff was very attentive and fun, as our waiter predicted my date's dessert selection. The excellent food and staff is reflected in the bill, but worth every penny if you're looking for a pleasurable dining experience in New York New York

9FiUVAn1LR2WKGKQjCOwKA.text: This place is awesome!  We had a reservation but arrived early and they sat us right away.  The whole experience was great and the food was amazing.  I had the prime rib and my husband had the aged steak they are famous for, both were delicious.  The salad was a wedge salad and was super cold, two thumbs up there!!  Service was great, overall it was a little pricey but for a special occasion or special night out it is definitely worth it!!  Will be back next year!

NSiDvhaDfa9t_F39qOPLGg.text: Our night started off great considering it was my good buds birthday. We were greeted  by two sensational hostesses who were phenomenal at making small talk. One was gabby and the other I cannot remember, but we laughed about the french origin.  Once we were sat our waiter was very accommodating to our every need.  The waiter and surprisingly our busser were also very knowledgeable about every aspect of the menu and could  converse intellectually with the entire party.  The steaks were phenomenal; although I can say the mac-n-cheese was a bit 'chalky' for my taste.  Dessert could not have come at a better time and rounded off the birthday evening perfectly.  On our way out we did stop and chat up the hostesses again, because of their fun-loving attitudes about life.  I thank the managers for the amazing and classy evening we were refreshed with in city full of... well the opposite.

G9PyV_pqYVZZPj95CUti7g.text: came here for a birthday dinner. loved every single bite, from my aged steak to the creamed spinach and mashed potatoes. definitely up there on my list of most delicious steakhouses.

O-1D4dUv_J4zb5TGExuq6w.text: Contrary to some of the other reveiws written, the service we received was stellar.  Specifically, Roberto our server was fantastic...very knowledgeable about the food (how it is prepared, ingredients, etc.) and the wine.  That said, the food was slightly above average at best.  I ordered the signature steak and, while it was good, it could have come off of any backyard BBQ.  The shallot bordeau sauce that came with it tasted like and had the consistency of canned beef gravy with a hint of red wine.  The side dishes were mediocre and even the bread seemed of store-bought quality.  What saved this from being a 2-star experience was my wife's prime rib.  It was very good and was complimented perfectly by two different styles of horseradish.  In short, I would not go back any time soon.  There are far too many other steakhouses in Vegas to try.

NLFU4AiH5I_AhDHUxz3neg.text: i thought the food was great but the service was horrible starting with the hostess. she was talking to the bar staff about personal matters. i went here on a date and i regret it so bad. its waaaay too casual for the prices they demand. the decor is outdated and so is nyny. not the best steak ive ever had and definatly would not return at those prices. go anywhere else. oh and our waiter had too many tables poor guy only stopped by like twice. i know its a bad economy but gees. and our busser was too young and unproffesional seemed like he was drunk or high.

RWbaYCYW91JHVXF79k-TkQ.text: great steak! had the DRY-aged sirloin and wet aged filet. both great but the sirloin was phenomenal.  you cant beat dry aging. steakhouse prices are the same here but clean and very attentive staff. knowledgable about the menu and an overall good time. i make a point to say you can have a steak anywhere and can only find a few places that dry age their steaks. the sirloin was the only dry aged steak out of the selections when we went, so dont be misled that ALL their steaks are dry aged. as with any restaurant, ask which steaks are dry aged. many do not have an area large enough to dry age all their steak menu items. Go have a good time and have a great meal!

XixjdjeDunUR48xf6hiZ_A.text: dissatisfied !! What a crock... not even in the league of fine steak houses.. the signature ny blows.. and I've had a better cowboy ribeye @ sizzler.. mac and cheese with Bacon was good though

egRc16cDa1SjmqUOF5LDrg.text: I do not often give 1-star reviews, but this was one of the worst restaurant experiences I've had in my life.  We had a party of 6, of which, 4 ordered the fillet mignon.  All 4 steaks came out not even close to as ordered had to be sent back.  I've never seen anything like that happen.  They were all ordered medium rare, and came back medium well.  To their credit, they comped us on one of the steaks, but that was because the 2nd time it came out it was also medium well.  The waiter was really embarrassed by all this.  We also ordered 2 bottles of wine, and one of them was spoiled.  I know that might not have been Gallagher's fault, as sometimes you simply get a badly corked bottle, but given all that had happened it certainly didnt help.  On the plus side,  I had the prime rib and it was quite good, although certainly not worth $32.   The mushrooms I ordered were also good and the calamari was absolutely delicious.  However, given all that went wrong I would certainly never go back again.  It really was the type thing you'd perhaps expect at a restaurant where the prices are $16 per entree, not $36 per entree.

8oaTWou3kuGYN4Mc-Vki_Q.text: My decision to dine at Gallagher's was based on Yelp reviews, and either the system failed me or Gallagher's was majorly off on a major night. I dined there this past NYE and expected my party and I to have melt-in-your-mouth steaks and a dining experience to be boasted to friends. Um...not so much.  The much reviewed rib-eye was not on the night's menu--there really wasn't much to choose from at all. My halibut order detailed an accompanying sauce and vegetable that did not materialize--or have much taste. Each person in my party ordered the lobster bisque--also sub-par and two ordered steaks that were mediocre.  My review of a restaurant is mainly based on customer service and quality of food. Gallagher's failed me on both accounts, though less on the former. I have no problem with "Go big or go home", especially in Vegas. But I also expect service and quality of food to be commensurate with the money I put down. I could have gone to Denny's that night for the same quality of food...you get the idea.

m7G3APdpXr9c1aFYJoV1GA.text: We went to the Zumanity show one year and saw this steakhouse in the New York New York.  The steaks displayed were quite impressive which is what drew me to make a reservation the next year we visited Vegas.  I was dissapointed and will not go back.  The steaks seemed to be good quality and were cooked perfectly.  However, they had no flavor.  They tasted like they werent even salted.  I would say maybe that they just forgot to season, but my wife ordered the exact same steak (New York dry-aged), and it was the same as mine.  It was very, very, expensive.  The side dishes weren't good either.  The service didn't impress me.  The waiter seemed to care less whether you enjoyed dinner or not.  Our plates and silverware had black char marks and fingerprints (very easy to see) on them.  The girls working the front and phones were quite rude.  Take my advice!  Don't let the flashly display steaks make you think this place is good.

bPpB6pHUew7WQkv3wYH9HQ.text: The 3 stars above is really for the service; I would give the overall food a 4, although skip the bruchetta.  We unfortunately were seated in Jessica's section, HORRIBLE.  We very much enjoy wine and I wanted an opportunity to view the wine list and decide what might go best with our meal.  Well, Jessica didn't seem to like how long this was taking me, she actually flipped the pages for me to recommend a "blend" as I couldn't decide what type we wanted, ARE YOU kidding me, so rude.  She didn't offer any sauces, explain the specials and was just rushed and rude.  She clearly wanted to turn the table and had no care factor.  We would have had dessert and after dinner drinks but we wanted to get away from her, seriously it was horrible.  She was the same to all the tables around us, I heard many a negative comment.  The salads and steaks were delicious, we enjoyed the flavors.  However, for us, service makes a restaurant and we most likely will not be back unless we specifically ask for a different server.

A0gX7RDC6tWR423dS1ZJ4Q.text: Everything about our dinner here was perfect - the Prime rib and their signature dry aged New York Sirloin cooked to perfection.  We also had sides whiched included, sauteed mushrooms  and asparagus that complimented the meal perfectly.  My wine selection consisted of a Chalone pinot noir which went very well with dinner. For desert, the creme brulee was sugar heaven. Our waiter was very attentive to our needs throughout the meal but did not rush us.  I would definitely eat here again.

tPXLZ8d1s2DH5VZWTQtJQQ.text: I was here in Vegas with a large party and we decided to come to this steak house since it was at the New York New York hotel where we were seeing the Zumanity cirque Du Soleil (review is next)....convenience basically is how I ended  up here. I gave it 3 stars for service but I took off a star for the seat I had right next to the kitchen door. I have never seen so much meat pass my way in 1 hour as I did this night..and I am not talking small portions here either. Anyway I had the ahi tuna which I thought was pretty good...though it did need some soy sauce to spice it up a bit....in fact I asked the waiter and he said quote "hmm we don't usually have soy....I can see if i can find some...I will get it" Very impressive service I tell ya.  Atmosphere was so so for Vegas...as we were in a large party pushed to the back of the restaurant. Overall I would say good food,good service.... just don't need to see a meat locker display in the front of the store...

efv8-_BXZfwet0vwfthoWw.text: This place is over rated. The lamb was overcooked, essentially like cardboard. I'm a huge fan of lamb, but this experience will make me second guess ordering lamb everywhere I go. We were having a decent time until the waiter came over to our table and told me to be quiet for the other guests, but there were no other guests... It made no sense so I complained to the manager and the manager said he didn't care... Thanks, I just spent ~$300 for 1 star service.

pH4Qr_bjZSz2jz_FfCXvjQ.text: I've been here twice because for some reason, my friend thinks this is a nice restaurant and insists we come here.  It's just OK.  Got the prime rib.  Wasn't that tasty, juicy, or tender.  Just overpriced.  There's gotta be somewhere else you can go for the $.  A $25 prime rib at Cattlemen's is better than this place.

AYc0M9Qh6M3WKzy_tn4XdA.text: My group stumbled upon this place in New York New York.  If I were soley grading the food I would have given it a 5. Our steaks were cooked to perfection and we had a very nice dessert. Everyone raved about the mashed potatoes and yes they were good, but nothing special. The prices at this place are outrageous. We thought it was just because we were in vegas so we were okay with paying however, after we looked at Olives in the Belligo hotel and they had a better atmosphere, cool view and their prices were a little more reasonable, we realized it was way overpriced. The atmosphere is very busy in Gallaghers and loud because they sat us right next to the kitchen. So all in all the food was good but you can get the same quality of food with better atmosphere at another 5 star place.

dTqJxUo-uKQU-04gmXLa0A.text: dry aged new york sirloin w/ shallot & beaujolais sauce + cowboy rib-eye steak w/ bearnaise sauce + sauteed spinach + four cheese macaroni + a bottle of syrah by andrew murray = 12 hrs of unconsciousness   $144 plus tip for a meat overdosing epic dinner that you can't do anything else afterward for two

t61xhIbKL0z8ZwTIYTtSTA.text: Got stuck in the back room here this time.  I can only assume its because we had a party of 8.  The waitress was way over-worked back here so the service suffered (even though we had reservations.)  Other than her, the water guys and assistant servers were on point.  The steak was okay.  This seems to be the only place in Vegas that gets away with selling an 8 ounce filet for the same price most places get for much larger...so I went for a different steak that kinda disappointed.  The sides were good, and so were the drinks when they actually got there (sssssssslllllloooooooooowwwwwwwww waitress.)  I still had a blast because of the company I was with and the jack daniels buzz, but I would really recommend you sit in the main dining room of this place if you go.  Its one of the few high-end restaurants in Vegas where you don't feel like an asshole if you are a regular person not wearing $3000 worth of clothes.  Atmosphere in the main room and food is great.  Back room where they stuck us;  not so much

LJGy7ZajFJVOINi5yUpW8g.text: Unarguably a very good steakhouse. My husband and I ate at the bar since there was a 2 hours wait for a table, but the service was very attentive, the food was good. The steak is definitely the highlight, I don't think that appetizers nor side orders are spectacular.

D71vx70faCWIQSwW5FZloQ.text: We came to dinner with a few friends on a Sunday night and everyone loved their meal. The food was pretty good, but not the best I've ever had, and it was pretty pricey. It's located inside New York New York which is a fun casino hotel to visit.  I had the filet mignon and my boyfriend had the NY steak. We shared some loaded smashed potatoes, sauteed spinach, sauteed mushrooms, and Mac n cheese. That sounds like a lot, but we also shared the sides with a few other people.  Our steaks were cooked perfectly and the sauteed mushrooms were delicious with them. All the sides were good, except for the Mac n cheese. It was pretty dry and lacked flavor. Even adding salt didn't help.  Wine list was pretty mediocre. I was surprised since it's a steak house and Vegas. I ended up with a glass of the Rioja, which went well with the steak.  Service was great and they were really on top of everything. Our server was very friendly, attentive, and was able to answer all our questions about the menu.   Food was good, but again not amazing. Very expensive. If you don't care about price and want a good steak, this is a good option.

GDqCbCKYivyZ5Io-3kaCRw.text: Amazing food and service!  My husband and I enjoyed an amazing dinner at Gallagher's in NYNY this past week.  I was nervous to try an aged steak, but the server (Kris with a K!) was patient and informative regarding the process of aging steaks.  He was spot on with regards to his explanation.    The bread was airy but crusty (they even obliged me with a little dish of blue cheese dressing to try it out since we had chosen a salad with a different dressing).  The New York steak was perfect as were the potatoes and creamed spinach!  The food, the server Kris, the amazing Chef and the entire support staff were second to none.  This is not just another hotel steakhouse.  Gallagher's has ambiance, fantastic steaks and an amazing staff!  We can't wait to go back!

VH7YqVVTWYCdVY-t2ngZXg.text: Do not waste your time. I researched several steak houses and really liked Triple George's but Gallagher's was closer to our concert location. I had a party of eight people with reservations well in advance. We were seated in a back room (not even attached to the restaurant) and stuck in a corner with a party of 25 very loud and obnoxious people. It was worse than sitting at a kids table at a bad wedding. Asked to change tables or at least sit in the actual restaurant. No availability, no apology from management...we ate as fast as we could and got out.

mf_9EhLW7uR-F_0iDqch1g.text: Gallagher's is one of my all-time fave steak houses in this beautiful U.S. of A. that we live in. My last experience was less then subpar but Brisa and Shepard from Gallagher's wanted to make it right and invited us back as their special guests to ensure everything was to our liking. We were first greeted by Jocelyn at the front desk and she walked us over to our table. She was very kind. John our server came by to greet us and filled us in on the daily special and took our drink order. Rafael was on it as well, he came by to make sure our waters were filled and cleaned up any remnants that we left on the table from the bread crumbs. The bread there is phenomenal. I try not to eat bread but when I do I will eat it at Gallagher's.   We started with the Shrimp and Grits appetizer. If there is one appetizer you order and you like shrimp, then this is the appetizer for you. The shrimp is succulent and cooked perfectly. We then moved on to salads. I had to go with the beet salad. Beets are great for the liver and the beets are roasted to perfection and they do not skimp on the beets. Wife loves the hearts of palm salad there. Then on to the steaks. The NY aged steaks are the way to go. I ordered mine medium-rare and it was cooked just the way I like it. The prices of the steaks are not that expensive when compared to the plethora of steak houses around Vegas. It seems like every hotel has their own signature steak house and they offer pretty much the same thing but the thing that sets Gallagher's apart is the nostalgia and that piece of NYC you would only find there.   The sides were amazing! The asparagus were about the size of bananas. Talk about asparagus on steroids. They were pumped up. I also ordered the chipotle cheesy Yukon gold mashed potatoes. I didn't want to share them with my wife. At first I told her they were the worst thing I ever tasted but she knew I was lying because my nose grew and I had a huge smile on my face after trying them. Do yourself a favor and order a side of mushrooms as well.   Through the years Gallagher's has been a regular in our rotation when visiting Vegas. We always receive top notch service and the food never leaves us in doubt. All of the employees are wonderful. I wish we could eat there more often but it's great to have it as a special place for us to visit. If you are in the area just stop by and try something. You will not be disappointed and if you are I am sure they will make it right. Thanks again to the staff at Gallagher's and to Brisa and Shepard for making sure the meal was to our liking. It was nice to also see Roxanna who goes around to take photos. She took our photo 10 years ago after we had a post wedding dinner party there. We decided to go with another round of photos and told her we would see her in another 10 years. And thanks again to John for wonderful service. Happy eating!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare, cooked to perfection.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aged steak, best in the west. IMO
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipotle bacon mashed potatoes are to die for

gHaRW4zMcBjxmrYjvoGKRA.text: We had a problem tonight at Gallaghers that was fixed through a team approach by an incredible waiter and an intrepid manager.  I also had my crab fingered...but I digress.  Gallagher's is a familiar and frequent stop when we are in Vegas.  We've hosted friends and family there, because of the excellent food, ambience and let's face it, it's damned impressive.  Tonight, there was a bit of a problem.  The surf and turf dish that I ordered included a pound of King Crab Legs that I attacked as if it owed me money.  That is..until I found several cold spots in what should have been a steaming pile of decapod crustacean destined for drawn butter.  "Touch it", I implored my wife.  "What??" she asked incredulously, thinking my sudden ardor totally inappropriate.  "The crab.  Touch it, it's cold."  She reached out, and with a hesitant digit felt along the creamy meat.  Ohh...if it were only hot.    "Oh Jesus", she implored, "send it back."  I shrugged and said "no, it's okay".  Then, I found the same in what remained of the crab legs.  It was now my turn to be steamed.  Our waitress, Catherine I believe her name was, came over all giggly and gracious (here was a real pro who can serve me anytime).  "Is everything okay?" she asked.  I turned to her and asked her to touch it, holding out the crab leg.  "It's cold."  Well, this service pro went into action and summoned the manager.  His apologies were sincere, and get this...HE DID SOMETHING ABOUT IT.  I can't fault an impeccable restaurant like Gallagher's for human error.  Shit happens.  Let's just say we were made happy, and I got my crab fingered by the manager.   A happy ending indeed.  We look forward to coming back to this incredible restaurant that understands that customer service is a crucial element of a successful dining experience.  Five stars and a return visit next time we blow into town.

5tLCMQAU8wjl94Biby75Gw.text: Does the steak need sauce? No. When you cut into it, is it smooth like butter? Yes. Then youve got a great steak joint. I love this steak joint. Yes, i used the words love. I eat way to much meat. So this is one my spots i keep coming back to. Theres just something about the way the meat tastes that makes me keep coming back. I mean i do the mortons, the flemmings, and the cut spots but...still this is one of my top spots. Its just simple. Great steak, great quality and given the price...honestly ive gone to wayy more expensive steak places and they dont touch this. If you are ever just looking for a good steak. Def check this out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look how beautiful and clean this steak is. Cut through like butter.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. East coast virginia oysters

R8psY7F6mNamCFWf3HgRvw.text: Best filet mignon I have ever had! I have been to cheaper places and more expensive but my husband and I always make sure to have dinner here when we are in town! All the sides are a la carte but for the food your getting it's worth it. Also some of that aged beef the have displayed in front omg AMAZING!!!

IPwbTNE9kdqyGJ2cuCuQJw.text: Non-authentic New York upscale with an overly inflated price and ego.  You'd think that at least the New York Strip half of the Steak & Maine Lobster dinner would be outstanding, but you'd be wrong. None of it was particularly good and for $140 it really needs to be.   I should've gotten the hint when they had no dipping oil for the bread. Would have been wise to cancel the order and leave at that point.  Always follow your instincts!

sxgz45yo8wXbK7fJSXBz_A.text: So I definitely DO NOT recommend this place at all. It was my first time here as I was there to meet some friends for dinner before a concert .  The service was UM sub par to say the best. Wait for it.......We were 1/2 way through the dinner and my friend found a huge black COARSE hair in his wedge salad!!!!! Super super GROSS! They somewhat apologized and said they would take it off the bill?!?! Unmmmm okay ....The food was as good as you would find at like Whole Foods in their ready to eat section . Extremely disappointed!!!

EZs8CoiUc9sgTXhkJ-4H1w.text: My party ordered their signature dry aged New York steak & filet mignon. They were both delicious!! The dry aged Ny steak was 20 oz so do bring your appetite when you go there or share it with your party. I definitely recommend this place :)

YYFHZRgPQP-7xZJYwKFiPA.text: My BF ordered the prime rib which he said was average to slightly above average. I had the NY strip which was average, but not not steakhouse quality and slightly undercooked. The service was poor to mediocre. We didn't have A reservation on a Saturday night so we had to wait about an hour for a table. This was expected. What wasn't expected is once we ordered we waited another hour before our meal arrived, The server only checked on us once during that hour. At steakhouse prices I expected steakhouse quality food and service, Gallagher's  did not deliver.

-pXymnDfWie4QJXMckYCfA.text: Large portions, all perfectly cooked. Everything was delicious. The sides where big enough for sharing.

h25agYSICIdHOmXawBaCyQ.text: Planting its seed in New York City back in 1927, Gallaghers since then has built not only a reputation with all things steak but perfected the quality and the service of their art. Being in Vegas there's clear competition on what steak house is the biggest in the game. Arguably one of the best, and up on the recommendations list with Vegas Elites; I'm glad I had the chance to cross this one off my list.   While roaming aimlessly around New York New York, weaving through replication of roads and buildings of the city itself, you'll eventually stumble onto an extravagant array of meat. Upon closer inspection, slabs and slabs of dry aged beef sitting beautifully in their window display.  Friday night with no reservation we arrived around 730 and luckily; no wait for a table needed. The space is lightly dimmed, tables dressed with white linen and walls filled with portraits and newspaper clippings. Service from start to finish was commendable, Each one of the hostess' and waitstaff were all extremely friendly and welcoming. Atmosphere and ambiance is set for a classy sophisticated date night.  TO THE FOOD!   New York New York - ($110) - Dry aged New York strip and a fresh Maine lobster. God, the presentation for this was remarkable. Arriving table side on a trolley, all eyes turn and are fixated on that glistening piece of meat with a gigantic lobster right beside, shell and all. The color from the two is enough to make your mouth water. As you try to comprehend how you're about to attack this monstrosity of a plate, the gracious server tells you to give him a second as he deshells the lobster for you, yes please, thank you. Enough bells and whistles, the lobster tasted like no other lobster I've had before. Without even needing to use the butter on the side, the meat was juicy and sweet and tasted unbelievably fresh. I'm sure fresh, considering how he just deshelled the thing beside me. Now to the second part of the show. The New York strip, grass fed, dry aged for 21 days, served medium rare with the bone in. This beautiful thing has changed the way I look at steak forever. I've aquired what I thought was a "beefy" flavor to a more intensified beefy flavor, each bite was so juicy. I don't know, perfect is the closest description I can sum up for this gigantic plate.   Dry Aged New York Strip - ($46) - Yeah, we ordered this too, we didn't think portions were going to be this massive. Probably would have been good thought to share. BUT THIS WAS COOKED PERFECTLY TOO. Like honestly, portion sizes are damn well worth it here.   Petaluma Free Range Chicken -($28) - Who orders a chicken dish at a steakhouse you ask? My sister. This was pretty good too, but I mean, I was devouring a steak, so a juicy bite of chicken has got nothing on the steak.   Green Beans -($9) - Simply sauteed with garlic; this dish- our only green dish, was a nice little reassurance that we too, eat greens.   Four Cheese Macaroni - ($10) - Creamy and decadent; two adjectives you definitely want to correlate your macaroni dish to.  Seasoned jumbo steak fries -($7) - Five star rating just for the fries. Yes even at a fine dining establishment, if fries are on the menu you better believe I'll be ordering. Nice crispy layer while you have a velvety potato mush in the middle followed with the seasoning and the added dust of cheese on top. Good god, bless this dish and bless my stomach for ever had consumed this. I'm not over exaggerating. You need to try this.   Clear as water that I'm blown away with my dinner here. Setting, service and food all 5 stars. No complaints. Most memorable meal during my Vegas trip.

uQHMq1Lnvmbh_395NR5fpA.text: Gallagher's was ok.  At the table we had 3 different steaks. Each was cooked well but way overpriced. I've been to other steakhouses and they are better. One of the steaks was supposed to be marbled but was nothing but fat. We did bring it to the waiters attention and they said we should have said something earlier and they would have replaced it. Drinks were good and the manager gave us a delicious desert and cappuccinos on the house. The atmosphere was nice but completely overpriced for the quality.   I personally would not recommend it. Not a chance.

_ukz0Y4T7ukX9ipZKiCHRQ.text: Wonderful food, great service, far prices for the quality of the food. Best steak I ever had. A bit noisy but you can still have a conversation. Will be back...

EZxSaTYbGRW57XrMl5BE2A.text: Steaks were ordered medium, but came out charred and chewy.  I believe the waiter knew this because he offered to take them all back as they were being placed, but given that we had waited for around an hour to get them, we didn't really want to stick around much longer.  The sides were said to be large and shareable, so we ordered a couple for the table.  The "Yukon gold potatoe puree" (mashed potatoes) could probably serve two people and the grilled asparagus consisted of 4 stalks, which is far from shareable.  At this price point I would have expected something on par with Chicago Cut or Bavette's (Chicago).  Also, I never really complain about these kinds of things on here, but this was definitely disappointing and I didn't want to call it out at the table and ruin the vibes of a good bachelor party.

rVRar8JU2W0M8eyeFV_xMg.text: This is going to sound bad... I've had better ny strips at lonestar and outback chains:( not only were they better, BUT, my entire meal at those places were cheaper than my steak alone at gallaghers.  In brutal honesty I found it lacking flavor and chewy. I know this is sloppy and unheard of with steak, but I dipped each bite in my garlic mash potatoes just to have some flavor.  I will say, my jumbo shrimp cocktail was sooooo good. I like a bold spicy cocktail sauce which they delivered. I also loved my (many ) drinks which I chose to have instead of dessert haha.  I'm sure I'll be back with my parents sometime. I'm crossing my fingers for better.

wzM9ynuYmOEAqlYfCR4nzw.text: Best steakhouse I've ever been to. I got the filet mignon, lobster tail, asparagus and parmesan truffle steak fries.my fiance got the filet mignon and mac and cheese.i am not ba fam of mac and cheese but this one was amazing.my lobster was huge,meat was amazing.service was amazing.thank you for a great night. I definitely have and will recommend this place to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ieUeuZ4G0b64Exbmsb8lhw.text: I was so disappointed with my steak.  I brought my party of 10 and we all made sure to order different cuts of meat.  I pretty much had a sample of everything.  The steak was not juicy and definitely didn't feel better than a buffet prime rib.  The only thing I remember here was the clam chowder.  It is was probably one of the best clam chowders I have eaten.  My service was just what I expected.  When you pay 60 bucks per steak you will always get a level of service that compliments that price.    However, I did like their selection of alcohol.  It was very much so to my liking.  I'd come here again only if my friends wanted to, but there are many other places that have amazing steaks with the same price or just a bit pricier.

lDzYL-ocGVfjgq3C7NJwYA.text: Amazing service. We celebrated 3 birthdays on our trip and were given 3 different desserts. Pricey but expected in Vegas. Our server made us feel welcomed and was very attentive.

CcAX4_dR-17XNXy_MDq-UQ.text: I had a fairly great experience at Gallagher's. My waiter, Roberto, was amazing. He gave great recommendations and was very attentive and was a wonderful host overall. I love creme brulees, but Roberto recommended the toffee pudding and sure enough, it was super delicious! It was warm out of the oven, and kind of fluffy with the excellent toffee flavor! I would have love to give Gallagher a 5 star, but the little Asian hostess at the front was a bit rude. She made no attempt to smile or make eye contact, or give me a proper welcome when I arrived for a seat. When she sat me down, she did not even acknowledge my appreciation. She just walked off. Well... I guess we all have bad days but, honey, you are in the hospitality industry, so give me a fake smile- I'll take that!

UDUXtKwz8bIlIadlPRLwAg.text: We seem to always eat here when in Vegas.  It didn't disappoint this time either.  Probably the only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that the waiter didn't tell us the size of steak we were to share only provided 4-5 bites per person.  I feel like he should have let us know we may prefer to order 2 since the last time we were there we ordered our own and left 1/2 on the table.    Other than that, everyone was happy with their food, we ordered quite a few things and all was cooked to order.  The salads were great, potatoes were great as well.  The service is always good as well as the cocktails.  I'm sure the next time we're in Vegas we'll eat there again.

P4tjrRVEZoRwF7A0jeTDMg.text: 1. Yes, the meat locker outside is impressive. 2. The meat is ok. 3. The sides are ok. 4. The service is ok. 5. The restaurant atmosphere is ok. 6. Price is not ok for an ok restaurant

uLRAt6RC0an-kDr8Tn_DiQ.text: We have two favorite steakhouses we visit wen going to vegas SW Steakhouse at the Wynn and this place.  Depends on how dresssed up we want to get is where we go.  THey ahve some awesome steaks here i usually get the ny strip or the cowboy ribeye which are both filling and juicy and plenty of flavor.  Their sides are big portioned so i would just get one and share it unless you cant agree then get two and share both of them.    My boyfriend always gets the ny strip and fries and it feels him up pretty good.  Great meal to have before drinking the booxe for the rest of the night.  Haven't tried any of the dessert items yet but one day  i'm sure i will cause i have heard good things about them as well.  This is a must place to go if you dont want to get to dressed up for a great steak.  The atmoshphere is also very inviting and warming and it doesnt get loud unless you sit at the bar .

5R8ZLJYu-yj8Wrrwg5XW9A.text: The Gallagher's Steakhouse was great and the food was great.  I had the Filet Mignon and the Lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great dinner!

Uinq5pfoFRn4CKJVts2MGw.text: Easily one of the best steaks I've ever had.  The staff was amazing.  Bobby our server was great.  Porterhouse was perfectly cooked, stuffed mushrooms were delicious and the Maine Lobster New York Strip surf and turf was amazing.  It was a lot of food!!  The only thing that keeps this from being 5 stars is the size.  Very cramped but I can deal with that because of the quality.

P5-JWIhNCEMuDg-oBc3ncg.text: This is once of my favorite restaurant's the steak is delicious.  Every time that we want to eat a good steak we go here.

IYCN2czWz_2g2V7np8GqtQ.text: Excellent place for a nice dinner in Vegas! My husband got the dry aged NY strip - it is huge! 18oz on the bone, he couldn't finish it! It was cooked perfectly medium rare, and so flavorful. The whipped potatoes as a side was a perfect accompaniment to the steak. I got the rack of lamb and again, it was cooked perfectly and so buttery tender. I had the beet salad to start, which was a great balance of sweet and salty with the roasted beets and goat cheese. Our server, Caroline, was attentive and super helpful in answering all of our questions about the food. We couldn't have asked for a better server, and dinner was amazingly tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautifully cooked rack of lamb

fTCB1mJfUa6MCAfmrlgLCw.text: So I've been here a number of times and it's the kind of place that sets the standard for a great steak house for me.  I've come with friends & family and everyone walks away happy.  The steak is phenomenal! I've had the lobster & crab, while I'm not normally a seafood lover, I have to say it was excellent. Always a Vegas most for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GNyV7y-dpoLF4MZs3eepYA.text: The is my favorite over priced steak spot in Las Vegas.  The dry-aged Filet is among the best I've ever had and side are simply ridiculous.  I side is probably enough to 2-3 people to share.

rRl7atSEv8YhWCqJ46QM7w.text: This was the best meal, as well as best steak I've ever had. Get the dry aged steak and get it rare. Exquisite.  The seasoned fries, which I assumed would be tasty, blew my freaking mind, and everyone elses as well after I made them try them. We had a bunch of appetizers as well, and all were delicious. The cocktails were delightful, and the wine that our server (Bryan) paired with my steak complemented it wonderfully. I really have never felt this compelled to write such a glowing review but this meal was as close to a religious experience as I've ever had.   Seriously, mind blowing.

i-v47I1PWnE6M1sbjhGTOg.text: Walked by this place when we were watching Zumanity.  Loved the display case of Dry-Aged Steaks and decided to give it a try the following evening.  First I must say is that the service here was Better than Excellent.  Probably one of the best service I've ever had in Vegas.    But here's the disappointing part... they serve USDA Choice Meat.  I didn't realize that until I asked the server.  Although it's probably the best USDA Choice Meat I've ever had in my life due to the dry age NY Steak, it's a far cry from USDA Prime Meat found in steakhouses all over the place.    And that's the reason why it drops 2 stars as the expectation level of quality meat wasn't there.  I guess you get what you pay for and for $42 for a USDA Choice NY Steak Dry Aged Piece.

hN6zamUZ2o-HldbMD-odng.text: When my wife and i decided on a venue for our wedding, there was on question where we would be bringing our wedding guests to celebrate. We come to vegas every year and typical stay on the south strip. Last year, we wandered into this place and we were blown away. Our wedding dinner was no exception. The service was phenomenal and the food was fabulous. I am surprised by the prices though. They seem a bit low for what you get. I have been to many steakhouses that are priced in the same neighborhood but the quality is well beyond what they offer.

4MWbawcU8cCOeVmsIagGJg.text: Recommended by a friend! This is the best steakhouse I've been at in a long time, if not ever. The staff is very good, friendly. The wine list is extensive and they have great "house" wines as well.  The bar does good drinks, and even when there is a mix-up (bad pun not intended), it was fixed rapidly! The ribeye was fork tender and cooked perfectly.  The sides were excellent as well. Atmosphere was very intimate and there are separate rooms for larger parties that can be closed off and prevents the noise from being all over.  It is a nice quiet place.  Definately recommend and will be back next time in Vegas

QNxDOHQCwVT8SjiayTZ0Aw.text: ...First off, after our first experience dining here, I ALWAYS bragged how great the steaks offered here were! Upon our recent dining engagement, I was rather disappointed at the amount of "charcoal coating" that covered our steak!(unlike our previous experiences)  Every bite of our steak was accompanied by bitter crunchy charcoal that coated our steak! My son had to literally scrape off the charcoal coating off his steak! We brought this to the attention of our waiter and he never apologized but did say that is how they ALWAYS prepare their steaks (ummm no!)..and rather  embarrassingly pointed out another table that steaks had arrived at and said " Look sir, these steaks were prepared the same as yours" ...very unprofessional to put me on blast in that dining setting! This experience was rather disappointing because We truly & absolutely enjoyed dining there in the past! But with so many Steakhouses to opt for in Vegas, I believe that was our last! I must commend the hostess that was very welcoming and polite!

Q0D33URClgF0MYJ-lGlrwg.text: Bobby was our server very good at his job ... Attentive and very professional ... Great suggestions on menu ... Will definitely suggest him and restaurant to friends and family ... And DELICIOUS steak made it that much better

GDNyBMntSAcqpxolfer3QQ.text: Great atmosphere, outstanding service and delicious fillet mignon.  The clam chowder was also very good.  Will definitely visit Gallagher's again, especially with it's proximity to piano bar.

O9lPInqQS1TeDWjwpPzUPA.text: Service is great.  Staff is friendly and attentive.  Our party of 10 came in on a Thursday night and were seated right away.    Brother and Husband had the chicken and loved it.  Said it was so tender, it was falling off the bone...great portion size too.  Pastor and friend had a giant steak, very good cuts and worth the money.   Most of us had the clam chowder and it was pretty good, I added some salt into my bowl.

GKq93uW96jreBzeUdFcoAQ.text: I really enjoyed my dinner at Gallagher's!  The filet mignonette practically melted in my mouth! Plus our waiter, Todd, was very friendly.  The next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely go back!

ufOA8zkacMX2WUU2kpN9Ig.text: Thanks Sam for making our dinner once again the best steak dinner ever! Year after year we have returned to you and it's always GREAT service, GREAT food and consistent! Rib eye is to die for, melts in your mouth! I think besides great food, your consistent service from people that have waited and serviced us for years! Doesn't change! Thank you!

tXxbgwaRHOr2GPHQjvq-Ug.text: Really went back and forth between 2 and 3 stars but when it comes right down to it, a steakhouse with a $46 steak that's allegedly their best (being that it is the only dry-aged offering) and is underseasoned and slightly overcooked.. I couldn't bring myself to give the third star. Slow service and underwhelming steaks left us fairly disappointed. Upon specifying that I wanted my steak cooked rare, the waiter gave me the always-slightly-condescending "that'll be cool and red in the center" speech before eventually bringing out a steak that was somewhere in between med-rare and medium.  Meh.  The Mac and cheese was delicious, though- had a delightful smoky flavor and thick chunks of bacon. Really delicious. Wish the meal overall had felt like they were putting in more effort.

Wkg5P9vicDqNQ7LEcywBxw.text: Great restaurant! Pricey, but great food. Tables are a bit crowded together, so be prepared to get cozy. Overall, my wife and I had a great time. I got the filet and my wife, who's not much of a meat eater, loved the lamb. The clam chowder was top notch as well.

YAGFCkjeCo-5RXggtWWggw.text: Great tasting steak and desert like no other, the real experience was the customer service we receive the moment I made my reservation. One person over the phone ask what I was celebrating and once I came in the restaurant it's as if everyone was wishing us congrats on our anniversary. That type of service needs to be recognized.

ycG49p_BAECzNlZUcCm5dQ.text: Celebrated my bday here. The steak was amazing and the sides too. Great drinks. So classy and lovely. I definitely will come back.  I love the display of meats. Droool.

83VOxu_ruFWlmSLn0vmSMA.text: Super!  The food was amazing. You have to make reservations if you're trying to get in. It was really busy. Definitely a good fine dining restaurant and the dry aged steak!!! Everything was good. Roasted beet salad. But the steak is king. And the $10 baked potato is worth it. The spud is so big and the cut of steak is so thick. 1 steak and 1 spud can well feed two people.

HrTVp57omL10QXmTtZ5AZg.text: We'll let me start off by saying we wanted to go somewhere nice for my birthday and my brothers anniversary... Also you can make reservations straight from yelp!!! Read reviews check out pics and look at star rating..and bam! Reservations made! Easy as 1..2..3.   Now we valet the car and found the restaurant quickly. There's a fridge out side aging the New York steaks.  Low lit semi casual restaurant. Got bread and butter with our drinks.  Both my husband and I got surf and turf.. Brother got prime rib which they shared..I asked the server how big the steak was he made it sound tiny...it came out we could have shared....got the bill oh yeah we SHOULD of shared. Food taste good steak was tuff for med rare filet mignon...lobster biggest I've seen in my life!! And that says a lot since I have been eating it since birth(I'm from Hawaii)..service was good for the price....rather go shopping

MaA6PxeBGAkiQWIXx3UubA.text: Absolutely amazing. First time eating here, and it's my husband second. He had a huge steak and I had the salmon. Best we have both ever had. Great flavor and large portions.  Grilled asparagus and a garlic cheesy mashed potatoes. Best food we ate in Vegas. Will definitely be going back next trip, it's our new tradition we have decided :)   Also great service, our server looked very young, but he was respectful and pleasant, great place, and highly recommend .

7BqZlMHx1mVcOQ3kqt3xsQ.text: This place is honestly the best steakhouse I've tried yet and has some of the tastiest steaks that you've ever tried. Definitely a winner in my book.

F2GKpqkfUZuAAauJsgC5dw.text: We visited with our family for my husbands father's 70th birthday. The staff took us to a private room in the back. This is a traditional steak house and the food was phenomenal. The dish that I don't think you should miss out on is the appetizer of cheese grits and blackened shrimp! it was to die for. All of the steak choices were good, our party order the Prime Rib, Dry Aged New York Strip and the Center Cut Filet Mignon. I loved the horseradish on the prime rib, it was very spicy, but the steak itself was so thick, I felt it would have melted in my mouth just a little more if it was thinner. Sometimes less is more. My favorite of the three was the center cut filet with blue cheese on the side. It was perfect! Of the sides that were offered the creamy spinach and garlic mashed potatoes were a table favorite The service was splendid and the waiters were very attentive. The meal equated to about $112 per person, that included two drinks, an appetizer each, a meat selection, a side, a dessert and tip. I think this is a pretty reasonable choice by Las Vegas standards. They had a photographer that took pictures at the establishment and she was a True professional! We all bought photos! Which was a bonus to an already incredible evening!

dhQy0cq0mARYXJ03Su5VHw.text: This place had excellent service . The steaks are big enough to share . I tried the crab cake appetizer and they were one of the freshest crab cakes I have ever tried . Will be back

Npvcwyp-G5rXO2C1VVy_Ew.text: Gallagher's Steakhouse is located right inside of the very popular New York Casino. So let's start with the ambiance....beautiful wooden floors, white table clothes, with all the silverware settings. It's kind of tight as you walk through, especially if there's a sporting event going on. My husband and I were promptly greeted and seated as we'd reserved ahead. Our initial hostess was very professional, warm and accommodating. As we were being seated our server pulled out my chair (my husband has an injured hand) and even assisted my husband with getting comfortable. My only complaint thus far is the restaurant is extremely tight, my chair was almost pressed against a door which separated the dinning area. So we ordered the crab cakes to start. The crab cakes weren't over filled with stuffing. There was a little crust like panko crumbs but the crab balls were filled with succulent blue crab. Please be aware, you will have a server but multiple staff will help you throughout your meal. Our drinks never went lacking! And even though it took a moment to familiarize myself with each person servicing us, they were all very kind, efficient, and accommodating. My husband ordered the prime rib. His only complaint is that he prefers it seared, Gallagher's prime rib is prepared in the oven, but the texture and flavor was dead on. Did I mention how LARGE it was. What stepped Gallaghers game up was when our server offered to cut my husbands prime rib. I was blown away by his compassion, service, and generosity as the restaurant was packed. To compliment his Prime Rib we ordered Mac and Cheese and the Sauteed Spinach. The spinach was perfect. The Mac and cheese had a chees sauce, so if you're a southern girl like me you'll tolerate it but you know it can't compete with over baked mac and cheese. Even if you cooked it like a souffle. Moving on I order the Porterhouse! My steak by far was the highlight of my meal. The cut was extremely generous, the beautiful grill marks, with a little blood drippings on the top. We shared our sides, and there was no way I could eat any desert. If you're looking for exceptional service you want to give them a try.

Jtan3aW_4C1snR76nnqf-Q.text: Be prepared for a long wait for food.... Drinks bread and appetizers came out quick but steak took awhile.  Spoke to GM and he took care of our drinks and a dessert platter.  He made it right for us but I doubt their process will change anytime soon.  Nice ambiance but I've had better steak. One of the hostesses seemed to be having a bad day I came to check in I said Hi and she ignored me and walked away. Luckily the other hostess was nice.
