Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Split New York New York...I&#39;ve had better steak

Jw544rsLXTKhghL6YuqVWA.text: Ok, so I was really looking forward to this place. This review is for my visit back in May 2014. I'm just a little late is finishing my review.   If there is one food type that I love in this world its steak. I was excited to finally tryout the famous Gallagher's. The Vegas location is quite cramped but the service was very good. Our waiter was attentive without being annoying. I ordered the Filet Mingon. The food took an incredibly long time to come out. We sat for 45 mins before we had our first bite...that's just unacceptable. When the steak finally appeared it was one of the worst steaks I have every had. It was like they cooked the filet on medium heat because it was very tough. There is no excuse for a tough Filet. It was chewy and didn't have much taste to it. I was very disappointed. I make better steaks at home, so I certainly expect more from a dedicated steak restaurant. I will never be returning. I would rather go to Ruth Chris' or Gordon Ramsay's The Steak, where they know how to properly cook a steak.  Yuck!

G9PPpO_42mMn63wNDsEyEQ.text: Whenever I'm in Vegas that's my Steakhouse choice. Service, drinks and food is great for the price. This time around I ordered 1/2 a doz oyster, jumbo shrimp, shrimp was huge! and prime rib for my main event. Prime rid was done to perfection. Thick, Juicy and seasoned right. Returning to Vegas for Christmas and have my dnr res confirmed.

IalIQkJiRokto1Mbv6oPcQ.text: Price gouging on New Year's Eve!  They raised their entree prices over 40% and threw in a baked potato.  Two steaks, two glasses of wine, $175.12.  Outrageous.  I'll never go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Price gouging on New Year&#39;s Eve

H5PQp0n4T2z2TXONim37gQ.text: Great cocktails, tender steaks that literally melt in your mouth, and friendly service. Love this bast from the past steakhouse.

GlHC637t-UQvUTkB1TCpbw.text: If you look at my checkin's via Yelp you will see we dine at steakhouse throughout the country with our travels.  Being in Vegas for a convention we thought we would give this steakhouse inside the New York New York a shot.  Staff was friendly, Wife and I shared the bone in ribeye. Very tough and not much flavor.  Much better steak house in Vegas for the same money

mPbEkBXtJC8XNxAO3FTDJQ.text: We really had a great time and the food was awesome!  Steak cooked to perfection and Mary (manager) is the best!!!  Keep up the great work!

rNAm65qLLjezyXz4dMeM7w.text: This place is definitely HORRIBLE, not sure why so many people recommended this place. Shortly, this is the WORST steak I've ever had, worse than my own home cooked steak. We came in a party of 8, ordered all different steaks and none of them were properly cooked, I really wonder if the cook know how to salt the steak. I could hardly finish even half the steak so I tried fed my dog with the take home part, but he refuses to eat lol. Plus, the service is really bad, we waited 15 minutes until a waitress came to order, and we waited for 30+ minutes for these terrible steaks.  this is my actual facial expression right now, nothing else to say

wqBk-9IySVgm1R3mRhDeyQ.text: Really  great  choice  picking  this one.  We came here right before  a show.  Very fancy.  My steak  came out a little  over cooked.  The waiter must of been  watching  me when I cut the steak and noticed  it wasn't  medium  rare. He right away  knew  there was something  wrong.  He asked  if he could  take the steak away.  He came back  with a perfect  cut.  Bravo.  The food  was delicious.  I will definitely  be  coming  back.  But next my husband  and I will  share  the  Ribeye.  It was way to much for me to eat. Thanks  for the hospitality.

70cfnZSS8eZhWa-X1Chx9A.text: 5 stars folks!!!!! yessir 5 stars   King cut prime rib med rare man vs food portion let us see how I fair! wow folks if u have tried house of prime rib in sf or broadway prime in burlingame this place puts both to shame, taste wise, portion wise, even price is decent for the size.  definite must eat here spot when in the city of sin, literally there King cut is probably 2 of largest prime rib cuts at Broadway Prime or House of Prime Rib x 2 that is literally how big the King cut is.   This is serious man food (arrr arrrr arrr "tool man taylor" would say) Portion good, service excellent, drinks excellent, go in small or large groups they can accomodate most size parties.   I have other steaks all over the place and this is hands down the best that I have had in Vegas, HANDS DOWN that is a bold statement, it even comes close to toppling my all time favorite Bob's Steakhouse in SF..  This I can honestly say if you are a carnivore this is the place you want to be, rare or med-rare is super flavorful all the way through!!! got to the center needed maybe a lil dash of salt but still even after 15min the meat just oozes flavor, Man VS Food in this contest MAN won, only left the fat and grissle usually I dont but due to the size of the meat I had to make room.  You probably wont eat the next day til late dinner, for some people, try to get a lil starch in you just a lil and dont order appitizers trust me you wont need them.  food ***** steaks KING CUT MED-RARE died and went to slaughterhouse heaven haha price $$$ for the King cut it was $38 the Porterhouse was $47  service ***** cut of water is all you need and it remained full all night ambiance **** dark, gloomy, like all steak houses.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. done had to leave the grissle and fat on the side
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Cut Med-rare
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Cut Med-Rare

KUo_AhFreLx_Q_A1gGHl5w.text: So I came to Las Vegas with my wife and we wanted a good steak for dinner. Of course I went on yelp to look for suggestions. It was real disappointing to see that this place wasn't first on the list. OH MY GOD!!!!! By far the best steak I have ever had. This place was exactly what I was looking for. Steak so tender and juicy that it just fell off the fork. Had the Porterhouse and my wife had a New York  strip. Simply amazing and magnificent. Had the special side for the night. Garlic jalapeno bacon mashed potatoes. They melt in your mouth.   Overall.....  Definitely come here. Try it at least once. You will not be disappointed.

9LbCFFeX5Butv83tJ9JAvQ.text: Service was great. Ordered a dry aged steak that did not taste dry aged. sides were delicious though.

bVRXHEGRjXHWbIiMSJK6Iw.text: What is it with Americans and their portions? Seriously big steaks!   We were catching up with a friend from home and were looking for a place nearby that 'offered an awesome steak' (thanks again Yelp!) and you can't get much closer then the lobby of our hotel.  Unfortunately our friend was staying over the road in the MGM... which is like a 10 mile walk away! (ok, not really - but seriously how big is that place?)   We turned up without a reservation at about 10pm and got straight in. We shared a starter of bruchetta and i'm glad we did because the mains were huge. The two boys had the recommended steak and I had a huge fillet of Salmon. Tasty and delish all round. Food comas followed... I wish we had room for desert because it all looked really good.   Go for it!

N27FGqMBArebW7sHBbPCtA.text: Below average experience for a "premium" steakhouse.  Waitress was indifferent to our party of four, calamari was one star, bone in ribeye looked great in the window but didn't carryover to the plate.  More than anything, the ambience was terrible. Felt like I was eating dinner in the food court of NYNY.  You won't have to look far to find a better steak.

j7VNIp5mlULgu0B0H_JpqA.text: Came for dinner with a couple of friends and we all ordered steaks (3) cowboy steaks and (1) NY steak. We also ordered calamari as an appetizer and as a side I ordered Mac n cheese which had bacon. Steak was so delicious they cooked it the way we liked it and to our specifications. Mac n cheese was so good!! Service was excellent!! The restaurant was very nice and the waiter and waitress were great!! "Best steak of my life!"

Jb6VGMK8yyE73tJME5aXcQ.text: Truly a top tier steakhouse. Filet was cooked perfectly and nobody at our table could keep their hands off the amazing sides. I wouldn't get the onion soup again -- it was the one thing that didn't impress.

ZxiwUVmCHxIpluxMTfJktQ.text: This place is a must when in Vegas !  I wanted a great steak and I found one ! You can't eat here if your on a budget . I had the cowboy ribeye steak ! Wait staff was awesome , very professional and friendly . Can't wait to come back and eat here again !

fqR9izUYxapSG_orf2uhvQ.text: OK, I'm in Vegas for four days on my own two weeks ago.  Going to great restaurants is what I most like to do in Vegas.  My wife and I stayed in the New York New York a couple of years ago but couldn't get in to Gallagher's the night we wanted to eat there without a 90 minute wait.  This time, I was able to walk in right away without a reservation.  I was seated behind a short wall that shielded the view of the rest of the dining room and was right next to the kitchen, even though there were a lot of empty tables in the main dining area.  Since I was alone I didn't mind the seating and I enjoyed watching the kitchen operations.  Had I been with my wife I would have asked for a different table.  I ordered the NY strip steak, medium rare, sauteed asparagus and the heirloom tomato with hearts of palm salad.  The salad was excellent and the steak was delicious but not as tender as I expected for a dry-aged prime cut.  Overall, the steak was cooked exactly as ordered, the sides were delicious, the cocktail (Bombay Martini) was perfectly executed, and the service was excellent.  I would eat here again and give the strip steak one more try.

tl1_Vgh_4gWIB2ReQGJS4Q.text: I recently went to Vegas and it was highly recommended that I would try this steak house with my family from being from Texas I know a good rib-eye steak. When we first walked into the restaurant We were greeted by a nice hostess that took us to our table. There was a gentleman that took our drink order and told us our waiter would be with us soon, shortly after the waiter came by took my order I asked for my steak medium rare, a baked potato and asked the waiter what he would recommend as a side he told me green beans were his favorite I took the waiters advice. The food was amazing I have never had a steak as good as that anywhere, the green beans were seasoned with just the right seasoning and my boyfriend was very happy with his baked potato and meal as well. The service we received at the restaurant was outstanding the staff was clean professional and polite. I worked in food service when I was younger and was taught a customers glass was never supposed to be half full the staff was very observant  and they kept on top of our table to see if we needed anything  I had such a wonderful experience at this restaurant if I could kiss the cook I would  Outstanding all the way this restaurant is now one of my top favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too good to let anything go to waste
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dinner well served

G3RXtuntrrB99HBZpZWHkw.text: Steak was good, nice and thick.  As with any vegas casino restaurant the abiance is barely held together with a thin veneer as half of the patrons are dressed in t-shirts and the other half looks like their company was paid for.  I was disappointed by the blue cheese sauce.  It was just, bland, not a lot of flavor going on.

aWruo8wzZS3O8_bqh6wKhg.text: Ate here approx 6:40 pm on Sat/23 Sep with 5 other friends: - bit.ly/VNbQPN $50.14 three-course lunch via Fall(?) Restaurant Week Fri/22 - Thu/28 Aug 2014. Gallagher's contributes $5 to a local charity. - I had: 1) Heirloom Tomato & Hearts of Palm Salad - great and light. 2) Prime Rib - sizable and awesome, especially with the real-deal horseradish. 3) Limoncello - I'm not in to desert but this was delicious (warning: it's really tart, which I savor). - All of my friends also got the $50.14 dinner special (some got the filet medallions, some the prime rib) and everyone enjoyed their meals. - Will be back.

u5TCLO0Li_gkMQsdiG5b5w.text: Almost every trip to Vegas includes a dinner here.  I always get the filet with mushrooms and creamed spinach.  This last time I tried the clam chowder and it was so thick, I didn't have to tip the bowl to finish my soup!  Service was excellent as usual.

7XptjlIK4i3AoC8zItk97g.text: Had the lobster main and filet mignon. It was amazing. Also had a side of asparagus. Great service. Called in a hour early for a reservation for 2. Highly recommended for a great dinner spot in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobter With filet mignon

2nNz_WTOLY8OwPNhcKf48Q.text: For starters, I had a Moscow Mule. That was a pretty stiff drink! A+ My wife had the clam chowder and I had the Caesar salad for starters. Clam chowder was packed with flavor, not too thin not too thick. Just right. The Caesar Salad was good not great.  We split the 16oz Cowboy Ribeye - Cooked medium. That's where the dining experience all went downhill. When I'm at a steak place, I know when I first bite into a nice piece of steak that it should sing to me. Well, after my first bite, my first reaction was, "this is not juicy at all!" It's dry and very chewy. In fact my wife said her jaw was hurting from all the chewing. Not very good. For $48 ribeye it sure wasn't up to par im afraid. On the plus side, Yukon gold potato puree was really good and so was our creamed spinach. And oh the free cranberry bread was good.

RxtLnA_saoFeio-PEPxq9g.text: Best prime rib ever! My husband and I come here every time we go to Vegas! We split the queen cut  prime rib and add on a bowl of chowder and it's plenty! The butterscotch cake is delish!

CQT0aRezZiXjrQzF8MK1lQ.text: Very Nice!  The service was wonderful, the portions were huge, and the food was excellent.  There were 6 in my party:  1 had the Ribeye, 2 had the Sea Bass (catch of the day) and 3 had the Queen Cut Prime Rib.  Everyone was very pleased with their food (I had the sea bass - Yum), and we couldn't believe how large the "Queen cut" of Prime Rib was!  It's pricey, but pretty much everything in Las Vegas is.  I would go back again, given the chance.

8P6Dh2M0q0LCBnDcyTsTNg.text: Hands down the best steak I've ever had. An elegant atmosphere makes for a good location for a romantic evening with a significant other or a night on the town with the fellas.Watch your wallet; everything is priced separately and it can get very expensive quickly.

0pX0r96qp4-NM5R_vdmO0g.text: Everytime I'm in Vegas, I make it a point to have one meal here. I have never been disappointed with either the food or the service.

F-jbTfbl95AYAVvLCM0S3g.text: I was really looking forward to gallagher's because all of the great reviews I've read about them but I feel a little disappointed. Maybe my expectations were too high because of all the good review but I have to say the food was mediocre at best. Maybe it was an off night for them but the fried calamari we had were a little overlooked. Then I had the prime rib and honestly I've had better at half the price. It tasted a little bland and the au jus wasn't anything special. Service was great that's why I'm giving them 3 stars but food was Ok. Prime rib at Texas Roadhouse in my opinion is way better at half the cost. But all in all not a bad dining experience.

qocsym6OVK1TgW3OyCx-dQ.text: I've eaten here several times, never had a bad steak. That said I've never tried anything else, but then again this is a steak house, why would you.  This particular night choose the heirloom tomato salad to start, nothing fancy but sure tasted good.  Bring your wallet, you'll spend more than a dollar.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pC9OUC6BAF8Yck_E5kcKjg.text: This is the worst steakhouse I have ever been to. Steaks (cowboy ribeye, prime rib, filet mignon) were either overcooked or had no flavor at all. The sides (asparagus, mushroom, fries) were either very salty or was super greasy. The appetizers (caesars salad, crab cakes, clam chowder) were very greasy as well.  Environment was also too loud for a steakhouse as well.  In short, I feel like I threw $240 down the toilet, because this was very mediocre food. Even thogh we were all very hungry,  we had more than half of the food we ordered as leftovers.

Y4j9yRjzTgVZMiGMDpejEg.text: This used to be one of our favorite places! Sadly, the service has completely fallen below expectation. The bussers and hostess are pretty dry, borderline rude, and self absorbed. The service dont really mind or care to do anything about it. They are obsessed with getting the next table ready. The food went from being ready in 15 min to a 48min wait. We missed our show and rushed to get a nearly $300 dinner down! Totally unacceptable! The mash is watery now as if its a powder mixed with water and the spinach dip was absolutely tasteless. I gave it a 3 because the portions continue to be very good.

6gSUcjr6v6naZTd829um3Q.text: I loved this steak house ever since they opened many years ago.  We celebrated reunion, birthday and anniversary throughout the years.  I haven't been there for a few years.  This weekend we decided to drive over from LA for a dinner.  It turned out to be a big disappointment.  First, the place has turned into more of a diner than a steak house.  The ambience is more of a deli.  The booth seat is so old it feels sticky and look dirty.  The approach made me feel I'm eating at an airport restaurant or at a cattle call.  I asked for a gluten free menu and 70% of the choices on it was not prepared gluten free.  When I asked the waiter, he said, "oh, that Mac and cheese is vegan not GF", "No, I wouldn't eat that because it has cross contamination."  He sure meant well and I'm grateful.  However, the administration should take note.  And then, the menu book is extremely dirty and worn out.  Secondly, the matre'd was made up with a team of "high school girl".  They were more focused on chatting amongst themselves than paying attention to customer.  I tried to catch their attention for some help.  They looked over, made eye contact with me, and turned away.  Fortunately, a graceful lady employee walk by and gave me the assistance.  Thirdly,  the food was below average.  Not the meat quality, that was still good, but the culinary aspect or there lack of.  It was quite a failure Some dishes were better but the portion were cut back tremendously.  The price of Ceasar salad was somewhere $10 and you get about 4 oz, if that much.  The clam chowder came large of a full plate at $12.5 and all you taste was salt and better.    The bread they served is cold.  The busboy gentleman was so kind, he was very good server, and he offered to microwave it.  The bread came out warm but chewy.    The calamari was decent.  We had Salmon for about $40 for a 6oz portion.  The salmon was seasoned well but boring.  They skipped the touch of lemony spell this time.  The lentils that came with it was amazing and generous.    The prime rib we ordered taste fantastic and a generous portion at $50.  A cowboy steak, at $51, was a good portion.  However, it was so charred up that we had to trim half of it off as it has bitter taste and not edible.  We approached the waiter, he replied, "that's how we do it...".  This is called service?!! Pathetic.    On the side dishes, we had sauteed spinach, it was good, portion size is ok.  Our truffle fries has absolutely no truffle taste.  I also had a colossal baked potato.  It was baked so overdone that the outer layers are about 5mm not edible.    We had 3 entrees, 3 sides and 3 drinks.  The bill is over $300 including service charge.  As this was a special weekend, we also paid for the  photography, which was about $180.  We always tip well.  For a whooping $500 evening, it was a most disappointing of all meal and restaurant quality ever in Las Vegas.  Or for that matter any fine dining restaurant we had ever been.    My consolation was the Classic Martini.  It was perfect!  Extra cold, extra dirty, 2 blue cheese olive.  Just when I thought I will never be back, I may just come for that.

vbq1y2WGjZygxRu--yWLig.text: This was the perfect place for a date night or special occasion.  First time in Vegas and definitely knew a steakhouse would be on the agenda. We were able to get reservations on a Saturday night, but unfortunately or very fortunately our Drake concert ran longer due to blessing us with the MMA flight.  We rescheduled for the next day.  We found parking to be very convenient in the New York New York garage (both times).   We were seated immediately at the time of reservation. Everyone was so kind and attentive. It's a nice dimly lit spot..again perfect for a date or intimate setting. We appreciated that the seating was perfectly placed so that we weren't on top of other guests.  The food! I'm sure you saw the meat hanging on the window.. Dry aged steaks! I believe at least 45 days.  I ordered the Sand in Your Toes cocktail, he ordered the Pomegranate lemon drop subbed with Titos which Gallaghers happily allowed. Full bar also available so they have your favorite drink.  Pork belly for an appetizer perfect crust on top. So delicious!  We both ordered the Dry aged New York Strip. Medium. It was cooked to perfection!  For accompaniments: mushroom sauce, onions, and King crab oscar.  For sides, creamed spinach and the special of the day cheddar mashed potatoes with carmalized onions.  The cranberry sunflower seed bread!!!!! We asked for seconds.   I dined with THE pickiest eater in the word and he had zero complaints. NONE  Preston was our amazing server. He was nice, gave us enough time to look and order. Explained the menu very well and I truly appreciate him making this a great experience.  We had plenty of food to go. The portions of steak are huge! Our meals were played for us upon our exit. Preston even let me take my drink to go. Which I kicked myself for leaving on the table when we left!!!!!  I can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach &amp;  special of the day cheddar mashed potatoes w/ carmelized onions. These potatoes were perfect.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dey aged steak mushroom glace and carmelized onions
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged steak with King Crab Oscar.

0ysIg-NynLvotbgexzcnbw.text: I have been to this restaurant 8 times and finally I am writing a review. Every time I have been here I have had great servers and phenomenal food, but this time I had a incredible server named Sam who made my cousin's first time experience at Gallagher's a memorable one. He convinced me to sway from my norm of the salmon and try the scallops which were cooked to perfection and the cauliflower puree was delicious, and my cousin's cowboy steak was the best steak she had ever had. She is now going to embrace my tradition of enjoying a dinner at Gallagher's when she comes to Vegas.

Pt59O67u8biEVMj2jSJ00g.text: Ate here 5+ years ago with my grown son while passing through town. I wanted to treat him to a quality meal while subtly showing him the lifestyle you can enjoy when you achieve success in your profession (nudge, nudge).  I remember the baked potato with sea salt to be excellent and the lighting so dim we could barely see what we were eating.   For this visit, they wouldn't give me a table unless I gave them my phone number first! When I asked why they need my phone number their reply was "we like to be able to keep track of our customers."  What the hell does that mean?   I was planning an evening of dining, cocktails, and gambling. Instead, turned around and left. Won't ever step foot in this casino again.  Who would treat a potential customer like this!?

RS_MKq4V-0dHeMIwtT7TXg.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and the service was exceptional.   We started with the bacon appetizer, which was surprisingly tasty. The ends were pleasantly burnt and caramelized. We also split a wedge salad, which came with just the right amount of bleu cheese and bacon.  The weakest spot of the meal was the bread basket. The bread wasn't warm or particularly good. I'd love to see them raise their bread game a bit.   For dinner, I got the filet mignon and enjoyed it, although it could have used a little more salt. My husband said the same about his NY Strip. Neither of us are salt fiends, so it's unusual for us to notice a need for salt. For our side, we got asparagus, which was the teensiest bit over cooked, but still delicious.   We ended with a truly terrific dessert, but I forget the name. It was a chocolate cake with ganache frosting. It was perfect and I want to marry it.   The meal was, of course, pricey, about $260 with tip. (We also had a few drinks.) but that's about par for us at a really high-end steak place, so it wasn't out of the ordinary for a meal like that.   If we come back to Vegas, I'd eat here again.

aUS41nIOoxyOLuFMr2fAfw.text: Take a bite of the big apple (well, the Vegas version) at this high-end steakhouse. Before you walk in, check out the giant Tomahawk steaks hanging in the window. No need to dress-up here, just be ready to spend some $$$. Good news... you can split your entrees because some are bigger than others. I had eaten a rather (carb-y) later lunch that day, so I was still kind of full. So, instead of steak-in' my vacation, even though those giant (brontosauraus-sized) steaks they were looked appetizing, I opted for the chicken dinner plate. Sometimes, I think chicken is boring, but this place seemed like it would do a great job on chicken. It wasn't a surprise because it was quite delicious! It was so much that my daughter and I couldn't even finish it all. She also had the mac n' cheese appetizer, so it was so much food for the both of us. My dad ordered the (brontosaurus-sized) dry-aged Tomahawk steak, which was massive! That would have been a meal for me, myself and my daughter. They are crazy huge. If you've seen the steaks that the Flinstone family has eaten... imagine that size for this. I would definitely eat here again! Quality was excellent!

Ivqcbhf9rzGDPDDzacmFTg.text: Great little Steakhouse in NYNY Hotel in the middle of the food court area. We wanted a nice steak and that's what we got! We would always walk by the window with all the dry aged beef and we would always say one day we need to plan to eat here- and we did!  The service was good and the steak was good. The creamed spinach was really delicious! We also got the crab cakes for appetizer and it was okay- I wouldn't order it again. I'd try something else.  If you like steak and are in the area, I'd recommend you stop by!

okThFZbmJ2zTKRPGb2J4NQ.text: New York New York isn't exactly the classiest hotel casino on the Las Vegas strip, so I was a more than a little skeptical about this famous New York City steakhouse clone.    Well the marvelous, marbled and meaty hype is real, but it doesn't come cheap, as most of these tasty steaks are around $50.  Fortunately most the steaks are huge, about 18-20oz each, and even better is the $58 Porterhouse which is a whopping 26 ounces delicious and decadent filet and New York strip.  10 years ago a younger Chun P could've readily gobbled all that fabulous flesh on my own, but no longer.  Older Chun P couldn't do it alone, so Mrs Chun P also likes her steak cooked "medium" and came to the rescue. Our friendly waiter "Kana" didn't hesitate for a second to let us share this massive steak, which saved us about $40.  But we also spent $48 on bottle of wine, and got sides of the $9 mushroom medley(delicious!) and $9 mashed potatoes(good enough).  The porterhouse itself was phenomenal and cooked to perfection with just the right amount of char.  Even working as a team, it took us quite some time to finish this gigantic steak...so delicious!  For dessert we ordered the $9 chocolate cake, which was chocolately enough and a perfect climax to our evening(at least the food portion of our evening ;) ).  Not sure when I'll be back in Vegas, but if I'm in search of another classic steak dinner in Vegas, I'll definitely come back.

jbl--wUfl9uR6MWnhJRkVQ.text: Service was good :  food was basic salt and pepper no special seasoning .  Steak was good .  Lobster was $75 for 10 oz tail alone and winter squash absolutely terrible they should call it Brussel sprouts plate that's all it was .   Malbec was delish thou !

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lmhNgkkoPP5_Ut2-uRTJ4A.text: Had a wonderful dinner last night after a concert at New York New York's Gallagher's steak house.  We started off with deep fried calamari, and a couple of cocktails.  The cocktails we chose was the "sand in your toes" they were good but a little sweet wish I had tried the pomegranate lemon martini.  The entrees were delicious and highly recommend the cowboy rib eye with mushroom medley and because it was St Patrick's Day they offered Alaskan Halibut with Chimichurri and chips with a veggi slaw which was very good.   We were too stuffed to try dessert. Maybe next time...  The service was great and I recommend trying this restaurant.

k8Qo7j2tL3gNIcMgv7svCQ.text: Service was great!!! Mashed potatoes are great!! Steak was dry, flavorless and full of fat! $52 is absurd for that kind of meat quality. I like my steak juicy and flavorful.

z0dnkKV7upqf01zetmQA5A.text: We came here for our anniversary. We both ordered the center-cut filet. It was possibly the best steak I've ever eaten. We were seated in the private dining room, which was awesome. Our server Todd was great and very attentive. I wish we had a Gallagher's close to home!

OjbkGmiFOxBVCHDnS9J7LQ.text: Incredible meal last evening!  My husband had the steak and lobster and it was one of the best meals he has ever had... his words!  The staff was so attentive and our waiter, Aris, was exceptional!! Thanks for the great dining experience!! It made our Anniversary even more special!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and lobster with asparagus and onion rings!  Amazing!!

6Et-l0Guz3RjAfLjcc6ONA.text: Boyfriend brought me here for date night, as he has been raving about eating here for a while now. We were greeted by two friendly hostess's at the front and brought to our table.   Ambience -- darker restaurant, New York themed, one of the older styled restaurants  We were greeted by our server, who brought over waters for us and some bread. We enjoyed the bread and butter while looking through the menu.   We ordered Oyster rockefellers, beef carpaccio, porterhouse steak and the cowboy ribeye. Also ordered mushroom medley, cream of spinach and side of veggies.   We both had a glass of the Cabernet sauv -- California, was great with our steaks. Our appys came out and the rockefellers were delicious!!! I could not get enough of them. But the beef carpaccio was a little disappointing. Very meh, especially for the price. Our steaks arrived and it was HUGE. I did not expect it to be this big. Steak was cooked perfectly -- medium rare, but was kind of bland. I had to use the sauce that came with the porterhouse. The porterhouse was so tender, and juicy -- would recommend.   PS: there's a lady who comes around and offers to take pictures for you and by the end of your meal, she'll come over with them and try to get you to purchase them. We said no because it was overpriced and the pictures were so big. She was so annoyed and rude when we said we didn't want them.
