xWf4rkZ1eYtBoFIiZQDMHA.text: You cannot go wrong with this steak house. Easy in and out. My dishes were excellent! I had the dry aged new York steak 90 day wet aged plus 15 day dry aged. It was like butter and music to my palate. Along with Russian  River Pinot Noir. And the bacon caramelized onion mashed potatoes. I was in heaven.  Plus my server Todd was flawless on timing attention and pleasant friendly treatment  like a pro. It's a high quality steakhouse so prices are not cheap but as far as value they are top notch.   There was nothing  I dislike even remotely. You have choice of bar with or without flat screen or for a bit of wait 5-10 minutes you can get a table. Hostess were so nice too.   I will be back every opportunity  I get.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged new York steak w bacon onion mashed potatoes and Pinot Noir

4L3nZfwp94jAormKkhbF-A.text: I hadn't been back to Gallagher's for nearly four years and I took a chance that it was as good as I had remembered it. It is one thing to recommend a place to strangers and coworkers, and quite another to recommend a place to your *boss* and then bring him there. Never mind bringing HIS boss with you, too. No pressure, right?  I made a reservation for part of our team following a long day of work at a conference in the Mandalay Bay. We needed to get out for some air and had spent nearly a week cooped up in the convention center. I thought I knew just the place and made a reservation online using OpenTable.   Our table was ready at the reservation time, and our server, John, was fantastic. We were seated at the "chef's table" in the kitchen area -- which could be a good or a bad thing, depending on the restaurant and the people you're with. It turned out for us to be a good thing and we'll request that next time (it is a U-shaped booth that holds 7 people). Some of the people weren't as hungry, so they decided to split a steak and some appetizers. I just wanted the signature NY strip that I remembered.   The place was crowded, and it took a little time to get the food, but I don't think we were ever left wondering or looking at our watches. If you're in a hurry, though, this may not be the place for you. Good takes time, so be prepared to be patient :)  All of our steaks were cooked perfectly and the shrimp+grits appetizer was a group favorite. I'm not a shrimp person, but those "shrimp" were like little lobster tails! The side dishes were reasonable priced, and I recommend the mac and cheese with bacon in it if they have it. The peppercorn sauce was a few bucks more, but it was a nice accompaniment to my steak. There was enough to share, so I did, and those who tried it enjoyed it as well.   Beware the fresh horseradish with the prime rib -- it is pretty potent.   You'll have a big piece of meat, but be sure to save room for the toffee pudding... even if you have to share it like we did.   For the quality of service and food, the price we paid was more than reasonable and we will definitely be back when we are in town again next year. Thank you John for taking care of us!

MN-RFDXVWuYoXYIOYthMbg.text: True rating is 3.45/5. The steaks are massive so sharing may be a good idea.  I had the ribeye- medium with king crab oscar which was quite tasty paired with a Zin. Ordered creamed spinach as a side and it came out cold so I had to return it. Creme Brulee was much cooler than I am accustom to but edible. Would have been nice if the table bread was warm to make it easier to spread the butter. Phone service was rushed but wait service was nice and polite. Prices are about average for the area. I've been here twice over a few years and I think it's time to move on try different steakhouses.... I mean it is Vegas.

yndpIoc6vW4sTQySs_NWGQ.text: It was my first visit to Gallagher's Steakhouse, didn't know what to expect. I was not very hungry so I ordered the clam chowder and wedge salad which were very good but not to complicated. My husband and daughter ordered the New York strip with peppercorn...now that steak was delicious!! They ordered the creamed spinach and macaroni as well. I only had a taste of the creamed spinach and it was also very good. We also ordered the lemon drop and cucumber martini...very good but very strong drinks. I would definitely recommend this place if you are wanting a very nice dinner.

HsB5trtcj1rhSyB2Cncruw.text: Amazing every time! Love the garlic cloves on the aged steak! You have to ask for it special now. Love going here when I come to Vegas!

hF709lE3k8n5GRksNROWzQ.text: Awesome steaks...filet or strip. Surf/turf is great. Nice sides. Creme brulee dessert is a must.

4mSrnTnZLrBWJmwlMqN_Tg.text: Fantastic meal! My mom and I were on a trip to vegas and ate dinner here. I have been twice before and the food has always been superb. For this trip, we each had the chilled seafood appetizer, which was a large plate of ice with 3 items - a huge shrimp, a lobster medallion, and a giant cracked crab leg. Sauces included aioli and cocktail. I asked for a side of melted butter. The seafood was fresh and fantastic. We each ordered the filet and shared 2 sides: roasted vegetables and the mushroom medley. I got the whiskey mushroom sauce and my mom got the peppercorn sauce. We were both happy with the sauce we chose.  Both sides were great and the steaks were cooked perfectly. Dinner was amazing! On prior visits, I had the onion rings, which are also really great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet and the two sides- mushroom medley and roasted vegetables

U0VnAPwrahitAbe8HG8SoQ.text: We were here for my wife's birthday. Nothing special as it's a pretty good steakhouse that is pricey. In reading the history of Gallagher's in NYC, I expected outstanding steaks, but they were good, not great.   Service was fine, but again, not great. When you pay these prices, you expect a grand experience and it was good, not grand.   I can say that I've tried it and with so many options in Vegas, I doubt that we'll try it again.

DHfPBYgdPIDiLSrDggbr0A.text: Best steak in Vegas!  Not only did my Cowboy Cut Rib Eye melt in my mouth, it tasted great.  Amazing meal with excellent service and all at a reasonable price (for Vegas).    I loved the windows (outside) where they show the fresh cuts of meal aging on hangers... That's the best adverting for a restaurant I've ever seen!  I walked by them and had to stop and stare like a dog begging at the dinner table.  (Vegetarians be warned... you probably won't love the meat hangers)!    Can't wait until my next trip to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy Cut Ribeye
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gigantic Backed Potato
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now that&#39;s just showing off!

owqvRbFgWWXrzj1UFWIeGA.text: This place was very good...a traditional New York steakhouse with a menu full of delicious items. The complimentary bread was great and perfect with some salty butter. We had the Dry-Aged New York Strip, which was so good - perfect, quality beef with a nice char and seasoned with just enough salt to bring out the flavor. They cooked it perfectly! We also shared Truffle Steak Fries and Mac and Cheese and they went well with this very hearty meal. We finished with a serving of Sticky Toffee Pudding and it was rich and delicious.  Definitely check this place out if you're at New York, New York.

wsQPQZcGPI5LHjFiqBgvIA.text: Came here with some friends for a birthday lunch and it was an average experience. We got sat in a tight corner spot since we had a baby and a toddler with us. They seem to not really care for having children or kids around in this restaurant. I ordered the surf and turf with filet mignon, we also ordered some oysters, ahi tuna and all of the desserts. We also got some hot tea and they come and ask you what tea you would like in a box of tea samples they have. I also ordered a martini fruit flavored which was pretty strong. Their Moscow mule was better though. Oysters were probably the smallest oysters I've ever seen in my life for a hefty price. It was still good but seriously the smallest things ever. What I liked most about my surf and turf was the crab legs. It was delicious. My filet mignon was pretty good as well but it was kinda rare in the middle which I asked for medium but it was more in the rare side right in the middle. My friend ordered a steak too and he didn't enjoy his steak as much so I felt bad. Maybe it was a little dry. All the desserts were fine and I enjoyed the creme brulee. Our bill came out to be around $500 for 4 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DobRyFT_9Kh_obMZCmsx5w.text: Just had dinner at the bar and the dining experience was not as advertised. The bartender was busy doing whatever on his cell phone, which was more important than greeting us. His service was not warm and friendly, barely adequate. The Calamari was excellent, but the NY Strip was cooked as ordered, but extremely chewy (tough, not at all tender) I did not complain, which makes it my problem. Had an issue with a gift card, that the bartender could not figure out(birthday gift) manager came over and fixed the issue (she was excellent) Disappointed!!!

11uQfP6-ACyu_cWQDlUESg.text: One of better steakhouses. And if price were factored in, would be the top choice. Great value quality. They got New York strip that's dry aged. I also tried rib eye and that's always my favorite cut.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great steakhouse on the strip in New York New York
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oA2p2T4L-tz81sgmmXUbEg.text: Overall, I would describe our visit to Gallagher's as disappointing. I went there with my husband and another couple; we were on a no-kids, couple's trip to Vegas. We decided to eat here after seeing the dry-aged steak case that sits right outside the restaurant and then upon checking reviews, thought it would be a solid choice.  Service was above average, even though our server seemed very blah and overall not very friendly. Got the wedge salad to start and it was delicious. The other couple got the caprese which looked incredible. Steaks were another matter entirely though. My husband got the cowboy ribeye. It came already cut off the bone, which I have never seen before (and he has ordered this many times before). I got the dry-aged New York strip. We both thought our steaks were just okay. Just okay. Like, I have gotten better steaks at a Longhorn before, kind of okay. Super disappointing. What was even more disappointing is that the steak knives were so dull that I could barely even cut my steak. I mean what the heck? The sides were very good though. We got the parmesan herb fries and the other couple got the spicy cauliflower which were both delicious. But, it's a steak house though. So when you're spending $50+ on a steak (without sides), it should be good, right?  Also, if you order a tea or soda, they charge for refills (at like $4 a piece). Which I personally think is insane. I haven't left many reviews as of late, but I was so disappointed with this one that I thought I'd leave this so maybe others won't spend $200+ on a disappointing dinner.

txpGJ6c9Dcz2a4CMkBEr5A.text: We have been here many times and are never disappointed. This time is no exception! Filet steak with bearnaise, here I come!

zI2l5MsslTiqz1bYAjbIew.text: I was lucky enough to be treated to a wonderful dinner at Gallagher's last night by one of my vendors. The hot seafood hors d'oeuvres were great (well, the oysters were terrible but the calamari & crab cakes were great) and my Filet was amazing!! I would definitely return to this fine steamy!!

seaKDxMcTcXFAiJEjt-Bxw.text: This place was very nice  Quality: So I am a HUGE fan of prime rib, so when I saw that there was a prime rib restaurant in my hotel, well obviously I had to try it out. I ordered bacon mac and cheese, truffle Parmesan fries, and onion rings as my sides and OH MY GOD were they the best sides I've ever had. I was beyondddd pleased! It's amazing how they put such a unique twist on a classic. The prime rib, however, was a different story. It was nicely done, tender, but not very flavorful. Could have used a tad more salt. I also get very excited over au jus and the one served w/ that prime rib just left something to be desired. It was not bad it I've definitely had better.   Service: everyone was soooo nice and attentive! Never let my drink run low but also did not bug. The ambiance was old New York/romantic which was perfect.   Quantity/Price: So for what you get, it's actually REALLY reasonably priced. My boyfriend and I shared the prime rib and sides, as the sides are served family style. Keep in mind I'm def NOT a skinny girl (mama can eat y'know? ) and my boyfriend... well he's a big ol' Hawaiian dude w/ an equally large appetite lol. We were both so stuffed and didn't even finish the food. And w/ all the food, the check still came out to under $100.   Overall, I really really like this place and if I'm ever staying in this hotel again, you bet I will be eating here. 8/10 would recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-VlCzJ3KJ-X46ScuX4TZ_g.text: For anyone else searching, they DO have blue cheese stuffed olives for your dirty martini needs! We didn't order food, just sat at the bar on the outside. The food looked and smelled great, though! Will stop in for a proper meal next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty martini with blue cheese-stuffed olives!

MUydY4MUvc8c1TL4AyMxsg.text: Back again to my  favorite place. Awesome dry aged steaks at a very good and fair price. Not over priced like many other places in Vegas. Staff is super friendly and the restaurant has a nice casual decor and atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

17_F8Fhvfl-leO842qespg.text: Our 2nd least favorite restaurant of our trip...  We came here after leaving the Vegas Knights game, my wife ordered a steak and since I was still full from lunch, I ordered the bowl of clam chowder and the seared ahi. The ahi was average, nothing special at all and the soup was below average. The clams were very dry and chewy.  My wife ordered her steak medium rare, it was clearly medium plus-medium well. Was very dry.  I also had the scotch-old fashioned. I could tell just how the drink was going to be when it arrive with multiple small ice cubes instead of an ice square or sphere... disapointing

IeWlAfcEhFgyYZq8uBHfXg.text: My wife and I recently dined at this classic American Steakhouse. Gallagher's roots date back to the prohibition era in New York and they have been serving fine steaks in Vegas at New York-New-York since 1997.   The venue is "old school" with the dark wood and subdued lighting associated with the elite historic Steakhouses of years gone bye.   Now for the dining experience;   For an appetizer we had the Caesar Salad and the Shrimp Cocktail, both of which exceeded expectations.  The Shrimp cocktail in particular was impressive, with large, fresh shrimp dominating the plate.   My wife's had the 8 ounce filet for her main course which was up to the mark and was perfectly prepared and presented. The sides of peppercorn sauce and the cream spinach were also very good.   Unfortunately, the Bone In, NY Strip Steak was a huge disappointment, as it was served "ICE-CREAM COLD!  I don't know how this can happen? Where and whom was this steak "hanging out" with? From a health standpoint, It's disconcerting when meat is left out and served a room temperature. I'm really not sure how or why this can happen.  In any event, I sent this steak packing and had to wait a half hour before getting another steak, at which time my wife had finished her meal and was ready for desert.   As for Gallagher's NY Strip, I do not recommend it.  It's a "bone in" steak that surrounds the meat on three sides making eating this steak a very difficult task. Also, the meat was very chewy, which is never my experience with this cut of steak.   For our troubles, Gallagher's did absolutely NOTHING! Not even an apology or an explanation.  This coupled with spotty service and the lack hands on management resulted in a 3 Star review.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wB-losp3tUHGm56xUwyacg.text: We are here tonight to celebrate our 10th Anniversary. Food was delicious. Server Roberto really went above and beyond to take care of us. Wife had the filet and crab legs and and the filet and lobster. Both were excellent and cooked exactly how we ordered them.   If you are looking for a great old school steak house in Vegas this is one of our favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet and king crab legs. What a great meal.

DiO8KojAPP8YaNDXnFX-dQ.text: Very nice restaurant.   The appearance inside is nice.    The service seemed odd.   While pleasant the servers would go from very little attention to a hurry up feeling.   The food came out too quick.   The cowboy steaks were good.   It wasn't as good as Perry's Steakhouse in Austin, our current favorite.

nXzntP9j_wg0PvPzPRTO-Q.text: Great wonderful awesome prime rib.    I loved the wedge salad.  The mushrooms could use a little more seasoning but still very  good.   Here is my issue... the wine selection is very subpar.    Please!   If you charge $50+ for prime rib, you really should have wine to match it.   Sorry but Tobin James is the bottom of barrel happy hour  get drunk of Paso Robles. Your food is better than that!!!  Hire a Sommelier!!!!!

AYnMmWy0LC5umB6zH7FVJA.text: OH-EM-GEE.  Hands down, BEST STEAK EVER!! This is the second time I have been there for the dry-aged NY Strip.  The steak bursts with flavor and is so big that you are able to split it.  The sides we got this time were the creamed corn and the mac and cheese.  We really liked the twist that were put on these two items.  We also had the calamari to start off with.  I'm not a huge calamari person, but it was good.  Try to cucumber martini if you like cucumber, so refreshing and delicious.  It doesn't have the kick back that a normal martini does, this one is so good!  Definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UExuN7da027-1zE-wuaYxw.text: Love the clams casino here, I had to order 2 orders!!! This is the place for them if you are into them!

nmd6QO7UOAfYlEhn9jrVBw.text: Great food. Great service. We were seated within 5 minutes of arriving. In fact we were about 10 minutes early for our 8pm dinner reservation for 2... Aris was our server and he was great and very personable... I had the dry aged bone-in NY strip. medium... she had the prime rib. medium rare. Our sides were the yukon gold mashed potatoes and the mushroom medley. They were both delicious. The mushroom medley was an excellent side to the steaks we ordered. The yukon mashed was excellent. Creamy and buttery.   The NY strip I ordered was delicious. It was huge and sadly I couldnt finish it... It was cooked perfectly and writing about it makes my mouth water at the moment. The dry aging really brings out a flavor I really enjoy in steaks. I would certainly order again. The prime rib was really good as well. It was even bigger than the NY strip. It was also cooked exactly as we ordered.   Aris our server was excellent. He anticipated our needs and made for great conversation.  He should be commended.  We will be back to eat at Gallagher's again for sure.

eZI0ioVQoK4twbNK2nY8Ng.text: So much food!  That is the first thing I think when I think about our meal at Gallagher's, but don't mistake that as quantity over quality, it was top notch and in huge quantity.  On our last trip to Las Vegas, my girlfriend and I went to Gallagher's one night before heading to a concert.  Not having ever spent much time in NYNY, we headed over a little before our reservation just to check out the place.  I must say, the "streets" and some of the other restaurants are a neat setting and worth a stroll through on your way to the restaurant.  As we were walking through we were keeping our eye out for the restaurant, and as we turned a corner, we definitely could not have missed the very large display of aging steaks.  A neat touch to see the meat as it is being aged, and it made my decision of what I would be having for dinner very easy.  We made our way inside and were quickly seated and met our server who brought us some water, bread, and took our drink order.  The service was very professional and attentive without being too overbearing.  The restaurant itself is a very large area without too much separation, and as such, is a pretty loud place.  The wine list was pretty good, although I would have liked to have seen more options for wine by the glass. They also had a few house cocktails for those who prefer them. The one part that I was a little turned off about was the photographer that comes around and tries to take everyones picture to sell you later.  That seemed a little tacky.  The food!  After seeing the steak out front, we both knew we were for sure getting a steak to eat.  My girlfriend got the ribeye, while I opted for the "famous" aged new york strip.  Both steaks were fantastic and both steaks were GIGANTIC. I preferred the taste of the NY Strip, however, you cannot go wrong with either one. For sides, I ordered the baked potato and she went with the special which were mashed garlic mashed potatoes, and we were planing to split asparagus between the two of us.    I will know better and hopefully after reading you will too! We had enough food for about 4 hungry adults. I would say we each ate about half of our steak, and my baked potato was the largest potato I have ever seen in my life! We did make a good decision on splitting the asparagus, as that was about the right size to split!  ALL of the food was wonderful thought, even if we could not finish it all.  We were so stuffed we were not interested in dessert, but I did see some of the options at other tables and at least from what I could see it looked great as well (also enough to share, btw).  Overall, I was very happy with the service and the meal, and it was nice to get the opportunity to explore a casino we had not spent much time in.  I have been to some of the other very fancy steak restaurants in the town and would rank it right up there with any of them for the quality of the food and the prices were very reasonable for Las Vegas.  Just think about splitting some of the food unless you are absolutely starving.

bJo4oaHGx3pFgNPMk9L-QQ.text: The food was much better than the service. It took 45 mins to get bread at our table, over a half hour to even speak to our server. It then took another 40 mins to get our food. The worst part was the restaurant wasn't that busy, there were some empty tables. Our server was just bad. I ordered a New York strip, their signature steak, medium and it came out very well. Judging by the other patrons steaks this was probably no fault of the kitchen, more than likely it continued cooking while we waited forever for it to be brought to us. The shrimp cocktail, Brussel sprouts and steak fries were all good. We will not return, would rather try the other dozen high end highly rated steak restaurants in Vegas.

QLHNbfrA4VrStOSuvawbqw.text: Gallagher's is a great choice if you are looking for a nice meal while in the madness that is the Las Vegas strip. Located in the New York New York hotel, it does a pretty nice job of creating an atmosphere that feel quiet and relaxing unlike the casino floor. Our group enjoyed the calamari appetizer, which was standard, nothing special. We also split the stuffed mushrooms, which tasted great.   For dinner I had the signature dry aged strip, cooked medium. I also had a baked potato on the side. The strip was cooked excellently, and the flavor was very good. I have not eaten a lot of dry aged steaks in my life, but I certainly enjoyed this one.   The service was excellent as well. Since you are on the strip this place is a bit pricey, so special occasions or to celebrate and big haul in the casino seem like what this place suits well.

WS6LQ1yAqd4enDdZ5U2McA.text: Food was great! I had the Cowboy Ribeye and a bunch of sides. Bryan and Mikey were AMAZING! Thanks for your service guys!!

87ElV_V78ApO5m3-V3IHBA.text: Very good and romantic. I love the ribeye and blue cheese bacon mash potatoes and the clam chowder was amazing. The service is out of this world thank you for making this relaxing and fun!

T-9bZkEBck-5xbBe6rpoKQ.text: Can't say enough about our experience here.  This restaurant is in NYNY so we had dinner while staying there on a recent trip to Vegas.  It was amazing.  I ordered the filet and my husband got the strip.  We both agree that they were two of the best steaks we have ever had. The service was great and they even brought my husband a birthday dessert.  Excellent dinner....would HIGHLY recommend.  Well worth the money!

83Y6RJNU9J2495PU7eFnAg.text: Got here at 7pm no reservations. We were staying at NYNY so I'm guessing that's why we were seated. Been here several times with no reservations, never had to wait. Then again we're usually staying at this hotel. Always seated in the same area, no complaints.   Service is always good, from the Hostess to the drink guy(?) to the waiter.  Just ordered bottled water, then a basket of bread was brought over. Good and warm but really didn't want to fill up on it.  As for the food, what can I say. Dry aged steaks are the best! But this time I had the Alaskan King Crab. Three nice size legs split in half. My gf had the porterhouse steak.  Maybe a 20 minute wait for our food not bad considering how busy it was. By that time we noticed a long line starting to form outside.  My gf's porterhouse was perfectly done, she enjoyed it. It also came with bone marrow, first time she tried it. I tried it and didn't care for it.  Alaskan King Crab legs were nice and warm, very tasty.   Another great dinner at Gallagher's!

apwwGS4jFMN-b38mZ8F1Ow.text: Came here because the ratings were good. Our waiter was not attentive and seemed irritated. I brought it the attention of the manager and he didn't seem very interested with my concern. Vegas is full of amazing restaurant and I could chose anyone one them? But I came here and it was not a good experience. I'll never come back here again.

JDW5SB9LrtN96jvOPcyZ4g.text: One of the better quality steakhouses on the Vegas strip. I've been to my fair share of them too. But almost everyone of them I've had to spend over $100 per person to walk out with a full stomach. Gallagher's is high quality without the the high price tags! Cowboy ribeye, dry-aged for 15 days for only $42... at 22oz after cooked, it'll feed 1.5 average persons or one of me! My friend ordered the king prime rib and that would have easily fed the table. I estimate it was over 30oz! If you order it for one, skip the free bread! You want to make more room for the meat!  Service was good. Decor is a typical old fashioned style steakhouse - dim light, leather booths, wood panels and B&W photos.   Check Please: Guest count: 4 2x cowboy ribeyes 1x king prime rib 1x queen prime rib 1x house salad 1x warm mushroom salad sides: large baked potato & wild mushroom medley 1x glass of wine Grand total with tax and tips: $265

ACqRlax6LDfNOZ-FHg1H8A.text: We LOVE this steak house. If you want a perfectly cooked steak full of flavor this is where it's at. Their sides are equally delicious - bacon mac and cheese nuff said :) everything is scratch made and they pay attention to detail. The flavor profiles are spot on. This place is always busy so don't expect attentive service but I'm sure they're doing their best with the packed house; which every time I have been has been the case. I wish I was in Vegas now I would go get a steak from Gallagher's :) enjoy....you're welcome.

B4aOOxbMQhtkK-QSOLMb7w.text: My new favourite steakhouse in Vegas. I used to be a Strip Steak (Mandalay Bay) boy, but here you can eat in a more relaxed environment with equally exceptional food at about half the price. The side dishes might not be quite as elaborate as Strip Steak, but when the steak's the star, how much does that really matter.  Delicious

atQDjFSSNhJ2-kdIYRfrzw.text: The best rack of lamb I've ever had! I always ask for my rack of lamb well done and cut into chops. Most places never get it right without drying it out (which is what Foundation Room at Mandalay Bay did), but here it was perfect! Well done and still juicy! Plus, they have an amazing baked mac and cheese side dish. Went on 9/5/15 for an early dinner before a show. I was so pleasantly surprised at how good the food and service was. I would definitely go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 9/5/15 Best Lamb Ever!

nzc3yJ81h4jlyOQpr0Z5bw.text: FAN. TAS. TIC.  Came to Vegas for a week (yes, a full week!) with my girlfriends. We wanted a nice dinner out after having grazed our way through the resort buffet, breakfasts that came complete with margaritas, pizza, and so much mexican food we were starting to say "ese" at the end of sentences.   Gallagher's appeared to fit the bill, although the raw slabs of meat in the case at the entrance are a tad off-putting. I know that they are designed to show you what you're getting, but I'm one of those "ignorance is bliss" people when it comes to eating animals.   Nevertheless, we came in, were seated immediately -- side note: next to the kitchen, like practically IN THE KITCHEN. I have never been so much IN a kitchen in my life. We were about 5 feet from the cooks and the grills. I think it was intentional: along the same vein of the exposed butcher case, so you can see what you're getting and where it's coming from, but it was distracting.  Our waiter was very good. Made good recommendations, very professional and courteous. My mojito was excellent. I had a seafood sampler appetizer plate as my meal -- it had crabcake, shrimp, and calamari. The crabcakes were TO DIE for. The shrimp were good, and the calamari was fine, but not the best I've ever had. I wish I just got crabcakes. So delicious. I sampled some of my girlfriends steak and potatoes and they were just out of this world.   Service was superb throughout the meal; the servers came and cleared our plates quickly and then used that fancy schmancy scraper thing to clear the table of crumbs and such (I love that thing!).  I would ABSOLUTELY 100% recommend anyone on the strip have a meal here. I know I will be back my next round in Sin City!

bXbmrfvwIdhlLrbjgIc7kA.text: I thought this place was fancy attire... I was way wrong.... Everyone looked so casual for a steak out. We went w/ a group of 8. The service was incredible though. They were very inviting and always asking us if we needed anything. My water glass was always filled. The only thing is the price was kinda expensive for the quality. I feel like the steak was a little dry. But overall the dinner was good.

zUmI7o6DGx2dNfg3ZBpObw.text: Food was phenomenal. We were staying at NYNY and felt the need to give this place a shot as they age their steaks to perfection. First and foremost Sam our wauter is a grade A boss, and took care of any questions and had great recommendations for what to order. We will definitely be coming back here without question, best steak I've had ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Cowboy Steak,&#34; medium, to die for!

_7LFOZYxNdBmMS0RmSFNHQ.text: I've eaten at Gallagher's in New York, New York 3 times now.  Every time has been great and left full and satisfied.  Only reason it doesn't get 4 stars is because I'm really picky about giving 4 stars.  The steaks have a fantastic flavor that comes from the dry aging process which is on display in the store front.  Service has always been above average, and the atmosphere feels very classic.  I don't really have any criticism of the restaurant because it is exactly what the star designation says.  A-OK, and that should be nothing to sneeze at.  In Vegas where you have a million options to spend your dining dollars, Gallagher's delivers a steak worth going back for and a fun experience.

SPFfshqsBS7zVXyyiKj9Yw.text: The obvious choice at Gallaghers is the New York Strip, they dry age them in the front of the restaurant. Prices range from $7+ for sides and the NY was $52, which is to be expected from a Las Vegas Steak House. Two people and two glasses of wine is about $210 out the door, but it makes for a lovely evening.  When my husband called to make the reservation the hostess asked if we were celebrating, and he said it was our honeymoon. No one ever mentioned after we arrived, seems weird to ask the question and then not mention to us when we arrive?

_Tc8AO4h7sdwo7o3876qQw.text: Especially since there are SO many famous chef restaurants in this town, average is simply not good enough here, very disappointed.

tia3Do5M6MdUb0TZ9_41yQ.text: Horrific.  Based on the waiter's recommendation was the NY strip aged steak medium rare.  So instead of going with the fish special I went with his recommendation.  I struggled so hard to cut the steak I even knocked off some of my sides.  I had a few bites which actually tasted ok but gave up eating because it was too much work.  He never came back to check on us and when he finally did show up I asked him about the steak and asked was it tough because it's aged?  He said no and if you had told me about it I would have changed it out for you but it's too late now.  Yet he never came back to check on our table so I did the best I could do with the steak I had.  I was so worried I was going to get ill after eating it.   Let me backtrack a minute where when I ordered a drink it came in a glass with lipstick on it and now I couldn't even cut my food?  $200 wasted.  Trust me, there are way better steak places out there don't waste your money there!  The sides we shared.  We had mac and cheese it was good but not thick and creamy, green beans were very good and that's basically what I had for dinner, and bread.

x_dI7o5FDiHeURw8GmgFcQ.text: Staff and service was excellent. Good portions for the right price. Can't wait to come back

VUmVFi9SecTPPaPclAT0-g.text: Excellent cowboy ribeye .  Aged 5 weeks.  Excellent service. Great wait staff.   One exception was that my iced tea glass was broken. I didn't notice it until I drank ed some. I hope it doesn't present a hazard later.

U2HfL_ly3LY_F9EzoDRpeQ.text: Not as good as the one in NY. The Steaks were good, but the service was rough. I would imagine that since this location deals with a lot of Tourists they don't tip very well, and that makes the staff disgruntled, so I can't blame the restaurant completely. Skip this location for the one in NY and go to N9NE Steakhouse at the Palms instead, a MUCH better steak.

fc144Re5Kya2nqLL_Rif-w.text: My husband and I went here the other night for a nice romantic dinner. Our server was great. We talked hockey, which is always great! We had the shrimp appetizer, you only get 3 pieces and it was like $12. I got the filet minon and it was good, but not great.  It was $44 just for the steak. My husband got the surf and turf and it said market value on the price...we were floored when we got the bill and it was $125 for his filet and lobster. The lobster was huge, but holy crap!  All in all the food was good, but I wouldn't go back since it was a little spendy.

bXc_bGZuOrjAJq7Yq5y7dg.text: I would have given this a 0 star if I could. Stay away, one worst steak of my life for the money. It tasted like I had made it at home myself. It cost me 62 dollars for the steak and the side( side not included). The steak was charred and I think they had not cleaned the grill properly so all the grill marks tasted bitter. When I told them about this the explanation was that Because I had asked for it well done!!!. I still tipped but I provably shouldn't even dine that. I love as starving today so I finished the steak but feeling ripped off.

J5uzK7ndOQ6g8Quu1d1DOQ.text: This is more like a 4.5, but since there are no halves, I digress.  So I heard about this steakhouse from my dad, claiming it was the best steakhouse in Vegas, and while I haven't actually been to any others, I do have to agree with him that it was very good.  I had the new york steak (35 dollars) a side of onion rings (7 dollars) and a glass of New Castle (8 dollars) which brought my total for dinner to like 50 dollars plus tax and tip. I'm not a huge spender on food, so 50 bucks is a pretty big drop in the bucket for me to eat, but overall I was very pleased with the food. The steak (cooked medium) came out perfect and was almost all meat (very little fat for a New York) and the onion rings were literally huge, not like the cheap kind you get at a fast food restaurant. Service was great. Our waiter happened to be originally from CA too, so he identified with a couple of guys in Vegas for the weekend and the food came out in a good amount of time.  Sure, I was dealing with a sick friend, and a overly drunk friend, both of who were bickering like preschoolers, but I enjoyed Gallaghers. Next time I'm in New York, New York, and have money to burn for a great dinner, I'll be stopping here!

0l5niJ86Lb-hNLJtawDo3A.text: A very nice place. Seats were too close to the next table but was cozy. Prime rib was a huge slice of yummy! A la cart is new to me but worth the price! Staff very friendly. Clam chowder was the best! A must do in Vegas!

Qrcw36TIiQ3eVFhpivDOTg.text: First off just do yourself a favor and order the house special in house dry aged NY.  It's the best piece of meat on the menu as it's the only cut that is dry aged.    Made a late reservation after seeing Barry Manilow at the Paris.. which by the way was a much better show than I expected.  Upon arriving my co-worker and I were promptly seated at a small table somewhere in the back of the restaurant.  We both ordered the house cut NY steak with asparagus and steak fries.    Got bread and drinks and then out came the steaks.  Wow.. what a great piece of meat.  I'm definitely a fan of dry aged beef and this steak did not disappoint.  My co-workers steak came out a little overcooked and she was gonna eat it but I made them send it back.  The waiter was really great about it and he came back with a new steak like 3 minutes later.. ok so he stole it from another guys order but who cares right?  This steak was done just right and my co-worker was really glad I made them do that.    The sides of asparagus and steak fries were good, nothing to writehome about just average.    Their dessert menus are this weird backlit tablet thingy that's kinda hard on the eyes but nevertheless was kinda cool.  Honestly my steak was so good, I can't even remember what we got for dessert.    Overall the place could use a good scrubbing and maybe a face lift, but honestly I couldn't care less as long as they keep their prices decent and keep serving up delicious reasonable priced beef.  4 Stars!!  (I'd give it 4.5 if I could)

-VfpE7ZgdW3HJlgjqMPt8Q.text: I was pretty excited after reading the reviews, but ended up wondering if any of the reviewers know what a decent steak is supposed to taste like. The sides and drinks were the highlight of the meal. (I got a Gallagher74, I think that's the name-it was awesome as was the broccoli.) Our server was decent, the bussers were wonderful, the manager was phenomenal (tall white guy, short hair, super friendly) and we had a reservation so we didn't have to wait. The steak? Mediocre at best. They're specialty is NY strip- the toughest, most flavorless cut of beef. So, I got the rib eye, as did my boyfriend, since we both like some marbling- it was ginormous, but mostly "marbling." My boyfriend said, "I've had way better steak for a quarter of the price." Me: "When?" BF: "When you make it at home." To be fair, I think they grill their steaks and don't let them rest before serving, which takes away a lot of flavor. Also, I like a warm pink center, so I ordered it medium well, it came out medium rare- not okay when you're paying $50 for 1 steak. The meal was definitely not worth the $250 we paid.

t8671QEl62rzDakJeAQHhg.text: Will be tough to find another steak on the Strip .... That isn't a better value than their...  Uh... Strip.

30tfYYfLKQluBJIBhaDXig.text: Outstanding meal !   We read a lot of reviews and asked a lot of locals about steakhouses and Gallagher's kept getting consistent reviews.  Our table ordered the Fillet Mignon, Seared Ahi Tuna & Lobster Tails.  All were cooked to perfection and simply melted in your mouth.  Delicious!    Really wanted to try to their aged beef, which is on display, but it was just too much for us that night.  Wish we had more people in our party.  That way we could have tried more of the steaks!  The service was top-notch too.  We would definitely go back.

oSF_HiciEianEtgmtrULOQ.text: I usually order a rib eye steak as it is my favorite cut. The rib eye is just so wonderful to savor. My most recent visit I decided to try their house signature steak, the dry-aged New York strip. It was good but too dry. That is why I always go for rib eye cut as it is flavorful and even when it is over-cooked, it does not dry out.

4j_NJo9oKoURWsiT1cgvrA.text: This was kind of a bailout dinner choice for us since we have been here before and we usually try new places each time we come to LV, but we weren't in the mood to take a taxi anywhere or walk around and also wanted to be close to the Cirque theater since we had tickets for that night.   Gallagher's was definitely the best option at NYNY so we didn't mind at all.  Dry aged beef lines the front of the restaurant, enticing the naive passerby to come check out their selection of prime cut steaks and chops.  Vintage pictures of stars and athletes line every bit of wall space that the moderate sized restaurant has to offer.  The relatively low ceilings and minimal windows create the appearance of a classic New York style supper house.    We arrived a few minutes before our reservation so I decided to jump on the shoe shining seat and have a good old fashioned hand shoe shine.  He made quick work on my shoes and I walked off with a seemingly brand new pair of kicks.  We walked in and it was surprisingly pretty crowded for a Sunday night.  We sat down near the rear of the back room, which sounds bad but it's actually pretty nice and quiet there and also it was near the door that leads to the restroom in the hall so it turned out to be a good spot.    Our server quickly greeted us and brought water and bread to our table.  We were torn on entrees and she was very eager to offer up some suggestions from her personal picks.  We agreed on the Ribeye and Rack of Lamb with sides of jalapeno mash and mushroom medley.  We also ordered the Crab Cocktail to start us off along with a bottle of a nice Chilean Red.  Crab Cocktail - Basically 3 sections of King Crab served with lemon and cocktail sauce.  No work necessary since it was sliced in half lengthwise for us.  Delicious.  Mushroom Medley - Great earthy side.  Not much to this so order if you love mushrooms.  Jalapeno Mashed Potatoes - Cheesy potatoes with a slight kick (very slight)   Salted perfectly and not too much cheese.    Ribeye - For me, a ribeye is a ribeye so unless you overcook it, the only thing left is the size of the cut and this cut was huge.  Served on the bone, this is not for the feint of heart.  Rack of Lamb - The star of the show.  Served medium rare is the key to perfection.  Basic seasonings along with a good sear makes lamb one of the best cuts around.  No different here.  Soooo good.  None of that mint jelly mess or paper booties needed.  We had lots of leftovers so we took some to our room to store in ice.  We also took some olive bread as well.  Great leftover lunch the next day.  We had a great meal here for a not-so-expensive price tag.  It was really good.  We would like to try some other cuts the next time we happen to be around here.  Oh, and there's a lady that walks around taking pictures if you would like.  She comes back with like sets of pictures that she prints out and places in photo folders.  I felt like it was high school grad or prom or something.   We got to choose 8x10 or 5x7 or wallet size.  Lol.   We ended getting just one picture in 8x10.  Felt bad but she shouldn't have printed them all out without asking what we wanted first.  For better profit margin, get a digital photo frame and show all the pictures to the customer so save money on ink and paper.  Nothing wasted except battery life.  But i digress...

0WxGZZR0CEJoo_IKz8dXFg.text: No no no. Avoid this place it's just well located otherwise food sucks!

nKmGHd1YhPeUUlSMuLR8SA.text: I always wanted to try this place but was very dissapointed with the food. It was outrageously expensive because probably of its location but the thing I didnt like most is the the house special steak tasted like your average steak at a random bbq party. There is absolutely nothing special about this steak house I personally prefer fresh meat over aged meat and a place that knows how to marinate their steaks to make the mouth water and not just throw a piece of meat on a grill and serve it plain.. We paid $150 for 2 and drank sparkling water with our meals. The portions were large and we did take leftovers home.

WA51fIeJabXZqksQEqTHwg.text: Went to this restaurant a few years back and loved it! After going to STK and a few other places over the past years instead while in town, we thought we would give Gallagher's another try. What a disappointment. Tough steak....crap...Sam, the waiter was awesome, though and that was the best part of the visit. Shrimps were very good, but the star of the meal, our steaks...very sad, indeed. Won't return. Now, STK, that blew our heads off...should have went there again.

L6M-WAkYfgr-seZQzgb54Q.text: The food was amazing and the atmosphere was nice. I had the Filet Mignon. I will definitely go back. The Special Spuds are a must try!

cgvvwLYGjUdfQc8p25NkGg.text: Amazing steak, great bartenders! We ate in the dining-room one night.  The food was very good - the steak was great!  Two night later, we were sitting at the bar Willie and Fernando as our bartenders; they were awesome!

QuijDZFlBOg-heVyU-c3ZQ.text: I will make sure I tell everyone how terrible the meals at Gallagher's are and don't waste your money there. My wife had a filet mignon and king crab legs combo and I had a ribeye and lobster combo.  To begin with, I ordered my ribeye medium rare and it was well done when it came. I cut it and showed the waiter and he took it back to get another one. The new one he brought was rare, but was so tough. I tried cutting pieces at different places but it was tough everywhere. My wife's filet was also tough. Both cuts of meat were so bad even Sizzler's has better stuff.  My lobster was so rubbery I ate only half. The only good thing was her crab legs but anyone can cook crabs.  When the waiter brought the bill, he saw how little we ate and how we both had cut our steak in different places to try and get a decent tender piece but didn't say a word. I think we was afraid to ask how our meals were and just lay the bill on the table. Our bill came out to $245 and that was with no alcohol.  this was by far, the worst dinner I've had in Las Vegas and this has bothered me since I returned home (Hawaii) that I had to let everyone know so they don't get "ripped off" too,

P2LNebAHO6_dE8hqxFX6yQ.text: Definitely not the best steak I've ever had.  I would say it is pretty good for the price compared to some other steak houses in Vegas.  I don't know if I just went on a bad day but the steak was nothing extraordinary.    This place is located inside the New York New York hotel.  It's not the most upscale place (despite the dim lighting, I wouldn't say the decor was fancy/romantic) but I received an upturned nose from the hostess anyway.  Not really sure why....I was business casual even though this place is clearly casual dress code and all I did was say "hello, I have reservations for party of 2" so I can only assume that there was hint of racism in the hostess' misdemeanor.  What further ruined my experience was the table of drunk Canadian men sitting next to us that got progressively drunk as the meal continued.   If you are looking for an upscale steak restaurant, I would go somewhere else.

WDlVhk6ztxqRfGd4ty9HTQ.text: very good food and very good severce!we have so wonderful steak here!

kYxPGyaqY2Qu7IJAPtCXLQ.text: My husband and I wanted a nice dinner while in Vegas and found Gallagher's thru Yelp. It was close to our hotel and not terribly overpriced, so we decided that would be the spot.  We are SO glad we chose this place. For appetizer, we had the calamari. SO good. For dinner, I had the Queen cut Prime Rib (medium) and my husband had the Ribeye (medium rare). Both were huge, cooked perfectly and tasted AMAZING. As sides we had the macaroni & cheese and asparagus. Seriously, the macaroni & cheese is to die for. The hickory bacon in it makes it just amazing. We had so many leftovers that we took a doggy bag back to our hotel for a friend. It was about $100 for both of us, which wasn't too bad at all, and worth every penny.  The *only* complaint is that they sort of shoved us in a corner table (not sure if the fact that we are an obviously pierced/tattooed couple had anything to do with it), but a better table would have been nice. However, our waiter Phillip was very nice & seemed non-judgmental, so we didn't mind too much.

bYwiFfMc1g8SjQE3XSWRGQ.text: This place was horrible! I paid 200 dollars for dinner for two, my steak was still mooing! If you are in Vegas and want a real steak, Gordon Ramsey Steakhouse does it right!

9UseEoNpc4k0y41Hm51ZvA.text: My friends had been raving about this place and we finally planned at trip to Las Vegas and made the reservation. From start to finish, the service and food were outstanding! Gio even remembered my friend and her husband, who had celebrated their wedding here. Gio was adorable.   I ordered the clam chowder, which was amazing! I also had the king cut prime rib, which easily fed 3-4 people, mac and cheese, and the daily potato special, which was a loaded mashed potato. EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS!  We had a group of 10 and we were celebrating 2 birthdays. They sent out two dessert platters with the prettiest little pastries. Very nice!  I'd totally go back and refer others as well. MMMM!

UWhNLGcrb4HWgEqnHiK6aA.text: The boyfriend and I decided to have a fancy dinner night. We ended up here by looking for steak places through yelp. We both ordered the dry aged new york sirloin. $40 bucks for a steak? ehh, when in Vegas. I ordered mine medium rare and it was perfect! the steak was juicy but I'd rather go to a less expensive place. I added wild mushrooms for $3, not worth it. it was about a tablespoon of string mushrooms that tasted like old cheese and wine. The bread they gave us was hard, so we both just stared at it while we waited for our steaks and talked about how fancy everyone was dressed.  *UPDATE* We were asked what hotel we were in I'm not sure if that's normal.

v42AzlHvalUE9oSWi0Nh5w.text: We came to Gallagher's for our Valentine's Day dinner in search for a perfect steak. It is an old, solid steak house with great meat, nice decor, and friendly but respectful stuff.  I had a filet mignon which was really good and also really big - I don't think I've ever seen such a big one before. Hubby ordered lamb chops and was not too happy with them - they were also large but half of it was fat, so he had to cut a lot of it off.  I wasn't sure what I thought about the sides being offered a-la-carte. It's good that they bring them separately and you can share it, but $9 for a mediocre mash potatoes? It's a bit too much in my opinion.

1WLiTbxm-wUrgNymYpNuzw.text: To update my review, I was called by Chris who I assume was a manager of some sort at Gallagher's. He listened to my feedback and seemed genuinely interested in it. I do want to clarify that although I said I wouldn't go back, it's mostly due to the fact that we look for different paces unless it's exceptional. He explained that 8:30 was at the end of their dinner rush so staff may be a little worn down which I completely get. Understand, that when Yelp ask for a review it's only on a microcosm of time and may not be a True representation of the whole product. Cris invited me back an because of his desire to make his restaurant great we will take him up on that soon.

T7UfzIvpmzvEwHpNikZFuQ.text: My mom told me about this place & I HAVE to eat here everytime I'm in town for now on.. the dispay of aged meat when you walk in. The vintage photos on the walls. The service is greaattt. I order the queen cut prime rib. Its enough to share and they don't mind that you do!! Can't wait to go back

vVMz8zihwDIKfqo8tWZZMg.text: Best steak I EVER HAD and i've reviewed a few steak places in the past! I little pricey but what do you expect being on the strip in Vegas! The service was good up until I wanted to pay the bill... I felt as if thwy wanted us to stay to buy more... Dont get me wrong, normally that's great but we ha to catch a show so were on a time limit! I loved it though!

LAC9eVbSaHBON-oe_mIuzg.text: Great food. Great staff. Annoying lady coming around to take your picture to later sell it to you for 25 bucks.

-VZhK2DXPq66LXV9KivLVQ.text: Not even a hint of the one in NYC. But, that's expected. Everyone in Vegas is customized to be brighter, glitzier, and much more expensive. My steak was good, but everything about this place is over-priced. $15 for sides? Come on, that's really pushing it. Maybe at Per Se, where extras for suckers have become one of their mainstays. Mushrooms or spinach, 15?? I have been eating prime rib at the place in NYC since I was a child. When I found out that this location had no prime rib and was given a business lecture to explain why, I should have left. But I wanted to give it a try. Today, steak is all over Las Vegas, so it really boils down to personal test. These over-the-top marvels of the modern meat-lovers havens are sometimes more show than go.

n-1U95vfHGbgVSVlz5DijQ.text: Went here for Valentine's Day with another couple.  I made reservations the day before with no problem.  All the ladies got roses! So sweet.  I had the rib-eye steak and a baked potato.  Holy moly that potato was huge. I could've shared that with my bf. My steak was too rare for me so I asked if they could cook a little bit longer and they did and gave me more onion strings. Yumm!  I also had a Grey Goose and Cranberry. Strong!! Kicked in real nice. No room for dessert. Was so full.   The place is cramped when it's at full capacity.  Walking to the bathroom was fun. Like walking thru a maze. Got a nice tour of the restaurant.  Next time I visit I want to try the House Aged Bone In Sirloin. I seen that on another table. Looked ono!!

DhIDGqJXlWq6BawlEA8hFA.text: For the price, it should have been much better.  The serice was really good.   The staff gets 5 stars.  The steak wasn't the greatest.  I mean, it wasn't too bad.But, for the price I thought it should have been better.    For a commercial thing in Vegas, I mean it's a touristy thing, let the tourists have fun, they will like it.   I live in San Francisco and have a lot of really nice steak places to go to and I've eaten at many others which have had better cuts of meat and were cooked better.  We sent one back because it was well done and we asked for a medium.  It came out right away, no waiting an hour for them to cook another, I'm sure they 'borrowed' someone elses to get ours out quickly, which is nice.  But, that wasn't cooked much less than the first one. :(  The steak was pretty tough.   The lobster tail was a little over cooked.  If you're not used to going to really nice places, (My Mom ate with us and she isn't used to going out to places like this) and she had a great time and didn't know the difference.   If you know the difference, you'll probably want to go elsewhere.  We spent in the neighborhood of $500 for 4 people.  It should have been the best quality for that price.    Now, we didn't eat the cheap stuff either.  2 of us had the surf & turf with the lobster tail.  and a couple of glasses of wine.  We skipped dessert and they brought us one small one on the house, that was nice.  Like I said, the staff was perfect from start to finish.  The quality of the meal was the only problem.

xFVmpckbL6DN1FUILV1_TQ.text: Best steakhouse I have ever been to.  I have been here multiple times and it never fails at being the best.  Great service and even better food.  Much better than Smith and Wollensky.  I would give them five more stars if possible.  Bone in New York all day!

qmNhUYE6xZeMOiXgZsgBrQ.text: Everytime out of state friends and family come over, they want to go to New York New York and see this place. They are too cheap and scared to travel to the real New York. Whatever....  Since they left it all up to me, I suggested we go here, because I was salivating at those aged steaks in the window.   The place is bigger than you realize, and they are always super busy. Who knew? Hostesses sat us right away and near a door that lead to the bathroom across the hall. NICE! The service was nice and so was the lighting. The crowd that night was a mix of families, business crowd and romantic lovers.   We all ordered different entrees (salads, calamari, bruschetta, crabcakes) shared and devoured them.   Holy Horseradish, wow the prices for steaks made me pause real quick. This is pricey. The taste proved otherwise, as I had the filet med rare. ' Everyone enjoyed their entrees. If you order seafood, they have no prices, so it varies on a daily basis.   I had the four cheese mac as a side and was NOT disappointed.   There is no formal dress code at Gallaghers either as everyone else was wearing whatever they wore touring the strip.

6w6VA-a62-VzNnm2B4gDRA.text: How do I say this? A good dinner but it was not one of those off the chart places. Nothing wrong, just a good steak and good service. I'm still looking for that epic steakhouse in Las Vegas.

5dgPKvhUUtNupkkjluZ5tQ.text: Had the Aged NY Strip - tasteless and tough. Not what was expected for the price and mediocre at best. Ambiance and service were very good but I was here looking for a juicy, flavorful nice piece of meat and just didn't get what I was expecting. Disappointed!

p7ZPsCKkPQbwVLMsVdgc7Q.text: My very favorite steak house, bar none.  I had a juicy Ribeye steak, rare.  The rest of my party mostly had the New York sirloin.  As expected, the steaks all came out as ordered and the aging process made them tender and more flavorful.  Ribeyes were nicely marbled but the NY steak was more lean.  The portion was very generous, especially for a fancy place like this.  Instead of wine, I got an Islay Scotch to pair with the steak.  The smokey flavor complemented the steak (or any BBQ for that matter).  I wish the pour was more generous, but that's the on gripe.  The service was also very good so I rounded it up to 5 stars still.

FBkzUahj1r9TWRt9Y5cH-w.text: I own two successful business here in Las Vegas. One is a tavern with a restaurant  I'm not a professional food connoisseur, but I've been to at least 50 different steakhouse's nation wide. There were six people in our party. The service was just adequate. The appetizers (shrimp cocktails and crab cakes) were good. Four of us ordered their signature steak (Dry Aged bone in New York Strip) I like it medium rare. When I tried to cut into it I shook the whole table, it was that tough. Also the same with one of my guests. No problem 10 minutes goes by and the waiter returned with two new ones. Again... both were tough as nails. this time the manager came over and I showed him how bad it was. So I said lets just change both to a filet mignon. Manager asks what temperature would you like that? both medium rare please. another 10 minutes goes by and he returns with two new ones. My guests was done right however, I cut into mine and it was so rare it looked blue in the middle. I picked up my plate walked over to the manager and asked him what he thought it was cooked to? Hm... thats on the rare side he said. I said No... thats RAW! and go ahead and keep the steak Im done. I walked back to my table and guests. The worst part, the manager never came back to apologize or show any kind of empathy for that whole experience! Its not the fact I spent $650.00 for dinner where their supposed to specialize in steaks, and they had THREE times to get it right.  Its all about customer service when things go wrong. I will NEVER entertain my guests there again. By the way I was there 9/17/16 @ 6:00 in the room on the left side with the long table. I'm not sure of the server's name nor the Managers.

_aFVepuTNhBlPsNl3sUvkw.text: I was here in June.  Just awesome!!!  Excellent service.  Perfectly cooked steak and rack of lamb to die for.  Beautiful presentation.  Nice decor.  Loved it.

FyxiBvSJdIRsXvQ6jNOKUQ.text: Wow, the food was so underwhelming, for ANY price.  I ordered well done and my meat was still quite pink and very fatty.  I reserved here due to the extremely high yelp ratings and was very disappointed.  However, loved the atmosphere and the service was top notch.  My dining partner also had a fatty, tough steak. With all the great restaurants in Vegas, wish I would have chosen a different steak house.

4RquHRLf_cUh-v1e9b541Q.text: We weren't planning on eating at a steakhouse while in Las Vegas, but when we saw their display of dry aged slabs of steaks, our eyes were set. It was a spontaneous decision to eat there and we were not disappointed. There was no wait. We got seated by he kitchen so we had a great view of all the meats on being grilled. Well, all of us of course ordered steak. They only had one type of meat that they aged, and that is the New York strip. It would have been better if they had other selections that they dry aged. The steak was delicious. The waiter's recommendation of getting it medium cooked is perfect. The meat was juicy, tender and flavorful. We also ordered a couple sides. Their mashed potatoes with asiago chedder was their side of the day and it was super yummy. The staff was overall nice and very attentive. They even let one of our friends take a picture of the kitchen area. The price is fair for what they serve. Expect to spend over $100 for two. Maybe more if you order alcoholic drinks with your meal. To those who love steak and is in the Las Vegas New York New York Hotel & Casino, I recommend you try this place and their dry aged steak cooked medium. Bon Appetit!

pHM77I8rAj_DKsNeza4J1g.text: I would love to give 5 stars but two things ruined it. I'll start with the good...we had a reservation and were sat shortly after the reservation time which is fine. Servers and staff were top notch. Never needed to ask for a refill and service was quick. Drinks and apps came fast which I loved. Ambiance is pleasant very New York feel. The shrimp cocktail was great and my filet was cooked perfectly. We ordered the green beans which were crispy and delicious. The bacon Mac and cheese lacked bacon, hence my disappointment. You could count the pieces of bacon and I was looking forward to that side it was just ok. We sat at a table and after awhile the chairs became very uncomfortable. I would have stayed for another drink but I was to uncomfortable to sit any longer. This may be a ploy to turn tables haha but I don't know so next time I go I'll definitely ask for a booth. The sticky toffee pudding was good not anything to rave about. I'll try the cheesecake next time. I'm a local and probably be back but in the mean time I'll recommend it to friends staying on the strip for sure.

V9kYsmJAueOR6lfJsT-mfQ.text: This place was over priced for what you get. My Mac n cheese was bland and my husbands steak wasn't worth what we paid for it, but it's Vegas. The waitstaff seemed to forget abt us and I'm not sure if it's bc where we were seated Or what.

ZxlK8yQoDrAdg27C03LwtA.text: Good food. Long wait for the main course, but worth it. Shrimp cocktail over shrimp scampi, and the truffle steak fries should be ignored for one of the better side choices.

XcB8WRkcjcM012hBKK4tSw.text: We go to steakhouses quite often and I have to say I was slightly disappointed in this place. My filet didn't have as much flavor as it could have and my lobster tail was slightly over cooked. However, I am not saying the meal was not good and that you should not go here; I had heard a lot of hype about this place and I do not think it lived up to that hype. My boyfriend got the Cowboy Ribeye and asked for it medium rare plus and his was definitely medium rare if not a little more rare. He doesn't like it like that so barely touched his plate (we don't like sending food back if we don't absolutely have to). If you are big steakhouse connoisseur like us then I recommend maybe trying a different place.

7xdP8Uj67S2Toyr7jxJqXw.text: There is only one bad thing we have to say.  Why did this place have to be soooo darn good that we will always want to come here when we are in Vegas.  We LOVE trying new places and different restaurants but it will be hard to pass up this place.  HERE IS OUR RECOMMENDATION we always go for ribeyes but the wet and dry aged New York strip is the way to go!!  Get it with the char and you will be in heaven!!

Y1VmgLwC-acGF-LVC7cr7g.text: Gallagher's, there is a question for you within my review. If you could please answer it.  New York New York is one my favorite casinos, after seeing Gallagher's many times, my wife and I decided to give it a try. We made reservations with some friends and had dinner there on Saturday night.   Standard steakhouse treatment, prices as expected and the food offering very similar to what other steakhouses offer. Our waiter Derek had a great attitude and he was probably the highlight of the night. Derek suggested that we tried the signature steak, Dry-aged New York steak. We also ordered a wedge salad and sauteed mushrooms to share. After eating the salad my wife fell nauseated and could not even eat her steak, she has to asked for it to be boxed. She is allergic to MSG and nausea is one of the reactions that she gets when eating a food that contains MSG. Do you know if your ranch dressing contains MSG? This is something important as some people are allergic to this product.  My steak was cooked perfectly and the flavor was really good. The mushrooms met the expectations. They served parmigiana and olive bread, they would be better it they were served warm.   The best part of our meal was the desert, We ordered the Sticky Tootsie was served with vanilla ice cream, it was just spectacular!!! The best desert I have tried in a long time.

-VFVgKBBRsTx4P9Gj7zEig.text: I made a reservation through Open Table about an hour and a half before we wanted to eat and I was able to be seated at the time of our reservation.   My wife and I decided that the 22 oz. cowboy ribeye was big enough to feed both of us and so we asked if it could be split. They were more than happy to split it for us (as long as we both wanted it cooked the same way). We ordered it medium and it was a nice pink all the way through. We had an appetizer of calamari and sides of green beans and a special bacon, chipotle mashed potatoes. Everything was excellent. The sides were more than enough for us to split. In my younger days I would've tackled the full steak, but now as I am pushing 50, the split steak was perfect.   After dinner we split the creme brulee. My wife had a coffee and I had a cappuccino. It was a great end to a great meal.

yC4FO3i-5XKCBq7oxAF28A.text: 1st of all, The service was awesome! But, The food not worth the trip. The New York was under cooked. I ordered medium I got rare. The colossal baked potato was not that big and the Cream Spanish was a soup. The steak fries was the best item that we had. I would come here for drinks at the bar because of the great service and drinks that we had. I really hope that they can turn this around, it's in a really good location.

OhbNkm21Wxcq1RMgj7G_KA.text: This steakhouse was okay. Steak was cooked perfectly, creamed spinach was great. I ordered the beef stew which was Excellent. Our only complaint was the bread. Why not warm the bread up for the table. Who eats cold bread and butter? Not to mention it was cold. First time dining here and I wouldn't rush back for any particular reason.

ZvAniB3_w-ZohwMIs1-v5g.text: This was among the best meals I have ever had. When choosing a location for our anniversary dinner, I went back and forth and eventually we settled on this lovely steakhouse located in New York, New York. Once we made a reservation online, it was smooth sailing from there! The atmosphere was great! Really reminded me of being in a classic New York eatery.   For starters, we started with Lobster Bisque, which was very flavorful. This set the tone for the rest of the meal. For sides, we ordered the creamed spinach, asparagus, and garlic mashed potatoes... and they were all admirably, if not spectacularly, done. The dry aged cuts were simply breathtaking. I've enjoyed many over the course of my life, but these were cooked to perfection. Can't say enough about these steaks! The meal was definitely the highlight, but the service was impeccable! Kudos to the wait staff for making it an excellent dining experience!  Gallagher's is actually quite affordable for a steakhouse (all of your classic cuts of steak will range somewhere between $40-$80, the appetizers hover around $15, and the sides just barely stay in single digits), but I'd recommend it without hesitation if you appreciate a fantastic steak!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying dessert with my wife at Gallagher&#39;s

zAQmgPgvtqQtpU5D3ubLGQ.text: One of the better steaks I've had in Vegas. I got the Cowboy Steak ($47), medium. I think all the steaks come a la carte, so you gotta choose your sides from the list. I don't think the mac and cheese lived up to the hype so I'd probably choose a different side. Brussel sprouts perhaps?  Not much else to say, other than that the service was excellent and everything was very well done.

En690N7hbUtOpGL54al4fQ.text: I used to have another steakhouse (unnamed chain)as my high watermark...but Gallagher's has surpassed them all! John was very personable as was all the wait staff. My husband and I were very impressed by watching the management willing to set or bus a table as needed. But the food was really the JACKPOT!!! OMG the filet was quality, cooked to perfection!!! So wanting to come back again soon!!!

SJbBAggcMbY_p5CREeldng.text: A fantastic steakhouse. We came here as a party of four on Friday night. We had a reservation and were seated quickly. The ambiance is nice and the wait staff attentive.  The food came out relatively quick. I had the 20 oz ribeye steak and a baked potato; both were delicious. You may want to order your steak done a level higher than usual. I ordered my steak medium but it looked more medium-rare however it didn't taste medium-rare.  When in Vegas again, this place will definitely be on my dinner option list.

GYQpoLDqRTFtSYvnfM9oqw.text: My husband took me here for our 8 year anniversary. This decor is great! Our waiter was very attentive and even brought out a special dessert for our anniversary. The food was great! They have an amazing Caprese Salad.

We got the calamari for appetizer and it was tender and just enough saltiness on it. My husband got the ribeye and it was cooked to perfection. It was tender and very delicious. And the Salmon! It melts in your mouth! Its seriously a must try. It's so good. We will definitely eat there again whenever we are the Las Vegas

WoibgRAHIUJggh30bF6Tgw.text: So we are self proclaimed Meat Heads.  We love a good steak and often seek out a good steak house when we travel.  We love love love the Gallagher's in New York City, so when we realized there was a Gallagher's at New York, New York here we jumped at the chance to have a little taste of home in Las Vegas.  I am sad to report that this Gallagher's is a poor substitute for the original.  It doesn't even qualify as the first runner up... for the $1.98 beauty pagent.       What makes Gallagher's exception is not just their steaks, which if you visit the one in Manhattan are on display as they are aged on the premises, but the experience.  Their service, the atmosphere with all the old pictures on the walls of former famous patrons along with their traditional steak house menu, cuts and sides are all part of the package.       The one in Vegas falls short of an exceptional experience on every count.  Our usual order is the Porterhouse for two with creme spinach, mash potatoes  and the house salad. We were so disappointed by the lack of service.  Our steak was practically dropped in our lap without so much as a word of explanation or a offer to serve a single piece.  This lack of service is only over shadowed by the fact that they can not possibly be using the same meat purveyor or method of dry aging.   The quality of the steaks is not the same as Manhattan restaurant.   There are no steaks on display or visible aging room. The pictures on the walls in Las Vegas look like they came out of the MGM studios set design or art department, not collected over years of actually services.  I am pretty sure Rock Hudson and many of the others were six feet under before the Vegas location ever broke ground.     On a positive note the steak was good (not great) and did come out cooked appropriately to order.  The Moscow Mule I ordered had a nice blend of ginger and lime.  I really enjoyed the cocktail.  I suppose if I did not know the original, I might feel differently.  However, for me the only similarities between the Manhattan Gallagher's and the New York, New York Gallagher's in Vegas are the prices.  So go once if you must just to say you have, but after that, save your Gallagher's experience for the next time you are in Manhattan.

TsA1kTU-PZmq7UzDj738JA.text: This place is delicious! Me and my boyfriend went here for my birthday. Everything was great. Service , food , and dessert.   I got the cowboy steak and my boyfriend got the DRY-NY steak.  We order mashed potatoes and truffle fries.  The meats were Cooked just the way we love it, which is medium rare.  By the end of our dinner , we were full. I would definitely recommend this place and will be stopping here next time I visit Vegas!

dF4URKaDGlH7teeGonlImg.text: Yummy Pomegranate Lemon Drop and friendly bar tenders! Hot Seafood Platter and huge steak fries were filling appetizers.

HAD-XdJIM0UANQnPSbZN5g.text: Good steakhouse in NewYork NewYork casino. My friend and I here dined here recently , we both ordered filet mignon for our entrees, medium rare the steak was cooked just how I like it! For my side I got the special garlic mash potatoes which were my favorite part of the meal! For a appetizer we ordered the scallop appetizer with bacon which was also quite yummy. Service here was very good and prices were reasonable for a steakhouse. We were able to get reservations that morning. Overall a good experience.

JvUk15O8WCFLYk1UMUF14g.text: The decor is of a typical steakhouse, wood everywhere and dim lighting.     The food was ok. I ordered the prime rib, medium rare and it was delicious! However, my husband ordered the cowboy ribeye steak, medium and it was really salty and dry. He said it tasted more like a sirloin or another type of lean steak so that was disappointing.     For the sides, we ordered mac n cheese and mushrooms.   The mushrooms were also super salty. My total bill was $130 before gratuity and for that amount of expect better.   It was a nice experience but I wouldn't come back.

9uCJhEAeZZWc4FvTBHn58w.text: This is fine dining not to be rushed. Service was formal and mannered.  Not stuffy though.   We had made reservations and were seated promptly when we arrived despite being a few minutes late.   The menu has several steaks, salads, and seafood. Everything is a la carte. You can customize your meal anyway you want.   We chose the New York strip steak.  Our steaks were cooked perfectly. So well in fact that the left overs were just as delicious and almost as melt in your mouth good as at dinner. The shrimp cocktail appetizer and the lobster tail were wonderful. Fresh. Tasty. We chose to share horseradish mash potatoes. Yummmm. It was a great accompaniment to the steaks.   The portions were on the generous side. So much that we could not finish our meal and took leftovers home.   Still when you have had such a good meal you're at least curious about the desserts.   Yes I peeked and they had a nice selection I chose to take the sticky toffee pudding with vanilla bean ice cream. Loved it.  Soo good. We all enjoyed every bite.   We found our dining experience relaxed and pleasurable.   The tab isn't for the faint of heart or those on a budget. It was our splurge on this trip and we don't regret one bite, minute or cent spent dining here.
