Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Horseradish mashed potatoes
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket and butter

aSNdfckBf020Qo6f-NkxRA.text: This is likely at least my 15th+ time dining.  Sat at the bar tonight and ordered a Medium Well $50 steak. I shared several times I've ordered MW but here it's often MR or Rare when delivered. I asked that it be prepared MW. When I received the steak it was MR (red inside). I enjoy beef tartare but prefer a steak be MW  Received the apologies and a second order of Truffle Fries at no cost but realistically, I'm not visiting again. I'm providing two stars because the bartender (Aaron) was awesome (attentive, prompt, friendly, professional).

DO_vMadHZ6bv5s96H9Kcsw.text: I had dinner with my Parents on our final night in Vegas and it was marvelous.  I had the Filet and it was cooked to a perfect red medium.

6PBaCMIu02sCiLe90-6CAw.text: During the many trips I have taken to Vegas, I have been to several steak houses. After eating at Gallagher's, I can say without question that it's one of Vegas finest.   My BF and I had a reservation and I have to say, I have zero complaints about our visit, the service we received and the food/drinks. From start to finish, we had excellent service and our waiter was wonderful. I wish I would have caught his name because he deserves to be acknowledged.   As with any good steakhouse, the bill will be pricey but worth it if the steaks are just right and that's exactly what they are at Gallagher's. We had a rib eye, lobster, NY strip, wedge salad, garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. Steaks cooked perfectly, sides...amazing. The sticky toffee cake our waiter suggested was one of the best desserts I've had at a steakhouse.   Aside from our meal being just about perfect, the service was top-notch and for a full-house on a Saturday night, I appreciated how fast our drinks and food came out. This will be a place we frequent for sure while in Vegas as it's worth every single penny.

eYpjL4Nhdh3WCYKYJnVLAw.text: Management needs to read this. I'd hope you read this. Check on my time stamps. Address this with your team. Ensure nobody experiences this in your restaurant. Hopefully this helps you fix your terrible customer service issues. Or don't read this and lose customers. At this point I don't care. You've lost a regular customer.   0 stars. This is my first 0 star review. Absolutely worst experience for me in a long time. Well over a decade.   I have eaten at Gallagher's countless times. Will never eat here again. The prime rib was one of the best I have eaten. Everything had nice portions. King crab was worth the price. As a family we were excited to eat here.   Customer service here is atrocious. Best part was  getting a seat. No problems there.   Worst part was getting any kind of service.   As you can see by their text messaging system we attempted to eat here at 4:28 on a Monday. Not many customers. I believe there was 1 gentleman by himself, and a group of around 5.   There was two of us. We were absolutely ignored. Plenty of wait staff standing around. Plenty of servers. We waited for around 17 minutes. You can see by the time stamp as we were leaving.   15 minutes into this a couple comes in. Not a minority. They get serviced right away as they were sitting down. They ordered their drinks and food. They were sitting right across from us at the next table. After realizing we weren't going to get serviced here for whatever reason I don't think it's relevant at this point we decided to leave.  It was hugely disappointing considering this is a place we looked forward to.    I am a minority. I'm very unassuming. I do well for myself, but when I'm on vacation I don't dress the part. Was with my kid. I hate to expose my family to this part of society but it's still alive. We were looking forward to some of the best prime rib I've ever had. This never happened.   Profiling, discrimination, don't judge a book by its cover. Call it what ever you want.   My suggestion is do your research. I gave you the info. Review your cameras and draw your own conclusion.

tTRh3r5pxtxT2F1MNtikDg.text: Firstly the food was incredible, small portions but very filling. Only reason I'm saying two stars.  Now to the rest..  If you have tattoos and aren't dressed completely up.. expect to be treated less than. My group was literally treated terribly by our waiter whom lacked any personality. Even the manager had a horrible attitudes and greeted nearly everyone but us.  I'm fine with high prices however my boyfriend had them bring out a cake and in the middle of them singing to me the waiter whispers in MY ear "there is a cake fee just so you know" we were told it was a slicing fee however I sliced it myself.. $5 a person for that.   Lastly the decor.. unorganized, dusty, distasteful.

Hs2h5zBYyRdrxEzmwUagnA.text: A very posh steakhouse located in the New York New York Resort/Casino.  The decor and ambiance has a very classy feel.  On the walls there are pictures of famous people.   It was a celebration dinner for my friend and we dined on surf and turf, prime rib, steak and King Crab legs. The prime rib was massive! And the other dishes were fresh and delicious. We also had side dishes of steamed carrots, Mac and cheese, fries and mashed Asiago potatoes.   The service is also very good here. It is a bit pricey, but you get your money's worth!

The atmosphere of the restaurant was exactly what we wanted  The service the food  Everything was perfect  We had the steak, crab legs, heirloom salad, an unbelievable red wine  We were very close to the kitchen and could watch the action which is rad

TsP1s1AtHDV0taIX4u_Q_Q.text: Old fashioned mesquit wood fried steak using dry aged for NY steak and wet aged for 65 days for my cowboy ribeye. Most people are not used to the wood fired steak and the char flavoring.  This is commonly found in Italy... where they use oak instead.  Typical yelp whine about the burnt is centered around a culture that fried or broil their steak.  Heck these folks probably use A1 and call that perfection.  Steak here is awesome, perfectly cooked medium rare, aged and just full of flavor! Spinach and bacon was however too punchy and vinegary for my taste robbing the spinach and bacon features.

yGqKPo0JYp75SjHz2wAWFQ.text: Ive never spent this much on a steak dinner, and i dont regret it. I went here with a friend while on vacation in Sin City. The service was excellent. We needed no reservation, it was on a Thursday night i believe. I even brought in my own drink container, a plastic 32oz container from a show we saw a few nights before. It was roughly a 80% whiskey, 20% Sprite mix, it was perfect. Ordered some crab cakes, and they were amazing. They were delicate and crunchy at the same time, and the sauce that was provided was delicious. I also ordered the wedge salad, and it had to be the best Ive had. Seriously, how do you make a wedge salad delicious. The steak was cooked perfectly, and my only regret was that i couldnt bring over the leftovers. I could almost cut it with my fork, it was so tender. Its not cheap here, but its definitely worth it.

wjOSrAcxi1DE-fcE1W-Z8A.text: Tell me how's it feel sittin' up there Feeling so high but too far away to hold me You know I'm the one who put you up there Name in the sky at..GALLAGHER'S! - Halsey (without me)  Nothing has changed about this steakhouse in years - and that's exactly how I like it. Old fashioned - always busy - wonderful prime rib and steak at New York New York. I had the prime rib the first time, it was super big and filling - excellent choice. This time I had the rib eye and it was also delicious, although the prime rib would be my first choice. They somehow ran out of lobster tails that evening..oh well! We got some scallops instead and it was cooked just right.   TOP 3 CAESAR SALAD'S I'VE EVER HAD IS HERE! No joke - I could eat their caesar salad every day. The salmon is very good also and a great size. Don't bother too much with the sides - enjoy your main course! Servers have always been welcoming and helpful here - feels great! Cheers!

H7QdnXADofw4pb5huT-7OA.text: We stopped in to see what the hype was about.  Ordered 2 signature dry aged NY steak and 1 cowboy ribeye.  Started the meal off with a classic caesar salad which was light but tasty.  For our sides, we ordered sauteed mushrooms, creamed spinach, and their daily special which was a roasted onion mashed potato.  The steaks came out with sides.  I cut into the steak which was tender.  Took my first bite...no taste.  Second and third was the same.  Asked the others on the table if it was me or the steak.  They all said agreed that the steak had no real flavor for being aged.  Other than being tender, it was a regular steak.  Would not spend that kind of money at Gallagher's again.

wX-9AaLanVvv6bj08IqTEQ.text: Our bread was served with a long hair intertwined in it. Marc was the Manager. He gave me a pat on the back and comped me $10 on some potatoes on a $300 bill.

rCFUvZnWKkCGVHSLbnSLog.text: Saw the dry aged steaks hanging outside of Gallagher's years ago but haven't had a chance to try it until today.  Pricing was pretty standard for a steak house on the strip.  I ordered the Dry Aged New York Strip(rare) and bacon mac and cheese.  Service was good as expected on any $50+ meal.  After ordering, it was about a 40 minute wait to receive my food despite the fact that I wanted it rare.  Steak tasted great and I surprisingly didn't have room for dessert.

c3lX8hNfR6NHi_Fw4KkE_Q.text: We came to dine here for dinner because while visiting the New York New York hotel the aging meats hanging outside caught our eyes. When we first arrive, the hostesses completely ignored our existence for about 5 minutes and then turned up to greet us. When we finally sat, our waiter came over and took our drink order. He was really nervous and was there on minute and would disappear the next. Our drinks also took forever. We figured he might have been new so it was okay. We ordered the appetizers which were the shrimp cocktail and the bourbon smoked bacon. The bacon was really good and they give you a nice slab. The shrimp were huge so that was definitely a plus. When it comes to the main entrees the rack of lamb, the branzino, and the tomahawk steak were ordered. The steak is cut table side and the bone on that thing is insane! The steak was good, but nothing out of this world. You would think with the aging process and all the hype that it would blow you away. It was good don't get me wrong, but not enough for me to want to come here for a steak again. There was no nice char on it and it wasn't all that melt in your mouth feel. My mother in law said the rack of lamb was amazing and she even had to share because they gave her a large portion. The branzino was also tasty! The parmesan and truffle steak fries were one of the sides we really enjoyed and the mushrooms were good. Would I dine here again if I came to Vegas, probably not, but at least we gave it a shot after that beautiful aging meat display they have outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ap_Bknvca3-OAb4mNcJueA.text: After several stays at the NY, NY, we finally decided to give Gallagher's a try before our show.  It is a very New York steakhouse with a lot of history.  The service was great, David made great recommendations.  We shared the Bourbon Bacon, delicious.  I had the aged NY Strip and my wife had the filet both with the bleu cheese sauce and and a side of onion rings.  The Toffee Pudding (not bread pudding) was great.  We will be back again

JiV2V9phiRU5BNEAAb33ng.text: Came here for a birthday dinner for one of our teammates. Our of all the steakhouses we visited in Vegas this time around (including Del Monecos) this was the most memorable.   The service was amazing, great atmosphere, and although pricey the steaks were better than the rest of the places. I ordered King Crab Legs - the portion I received took over half the table and I needed help to finish.   If coming for a birthday dinner they don't sing happy birthday but do have a cute chocolate dessert which comes with a chocolate that says "Happy Birthday".   Definitely a go-to in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Crab Legs. HUGE portion
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Center cut filet mignon
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Dessert

-h6BRMx2VwNw73mbRs0d-Q.text: Amazing beef quality and excellent customer service!  We had dinner here on the New Year's Eve, we were lucky enough to be able to get a reservation at 7:15pm; we arrive at 7pm but the hostess asked us to check with them right at 7:15pm with an impolite attitude. That was kind of odd, why can't we be seated a little earlier if we arrived early? Unlike we have arrived at 6:45pm. Not to mention we had walked over here all the way from Fashion Show mall - one star off here.  However, it got all better after we sat down! We were served by a nice gentleman; we ordered their prime rib and aged new york steak, and oh my god they tasted extremely flavorful and juicy!  We also had their creme brule, not the best we had but still very fresh.  Would definitely come back here when we go visit Vegas next time!

7YNu0wssmQZG3Gf1jeLniw.text: I asked my friend who visits Vegas a lot for a place where I could get a great steak dinner at a reasonable price.  He recommended Gallagher's, and I was happy that he did!  The service here was outstanding.  From the moment I sat down I felt like I had everything I wanted exactly when I needed it.  I sat at the bar, since I was eating alone, and the bartenders and servers were easily accessible.  I could not rave more about the service because it was as good as it gets.  The food was outstanding as well.  I started my meal off with a bowl of their very tasty New England Clam Chowder. I then ordered the New York Steak and the cheddar and chive mash potatoes (which was the "special spud" of the day).  The steak had great flavor.  My only complaint was that it was a little tough.  The mash potatoes were amazing!  I'm salivating thinking about them right now.  The meal was a great combination of food, and I was ready for a long nap after I was done.  I could not finish everything, but I was happy that I got to try it all.  I am really glad that Gallagher's was recommended to me.  It was an excellent experience and I will be sure to come back again the next time I want a great steak meal in Las Vegas.

I1qgmod1Vf1cdvqXEn7lqg.text: We came here for dinner on a Friday, it was pretty crowded, we had reservation and were seated quickly. The service was great and fast even thu the place was full. I had the porterhouse and my wife had the prime rib..both were great and cooked as requested.

jGPeDSLH5p4caRo9lttx-Q.text: Amazing!.  Filet Mignon and Alaska King Crab legs were delicious. Crab legs were 16"  inches filled with such sweet taste. Filet was so good; perfectly seared but not burned outside and meat was buttery tender.  Expensive but worth every dollar. On my best ever list.

OvmXNxVRnubSZRAPn-mJmw.text: Our food was okay. I had the ribeye stake and my boyfriend had the lamb. It wasn't the best stake I have ever had so the price did not met my expectation. However, the friend with good friend and our great waitress made it a great night!

R5aPkVaQJoVHhkH3-xmSIA.text: We had a wonderful dinner here. My husband and I were looking for a great steakhouse that wouldn't break the bank. It was wonderful! Steak was superb! We had the porterhouse which we share. Didn't even need steak sauce. My husband also ordered the creamed spinach and French fries- fries were very good. Overall wonderful!

Inr_Ls-4e3Pex9hapGBpqg.text: I have traveled extensively and been in restaurants in 83 different countries.   Gallagher's is by far the finest service and the best food I have ever had.  Wait staff went out of their way to make our experience top notch.  Pricey, but worth the $$...next time I return to Vegas, it will be on my list.

LJ-1G2iNS5MvdWC4Me0x9g.text: Best service and steak and lobster we've ever had.. Cooked to perfection and we come every time we're in Vegas. Always the best cuts of meet and outstanding service. They have the most delicious bread too.

f3w2YWryqelBeQ4lr5XytQ.text: I'm not sure if this place is under new management or something, but it's not what it used to be.  Service is slow, portions are generous, and the food and cocktails are just so/so.  We ordered Oyster Rockefeller and the oysters were gritty from being shelled and the presentation was really basic.  Flavor was OK, but nothing inspiring at all.  My wife ordered a heirloom tomato salad and that was quite good.  We both ordered steaks and while they were cooked properly, they were not seasoned at all.  I had the Cowboy Ribeye and it was pretty much flavorless and actually quite tough.  My wife had a filet and again it was cooked just right, but just not seasoned at all.  I really expected the quality of beef to be much better.  Additionally, our waiter was overwhelmed or just not up to the task of handling several tables, and was very slow....

v-aZhAN7WDV4JcdHnq3nAg.text: Don't go to Vegas much but if you can appreciate a piece of steak, seek no further... Gallagher's delivers. Save room for desert. A True must!!

Unlp5vA3tJPnRcTkDK_CLA.text: Needed a steakhouse to celebrate a birthday and this place did not disappoint!! The steak was excellente, the perfect taste, not too salty. Loved the charbroil taste and crust on the steak.  The sides were the best, potato puree and green beans are recommended. The service was great, will return!

rw9Otqhfs2fxvGepS_8S0Q.text: Dreadful experience at Gallagher's this weekend.  Horrible service.  The waiter actually wanted to argue with me about ordering an appetizer (didn't want me to order).  We had a large group and found out that he had done same at other end of table as well. Ordered the ribeye and was mediocre at best for a higher end steakhouse.  Two of the three others ordering the ribeye had same conclusion. Was told the crab was excellent by others in our party.  Also, I got violently ill about 30mins after leaving restaurant.  The only item that I ate that others in party did not eat (sides, apps, etc) was my ribeye and the drink that I was served by our waiter when he apologized for arguing.  After discussing my condition with physician that was part of our group (the next day), she is convinced that something was slipped into my food or drink.  The symptoms were not typical of normal food poisoning.  She called restaurant to discuss with management and her call was not returned. A bad experience all around and will not be back...

SXpFDbshIVIlnuoQUZkcug.text: My second trip here and as good as remembered. New York strip lion was perfect. All three sides we ordered - potato puree, onion rings and four cheese macaroni - featured large portions and were delicious. Staff was excellent. Prices were reasonable - what you'd expect. Fully recommend Gallagher's for a great casual steakhouse experience.

b-eiFAcSprf8kT4_16shXg.text: Started off with the worst old fashioned ever. Likely made with fanta and at the very least had a "splash" of soda. Guess what guys, no soda in a properly made old fashion.  Once we choked down the old fashions we decided beer was a safer option, hard to screw that up.  Waiter disappeared for 15 minutes, so we waived someone down and said we wanted to order some beers. He said he'd send our waiter. Instead two more old fashions showed up. Sent those back and ordered beers from the waiter.  Food finally shows up, steak was ok, cooked properly, right on the inside, but seemed pretty charred on the outside and overall was cold, like it had been sitting around a while. With the creamed spinach, the spinach was hardly done and overall was not very creamy. The mushrooms were a great mix of mushrooms with a nice smokey flavor, but also cold like they'd been sitting around even longer than the steak.   No idea where the other reviewers have been eating but if you've had a good steak in Seattle, San Francisco or Chicago, stay clear of Gallaghers.

c-hGRt_O7wTgXMVzKBanEQ.text: I'm not a huge steak fan but the pork chops are delish.  Although everything is a la carte, you'd be surprised how full you are after eating 5 lbs of meat.  :D  For those who are really into steakhouses, this is a good place to go...I personally prefer going to Emeril's in MGM for more variety.  Emeril's has a steakhouse too; Delmonico's.  $40 stea  Bathroom is sort of annoying because you share it directly with the food court area and there is always a line in the ladies room.  It sort of ruins the nice restaurant feel to step into the garish potty lighting.  Shrug....still keeping the 4 stars.

eqDF7QLxzU47wTD40vRaVg.text: My filet was very good. The service was very good. 45 minute wait with no reservation on a Saturday night, not bad. It was too bright and the wooden chairs have to go. Felt like being in a cheap Vegas restaurant. Prices are very high & I would of loved it if the ambience was not so Denny's.

GKy-P7OKOuOq3NYnMOhfZg.text: Just so you know I'm an avid steak eater, I live in Vegas so I've tried a bunch of steak houses, and I know what to look for when it comes to a great steak after going to some of the best steak houses Las Vegas and California has to offer. So let me start by saying that I'm giving this two stars because service was great and that was it. I took my parents here when they came to visit. So after checking Yelp for reviews but never thought that most reviews were from people that don't live here or go to steak houses much being that they're here for vacation that's it. My mother and I had ordered the 3 month aged New York strip and my Dad ordered the Ribeye. We also ordered 3 sides and some drinks. After cutting into it and trying it I was not impressed at all. For being aged and some what of a big deal for the restaurant I honestly could have made the exact same steak at home. The sides were not bad but to me were too small of a serving compared to other restaurants. I can also say the price was not bad compared to other restaurants being that after all the food and also three drinks and two beers the bill was only $250 which in my previous experiences was about $100 lower than usual. So let me end this by saying you want to try a different steakhouse before ending up here.

-JnIwYEnuvNs0ZwGbBrI4Q.text: We ate here for Christmas dinner while staying at the New York New York. I had the $48 dry/wet aged for 5 weeks  New York strip steak. It was TOUGH! I had to really saw at it to get a piece cut off and then chew for awhile. I was very disappointed in the quality of the steak. I had a better steak at Dick's last resort then I did here. Needles to say we didn't eat there again.

huu5eSRJAThhT36AkVS8pw.text: I went there this weekend with my boyfriend for our anniversary dinner. We were seated promptly at 7:15 (reservation time). It was a Saturday night so the place was packed, the service was great! Our waiter was attentive and made us feel like we were the only people he was serving.   I had the prime rib, medium rare, and the boyf had the cowboy rib eye medium rare as well. The meats were well cooked and delicious.  The prime rib was one of the best I've had. We had the cream spinach, it was  really yummy! The blue cheese dressing they have is sooooo good! Order the wedge salad, its a must!  I look forward to dining here again!! The prices are reasonable for a steak house. The sides are far less expensive than most places at $8-$10.  Dinner for two at about $140 (we didn't order alcohol).   P.S.  There's this lady that walks around taking cute pictures of you and your date, she sells the 2 portrait album for $45, (optional, she totally walks away if your not interested).

UV1-6owv1zhTqkjk7hSi2g.text: A great steakhouse amongst the excess of options that Vegas provides. We arrived at 7 on a Thursday and had reservations, though the place was not busy enough to require them. I ordered the filet mignon, medium, and my wife ordered the prime rib, also medium. Both were cooked perfectly, and the quality of the meat was extremely high.  For sides we had the yukon gold puree, very tasty, and green beans, also very tasty. They have a great drink selection, some nice house cocktails (I had the Fire and Ice I believe it was called, a fun mix of cucumber and jalapenos), and the service was great.  The only downside was the location/atmosphere. The entrance is directly from the casino floor, which I tend to like the restaurants set back more from the crowds, but once we were in the restaurant our table was seated far back inside, and it was nice and quiet.  Overall, a great place to eat for a nice meal with amazing steaks. Would definitely go back

0zx0t0wrlhR04P4HamMz2Q.text: If your looking for a beautiful steak and lobster dinner look no further this is it .. the best aged new York steak dinner you'll ever have...! Period

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef doing his magic!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best steaks in Vegas baby!

-KXJulyZoVj52KpwZ2Cu8Q.text: Not impressed.  Overall this place was good, but nothing outstanding. It was like something you  could easily make at home with a decent cut of meat. Well, I dont go to a steakhouse to get a home cooked meal, I go to eat something a cut above.  That being said, nothing was bad either, just not a standout. Service was attentive for what it's worth.

pWhlj7lsNwu9lCzk8LQeDA.text: I drove all the way from Southern California to come to Las Vegas is Gallagher steakhouse because I love the Gallaghers that's in New York City. I am originally and east coaster and when my grandmother flew out to California we decided to make the trip to Las Vegas to have our favorite dinner the eight hour round-trip drive was worth it. They don't rush you yes it's expensive but you're getting high quality beef if you go I would highly suggest the prime rib it's my favorite.

hFFQmN-zk5A4Sf8Dl_oEyw.text: YUMMY! We were ready to sit down after a long drive WITH A TODDLER. They accommodated us by sitting us where we asked to be seated (for everyone else's comfort) and brought bread right away so the baby would be happy, and he was. Between the great service and the incredible food, they definitely have a repeat customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our great dinner

JDx7pq0gcGfwSEJti7yaZg.text: I love the place. It's not the sexiest steakhouse for sure, but classy. The service is second to none. When you approach the restaurant and see the cases of aged beef out front, that's a good indicator. I was not disappointed. The food was fabulous. The portions are large, so if you're not starving, split some items, especially the sides. Great steaks though. Will return

AoCLOQ_fCLnZe_k-3VXhcg.text: Amazinggggggggggggggggggg!!!!!! Best Steak Ever...The Mac n Cheese was something else.. It was super awesome! The lobster.. oh man! This was the best dinner ever... Worth every penny.. Service was Great...

lE4tYDg6SvdUQhcZOvKQ-w.text: We dined here for dinner on Thanksgiving Day with our good friends that were visiting from Hawaii. I don't know where to begin, but this place was such a disaster.  Service was horrible and slow. Extremely slow. So it was Thanksgiving night and they were busy, but it wasn't a full house in the restaurant. Our server (I guess I'll be nice and not mention his name) was never around. I think we only saw him 3 times. The first time was when he took our orders. Then he disappeared for an hour. We also waited over an hour for our food. He finally zoomed passed us right before we got our food, and then WE had to flag him down to get some drinks. The third time, he brought us the bill. Horrible. The guy who refilled our waters provided better service!   The food wasn't too great in my opinion. The bread that they served us in the beginning was too hard and the butter was pretty frozen. I ordered the center cut Filet Mignon. The glaze on top of it was tasty, but the rest of the steak lacked flavor. It was also kind of dry. The bottom line: it needed salt. I also ordered the seasoned jumbo steak fries as my side. The seasoning made them taste weird. I couldn't really figure out was it was but it did leave a spicy after taste. The steak knives that they gave us were very dull as well. My husband and one of our friends ordered the dry-aged New York Sirloin. They both said it needed salt. Our other friend ordered the queen cut prime rib and enjoyed it. So at least one of us liked our food.   FYI - the bathroom is a hoax! You open the first door with a sign that says "restrooms." Then it leads you to a second door with a sign that says "restrooms." When you open that door, it leads you to the nearby restrooms in the casino. LOL.  The bottom line: Not recommended and the steaks need salt. You know its bad when you have to have salt, A1, ketchup, and whatever else to make your steak edible!

5VumBQ6tPjhKj-rdKm_Lag.text: Meat was very very good along with the side dishes. However, the service was terrible. Waiter messed up on order two times, other staff had bad attitude when I asked for a few dishes to share with others. Received requested horseradish towards end of meal. Never would I go back there again.  Hopefully your service will be better should you decide to try it. For the price we paid you would think management would instruct staff to be more attentive and courteous.

Y1hHT8nFinEoW4rfkkFDYQ.text: My wife and I had a wonderful date night here last night. Sat at the outside bar to people watch and have dinner and drinks. Our bartender was Shaun and he was amazing. Very good knowledge about the menu and different cuts of the meats. Brought out our food and drinks in a timely manner and engaged in conversation with us. Super friendly. The food was amazing. Pricey but totally worth every penny. Would definitely recommend this place for a fancy date night.

p_GdNaO7e4GRkNm8w17Jog.text: Amazing Rib Eye Steak with Mac & Cheese, outstanding.

rty269fQKjhRBlLilvoM8w.text: What can I say great service, great food!  I had a special with two fillet medallions and crab claws. The crab was sweet and fresh as expected and the hollandaise sauce was a great match.    My wife had the prime rib.  The cut was large and perfectly cut.    Definitely head back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MyJ3-GwbWICR8ZkU7D1v0w.text: This place is a classic NY steakhouse atmosphere first class food. The prices are slightly lower than other Vegas steakhouses, but the quality is on par. Also outstanding service.

SA0Pb9axRKrYGEBGJCncTA.text: Top notch food and service! Last dinner in Vegas so decided to hit Gallagher's for my fill of some prime rib. It came cooked perfectly, and the cut itself was high grade beef, not like at those "prime rib deal" places. The creamed spinach and mashed potato (with a trio of aged cheese) were the perfect compliments. My daughter had the New England clam chowder and it arrived filled with clams. She was so stuffed, her calamari was barely touched even though it's lightly breaded and deep fried preparation was too much for me to resist. You can expect excellent service to go with the meal. I will definitely try their signature steaks next time we are in Vegas.

70jr3eJ-xs9Y_9pgAfaLhg.text: We ate at Gallagher's before we absolutely loved it! It was amazing! We put it on our short list of to dos when we came back to Vegas for my birthday. We went and ate with 5 of our friends. I was super disappointed. 3 of us ordered steak and all you could taste was char. Very disappointed for what the meal cost! We did talk to waitress and she offered free drinks just to my husband and I not the other people at the table that had crappy steaks also. After talking to the manager she did end up taking off one steak again ignoring the other people's complaints at the table. We still got charged the 18% tip for the crappy meal. I was looking forward to coming to Vegas to have this great steak and it was terrible. Never again will we put it on our todo list. I know restaurants can have bad days too, but the waitress even stated that they had complaints for the last two days about them and that char taste.

ADG3i9AUY4IZyBveJAOKfg.text: Can't ask for a better steak. Porterhouse was huge and cooked perfectly. Mushrooms are definitely a must with the steak. I was very impressed. We got 3 porterhouse's all cooked perfect. Great job guys.

RPmfXyouVnP8VIbty80taw.text: A decent steakhouse, but not the best. Service wasn't anything special either. I'm a huge fan of rib eye, so I was disappointed when my rib eye was overcooked, tough, and bland. The dry aged New York strip however was pretty impressive.  Must try: - dry aged New York strip - prime rib - sticky toffee pudding w/ ice cream  Okay to try: - asparagus side - creamed spinach - cheesecake - caramelized onions  Don't need to try: - cowboy rib eye

o12-ULRilCDfSrGh0pd0iQ.text: Service was excellent, food was even better. We ordered the NY strip and the petite surf and turf. Both steaks were delicious and cooked to perfection. For sides we had the Mac and cheese and the asparagus. Both were very good as well. Overall a great dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite surf and turf $70
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY strip $48

RBtKUc3S66RheVGmrS0fVQ.text: The steak is good but doesn't make up for the horrible customer service. I was specifically told I didn't need a reservation for 4pm, however when I arrived before 4pm the host would not seat me despite what I was told by another employee. That was my second time returning within a 3 day time period. Great way to treat a returning customer!

6idkGxG98lbttxonlVnR7g.text: The New Yorker dry age steak was very good, cooked perfect, medium. I had the creamed spinach which goes very well with steak. I'll be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aged New York strip with cream spinach, it was every bit as good as looks, Cooked medium,what a great steak dinner

1IDmxwoJ0TG69fz-zwG3yQ.text: Excellent food! Was here over Christmas with a friend and we shared some steaks and side dishes. It's an a la carte menu so you can order to share.  The dry-aged New York strip is the best! We also tried their filet mignon which was very good, nice and buttery; but the dry-aged NY strip blew it out of the water. We also ordered the roasted Brussels sprouts and the Yukon gold potato puree - fabulous...and fabulous!

3PEETSxMPA7hkxUJ7IQ9wA.text: If you find yourself in Las Vegas, make sure that you save room for dinner and get to Gallagher's. This location is as close to a replica of the original as you can get.   From the moment we walked in, the staff was professional but friendly and were seated right away. As you look around, there are pictures of iconic figures all around. We were seated in a back room, walking through a half full main area near the bar, then past an empty area to a back room. I jokingly said to the hostess "Did you hear about us? Is that why we are going to the back all alone?" She told me that they just opened this area. I countered with "If no one else is seated in this area in 10 minutes, we are moving to the main area." Would you want to sit in a giant room all alone? Sure enough another couple was seated near us and the hostess just smiled and winked at me.   Dinner was a Rib-eye for me with crispy onion strings and the house specialty, the Sirloin.  We also ordered green beans and steak fries. If there was a word that completely describes the deliciousness of this steak, I haven't found it yet. Our waiter Aris suggested a dessert that we could share of Toffee pudding. It was fantastic.   Overall this is one of the best places to eat in NY NY. You would be doing yourself a disservice if you do not experience Gallagher's.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy Rib-Eye
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NYNY Sirloin

mQ_Y1bcN2WfcMGA6OqNUCw.text: Their signature steak, the NY steak is delicious and tender.  Taste is a bit unique as the dry aging adds a slightly more intense beef taste.   I am a big beef eater but the steak is a bit too big.  I finished it but it was a bit of a chore.   Suggest trying 2 steaks for 3 people and getting 2 -3 sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged- grilled to perfection.

WWXHvMJ1nYFRjRGXbU0iXQ.text: Go to Vegas once or twice a year. Always wanted to go to Gallagher's but never seemed to happen. Finally on our Feb. 2017 trip we made advance reservations for Valentines Day and had dinner there before our 8pm show at The Park theater next door.  Here's the good. The place is nice looking enough. Our server Derek was fantastic -- very personable and excellent at his craft. In addition to him, there's a person that busses the table and came by often to make sure our water glasses were always topped off.  And after our salad course made sure all bread crumbs were wiped from the table (a bread basked of sour dough French and cranberry rye is served). Truly great service!  We each had Caesar salad that was very fresh. Served on a flat plate, the romaine leaves are left long, drizzled with dressing and croutons. So one cuts the lettuce themselves. Salad was tasty.  We ordered 3 sides -- creamed spinach, mushroom medley, and pureed Yukon gold potatoes. Sides were okay.  Here's the thing though.....ordered their Signature steak -- NY Strip bone in ($48). Ordered medium rare and cooked perfectly. Problem was the meat. It had grizzle and way too much fat. It just was a poor cut of meat and they tout it as their Signature cut?!?!  Derek was sympathetic and offered amends.  He offered to have them cook a new one, but we did not have time for that with our upcoming show. He offered to comp dessert but again didn't have time or cared for dessert then either. I thanked him, told him I appreciated that and we'd just take the check. He brought the check and he didn't charge us for either salad. Really a stand up thing to do and I didn't even ask for any compensation.  So 5 stars for service, 5 stars for knowing how to take care of a customer.....but darn it.....it's a steakhouse and the steak just wasn't good. Maybe we'll give them another shot one day.

p1o56W3SkkHcUs-vqivtEA.text: The filet came drowning in this awful sauce, despite this not being referenced on the menu.  Really, I'm paying $50 for a top quality steak just so you can ruin it with some silly sauce?    I could have been eating chicken or fish, the sauce was so strongly flavored, it would have been impossible to tell.  I sent it back and they brought me a naked steak, but they didn't season it.  The by the glass Wine Menu is laughable for a steakhouse of this supposed quality.  I'm surprised they didn't have Barefoot listed--that was about the quality level of most of their wines.  The Creme Brulee was way overcooked and chewy.   Our waiter was really good, but everything else about   I'd recommend picking pretty much any other steakhouse in Vegas.  Frankly, there's a Nathan's hot dog at NYNY, even that would likely be a better choice.

gdDWDuk6IYNWsAg-vLvkcA.text: So good this is now our go to place for a nice meal in Vegas, well this and Oscar's downtown. Not only do they have the nicest wait staff and bartenders on the strip, the food is delicious. Portions are large enough to split if you order a couple sides, the mashed potatoes and creamed spinach are favorites. The shrimp cocktail is huge and has a bit of a spicy kick. The filet is tender and flavorful but the prime rib...so good and it's at least half a cow in size. I'm very picky with prime rib and now Gallagher's is #2 in my top 5- 1. La Cave in Costa Mesa,  2. Gallagher's Las Vegas, 3. Houston's in Irvine, 4. Captain Jack's Huntington Beach and 5. Northwood's Inn La Mirada. Sit at the bar for people watching and faster service, we make reservations as backup in case the bar area is full.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The prime rib was one of the best I&#39;ve had.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly medium rare prime rib.

pABwAq7ZxKoS06Be5j8OHg.text: I would not recommend this steakhouse.  My wife and I went there last night for my birthday dinner and the steak I had the "signature" bone in NY strip" was so tough I could not cut it.  They brought me a different one 10 minutes later and it was not much better.  My wife had the Prime Rib that was just a hint better than OK. For a $150 meal we felt slighted and will not return.  The cocktail was delicious...

h22FVT0oW1-cRoPGqyONZw.text: The waiters were very friendly and the food was very very good!:) We had rib eye and fillet mignon and both steaks melted in our mouth! So good!! I also ordered a cocktail and it was good:) the clams and mushrooms that we ordered on the side were very very good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye!:) Yummmm!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fillet mignon! Melts in your mouth!!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams were soooo good!

uJbLz6baYZ1GRn67TSR8CA.text: One of the best aged pieces of beef I have ever had the pleasure of eating. This is one of the first time I've ordered a cut and it come out exactly how I'd want it cooked.  The portions are very large as well.  I swear I needed to waddle out after this dinner.  The service is also unmatched.  After every sip of water my glass was refilled almost instantly, it almost become a game against the server to see if I could drink my water before he came.  The potato sides are wonderful, I would highly recommend.   Whatever they're doing, they should keep it coming.

P1UQYscNAriYi2axVSWXDw.text: Horrible taste of food for the price you pay. Everything was cold. Mac and cheese taste like starch and the steak is like rubber. Never again!

La-42N7XC_Rh33R3815kZA.text: Went there this past weekend.  Unfortunately, the Shrimp for the appetizer was the star of this meal.  We both ordered the aged steak and it was ok, not great.  I don't mind the price, if you want a good steak you are going to pay for it but this was not a good steak.  It was ok,  I expected the steak to be more tender than it was.  The Blackened Shrimp appetizer was exceptional but the steak was lacking.

xmMCUsfCknqP9u_D_nqboA.text: I was here last week during a convention and took a group of clients here for dinner. They had been here before, but I had not. They selected this place and I was confident they knew what they were doing in choosing where to go. From the moment we sat down it was top notch. The  atmosphere is nice and quiet, and the menu is excellent. The steaks were cooked perfectly and the drinks and desserts rounded the night out. I would come back and recommend this to anyone headed to Vegas. All thinks considered in LV, the price wasn't too bad either.

aubMbClEFKev3szk6XMw5A.text: This is a nothing special steak house.  I had their signature dish--bone-in dry-aged NY strip.  It was ok but by no means memorable.

EvnjJSYhtEwMKfsUJgGJyA.text: - Asked for medium rare filet mignon and dry aged new york strip - received it on a blue rare side. I heard that's medium rare in Vegas and have nothing against blood on my plate, so maybe it is ok. - The meat itself was good but why so underseasoned? We prefer our steaks seasoned aggressively with black pepper and truffle salt. Comparing to this, Gallaghers steaks had no special taste at all. - The only thing worth to come back - seasoned jumbo steak fries. One of the best fries ever! - Oysters Rockfeller - tasty and seasoned nicely. - Service was great, our water glasses were filled timely. - Why keep an annoying lady with camera walking around asking if you want a picture??  Overall: I believe there are better places to have a good steak in Vegas so we will keep searching for it.

1Vd3pYDLPmWpyLCknA5Xdw.text: The reason I give them only 2 stars is because the way me and my friend were greeted by the host. She was very rude and unwelcoming. My friend did not wear the proper dress code. Instead of explaining us nicely that he needs to change she refused to let us in, and acted very unprofessionally. I want to say that the food was good, but she ruined our evening and I left the place with a bad taste.

hMxh3w5wbvAhm-KdZUVcIQ.text: This place is more than solid - the food and service are both exceptional.  We had a nice meal there in late February 2017.  Yes, it is a Steakhouse in Las Vegas.  Yes it is a bit pricey.  But everything was really first rate.  The New York steak was excellent quality and perfectly cooked.  The Cauliflower side dish was so good we ordered an extra portion "to go".  The drinks are generous and the service is very professional.  All in all, a highly recommended place.  Why not 5 Stars?  Because we save that for once in a lifetime kinds of meals.  This was very, very good - you should eat here.

AzuRIB81SvAtspUovCk5pg.text: Beautifully executed meal especially given the size of our table!  The wait staff was on queue every time.  Our drinks were never empty, water was always filled and the wine was always being poured.  Excellent service!  As for the food, I'm not a huge meat eater so I decided to forego the whole reason behind this restaurant and opt for 1lb. of King Crab legs and then munch on a few bites of steak from other plates in our party.  My legs were quite substantial, however they got cold fast since they come split in 1/2.  Not a bit deal, but when you're paying $45 for a plate of food you'd like it to be warm.  I also had the chance to taste the New York Strip and Ribeye, both cooked to perfection, nice and tender.  Our table decided to order several sides to share including the asparagus, mac and cheese and something else that escapes my memory (too many bottles of wine).  All the sides were absolutely amazing and the asparagus was cooked perfectly.  Great experience eating at Gallaghers and I would certainly recommend it to anyone.  Know before you go:  the bathrooms are a mile away so don't drink too much!!

1OqOLTg-jr46Zrc4ku-kRA.text: Our dinner was disappointing, we were looking forward to this dinner and expecting a special treat, especially because the dry aged ribeye steaks are displayed on a glass case and they look delicious, they were seasoned ok, but there was no wow factor, it just tasted like an outback steak and to top it off it was chewy. My husband cooks better steaks from Publix than Gallagher's cooks its dry aged steaks. Also drinks took a while to come out, and the sides didn't make up for it, the mac and cheese was bland and I didn't care for the consistency, overall very disappointing, I wouldn't go back.

HyRBr3tkzrK2Qrw1PXdNww.text: Best. Steak. Ever!   We chose this place based off reviews and because it's one of the only upscale restaurants that allow you to bring a baby and my husband and i needed a date night! Yay!   Ordered the ribeye, porterhouse, yukon potatoes, asparagus, bacon mac and cheese. Oh and request a side of roasted garlic if you're a garlic lover! (It's not on the menu) my husband and i both thought the ribeye was the best but the porterhouse was seriously neck and neck. We plan on revisiting and ordering everything the same!  Everything was seriously so good, the most moist delicious flavorful steak I've ever had and I've been to steakhouses triple the price in California. Amazing.   For drinks we got a moscow mule, ew ick save your money! And a white Russian, yum!!  And lastly, our waiter chris was very very very friendly. He even brought over a baby spoon from the kitchen so our baby could eat some mac n cheese and potatoes with us :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye and porterhouse. Amazing! Must go!

woTnwQHrWQikQ0FT6wL8pQ.text: Exceptional service! Very attentive, they made sure we always had what we needed. Even the bus boy was awesome!! The ribeye was the best we've ever had! Crab was a perfect combination of salty and sweet!!

U6z0bdnyngw4MyLmINN6Gg.text: Party of 4 , would give it 3.5 stars.... Tried the Prime rib (not that good) The aged NY steak (good) and the Fillet Mignon (very good!). Prices are good for a steak house in Vegas and they have a decent wine selection.  The prime rib was the disappointment only because I read so many super positive reviews here on Yelp about it so it raised the expectations..don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad but it wasn't as good as so many yelpers thought!  Hope this helps your selection on your next visit to Gallagher's

N-vh1RPjZ45WiU1IxnsHSA.text: My husband and I decided to have our anniversary dinner at Gallagher's.  Since we were staying at New York New York, I called down to the concierge to make a reservation for our dinner and let them know we were celebrating an anniversary.  They said the reservation was made and all I had to do was show up.  We show up at our reservation time only to find out that our reservation wasn't actually made.  Not sure if that's the concierge's fault or it was lost in the mix at the actual restaurant.  Either way, I was a little annoyed.  Our server was Bryan, and he was great.  He was very descriptive with the menu options we had questions about and was open about letting us know what his personal favorites were.  My husband went all out and ordered the New York New York which included their dry aged strip steak and a whole lobster.  I went for my usual 8oz filet mignon with a side of mashed potatoes (potato puree is what they called it).  As a starter, we decided on the fried calamari.  A trio of bread was brought to our table, which is always nice.  Their olive bread was different, but a good different. It had that briney flavor, but it wasn't too overpowering. Almost immediately, our calamari came out.  It was perfectly crispy and flavorful, but a little on the chewy side.  A few minutes later, our entrees came out.  My filet was ordered medium and came out more of a medium well.  Not juicy at all.  My husband's steak was cooked perfectly, but the lobster tasted like it was left in the water for maybe a minute too long...again, a little chewy.  Service was great, but the quality of the food wasn't what as we expected.

Eq9TqGyvSFv8rLC6PIHJsA.text: One of the best steaks I've ever had...very, very good. For sides, we ordered the green beans and mashed potatoes. Both were very good- however the server mentioned that the sides were portioned for two people - I would argue that both were really a slightly large portion for one person- two would be stretching it. Overall still love it because the steak was really good (I ordered a filet mignon prepared medium).

9VVbvKvtk-bZhq4X4XzXfA.text: We always walked past this restaurant on trips to Vegas and finally decided to make reservations. Reservations were very easy with open table, we didn't even have to call. The staff was courteous, however, they did not mention their team approach to serving nor did they mention what makes their dried NY steak different from the typical NY steak.   The food was delicious. My boyfriend got the dried NY steak and I had the filet mignon. For $45 a steak, you can't go wrong with Gallager's. we also ordered a side of sauteed beans and the potato puree. This was more than enough food for us and left no room for dessert.

J6kQgAq8caLW0OyObO7Nqg.text: Dinner takes SOOOOO LONG.  Waiting 40 min for our steak is toooOOO LONG.  Not fun when you're already drinking, killed my buzz.  The steak was pretty good, but sides were average- still I was hungry and went well with my steak, I especially like the creamed spinach. Again, the wait just TOO LONG, but they did have a big system error and their computers broke down.  LONG wait and older crowd.  If you want to spent a few hours over a steak, this could be a choice

d5asbsFVY_uy4IDIuHf1PQ.text: Took my girlfriend here the other night because she kept complaining about how she needed a steak. I knew if I didn't get here a good steak she would throw a fit all night, so I opened my wallet and fed the beast. First off, I would suggest making a reservation here if you don't want to wait awhile, this place gets busy and stays busy. We arrived at our reserved time and were seated right away in a little corner of the restaurant. It was a nice cozy little table, a little too little, but was situated where there was less noise. The restaurant was extremely loud due to the proximity of the tables, so just don't expect the most romantic dinner out here.  The service was spectacular, 5 seconds after we were seated, our drink orders were taken and the menu was explained to us. All portions of the meal were perfectly timed and the servers worked with me to get us to our 930pm show on time.  As for food. We got the seared diver scallops as an appetizer, caesar salad as the second dish, and the dry aged new york strip and cowboy ribeye steaks with the bernaise sauce. Sides are ala carte and served separately, but I ordered the creamed spinach and grilled asparagus. Everything tasted great, but the steak portions are no joke, the pictures on this page do them no justice. I barely finished half of my steak and had to take the rest home. If I could go back I would have eliminated one of the sides from my order and possibly even the caesar salad and I would have still been full. Gallagher's steaks seemed a little tougher than what I was used to, perhaps it was because they were dry aged, or maybe because they were just that thick of a cut. My bill with all of the above and 1 glass of wine came out to $169.  If you are in the area give Gallagher's a whirl, and come hungry.  P.S. the leftovers were delicious.

f6FDWnFACkdEEiglzTme_g.text: If you are having drinks at the bar, check your bill closely. We went tonight and were over charged 1-2$ per drink. Would have given them a nice tip to compensate, however since they did this to us and some ladies sitting down from us, they received nothing!!!

iXwmeVxlD65EU6Ge0YiKlQ.text: Gallaghers was good. Upscale Las Vegas without the pretense.  Great Steaks, as you'd expect. Service was good if a bit impersonal.

ffGvEbJNaRZy23DsV7FBXQ.text: We've been here several times over the past 10 years and have always enjoyed perfection. So we were surprised to be disappointed on our last visit. We were in a hurry to catch a Cher show at the Park, so sat at the bar, ordered a bottle of champagne and ordered our meal. My salad came lacking the cheese the bartender had said would be on it. I mentioned it to him and he expressed surprise but didn't offer to get some for me. No big deal.  Then the medium rare filet arrived medium well, and it was stringy, dry and tasteless.  We didn't have time to request a new one so I ate it. Next day, I wished I'd sent it back, but with the champagne and everything, I didn't want to kill the evening. So very very disappointed.

8WO5bx7FuMGFs12LfkvR3w.text: Had the ribeye medium well my jaw hurts  From chewing should of got it med  Waiter was bad should of told me

VlONzFelQ0JTbulzIJpkhQ.text: Best steak I have ever had!   It is a coincidence on this site that there is hundreds of reviews f great experiences. GO HERE!!!  If you have a nice dinner planned and like steak, this is your stop. I had the porterhouse with peppercorn and asparagus...WOW the asparagus were huge and not hard at all, the steak was so tasty and tender. Medium rare is the way to go!!  Just do it, you won't regret it!

VR8yiXKw8HVlo-irVgsKKg.text: Took our group of nine to dinner. Cocktails are 5 star, no complaints. Those that ordered filet mignon and rack of lamb also perfect. But the one sea bass order was horrible. It had a fish smell and fish taste, definitely not fresh. DO NOT ORDER FISH!  And the lone bake potato order came cold. Overall, some orders were perfect, others not so much.

IiAyNI1DCnZIzw3uxFgRGg.text: Best food ever!!! Cowboy ribeye is so delicious and clam chowder is the best I've ever had. Nothing compares to Gallagher's food. My boyfriend and I ended up coming here two nights in a row because it was so good. Service was great too.

v4nCmc3FvAS8-FQCD2Xnxw.text: The Wagu Ribeye has incredible flavor.  Perfectly charred on the outside and seasoned to perfection.  We added a 12 oz lobster tail perfected steamed and full of flavor.   Definitely worth the money.

dDBp1cBIdqCWY4j1qKrGWQ.text: Steak is in very generous portion with affordable price.  Why not 5 star. As a server offering wine or liquor is normal but not pushing. Not everyone is drinking especially we are coming with kids. I know this is Vegas.  We will drink when not with kids. We still spend 150 ++ in your restaurant for party of 3.

DNDohJPQkNhfBIf6Cur8VA.text: Delicious meat, but a bit disappointed by the sides. The puree is amazing and it would be sad to miss it. Sadly the creamed spinach are very heavy which is stepping into the steak's role. The green beans and mushroom were without any surprised.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged New York strip

SKQK6OZuS2Npiq7Yj-apeA.text: We were late and they were able to accommodate a large party in a very reasonable time. We had the soup and it was delicious. Donna was an awesome waitress.

PDRzjFisB1w2hwEX8Z9fGA.text: As a steak lover, we saw this place while prowling the Strip for places to eat. The dry aged beef sealed it for us. Service was great and the wild mushroom medley was the best I have ever had. Unfortunately, I could not say the same for our steaks.   Steaks were cooked just right. But it was neither very tender nor did it have that dry aged flavor. I was really disappointed. I use Ray's the Streaks in Northern Virginia as the bar for dry aged beef. Sadly, this was lacking.

xLCC050pxbjPo-NRerhIrA.text: Dry-aged is king, and Gallagher's does it best.  I am in Las Vegas about 8 times a year for work, and I eat at Gallagher's every time I'm in Las Vegas. It's my favorite restaurant in town.   When I get in steak debates with people, I insist that they come here with me. I'm more than happy to buy them a meal (avg. plate about $45 pp)  to show them what dry aged meat can be. Gallagher's nails it with perfect broiling. I usually get the cowboy ribeye. Despite being almost the size of a dinner plate, it's always impeccably cooked.  The texture of the steak is what will win you over. Tender, soft-cutting, and sooooo easy to eat. A medium cooked ribeye from Gallagher's is something I daydream about. You'll see.   All of the sides are incredible. And huge. My favorite are the steak fries. Forget what you're picturing in your head: this is a HUGE baked potato, quartered lengthwise, coated with spices and served with a killer spiced ketchup sauce.   Also try the pork chops (huge) and just about any of the desserts. Creamed spinach is also very, very good.  Again, this is my favorite place to eat in a city full of great eateries. Don't miss it.

ZcM_xvf7gYhT2CPqcJ3EyQ.text: Went here for my 30th birthday dinner after seeing Zumanity just "down the way" at NY NY.  Seriously the BEST filet Mignon I've ever had and I'm a midwest girl so I guess that says a lot...cooked to perfection!  I ordered the Filet with Bearnaise and we split one of their side specials...blue cheese bacon mashed potatoes (also YUM!).  My husband got the New York Strip, which I believe they age in house and he said it was easily the top 4 steaks he's had (he's way more of a steak guy than I am) and it was enormous!  I think we could have had about 3 baskets of the grain fruit bread they offered with the meal as well.  Our server was spot on and very helpful.  The only downside, which you could tell management was trying to remedy, was a group of middle-aged drunk guys who were being really loud and obnoxious (won't deduct any stars for those idiots' disruption).  After the meal, we were offered a dessert menu and my husband asked the server if they had any birthday desserts since we were celebrating.  The server brought out a little scoop of cookies n' cream ice cream with a homemade birthday chocolate and candle...nice touch :) Definitely made for a special evening and we will surely come back when we visit Vegas again.

00j1z4Y6eKAybwVV5HP9Lw.text: One of the better steakhouses in Vegas.  I went during an off night with a small party, they had the prime rib and the bone in New York. Both were Excellent.  I had a Porterhouse.. the price was a warning sign. If you are paying $45 for a New York and your porterhouse has a combined New York and Filet but yet it only costs an extra $5 chances are you are getting a little less than both.    I got a thin porterhouse that was shoe leather. Too thin to cook to rare/medium without burning it.  The wait staff picked up something wasn't right, I just told them it wasn't acceptable,and that I wanted a bone in New York as a replacement. Instantly the steak was gone, and the manager came out and apologized, and I got my replacement steak rather quickly.   The New York was very nice and one of the better ones I've had at a restaurant. Flavor was buttery with a nice taste due to the aging process. Very tender.. even the fat was good.  The Caesar Salad was average, but the wedge salads were pretty good. Salads weren't huge for the price, but the presentation was nice.  No comments on the seafood we never had any.  Service was excellent, however it is Vegas, so don't be surprised you're sitting next to a couple in beach attire.  The price is average  for USDA prime steakhouse.

1lLmjkAEs3mtLQTfMKIgfA.text: I had a reservation there for New Year's eve of 2018. We went there with my family. We ordered the food it usually takes about 30-40 minutes until they bring the food orders talk about 1 hr and half until they brought the food but the food was so cold in the service was horrible because the manager told him what's going on the manager was unprofessional didn't even help us with anything she just said that she's so worry are very busy so and so I will never ever go there even if I'm starving to death bad experience of all.

ly0fgiXWlhiIak05VuVpBQ.text: Solid Steakhouse but I would expected more from a LV strip steakhouse.   The service was reasonably good considering we were a table of 20.  The wait staff hustled but the bar staff were slow on the delivery to our table.    The steak was good but not amazing.   I have had enjoyed better steaks both on and off the strip for less money.    All of the sides were adequate and plentiful.  There was more than enough food and nobody left hungry.    I would return here if someone else is picking up the tab but if I am buying, there are other steakhouses I that would be higher on the list of places to go.

YLc5zrtqjf-A0YYA-msOVQ.text: So 3 months in row in Vegas had Charlie Palmer, cut   And none come even close to ghallagars.   Amazing rib eye!

k13Aa8ygE4qggNI1pRDNEQ.text: Food had no flavor and very cold. Ordered 3 different types of meat dishes and they all were overly dry!!! Also waiter had a very rude attitude! Not worth $100 a plate!!!!!!!!!! ( pizza next store if 10x better and 20x cheaper)

L31pxGgGwirp8OeNhq61BA.text: This was probably the worst steakhouse I've ever been to. Apparently they do not know the difference between medium and well done. We all ordered between medium and medium well, however 3 out of 4 of the steaks came out well done. Not worth the price. If you want to go for the fancy steakhouse don't waste your time and money here just go to Ruth's Chris better food at practically the same prices.

kQ5pOOuPs_sGUsEFO9xVHw.text: This place was AMAZING! Pricey, but amazing! I got the Aged NY Strip with the King Crab Oscar on top and my husband got the Cowboy Ribeye. They are huge!! We asked for medium-rare and they came out cooked to perfection with just the perfect sear and flavor.   We also got the house special which was loaded mashed potatoes that were so cheesy and delish! Yum! Sides are plenty big to share.   We made table reservations the day before and we were seated asa we arrived. Our table was in the back, in a room that had a very romantic ambiance. The lighting and the table were perfect.   The staff was very nice and accommodating.  Overall it was a great night. Food/steaks were perfection. We highly recommend it. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aged NY Strip with King Crap Oscar topping. Cooked medium-rare. It was amaaaazing!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy Ribeye.. yummmmm!

m9zUI2OZ9cJxCyH_POl0RA.text: Had a late dinner at 8:45pm. Made a reservation and seated quickly. Our waterboy was incredibly friendly and chatted with us. Our waiter was great too. You will see people both dressed casually and in semi formal wear. I had a cowboy ribeye 16oz and hubby had prime rib. We ordered seasonal veggies to share and drank water as we already had plenty of drinks during the day. We were served bread and our meal arrived in approx 30min. My steak was incredibly well marbled, tender, perfectly pink throughout with an excellent smoky spiced crust. They provided fresh horse radish which tasted great. Hubby and I swapped a bite of our plates and agreed both our steaks were perfect. My steak standards are high but this place hit the mark!!! I devoured my entire pound of steak. Sorry no pics but check the cowboy ribeye and prime rib pics others have posted.  Too full for dessert but we'd definitely eat here again. Our bill with a 20% tip was US$136.

Ld1CSVw_yDuH8plTAvsPKw.text: The filet is so soft! Amazing steak and sides. French green beans are my recommendation. Yum

FW7sp1xmiV_MhYrOvsU9xA.text: I've eaten at a few Vegas steakhouses (not too many) and really enjoyed Gallagher's. If you haven't tried dry aged meat you owe it to yourself to try it at least once, it has an "earthy" type that you'll either love or hate. I've had it once before and really liked it, my wife wasn't sold on the idea so she ordered a non-dry aged filet and enjoyed that.   The place was crowded but not totally full on a Monday night around 8:30, they use Open Table so I just made a reservation through there. This place has more of a steakhouse feel than some other places in Vegas hotels/casinos. They bring you a side of a couple types of bread and butter which is enjoyable enough. I added a tomato and heart of palm salad which is one of the best salads I've had in a long time. As for the main course, the dry aged bone-in NY strip is their signature and it's a monster at around 18oz. I made a valiant effort but couldn't quite finish it. This is the best steak I've had in quite awhile and the dry aging isn't just hype, you can really taste the difference. As for the sides, the green beans were okay but nothing special so I'd pass on them next time. I was stuffed after my meal but split a slice of good but not amazing cheesecake, it's worth a try if you're wanting dessert.  Service was very friendly and efficient without hovering too much. I really enjoyed my meal and would come back here. Oh, they do the tourist thing where they want to take a picture to sell you, I was stuffing my piehole when she came by and respectfully declined the offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread

62fDnL_W2MNGUGivMmfqug.text: We've come to Gallagher's for Thanksgiving for the past 4 years and we've always been very pleased with the food and service. This year, however, we were pretty disappointed. Those in our group that got the turkey dinner were very disappointed. The turkey was rolled turkey and not cut from the actual bird. For the price ($42) it should've been fresh turkey not processed. I ordered the Cowboy Rib Eye because I've been wanting to try a steak there. I asked for medium well and although the majority of what I ate was cooked properly, when I got closer to the bone the rib eye was very undercooked. People who got the turkey dinner also were complaining that some of the food wasn't very hot. And to top it all of we were seated in the most inconvenient table in the restaurant. The table is separate from the rest of the restaurant and is located next to the kitchen. The heat from the kitchen was extremely uncomfortable and good luck if the person on the inside of the booth needs to go to the restroom. Also, because the table is somewhat hidden it felt like our waiter forgot about us. It took about 30 minutes for us to get iced tea and wine. Because we've always had a great experience, we were very disappointed with this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our view from our table

irt7lbzjAemnwv049-2bMg.text: We have been eating at Gallaghers for over ten years. We love our waiter John. In fact, he is the reason we continue to dine there. The food is always consistent.    Our only complaint is that the  current chef took the shrimp  scampi off the menu Five of us dine here, and three of us order the scampi.  I would say, it is one of the main reasons we go.  After all these years, I would hate to part ways.  But truly without the scampi we may have to look for a new restaurant.   Someone needs to rethink the new menu changes.  If it ain't broke don't fix it.

52r0027TLDPz1WofmZeq1g.text: The worst steak house. The food is at the best mediocre. People fall for False advertisement. Seriously you can find a lot of good quality aged steak elsewhere. The meat was cold in the middle. I had to send it back. Then they over cooked the same meat and brought it back. I wouldn't waste my money in the place. Try " Gordon Ramsay Steak". 100 times better. Don't fall for the advertisement.

P4MyF13Lq4mL2xnliV8IoQ.text: Food was beyond delicious! Service was excellent too! Husband and I definitely enjoyed this place! Can't wait to go back. Pork belly, Dry Aged New York Strip, NEW YORK STRIP STEAK & FRESH MAINE LOBSTER

GNWQ2kzwP4Pk2uFEomjMLg.text: We were a little disappointed...  He ordered the dry aged strip and I ordered the filet mignon. They over cooked his, but it had good flavor. Mine was small for the price but had amazing flavor! I ordered it medium and the last piece was definitely rare and left on my plate. Lol  We shared the 4 cheese macaroni, garlic mash, and asparagus. In the other Yelper photos the asparagus looks woody and unappetizing. Looks are deceiving!! It was delicious and tender! Almost seemed like maybe they marinated it prior to cooking? The mac was disappointing... Like dry Velveeta and shells. However the bacon they put in it was smoky and amazing!! Totally saved the dish! The garlic mashed potatoes were more like garlic soup. :/  Staff were polite but not friendly. There's a difference, yes. They didn't offer to box up our leftover sides or his steak. Just cleared the table and brought a dessert menu. We didn't get dessert, but the table next to us did. They looked great! (big!)   Bathrooms are outside the restaurant in the casino, but nice.  This meal was well over $100 and we could have done better at home for half the price. :(

PboEcIYvZNmey7QEK7AupA.text: This place is so bad. Did the hostess or server ask if my wife and I were celebrating any special occasion? No. Comfort of the restaurant would get a negative 10 from me for hard wooden chairs with no padding and cold air blowing from the vents in January. I guess common sense is not so common. The server seemed annoyed that my wife amd I were there. The other servers seemed much more friendly. She was very pushy and seemed rushed amd trying to rush us and there were many empty tables in the restaurant for obvious reasons. As far as the food goes, it also was bad. Best part of our meal? Mashed potatos, they were good but not great. I had the signature 28 day dry age new york which was so tough and chewey and flavorless. My wife had the salmon. She liked the salmon except it wasn't cooked all the way through. I saw a manager but at no point did she ever come ask us how things were. It would seem from top to bottom this place just doesn't care. The ambiance is super cheesey too. Tries to come off as high end but it is so not high end. Ive had better steak at outback steakhouse for a fraction of the price with staff that care. Of all the steakhouses in las vegas i would recommend any of the others, it couldn't be worse. Gallaghers seemed they didnt want us there. They are getting what they want, I won't be back and I recommend everyone else save their time and money.

iubZB-Tgyk_E3_rzFXG-7w.text: Las Vegas is as tough a market for steakhouses  as anywhere in the world. Gallagher's is NY NY's product and holds its own. It's meats are on display and are unquestionably excellent quality. A combination of dry/wet aged meats are available for the discerning meat eater.  NY NY is a middle tier casino resort and this is arguably their top product. It's fittingly casual but don't let that fool you, the quality is there. Look for fresh seafood specials as well, I had a crab leg here the size of my arm (almost)!   I would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZI9K0YyFgRO1kojk-4vb-w.text: Gallagher's is good but overpriced.  Great (free) cranberry bread, good soup du jour (jalapeno corn bisque), basic overpriced salads, and flavorless steaks that are so large that you don't even get sides with your "meal"--those are a la carte, as if it wasn't expensive enough already.  Do not go here if you want to have a romantic dinner date!  It is so loud that it's barely enjoyable!  We made a reservation ahead of time and even said it was our honeymoon, yet they proceeded to seat us at the noisiest area of the restaurant.  If you want to gamble your money away, like at the rest of the casinos, then go to Gallagher's.

p2p2DnQ2E7tz9EP-RORvvA.text: This "was* my go to steak house place in Vegas. I come very often. This is my anniversary weekend and this place just ruined it. I asked for a certain bottle of wine per arrival....and once arriving I was told it wasn't available anymore. They has a different bottle as an alternate. Fine. Once getting the bill I notice it's a good $25 more than the bottle that I usually order. I ask then about it and (what i assume is the manager) comes over.  He asks me if I was made aware of this by our server. I inform him I don't even know how are server was because we've have at least 4 people serve us. Which is not the norm when we have our usual server serve us. He informs us that hes going to ask the server if she informed us. If she did we would be charged accordingly..if not he would fix it. He finally came back and told us that she had informed us in which we said we would that's impossible. End of story they weren't going to discount us a dollar and we're paying whatever they say because they said so.  I haven't even mentioned that not once did we get our wine refilled.....and we had to wait 1 hour to get our order fulfilled. Worst experience ever. Especially for a anniversary. I never not come here on my visits but this could be the last time I ever come here. I will reach out to the higher above. This was just unacceptable for a $200 meal for 2 people

IZfzRZeyT_AjLnPZr2YqZQ.text: Amazing dinner, amazing service everything was just fabulous you gotta check it out....the NY steak and Lobster and bacon and cheddar mashed potatoes were off the chain....

_dUf6P1KdK32EXgPaWrVsg.text: Service was very good. The food was good, I had the NY strip, spinach salad and a baked potato. It was not the greatest steak or the worse. It was about what I expected. I'll try it again. This was very middle of the road as I am having a hard time writing this review.

TCjzRuT7t2c8FKfmbOBKNg.text: Service: 4 stars Food: 3.5  Came here on a Thur night w/ reservations @ 6:30pm for 2 and we were seated promptly. The place was pretty busy for a weeknight.   Ordered:   surf & turf (filet) for myself , cowboy rib-eye for hubby & side of mushrooms, Pinot Noir.   Positive: rib-eye was delicious and perfectly cooked, mushrooms were flavorful.  Service was spot on & our water glasses were never left empty.  Con: Restaurant was a little loud and the lobster was slightly overcooked and chewy. Filet was good, but nothing to write home about. At close to $100 for the surf & turf I expected better quality & execution. I should have ordered the rib eye which was recommended by other yelp reviewers & our cab driver.   Atmosphere is more relaxed being that it's in the NY NY casino, so we didn't feel out of place wearing jeans and a nice top. However, we did see some older patrons wearing a cocktail dress or slacks and they fit right in too.

v2dZHqS6o_gMema48fSwZw.text: Ate here this weekend on our Vegas trip. We made a reservation just a couple hours ahead of time and were seated instantly when we showed up.   The food was outstanding! I had the cowboy ribeye medium rare. It was cooked perfectly. Our table got the macaroni, creamed spinach, mashed potatoes and onion rings for sides. Everything was delicious (especially the mac & cheese.. drooooooool). We also got the Maryland crab cakes as an appetizer. Let me just say.. I am from Maryland and a total crab snob, and this place knocked it out of the park! They were perfectly spiced and just the right amount of kick.   Our waiter was really friendly and we had quick service.  A++ would food-baby again.. :-)

W9NWlVwEOr9zGGh6yvhL7A.text: My husband and I were pleasantly surprised when we had dinner here. We were expecting good food but after eating our meals this was my favorite meal in Vegas! The prime rib was cooked perfectly! The salmon was delicious! The service was absolutely great as well! We made reservations for the same day which was very accommodating. Our table was ready even when we got there 30 minutes early.

NdMUJZZEXUuKtteTeR90ZA.text: I've been a fan of Gallagher's for a while. I must say though, I feel the Las Vegas location is better than the NYC one! The service, steaks, salads and sides are all outstanding. When in Las Vegas it's one of my "go to" places to eat!

iMUNAFdDRyjhZQt7AjHFVg.text: I like to enjoy a good steak and I have to say this is probably one of the best stakes I have ever had. The lobster was so sweet and tasty.

HiPzlbdnOSoOlFhhGb5YNQ.text: Service was excellent! Even though they were busy, they managed to find us a seat pretty promptly as well. I ordered the filet with sauteed mushrooms and we had 2 sides, asparagus and macaroni and cheese. Overall, the steak was a good cut. I like my steak truly medium rare, which is really hard for most restaurants to accomplish, and they got pretty close. The sides were pretty good, not the best I've had, but still pretty tasty. I would probably go back if I was staying in New York, New York again.  Food: pretty good Service: excellent
