So I bounced to Vegas for my first Yelp Elite event (Spring Break Vegas! in da house) and ended up here.  It's just what you'd expect for a really good steakhouse.  Great wines, too.

cvDBjpiIBDOf8QCyduAU4w.text: We went here for dinner and all the food was just fantastic!  For my appetizer I had the crab cakes - YUM!  It comes with 3 medium sized crab cakes all which had giant chunks of crab just like perfect crab cakes should.  I also ate off of my sister's caesar salad which was delicious.  For my entree I had the filet mignon with Bearnaise sauce.  SO GOOD!  This place is definitely on par for awesome steak with other fantastic steak houses.    For sides, I had the mac and cheese and asparagus.  The mac and cheese was actually not that great.  The only semi disappointing thing about the night really.  It wasn't bad but at fine restaurants the mac and cheese is usually to die for and theirs was just OK.  Asparagus was great.  The highlight of the night though was probably the service.  Our waiter's name was Paul and he was just fantastic!  So funny, so easy going, great service.  Overall - seriously a great place, I would definitely recommend to everyone.

TDpfVnnOxXVHoJVAIrsQXQ.text: Service was very poor. My wife's steak was underdone. They brought out 2 others both were rarer then the first.  You'd think for a 60 dollar piece of beef they could get the temperature  right.    Don't know if I'll be back

b5lowk12WgIEqXW_24fzIA.text: Ate hear last friday for a small wedding rehearsal dinner.  It was mom meeting the bride's dad for the first time. You could cut the tension with a ... knife (yes that is terrible I know).  Tempted by the dry aged but I decided on the prime rib.  The meal was large enough to split easily. I can put down about 5 plates at the bellagio buffet if you need a reference for the steak size. The cut was around 3 inches thick no joke. Perfectly cooked and possibly the best prime rib I have had but I have not been to Lawrys.  The atmosphere was fitting for a steakhouse with good lighting, not too dark.  Informative servers.  Everything is a la carte including sauces for the meat at around $3 per and the meats were around $35 to $50.

WHySkOaiImq-beMRWnkXzQ.text: The steak was good, but definitely not worth $100/plate.  This place is not as good as STK or other truly premium steakhouses in Vegas, though the prices are just as high. Service was lackluster, too - our waitress disappeared for long stretches of time, and when we finally got the bill we found that we had been forced to pay her an $80 tip that she clearly did not deserve!

Qdqhl6IYhJ69BnMf1tonbA.text: Once again delicious. Our party of four had two cowboy rib eyes and a lobster tail, Mac and cheese, onion rings and mushrooms. For desert, cheesecake and the pudding. Zero complaints, everything was perfect. The sand in your toes drink was also really good. Will definitely be back next time in Vegas. Thank you Gallaghers for a great evening. Our 8 month old loved sampling.

E0goZcACoAbe7cTkbngkwA.text: Whenever we are in Vegas this is one restaurant we also go to. It is in New York New York. You need reservations. The food is excellent. The sides are enough to share. I got the filet last night. Cooked to perfection. The service is right on. Great place.

2xYhG2vGqlaFT7SXBDbsZg.text: We ate here last Saturday for dinner. The service was very slow. Ordered the steak medium and it was cooked well done. The waiter took over 20 minutes to ask us how our food was. We told him about the steak being over cooked and we had only taken three bites from it. He sent the manager out who argued with us over the steak calling us liars basically.  I would never recomend this place. Our experience  was terrible. We left there hungry and disappointed. I guess they have enough first time customers they don't need repeat customers. Take your money else where, do not eat here the management  could care less if you ever come back that was very clear.

O8drL_scrDoP9iryIijMqQ.text: Overall food was good:) Considering on- strip location, menu were reasonably priced. Waiting time was a bit long so I was kind of not so hungry by the time steak arrived. Don't eat too much bread!!

7S4QmvY7vjMN3vT0UwLTuw.text: It's an okay steakhouse...there is nothing that stand out.the only thing different from every steak house I have been to is they serve three crapcakes as oppose to two

WCRRJgzdttIlJs8nyrqfGQ.text: Arrived about 15 minutes before closing last Tuesday evening with 3 friends and family. Didn't realize they closed at 11. But everyone from the bartender to our server was very polite and accommodating. Didn't rush us and gave us great service. Had the chowder, Salmon, and surf and turf. It was all amazing! Going back on our next visit to Vegas and recommending to all my friends.

O4ADWet6785hwi9YtDBDTA.text: I've eaten here twice and had fantastic experiences both times. Most recently we visited for my 35th birthday. Whoop woop! And the ribeye was excellent, the potato puree was dreamy, and the roasted veggies sublime. Our party got a variety of entrees and everyone enjoyed their meal. Will definitely visit again next time I'm in Vegas!

Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooked perfectly med rare

7Xj69aPiW_ceCCJKbHUHEg.text: I had heard a lot about the dry aged steak and wanted to try one so thought this would be the place as the advertise their dry aged steaks by hanging them in the window.  After talking to the staff I decided to go with flavor and their recommended ribeye steak.  This is my favorite cut which I have had before in other restaurants.  I did not order any sides which are all separately priced as I know the steak should be more than enough.  The steak was delivered and was cooked medium and was hot throughout and pink in the middle.  Sound just right.  While the first bites were delicious, it became tougher and tougher as well as less juicy.  Other rib eyes I've had have been a little thinner cut but much tastier and of better quality. The service was very prompt and you might expect from a high-end steakhouse with the water glass being filled frequently. The dark wood make you feel as though you were in an English manor and add to the experience but doesn't over come the lack of quality meat.

1TAzGhKyhoVEg48XWbgW0w.text: Service Excellent! Food Excellent! What more could you ask for?  We wanted to have a nice dinner before our Cirque Zumanity show.  With aged steaks displayed in the front, it was hook, line and sinker for my husband!  We had arrived a few minutes early for our reservation but they seated us right away.  One of the gentlemen assisting the waitstaff immediately filled our water glasses as we glanced at our menu choices.   John was our waiter for the evening.  He was spot on for our special night!  They kept our drinks filled and they all were so polite and friendly.    We started with the clam chowder soup.  This was so creamy and delightful! And the serving was more than enough to satisfy my taste buds.   It was almost enough soup to fill my stomach before our entrees were delivered.  I would get this again for sure!  Our entrees were brought out shortly thereafter.  I went with the shrimp and grits.  LOVE IT!  The shrimp was grilled perfect with a light seasoning.  The grits were so creamy with a delicious cheese blend. This entree didn't stand a chance against me!  I finished it like a champ!   My husband, of course, went with the dry aged sirloin he saw in the display. Yes. Yes. and Yes again!  Medium rare is the way we love our steaks.  The chef prepared this perfectly!  Plus this steak was absolutely huge!  We agreed to split the steak next time we dined here.  I know you pay a little more than usual for their steaks here but I feel like you get what you pay for.    This was a perfect meal at an exquisite restaurant.  I would recommend this to anyone! AND WE WILL BE BACK!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside decor.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jLLizi0c2e-hKcf-7gRBPQ.text: Dinner for two with drinks? Set aside a good $200.00 for the budget minded folks like myself.   I will still review this steakhouse with all 5 stars as I whined about price above. Why? It's all about the quality and precision. You show up to a steak house specializing in dry aged beef and order a salmon plate? Get out of the van, Jan!   Hell no, the specialty is the New York strip steak--order it and be amazed. Be advised each menu item is ala cart therefore the 46.00 steak is NOT accompanied with a side and salad for free. You will spend another 20 bucks for a veg and green salad.   The food is amazing, even the wedge salad was well planned and tasty. Every detail is appreciated in the establishment. Our server named Sam was more of a father figure, Gambino crime boss than a waiter. His service was very appreciated and useful.   I have never spent a solid 50.00 on a steak and only a steak. I will gladly return every time I'm in Vegas. It was that good.

HVh4GQhlat0zmwV6fA9KHg.text: We came here on January 10, 2016 - 6pm reservations for 14. The wait staff was undaunted by the number on our table - which shows just how great they really were.   Spinach Salad, Crab-Shrimp-lobster app, the bread, the Steak Fries and Onion rings were serious!  The main courses - NY strip, Prime Rib, Cowboy ribeye, Salmon, - fantastic!! Dessert - Death by Chocolate, Cheesecake -outstanding.  We really had a great time here!!  It's located in the NY NY Casino and Hotel. Great Job guyz!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key lime pie
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake!!!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ny Ny strip steak!! -Huge!!

r8wCG_fwuNsxYq2aOIxcTA.text: One of our favorite restaurants at Vegas, we ordered oysters which were very fresh, prime rib, salmon, and chicken were good, besides, the service was good as well, definitely will go there again.

-Osa6wlkiQjGpEHfr2jplw.text: Made an appointment on Opentable a couple weeks beforehand (highly recommend doing this, because the stand-by wait was over an hour). The entire staff, including the hostess, food runner, and busser, were all very accommodating and polite.  Girlfriend ordered the Dry-Aged New York Strip and I ordered the Cowboy Rib-Eye. If there's one thing for you to take away from my review, it is that both of these meat cuts are HUGE! I ate about half of the Rib-Eye, and my girlfriend barely dented the New York Strip. Both steaks were cooked very well and had all the qualities of a good steak (juicy, flavorful, tender, etc.). Unless you come here with a gigantic appetite, I would recommend you and your partner to split one of these steaks, because they are big. I think our waiter told us the NY Strip was 16oz.  Highly recommend this spot to anyone on the south end of the strip looking for a good steak.

dKReNFVRaojmt9rHDppHig.text: We were treated like a king and queen. Roxanne took our pictures! It was an amazing meal and experience!

J0Y61xzxBKKLIC4S9V8vDg.text: Can't beat their in-house dry aged Angus meat. Great wine list, classic sides. Love the roasted garlic and the good service, great meal guaranteed!

GNpse-nZ3t7wEHHCFTWVlw.text: Before seeing Zumanity, I had dinner at Gallagher's, something I haven't done since the 1960s when I ate at the original in New York City.  I had a reservation for 5:30 and was promptly seated in a mostly empty restaurant.  The waiter was soon at the table with ice water and to take a drink order quickly.  After finding out the weights of the various steaks. I didn't want 18+ ounces in a steak so I ordered their "signature house-aged bone in sirloin."  I ordered it cooked blue.  I also ordered a side of the Special Spud.  Last night, it was mashed potatoes with jalapeno pieces, bacon bits, and cheddar cheese.  For dessert I got the Sticky toffee pudding.  I was brought a nice bread basket with two types of bread and some whipped butter.  The server brought my iced tea and it was kept filled throughout the time I was there.  The steak came and it was done exactly the way I like it--nice grill marks on the outside and cold, red on the inside.  It was a good steak.  The Special Spud was very good, probably the highlight of the evening which isn't necessarily a good thing when a side is what you remember your dinner for.  The sticky toffee pudding was good, also.  It came with some whipped cream and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  Service was attentive and pleasant from the time I was greeted at the door to leaving. My server was Bobby and he was a very pleasant gentleman.  I enjoyed the ambience of the restaurant and it got to be fun when some more people came in and I could overhear the tourist talk going on.  A solid steakhouse but it's not in my top tier of Las Vegas steakhouses.  Note:  For those on vacation, they have a photographer come around and take photos so you can remember that special dinner in Las Vegas.  I enjoyed seeing the couple two tables down from me look at the finished photos and purchase one to take home.

Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu in light up folder.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special spud.

2wztiU_QTaW8fqZK-M6L1Q.text: Love Gallaghers!    Great ambiance and great service at this wonderful steak heaven.   I started with the Lobster Bisque that was supercreamy and had lots and lots of flavor.  Followed up with the New York Sirloin that was about 10 oz if i dont remember wrong. It had a great charred crust and still perfectly medium rare pinkish inside. It was melt in your mouth good and Went perfect it the Classic bearnaise. The small Ceasar as a side was delicious and the dressing was one of the better Ceasar dressings i have had for a while.   Prices are as expected a Little bit higher here but its still a solid pick if you are craving a nice piece of meat on the strip.

vZcJOqRCwkTltVO7ZoQJdg.text: This place was top notch all around. Ordered the dry aged New York and it was cooked to perfection, lobster mac and cheese was also amazing. The wait staff was great and location was excellent considering it was in our hotel. Made reservation through yelp which made it easy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Dry Aged and lobster mac and cheese

uu93xI2mJjPyUPoK9GY-sA.text: If you want amazing food and not tiny portions, then this is the place to go. We are always so pleased with the food here. We travel all the way from Texas, just to make a point to eat here for our anniversary. The steak is amazing. A little pricy for steak, but you get what you pay for. Delicious food! :) Can't wait for next year.

wrL9j2hF93NjjXZS9KP00g.text: Walked over with a friend from the Aria to the New York New York just to try this steakhouse. They start by bringing complimentary cold bread to the table. The cranberry bread had a good idea behind it but end of day it was cold. We both ordered wedge salads. The wedge salad was flat and uninspired. The lettuce yellow and the blue cheese dressing watery. Fast forward to dinner I ordered the filet mignon & she ordered the rib eye steak. We ordered macaroni & cheese with asparagus for sides..   The filet mignon was just beautiful. It was tasty and cooked to perfection. In fact the filet mignon & our sodas is why I am giving this steakhouse two stars..   The rib eye on the other hand was just an atrocity. The first rib eye was remarkably overcooked and rubbery. We then we waited another 15 minutes for another rib eye that was still tough. The manager brought the new rib eye personally and apologized but the steak was still a let down. We both tried a cut. It was tough. The macaroni and cheese was undercooked. The noodles in particular were hard. The asparagus had a slightly bitter taste. We added in two sodas and the bill was $170. I never mind to spend hard earned money on great food but this experience was mediocre at best. This was just not worth the time or effort.. Unless only ordering a filet mignon & soda.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon, asparagus, mac &amp; cheese, rib eye, &amp; soda

4ozZ9-TQft-HPmsZnV9_Pg.text: We made a reservation to celebrate my Sisters  Birthday, we got there and our table was ready for us with no wait, from beginning to end the service was great, our waiter was Excellent and Roxanne (the photographer really sweet lady) The food was delicious and was worth every penny I spent there!!!...

4a08dq2NvlB8nn4iTKEmTg.text: This is truly a great steakhouse.  I had the dry aged New York strip steak. It was cooked right in the waiter was on the ball and made it enjoyable evening. Even going so far to provide a custom dessert for me.The next time I'm in Las Vegas I will be back.

Oc6hSAw9j-Ya_ia11bJuvQ.text: I really enjoyed Gallagher's and the staff was extremely nice and helpful.  The only thing that I wish they would of done is told us the portion size.  My sister in law and I ordered the prime rib.  Both portions were huge.  We could of split one.  Wish they would of recommended it.  We both took half home.

SpAvBtSa14NgaeQp2DluLQ.text: We had the aged porterhouse for two, asparagus, and oyster appetizer.   The oysters are $3 a piece. We ordered 6. They are very tasty but they're small so you only need to add a tiny dab of horseradish. That sure had a kick to it! I liked it.  The asparagus was cooked to perfection.   Our thick bone in steak was a perfect medium and it was seasoned just the way I like it. I didn't need the sauce. In fact, make no bones about it I ate my whole portion which was more than my brothers. If I'm gonna cheat on my pegan diet for a special occasion like this I will savor every last bite. Also, when you don't eat carbs you save room for the best part. Haha!  No need for dessert.   This was my 3rd time eating here and like always, DELICIOUS!

xFqX3oSQ555tWB6yqNZ9OA.text: Definitely wasn't worth the price in my opinion.  I ordered the rib eye and my wife got the filet that was the special.   Both were well cooked but we're very bland.  Perhaps they were hoping for the aging to really make the flavor stand out, but there was nothing special about our meal.   We shared the parmesan truffle fries that came with her meal and also the bacon Mac and cheese.   They were both far and above better than our meal as we're out drinks.   The service was good too, but when you go to a steakhouse like this, the steak has to stand out, and it sadly disappointed.

OevctLucBXYcSFthi1UoOA.text: The food was okay, but not great. I got the new York strip, and it was cooked correctly. The truffle French fries were a let down, considering that they were $10. They were just mediocre, normal fries with some cheap parmesan dusted on top. I didn't taste any truffle.

acuRk7FDTrZtrALTOg1D3g.text: My boyfriend and I came in for New Year's Eve for a nice steak dinner. From the outside you would never think this restaurant is as big as it is. Beautifully laid out. Several rooms that would be good for a private party or work get together. We were given ice water and awesome cranberry bread after we sat down. Our server Todd was awesome! He knew his menu very well. We both ordered the filet mignon. I got the potatoe puree and my boyfriend got a loaded twice baked potatoe. We ordered a side is asparagus to split. The filet mignon was cooked perfectly and was maybe the best steak I've ever had. The asparagus was very tender. All was very good. I got keylime pie for dessert. Very tasty! Totally recommend this restaurant and would come back again!

T-rH9mr31aggFOBBUhPPCA.text: So disappointed with the cowboy ribeye.  My husband felt it was slightly over cooked.  We ordered medium rare and it was more on the medium side.  I expected with the aging process that it would melt in my mouth.  One of the toughest steaks I have ever had.  Couldn't believe the grizzle.  We never complained but will never return.  We don't often spend $49 for just a steak without any sides.  Had better steaks at the buffets.

NdkTbS8Wuv_9IvVKdFvl1g.text: We dined here on a Friday night at the New York New York . We chose Gallagher's because of the dry aged strip which in the past dry aged steaks I've had have been divine .  It's a little dated on the inside but still has the classic steakhouse feel .   We didn't have a reso but still got sat within a couple minutes in a pretty busy restaurant .  The service was just ok for a alacarte steakhouse . The server didn't offer specials or explain the menu at all just waited for us to order . Throughout dinner we had to wave him or a assistant over for service .   The food was pretty good though . I had the shellfish platter for 1 which was perfect for me not too much but enough to enjoy . My girlfriend ordered the wedge salad which was on the bottom tier of restaurants wedge salads. We ordered the bone in dry aged strip and The steak was pretty damn good . Mouth watering and a little fatty cooked perfectly medium rare and juicy .  The steak made the dinner for sure and it's all we talked about post dinner . The sides were good as well . The Mac and cheese and steamed spinach were standard fare.   Overalls as an ok experience with a great steak . Probably won't be back but will have to find a dry aged steak somewhere else.

X4sCNDXr-QeEn3NGqqbk7g.text: Really nice experience, the way they cook steaks is not my favorite... Medium rare here is hot red center, rare was a bit blue in the center - I tried both. I wanted something in between...  The sides are very good, and the bartender prepares a great old fashioned.

mE7LM23gDv8WZ0wPKPY9Qw.text: Oh my great goodness the steaks were enormous.   Wish we would have known because many people in our party would have shared steaks instead of getting their own.   Everyone was pleased, and the special mashed potatoes with cheddar, bacon and jalepeno were out of this world.   The Ahi appetizer was to die for.

ozBWWnkC0ZcHCJRqnAFzbg.text: I was expecting more, but the food was ok. We got the New york steak, the filet mignon, mashed potatoes, and mushrooms. The cook on the meat was good on the inside, but both of our steaks were too charred on the outside. All of the food was not well seasoned, i ended up using so much salt on everything. I guess I was expecting an amazing meal, and it was ok. Drink selection is also not great...not too many options. There are better steak places to be honest, it sounds weird, but the steak and mushrooms at Hells Kitchen was wayyyyyy wayy wayyy better than the ones here. I would skip this place.

idQt1yrw9pDY_L0IpcbBMg.text: Great food and excellent service. - they messed up my steak and were so kind to make me a new one !

CcJxJbZaTbXwA23SvzRi_Q.text: Gallagher's holds a special place in my heart because I have dined here numerous times with my husband,  usually in celebration of a special occasion.  Situated on a "street corner" inside the NYNY, a few steps from the casino floor, this establishment is based on a restaurant of the same name in NYC.  There is a bar that you can sit at either inside or outside, and that is where we sat on our most recent visit.  Previously, we have eaten inside, and it is classy joint.  There is a usually a hostess dressed in black who will escort you to  your table.  After being seated, you will meet one of the most professional waiters or waitresses ever and he or she will be your guide to all things Gallagher.  The service here is pretty impeccable and you will realize, as we have, that the individuals who work here are dedicated to providing a quality dining experience.  I have only tried their signature steak and the salmon (just once on this last visit).  The salmon was good, but I am still kicking myself for wasting a Gallagher's visit and not having a steak.  It is the best I have ever had there.  Sides are always great as well.  Personally, I like the asparagus and the cheesy mashed potatoes.  I usually lead with an heirloom tomato and hearts of palm salad, which is a great mix of flavors and textures.  I've also had the shrimp and grits just once, and it was awesome.  Sitting at the exterior bar, we still had great service and food without the frills of fancy dining.    I definitely see myself visiting Gallagher's in the future with my awesome husband and maybe some friends or family.  If you are considering it, definitely try it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Organic salmon with quinoa - tender and tasty

zLhrU8kNFHWRu6hQiAtp5w.text: This was our second time at Gallagher's and it  lived up to and exceeded our ridiculously high expectations after our amazing last visit! The incredible food and our server Denise made the evening absolutely perfect! I can't recommend this place enough

9-QbPOXK3wUV9PJESMCZXw.text: First off we made reservations for two for 6:30 over 60 days out and it still took over 45 minutes to get seated I was not very happy over that , when we I'd get seated they sit us in a back little bark corner and it was so loud my wife and I could Not talk across the table Norman's here each other. The steak was just ok in my opinion. And the southwest corn the wait said was amazing neither the wife or I could eat it. But the lobster was very good. But it was very expensive for the service and quality we got in my opinion.

RXgyrKNVxvBCQtiz49nLZQ.text: This was delightful!  When you first walk up you would think it would be ok, but once your seated, staff does a great job of taking care of you.  That doesn't however mean service is fast.  This is not a place where you jump into your seat, eat and run.  Once your seated it is a leisure pace so you can enjoy cocktails, apps, salad, main course and dessert in rushes.  Because who would want to rush enjoying these flavor profiles!  Rich flavors, tasty pairings and delectable combos, I enjoyed every bite.  Our waitress was delightful and good with the recommendations.  One thing I did notice was one of the "managers" only seemed to find time to touch on the tables of high profile clients while standing around the rest of the time instead of making rounds and touching more tables.  I would have loved to tell him his staff was doing a great job.  Would totally come back.

fTeAa0hu9fhly8JWDe6Mkw.text: Food was really good. Got the free range chicken which was great. It didn't even taste like chicken which is actually a good thing. Way overpriced in my opinion. My family got the steak which costed a small fortune and the bill would baffle anyone. I mean I would call it fine dining and breathing but if you are anything like Mr. Krabs this would put a dent in your wallet. Overall really good food but prepare to put a second mortgage on your house after you eat here.

DYqVKYb2ywpYSGZ1ARqobA.text: Great culture, food and energy!    My husband and I decided to take a road trip for our honeymoon and stopped in Vegas on our way north.  We wanted a great steak and were referred to Gallagher's in New York, New York by multiple people in the area.  We made a reservation earlier in the day and indicated we would like the opportunity to sit together.  When we arrived, the place was packed and we did not especially like where they seated us.  Without issue, a manager relocated us to a booth where we could sit together comfortably.  Shortly thereafter, we were greeted with champagne.  All of the wait staff was extremely pleasant and attentive.  Management helped the staff bus tables, deliver food and overall jumped in wherever needed to help.  The food was delicious as well.

T1sGOOhhro6qmDCXsgucoQ.text: Gallagher's showcases their dry-aged steaks in a glassed exterior wall to draw attention to those passing by.  This is brilliant marking because the steaks look absolutely amazing.   We started with shrimp scampi, clam chowder and a wedge salad. The shrimp scampi ($18.00) was prepared with a tomato cream sauce and was very good. The clam chowder ($8.00) was made with a heavy hand of bacon. The bacon choked out the flavor of clams. The salad ($9.00) was fresh, cold and delicious.   For entrees we took the advice of our waiter and ordered the cowboy ribeye. ($47.00) It does not come with sides so we added creamed spinach ($9.00) and a baked potato. ($9.00) The ribeye was cooked perfectly and looked mouthwatering good. The compliments stop there because the steak was really tough and bland....a huge disappointment. The baked potato was good but the creamed spinach was not seasoned properly and had a distinct taste of flour.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cream Spinach ($9.00)
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi ($18.00)
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy Ribeye ($47.00)

W8McroD-iWXCejtxA6LQuw.text: My spouse and I were in town and were craving steak other than Ruth Chris . I must say the ambiance wasn't what I expected and the hostess wasn't as inviting but our waitress was awesome. We made reservations earlier in the day for 730pm and there was a good amount of people in the resurtant. They have a woman going around taking professional pictures we took pictures and they came out very nice with a booklet. Also they have a huge storage on display of the aged meat and their prices are very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip steak with Lobster and Cowboy Rib eye
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2W0KcFO3dUdsFWEDu629kA.text: Creamed spinach was superb. NY strip steak was tough, no flavor without the sauce. $50 ala carte steak, I expect a lot more. Truffle fries strips were either burnt or undercooked. Sand in your toes cocktail was delicious and well priced at $10. Hostesses were poorly trained. Empty restaurant at 5pm and they sat us all at the same wall of table/booth (shared booth seats across a wall- that moved every time someone got up). Service was ok. My steak plate was really, really hot, which means it sat under a lamp in the kitchen, and it tasted like it. The outside was very dry. The "Italian" bread was also stale. It was obviously pre-cut and left out.  It's a lazy Vegas restaurant that should be much, much better.

sKDw7zwrqEVu2BNEhy5dXQ.text: Some of the best service I have ever had. Our server, Aris, was phenomenal, consistently checking up on us when the time was right, and giving us time when we needed it. We had the Cowboy Ribeye and King Crab Legs. Both were top tier. Would recommend to anybody looking for a classier setting with amazing service. Stars cannot do this place justice.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy Ribeye
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel Toffee Pudding
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Crab

LOLGEE5lXBwwBn5t2V4c0w.text: I'm pretty bummed because I was really excited to eat here. Drinks were good and the ambiance is nice. Our server was decent but it's obvious that the service assistants (whatever they call them here) are the ones who do all the work. We never had a low glass of water, empty bread basket or crumb on the table.  Unfortunately, the main reason to go to Gallagher's is the steaks and our were disappointing. I got the center cut filet, husband got the porterhouse, both ordered medium. Mine was way overdone, not so much as a line of pink. His was RARE, I mean really rare. It was like they threw them on the fire at the same time and removed them together.  Bad part is husband is just learning to like steak medium, he was raised in a "well done" home (I know, blasphemy) so this was too much for him. We didn't send it back, it was late so we traded steaks. Unfortunately I ordered the Oscar accompaniment, which could've used a little more bearnaise to be honest, so he got that when we switched.  We won't be back. There are too many great steak houses in Vegas to spend $300 and get the temperatures wrong on all the steaks in the order.

WLrurwETMHRaZAov_9GPqQ.text: Great quality of food and great ambiance. The prices are much more reasonable that other places and the quality and service just as great

M6Ku8jEv2rftMvy02l0p9A.text: Still giving this place a strong 4 ! Every time we make it to Vegas this is a must stop .  Guess we rationalize spending this kind of money on a steak Is because we do not gamble. Good meat ! Very full ! A wedge salad and the slab of meat is plenty , no need for sides.  Always full , always moving !

GBMwXKkz8tuA9DV1PqG5qg.text: This restaurant located in New York New York hotel and is One of best steakhouse in Vegas, I have ordered Ribeye steak well-done because I hate to see the blood dripping off the steak and It tastes just so good soft and fatty.  For the appetizer we have order jumbo shrimp, they served 4-5 pieces they are huge but good for sharing .. highly recommended!!

W2ln03vjdLJk_55_nTuxdg.text: My fiance and I have been to this restaurant once before a couple of years ago and it was wonderful. We were very excited to bring our friends this time, but it wasn't good. The heirloom tomato salad, shrimp cocktail, and mashed potatoes were great, but unfortunately the steak was not good. It was very tough and so charred that we had to ask for steak sauce to cover up the flavor! When we addressed the issue, the manager didn't handle it professionally or appropriately. We will not be coming again.

3rlxvBMiX58gxvt2cyI4DQ.text: Located in the New York New York casino. This spot really didn't hit the Steakhouse mark which should be high based on price per plate.   The majority of the steaks were cooked to order, but at least 1/2 of my group of 8 people sent them back to be reheated. Service was good at times, but were then ignored for long periods. Likely won't return.

3WhRx8oPRAAy5BGKxbWqdw.text: We've been here countless amount of times over the past fifteen years. If it ain't broken, don't fix it.   Tonight we dined for our birthdays and we brought new guests with our group.   The menu has changed. They changed the scallops. Arguably to die for, amazing, as an appetizer. Now, they changed it to an entree and is no longer the same dish, however they hiked up the price for the same amount of scallops.   The salmon is no longer their signature salmon.  Now it comes with lentils instead of quinoa. For real?  The waitress said they gave a new chef that changed things.   Honestly in my opinion, I would change things back.  The lentils were good but it devalued the whole dish entirely. It looked messy, and took away from the finesse of the whole dish entirely.   We ordered dessert and the size of their sticky toffee pudding is much smaller for the same price.   Such a shame. My family and I frequently come here, but these changes sucked.   Please go back to the original menu!!

onBA8Yj2sQb19q8kkP75fw.text: I always come here for my anniversary for dinner  I was very disappointed today ! What happened to this place?????  steak had no flavor as if the steak was just cooked with no seasoning.. NO  FLAVOR!

6decvuEgs7Z7LxsxtNON7g.text: My third 5-star dining experience in a row in Las Vegas was here, during my first visit to Gallagher's.  My group of four was quickly seated in a quickly filling dining room after we arrived for our dinner reservation, and I immediately went to work sampling attractive menu offerings.    A Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail sported excellent meaty shrimp accompanied by a zesty horseradish-based sauce.  Next was an equally tasty Spinach Salad with Warm Bacon Dressing that contained large chunks of bacon and Red Grapes.  Paired with the salad was a complimentary Bread Basket that held a Baguette, Olive Bread, and Sourdough Ciabatta that was just sour enough.    Next up for me was a Center Cut Filet Mignon with Wild Mushroom Sauce, Brandy Peppercorn Sauce, and Bearnaise Sauce along with a Colossal Baked Potato that was truly huge in size. and enhanced by add-ons of bacon and chives, while Diane enjoyed bacon and cheddar cheese with her giant spud.  The potato was cooked perfectly, and my 8 oz. steak was buttery, flavorful, and perfectly medium rare.  All of the sauces went very well  with the meat.   I left no leftovers on my plate.  But Diane could not finish her 14 oz. New York Strip.  When it was boxed, the remaining Sourdough Ciabatta went with it!.    The food here was expensive but worth it.  Surf & Turf was running $125.  Service was very good, and caring.  And the ambiance deep in the bowels of New York New York was that of a clubby classic steakhouse.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Colossal Baked Potato
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 oz. Filet Mignon
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 14 oz. New York Strip Steak

xB81Pj4pG7e7pvyH9siP3g.text: Located in the New York, New York... I made a reservation online, promptly seated at the table of my choice, water glasses always full. Excellent service! So it is hard to critique a place that is close to perfect... First and foremost...No casino smoke!! The steaks are prime dry aged, seared to perfection, choice of 5 sauces, I chose the peppercorn sauce. So...with even the best looking steaks the meat can be chewy... therefore the 4 stars... the big thing...No hint of smoke!

-Iq5fB1g-ZeQmhMZ0a53Pg.text: We felt like it was a "Thunder Dome" nite, so we decided to head down to the strip to Gallager's.  Solid steak dining experience located in the New York New York hotel and casino.  Only reason why not a 5 star review was due to the small portions compared to what you pay, and the glass they served my Macallan 12 year old whiskey was pretty dirty.   I was close to sending it back, but couldn't bring myself to be a borderline "dinning snob".  Since I had a nice ribeye steak the previous nite, I decided to try out their rack of lamb cooked med rare... as if there was another way to prepare it.    Whatever the spices used to prepare the dish, it totally made the lamb explode in your mouth.   The sides were good, but the bread pudding we had for desert was a let down.  The wife had their filet, and we added the lobster tail on our cuz's dish.  You be the judge... worth the price?  Or worth paying for the ambiance?

Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet

rAjYitExZGeivfQAPa4Vew.text: I really wanted to give this place a 3 star but the steak and crab cakes were so damn good! Probably will try something new next time but glad I stopped.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_iAChmCNWFfl9FRWcRSccQ.text: I had a lovely dinner here with the hubby, make sure you guys make a reservation because we didn't and we ended up waiting about 35 minutes for a table.   Once seated in had alerted the server that we are in a slight time crunch because we were going to go see kaskade after dinner. And he was understanding and got right to our order so we can leave on time. We got crab cakes for an appetizer to start and my hubby got the dry aged steak (and with bernaise sauce) with an Australian lobster tail, and I got the rack of roasted lamb and we were going to share a side of mash potatoes.   The food was cooked perfectly, my lamb was extremely tender and practically falling off the bone, and my hubby loved his meal as well the only down side for him was he asked if he could get the main lobster tail instead of the Australian lobster tail but they couldn't do that. And personally we just prefer the Maine lobster because it's sweeter and more succulent. You must get the bernaise sauce if you get the steak, it takes the steak to a completely different level, it makes it so much better. The crab cakes was great and so was the mash potatoes.   Our dinner was very delicious and we'll definitely be back the next time we're in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FiJ23VnRHL1GMW2eWN99jA.text: Located in NEW YORK NEW YORK hotel/casino --- Very cool fridge display of the ageing meat just right at the entrance into this restaurant. You can tell they really have pride in ageing their meat to perfection.  Seating was quick and pleasant. Atmosphere was nice and quaint. We did not need reservations as it was a weekday on low season for Vegas. My husband and I enjoyed our meal and price was ok. You can't complain for the type of steaks your getting. If your not willing to fork out and spend then don't eat here. But if your looking for quality steak and cooked just to your liking, I highly recommend trying this place out.  I liked the fact that you can't smell the stinky smoke flowing into your area and dampening your dinner meal.  That was a plus because i'm so allergic to the smell of smoke which is what bothered me a lot through the casino floors.   I don't have anything negative to say about this restaurant other then that the service could have been a bit more attentive. I needed some water and had to look for a waiter several times before I got my water filled. I'm pregnant so I couldn't have any wine therefore my husband was nice enough not to let me watch him enjoy a glass of wine while i sipped on my water. He had water as well.

Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

mjYMhGEXBQvzjPoHT1gF5A.text: The service was horrible and the steak over cooked! If you want a well done steak instead of juicy steak then go to Gallagher. Don't waste your money

GUm55RlEDmzyfoAdIIk9aQ.text: I'm not a big meat eater and this my first time eating a dry age steak! The steak was cooked perfectly! It was so tasty I ate the whole thing and I usually can't finish a whole steak! I also had cream of mushroom soup. It was the best soup I ever drank!

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5V5tKa-IbVvVhnQe03bRfQ.text: So please be advised, this will be the best steak you have ever had. The price might scare you at first, it sure did me, but the cut of you will receive will be more than you expect. The cuts are huge! I would also like to say you should save room for your steak. Dont fill up on appetizers and side dishes, even though they are also very tasty.

tvNcok_-Opu6e-NQXglLuA.text: A very nice steakhouse. High-ed food and high-end prices but worth it. I got their specialty dry aged New York strip. They cooked it perfectly. A True medium rare. We had the oysters from the raw bar as a starter and their toffee bread pudding as dessert. I have no complaints at all. Our waiter was very friendly, prompt, and knowledgeable about their vast wine menu. Highly recommend this place for anyone with the money to spend.

Ms0T_slG28FDAc1xGBSKTQ.text: First off, I'd like to say I'm not a steak person at all. With that being said, the filet mignon I ordered here was so perfectly seasoned and cooked medium rare like I asked and SO tender - divine! I now think that the steak I have tasted at other restaurants has been either over- and under-seasoned and usually too oily for my liking. Green beans as my side was simple, really nothing to rave about and in my opinion, should have been included with our steaks. Dining partner ordered the dry aged strip which he raved about; when I tried a piece, it was extremely flavorful but almost a bit on the salty side for me. It could be due to the dry aged flavor, it has an umami taste to it. I do have to say his dish was HUGE, a gigantic steak which he somehow miraculously finished.  Note: As I stated, this place charges separate for the sides, an order of steak is simply just a steak! I would think it is standard to have a side of vegetable or carb come with a steak at this price point.  Overall I would say this place is very good and has a very intimate date vibe with excellent steaks. Worth the try for a steak connoisseur but the prices really do add up quickly.

vTERkwH10gWqE1ENQG4ilg.text: The food is delicious! The service is awesome however the wait for food is a bit lengthy. My husband and I both ordered the daily special which was a tomahawk steak and the Chilean sea bass. Both were delicious! My husband usually orders his steak rare and the waiter suggested he order his medium rare. My husband was a bit disappointed with the outcome of the steak but I enjoyed it. The Sea bass was delicious but I did not love the risotto served with it. It wasn't as creamy as risotto is usually.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk Steak
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Sea Bass

6vv4bDQrLRotsJwkIRr3Dg.text: I'm sad to have to write this review, Gallagher's had been our go to place for great steaks and excellent service for several years,but this last visit  was horrendous. Immediately I noticed the service was lacking, I've been there when the place was packed and still received excellent service. This night was not super busy, and it took out server,Todd, at least 20 minutes to even step over to the table. Every time he came over, which weren't many, he spoke to us while running past the table. He clearly was not interested in hearing how our food was tasting or whether or not we needed anything else. I ordered the cowboy sirloin and my date ordered the  filet mignon, we ordered sliced mozzarella and tomatoes as an appetizer and asparagus as our side. The steaks were completely dry and lacked any flavor at all! She didn't even get down one bite and I added butter to mine from the table and ate mine( I was starving and figured i may as well try to get it down). The asparagus was too oily and had a weird fishy after taste. The only good thing about the meal was the appetizer. Sad to say, I will not be returning to Gallagher's. I went ahead and paid the $130 for my meal, left a tip, not as much as I normally would but far more than Todd deserved, and went away feeling disappointed. I've recommended this place to so many friends, family and colleagues but I'll have to update them on this recent visit. I guess all good things come to an end.

qdd9FAszHzmnmNuiyLssQw.text: I was taken here for my birthday 2 years ago. This place is everything my host said it was. When you walk up, you can see the steaks dry aging in the window.   The waiter was attentive, we ordered all courses and each was executed perfectly. Bring your wallet because everything was a la carte and the bottles of wine are high priced. It's a splurge but definitely worth it.

KTmo5rpJpzCiCdERFNX8gw.text: The steak was aged beautifully. The butter garlic mash was heavenly. The clam chowder was perfect.   The only thing was, I told the lady it was an anniversary during reservations and when we got there, a photographer from the hotel was there to take our picture , and of course it was a pretty penny for the photos. I felt a little hustle as no one else was getting asked about pictures.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Photos from hotel photog. Although it&#39;s very nice, I felt like we were targeted.

vEjtw9ZcsGtt6jcbJB-eLg.text: We were celebrating our 11th year anniversary, so we decided to finally check out Galleghers at the New York New York hotel and casino & scratch it off our list! The food was absalutely Amazing! We ordered the Bone in Ny with 2 sides one of them was the  creame of corn & mushrooms with a bernaise sauce. Yummy lol The reason I gave it 4 starst is because even though our server was sweet & friendly I feel like we were dealing more with our busser then the actual server . I don't know maybe he was new.  And to top it off the truffle pudding was Soo mouthwatering oh man I would go back just for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle pudding must try!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Ny with cream of corn &amp; mushrooms as our sides. Bernaise sauce is out of this !
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceaser salad dressing tasted fresh.

p35kjEBlT8nflm68uHAZXA.text: This place is OK overall.  Trusted Yelp to find a good steak place for my friends birthday in Vegas without breaking the bank so we made a reservation here. Although we made reservations in advance, we were sat at the kitchen. For a place that is as snobby as the staff were, I was surprised that they even had kitchen seating? I don't mind a nice personal view into the kitchen but this kitchen was a bit noisy and carefree on the fact that customers were placed there. So the ambiance of this place was not very impressive.  The food: They had the bone in filet as their special but they didn't work too much on giving it a good price to convince me that I wanted a meal that was preselected in sides and seasoning. I could build my own filet with double the seasonings for cheaper so I did that instead. My friends had bone in NY Steaks and another filet with king crab oscar. The best meal was the king crab oscar filet. It did add a twist to the meat that brought out a different flavor to the entire meal. I have to agree with our waiter and state that it should always be served this way. As for my meal, I tried the peppercorn and onions. It was meh overall. The steak, of course, was good but only because it was a filet. The meat is already what it was and it being Gallagher's didn't add anything special to it so i will not give credit to the restaurant in this case. Overall, I would say it was a 4 star quality if it was based on the food itself.  Price: it was about average to be expected for a steakhouse. It was not obscene but it was not cheap. The perception of price is used in this establishment. An old marketing trick to assure that the hit to the wallet isn't visually grandiose; all items are a la carte. So you buy the items piece by piece. I enjoy the "option" feeling but don't think it's a fair trade value for those options in this case.  Service: Now this is where the stars fall off. Did you think I rated it poorly because I snobbishly didn't want to sit in the kitchen? oh no, I enjoy lots of different experiences and would have flipped a story to make the birthday girl happy sitting there as if we exclusively saw what goes on back stage. No, the service was extremely poor (overall). It started good actually, The reception were very professional, clean, and helpful. Loved it! The waiter was friendly and showed a lot of effort. He came by and spoke to us, explained meals, specials, and drinks. As the night progressed, we saw less and less of him as well as not be able to ask anyone else for assistance. We started to wait for drink orders for over 15 minutes with no one in sight. So, about an hour in after ordering our meal, I flagged down some person with a suit that was headed to the kitchen. I only assumed because of the direction he was going...I mean, everyone else had a name tag and after I had flagged him down, I realized. . oh! he had no name tag. So I asked..sorry, do you work here? (perhaps a manager since he has no name?) His response rudely was, "Of course!" with a duh attitude. I wanted to explain to him that he didn't fit the normal uniform and I didn't notice that he had no name tag. And at an upscale dining establishment. . . finding a man in a suit is rather common. I had a vest on myself and just a coat away from dressing better than him. But I shrugged it off as I didn't want to hold him back from where he was going.  I inquired about our meal since at this rate of just waiting without any sign of our waiter, it may be another hour before we get to eat and will miss our show. I made the reservation for 7pm and had a 9:30pm show. We were hoping to grab a drink before it but spoiler alert, we finished dining at 9:20pm and had no time to look around the hotel. He then proceeded to look down his nose to me and say that this was a True Italian dining experience and that I should have known this before booking this restaurant before the show. My issue here is that he started scolding me without even knowing the context of the situation or even talking with our waiter. This bothered me a lot. Is it True Italian style to wait for your drink for 20 minutes before they arrive? I think some Italians would disagree. I know I would get sober enough not to want another by then personally. i highly doubt our case was based on the theme of this establishment. I could rant on about more after this but this was the main story experience of this place. It's Vegas. Many choices and great options to partake on.  Go elsewhere. I truly don't recommend this place. I regret not just going to StripSteak at the Mandalay but I wanted to try something new.   perhaps the real Gallagher's in Real NY is better? I'm not sure. I surely don't want to find out when I'm in the area. I'll try other places as well.

RnIadsN6jWRrkoYAYvQOIg.text: It was just ok, I thought it would be better. Maybe I'm just too use to places like Carnevino, Ruth's Chris, and Flemmings(love those places). Anyway, they have dry-aged and dry/wet-aged steak, the New York steak is the only one just dry-aged. I ordered the New York steak, creamed spinach and Mac and cheese. Honestly instead of tasting creamy , it had a chalky taste to it.  The left over steak I had actually tasted so much better the next day. The waitress came by and checked on us before our food came, after that she disappeared and we had to ask another waiter to find her so we could pay the bill and leave. We waited way too long there after finishing our meal. It's not an absolutely terrible place to eat but I know I wouldn't come back to spend money here, it would have to be FREE! #SorryNotSorry

Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged New York steak
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday ice cream

qthASTAfQgJr4Y6FOUFgqQ.text: We had a great dinner for our family party at Gallagher's.  We were seated in their back dining room, which was a lot more private.  Everybody ordered steak of course and the Filets and Cowboy Ribeyes we had were all prime.    I also recommend their Clam Chowder.  It was some of the best I've tasted.  Everything is ala carte, but the side orders came in big portions.    Service was top notch, also.  If you'd like to go to a classy dinner at a Vegas Steak House, you couldn't go wrong, IMO.

mlHiFKBI5ekjEIU0chNzrQ.text: Great place sits in NY, NY Las Vegas and it's not only for Steaks, but also for Seafood.  Had their Seafood Appetizer platter and was not disappointed with the quantity and quality. Nice ambiance just like a NY Steakhouse set in a busy Casino

QnRR9l3Hnb-WH_yOdhyeDQ.text: one thing this place was loud sound echos all over we had a real loud table by us they were drunk and loud.but as I could see spending a lot of money so nothing was done. My food was good had the shrimp and grits to start things it was really good. The calamari was just ok kind of weird texture.  Everyone enjoyed their steaks the service was good.  the problem was the loud drunks next to us.  Places like Anthony s at the golden nugget and Binions would not have allowed that.

G6L8I_feHZhXqBBumPb8lw.text: Went here for my boyfriends birthday and the food was fabulous. I had the salmon and my boyfriend had the steak.   The only hiccup we had was that we were seated next to a couple with 2 loud kids. But we asked our server to be reseated and he kindly moved us to the more private room away from the screaming rugrats.  Great service, great food. I would eat at this place again in a heartbeat.

HTwknG-DVFvRoaPLyiiK7w.text: We went there for a formal dinner before show. We ordered shrimp cocktail for the appetizer, french onion soup, rib-eye and filet mignon. The shrimp cocktail was really good. The steaks were huge so they were really worth the price. We couldn't finish two steaks and had to box one. The only issue was that you had to order sauces for the steaks because they didn't come with any seasoning. The rib-eye was a little overcooked in my opinion.

NozmYIQoNiwDm9TjXx9dOg.text: Back in town again, back here again, great steaks and service, tried recommended Sticky Toffee....worth the trip JUST for this dessert! Fantastic!!!

-zEzC3ts-pDk2FazBeXWzw.text: I ate here about 3 years ago.  It was one of the best steakhouses I've ever eaten at.  However, it does come at a price.  Expensive, but in my opinion, well worth it if you are looking for the finest meats and seafood.  I ordered the surf and turf, which was on point, all the way.  Cooked perfectly and the flavor, top notch. The sides could have been a little better, but the filet and lobster more than made up for that.  I would definitely make a stop for dinner here again at some point.

BWj0se9pELqauCZSyMH0JA.text: Not good. We love steak and were very excited to eat here. It was not what they advertise to be. The portions are huge but the quality is sub par. We ordered the New York Strip and Prime Rib. The New York was so chard that all you could taste was char. The Prime Rib had zero flavor and was slightly under cooked. The sides were okay, but not worth the cost. If you want a great steak dinner, this is not the place!

JLhr51QivA-I7GtHC3jVcA.text: Wow, the food here is AMAZING! The Cowboy Ribeye is as good as they come.  I would write more, but I want to eat!

lKUKUxvkT-i_iXhWGuaIeA.text: For the price it was the best steakhouse I have been to.  The service was amazing. I love how they have so many people working to make sure you have a great experience.  I had the ny strip and my wife had the filet.  Both steaks were huge and very yummy.  The Gallagher wedge salad was very refreshing and a good way to start the night. We look forward to eating there again.

m_uaJGmtQn5oNmdi77-Q0g.text: Yes, the steak was good but the service was AMAZING! I wanted to talk to the manager or something to thank them for the impeccable service they provided, but we just left a nice tip instead. Thank you so much for a great experience :D

vTYfuOyjQZDqOjOwP20jhA.text: Dry-aged beef FTW!  Been here for a few times and most recently after a tradeshow.  It seriously is one of my favorite steakhouse... anywhere  I always get the dry-aged New York strip sirloin, done medium rare.  It's an amazing piece of steak.  Must be around 20-24oz, it is just thick.  It's always grilled perfectly.  That first bite, when the fat from the steak just melts in your mouth... is just the best.  I never get any sauces or condiments to go with the steak since I think they season the steak so well that nothing is needed.  Having grilled with the bone gives it that extra flavor too.  Better than any steak I've had anywhere.  As for sides, that's the only downer.  All the veggies are pretty much sauteed and drenched in butter.  It's absolutely delicious but at the same time... it just might be too much.  Mashed potatoes are nothing special and mac & cheese isn't that cheesy to me.  Caesar salad is big pieces of romaine lettuce with grated parmesan reggiano.  Nothing special but the croutons is crazy good.  I can eat a bowl full.  Also got to try the fried calamari this time around.  Pretty damn delicious, especially with the marinara sauce.  But really, if you come to a steakhouse, the only thing that matters is the steak!  Located in NYNY, the steakhouse looks like a classic steakhouse from NY with the decor.  You would think it would be loud since it's right next to the casino floor but its more from the patrons that are dining and the high ceiling.  Make reservations, cause it's not big at all and it can get full fast.  If you want a lot of steak, order the Cowboy steak.  It is huge, just huge.

rqRh-rfnnHgvGoreWTqY7w.text: Went there to celebrate a night with friends and the service was great and the food was amazing. We had fresh seafood and a great steak.

WXjFMaHukvy1obd5yxzzJw.text: We had the Ribeye tonight; very tasty - aged Angus, five weeks. Marinated asparagus, broccoli in a light cream sauce, started off with oysters on the half shell... wish I could hold desert. Sam was our server - what a nice guy, he enjoys a fine cigar too...  This restaurant is wonderful  :  )

3EZ_W3iOo7kA-4diiGIMWw.text: Staff very friendly and responsive.  We were a party of 2 and they put us in the back groom with two larger parties were seated.  The noise level in that room was a bit higher than I liked, it was Saturday night, so whatever.  We didn't have an appetizer, just main course.  My wife had the salmon and green beans, both good.  She wished the salmon was just a bit more cooked through, but by no means was it "bad"...   I had the NY and broccoli.  The steak was fine, not the best I've ever had, but it was good.  For the price, we enjoy Brand Steakhouse in Monte Carlo better.

iwsh7Hfk7894KifGtnMMLQ.text: This review is solely based on the awesome restaurant management at New York New York. After leaving my poor rating for gallaghers on yelp, I had a manager contact me asking about my experience. She was extremely kind and offered a second trip on them to gallaghers. I just received my gift certificate and am excited to go back and have a better experience. Thank you!!

Uti-13NyfxnHbgNzdj8jTw.text: This place is seriously good. I think it ruined other steaks for me which sucks. But it was so so worth it. I forgot our waiters names but I think he was employee of the year in 2008 or 2009. If your reading this thanks for the awesome service

n25mCmWMV2q4OgWr0Dfftg.text: We ate here on Thursday 6/7/12. Party of 8 for my friends 40th birthday. He had been to Gallagher's many times. It was a first for myself. The service was great. John was our server. He was very attentive, just what you would expect from a steak house. My wife and I ordered the iceberg wedge to start. It was great, exactly what I expected. We shared the chilled king crab legs appetizer. The crab legs cut long ways and served on the half shell. Wonderful! Then, we shared the New york steak. It was very good. I will eat he again for sure.

iU7wxnNF_aGg39532wbyEw.text: May 20th my husband and I were married and were taken to this restaurant by our best men and family members. Making reservations was easy and the customer service just over the phone was great, but even greater when we got there. Our waiter Preston  was not only charming but very experienced  in his trade.  He walked us through the entire dinner experience. I ordered the cowboy steak med rare expecting a much smaller portion I was pleasantly surprise to see the size of the steak. However the steak was a tad bit on the rare side our waiter must have watched me cut into it because he was right there to ask me if everything was OK. I told him it was a Little  to rare for my choice and he immediately took it back to the kitchen. When I got it back it was like they gave me  new steak. We had a amazing time and my husband and I will definitely be back. To sum it up, great service through out, wonderful atmosphere  and wonderful food. Best steak house so far. Thanks Gallagher's for making my wedding night so special.

g2Wgjv5MijZaog3FrG22CA.text: I rarely write a review, but our meal was soooooo good that I felt obligated.  We ate dinner here while staying at the New York Casino in Las Vegas.  Pomegranate Martinis were served in frosty glasses and were delicious.  I thought I had had the best beet salad ever....that is until I had this one.  The beets, greens, dressing were so fresh and tasty. Clam chowder, best I've had and I have lived in San Francisco and New Orleans!  Blackened Shrimp & Grits were to die for....The waiter had asked if the 4 shrimp would be enough since this was an appetizer for my meal.  I could barely eat all 4 they were so big.  Had crab cakes....delicious and the wine to the key lime pie were simply the best. Top service too-boot.  I am so critical when it comes to dining out, but I couldn't find anything that wasn't perfect here. A must if going to Las Vegas!!!

0BaG2t8tyWcV8KRNpBvsKw.text: My fiancee and I happened to stop by here while we are New York New York and was glad that we did.  It was a weekend night out and we were leaving that Sunday.  Their bar service was absolutely phenomenal!  The price is right and they know how to make dirty martini's (w/blue cheese olives) and Manhattan's straight up.  Its so hard sometimes to find a place that makes them the way they are supposed to be.    Being a  NY restaurant themed it would have been a shame if they didn't know . Going to come here for my Manhattan's from here on out.

i_omS8nMFzGCwCsUnCNTNA.text: Researched yelp for the perfect dinner for my honeymoon and this was it! We ordered shrimp cocktail- amazing! Biggest shrimp I have ever had and a spicy cocktail sauce! I had a wedge salad and my wife a Caesar, both were average We shared the cowboy ribeye which was sooooo good and we couldn't even finish it. We also ordered a side of steak fries which were seasoned sooo good and came with homemade zesty ketchup. They were the best fries I have ever had. For dessert we shared cheesecake which was light and airy and creamy. Very good but I prefer the hard rich kind myself.  Excellent food, but as people wrote before, the staff is ALWAYS THERE! Our waiter came by probably 12 times, plus multiple bussers clearing plates the second they were emptied. I was well taken care of but they could give a little more privacy

STJ1h6wvjOVumSZArv3JfQ.text: This restaurant must be one of the good choice if you looking for a meat-ful dinner in Las Vegas. Location is in NYNY hotel.

fEb2Y6fZkdDjodD1jDjg6w.text: Food was divine.  The filet practically melts in your mouth.  Curry mashed potatoes were flavorful and a nice change to an old favorite.

b5JZ9Hq06p8qTwy8ZDPwBw.text: Gallagher's really is top notch if you want a good steak in Las Vegas.  1 1/2 inches thick, of pure aged sirloin of mouthwatering pleasure! This really was a great steak. I went with a friend who has never had an aged steak and didn't know what to expect. I actually told Mark our waiter that I blog on Yelp. He made sure we had the thickest steaks the chef could find. They were cooked to the perfect temperature and just melted in your mouth. We split a gigantic baked potato, with all the toppings and it was also cooked just right.  The service was just as good as the food, there is a great buzz of activity throughout the restaurant, and when we came out the line was 20 deep. A must go to restaurant if you are in Vegas.

C4JhGMcfmIKrSrZFL2P1FA.text: my plus one took me here for a lovely, lovely birthday dinner before the beatles love show.  Everything was superb and deliciously season!  Pass on the mac and cheese it was so so and honestly coudl've skipped it completely, however, that did hamper the incredible dinner at all.  Since it was vegas and drinks were plenty at the tables we opted for the most valuable of all things in vegas... Water!   the steak was cooked to order! I didn't any of  my lovely companion's crab legs cause I'm not a shell fish kind of man but she sure did make it look good!  I like staying at NYNY and now i'll go to this place more often since my first time was the best time and it was on my actual birthday!

8HkWJepu-9LNpsAU97NQYQ.text: I believe this was the best steak I've ever had. I told my girlfriend that the only two things I *had* to do during our stay in Vegas was hit the buffet at the Bellagio and have a steak at a fancy, classy steakhouse. The steak was the highlight of our trip.  We made reservations, and arrived 15 minutes early but were seated immediately even though we were prepared to wait at the bar. I would have preferred slightly more room between tables and a little less noise, but otherwise I felt the place was very comfortable. Our waiter was very courteous. I wore a sports jacket/tie and my gf wore a LBD, but it looks like the dress code isn't that strict. Still, I'm glad we took the classy route. You can relax and go slightly more casual if you want, but if you want to dress nicer like we did you'll fit in, too.  I ordered the signature sirloin, and I can't imagine why anybody would get any other steak. The filet may be more tender, but it couldn't possibly have flavor like this and believe me it was VERY tender. I ordered mine medium-rare and it was cooked perfectly. The edges were just a bit caramelized, the inside was a nice even pinkish-red. I love how they keep it on the bone, it really enhances the flavor. My girlfriend ordered the pork chop. I expected a single double-thick chop but instead it was two thinner chops, but it was still very tender. I had a taste and the sauce was a little sweet for my taste, but it was excellent. My gf loved it. She asked our waiter a question about what fruit it was made with, and he knew the answer without any hesitation at all (apricot I think?). VERY good waiter. We shared our sides, the potato certainly lived up to its "colossal" billing and the asparagus was nice and crisp, although I could have done without the heavy hollandaise sauce.  I ordered a wine by the glass. At the end of my second glass as we were getting ready to leave, I noticed there was a wine sediment at the bottom of my glass. I was impressed with the service and I'm sure if I'd noticed it when I started drinking it, they would have fixed it for me. So I don't hold it against them. My gf was very happy with her cocktail.  We were too full (and satisfied) to try dessert.

H7AaA0GYkUx4a5vDaSaScQ.text: Tasty, tasty steak!  We wanted to have steak before leaving Vegas. Looking at our options, Gallagher's seems to offer the best value for quality. Made a reservation to make sure we got in on time, as we had a show to catch. Definitely the way to go, since we saw a group turned away just before we got seated.  Had: Aged Top Sirloin - the aging sure did enhance the flavors of this steak. The beef is the highlight here. They don't try to cover it up. Cowboy Rib Eye - Big, tender and juicy slab of beef.  Both were perfectly cooked to order. We didn't eat any steak for a few weeks following this meal because we didn't want to follow up such good steak with something worse.  We also ordered the steak fries. These were great as well. Crunchy on the outside, hot, soft potato on the inside. The ketchup, omg the ketchup! Delicious ketchup with a kick. Our guess is that it's infused with truffle oil and possibly some roasted jalapeno as well. Whatever it is, it lifted the fries beyond 'just another basket of fries'.  Our waiter was attentive throughout.   We found out that there was an emergency in the kitchen (saw paramedics coming in), yet the only tell-tale sign was that our food took a little longer to come out. They  run a smooth operation.  We have no regrets picking Gallagher's over the other, more upscale steakhouses. The steak is definitely worth the price here, especially when you take into account the Strip premium.

QFtix85q6lrf6L0lC46uJA.text: I'm pretty easy to please when it comes to steak -- as long as it doesn't look like a burger -- but this place is something else, and not because I've stopped here almost every time I've gone to Vegas.  The ambiance is perfect; not Vegas cheesy, but classy, especially if you have one of the seats that faces out to the "street" in the casino. It's a refreshing change from some of the other Vegas dinner places that try a bit too hard.  The food is incredible. I have never had a bad steak here (ask me my opinion of Pacific Dining Car), and the sides are top notch. I highly recommend the beefsteak tomato salad, much different than doing a regular salad. And every other side I've had here really complimented the menu (the potatoes, the spinach). It's a complete restaurant.  The bar really knows how to serve them strong, has a good wine list, and a great beer list. And I've knocked back a few at the bar without even eating here.

FbxuIrVDpe8LMr2Myf4U8g.text: I nursed many drinks in front of Gallagher's just hoping to see a vegan get angry at the glass-front meat lockers. It never happened, and I was really surprised. The sight really is grotesque in that uniquely carnivorous sort of way.   Just the same, I really liked the food. It wasn't a cheap steak, but then again, it wasn't a cheap steak.   Definitely recommended.

nLgIo4-4pazxo-H3kpyDog.text: Stopped by here for a drink before heading to see Zumanity.  Our bartender Fernando delivered the best service ever.  We then ordered dinner which we did not intend to do.  But the drinks were so good and the service matched up, we just couldn't resist.  Cant wait to visit this place again.

0JBTlndqoJrax-9FVYp8zg.text: AHMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Sam our server was fantastic.  An amazing meal!! Tried everything everyone order and it was all melt in your mouth spectacular.  And who ever the bartender was should be my new best friend. I ordered a Lemon Drop, and it was so good I had 2 more! hehehe

HKJl2WQPUKESrrWR8-ZKJg.text: Was not impressed with the bone in strip steak. Was really tough. Out of the 3 strip steaks 2 were done right and 1 was under done. The prime rib was out of this world however. Service was top notch as well. I would return

2c0HTk8Ey2jfKxaHjZo1UQ.text: It's been a long time since I had Gallagher's steak. The last time was at this place was actually New Year's Eve 2007(I checked in NY NY). This is where I had one of the most great tasting Fillet Mignon I've ever had. Thinking about it still makes me Salivate. The meat is served just how you want them, out of all the times I've been in this place, I NEVER had to call on my server and had my meat re-done. Huge serving, I never realized how much meat I can consume after eating everything on my plate.  I must say after eating  everything, I could hardly breathe because I was so full. Money well spent on a giant size meal. Hands down!
