Yw7tIHQ_K_u01QJCII8ALA.text: Major downgrade. I had the aged sirloin. It was soft, well cooked, etc, NO FLAVOR. This is not prime or kobe, its barely choice, its like meat from a bovine weight lifter. Noise level was way too loud. Wine list is terrible, not nearly enough wines by the glass, and selection was bad and shockingly overpriced. Sides as usual were very good. Too bad the signature steak, done medium rare, was simply soft/tender but had NO FLAVOR. Utterly embarrassing. My friend who went with us seems to have food poisoning now.

xjuOUkOypfX11ev6vChMaA.text: i had to try Gallaghers LV to see how it compares to New york. Between the 2 of us we ordered  1 ribeye; medium rare, garlic mashed potatoes, and a side of broccoli. The portions were huge, i couldn't imagine eating a whole steak by myself. The ribeye was tender and juicy with a little char and the outside just like in NY. I will make sure to eat here again on my next trip to las vegas.

XtYFpvOL_Vc1Cb_M8Kw02A.text: Super delayed review but the hubby and I went to Gallagher's last summer during our annual trek to Vegas to celebrate the birthdays. It was during Las Vegas Restaurant week. Hubby tried the Filet Mignon which he really enjoyed, a tender piece and very tasty. I had the rib-eye which had perfect marbling and an out-of-this-world flavor! Both were good size cuts. We shared the Four Cheese Macaroni, Creamed Spinach and Yukon potatoes for sides, all were delish! As tasty as our meals were, the highlight was definitely the service. Our waiter was super attentive, friendly and offered spots to visit whilst in town (though we're not Vegas rookies). We're heading back this summer and will absolutely be returning to Gallaghers!

eSUxUC_BxRwOVhNPR_-0PA.text: Great!!! Service... Beautiful Inimate & classy ambiance.. My 2nd trip there & still the best ribeye steak I have ever had.... I highly recomend !!!

JR8WXcbWBXYIvbEJFTpFmw.text: i took waaaaaay too long to come to this place...  i always   maybe it had to do with the fact that every time i had been to vegas, and was around the new york new york, i was with dudes.  my homies.  all of which had no interest in trying (spending) on something more than something quick and cheap.  so now that i'm married, i'm happy that i get to come with my wife.   i was finally able to come here after a marathon hunt for creamed spinach.  and we knew that only steakhouses would be a sure shot to get some...   the place is casual, its dead in the middle of the food area of the NYNY.  so dont expect to completely cupcake - it is a bit busy and noisy.  i can look beyond this no problem...  we shared the cowboy bone-in ribeye, creamed spinach, whipped yukon potatoes, caramelized onions, and a mushroom medley.  the steak was fantastic - nothing short of a great cut and cooked perfectly MEDIUM.  the meat was tender, juicy, and cooked on a well-seasoned grill.  that makes a huge difference in my book, a well seasoned grill.    the yukon's were great, maybe a lil too whipped for my liking, since i like them to be a little thick.  the flavor was good, nothing that i would make it a point to order again.  creamed spinach was good.  it lacked salt, which to some may be a good thing since you can add some (rather than too much and be SOL), but i rarely grab a salt shaker, unlessi absolutely have to.  and this time, i had to.  yes, i would come back.  i likedededed it!

VuYo6_hPQBlHGFmwKJTAcA.text: My husband and I went to Vegas for our 1st marriage anniversary. We are irish so we really wanted try this place. We made reservations hours in advance. When we got there we were sat in the back in the corner , the lady walking by to take pictures walked by our table twice and didn't even acknowledge we were there. My husband ordered his steak medium well and I ordered mine  medium. His came more well done and mine was more medium rare... For the money we paid we thought we would get better quality.. Oh and the Cesar salad had whole romain leafs. We thought that was odd too.. Oh well we won't go back

NARHVTJ5AszkbTdRF-Oh2Q.text: We went to Gallagher's to celebrate my 30th birthday, and were actually very disappointed.  The service was awful.  Our server was condescending and more interested in a larger party that clearly had a bigger check.  The food was good, but nothing special.  With so many terrific restaurants in Vegas I will definitely be finding somewhere else to go next time.

2why5GHo_i9M3H4Q1Dr4AA.text: Had A Great steak in Vegas, at New York New York. Wasn't a five star for me but definitely 4.5  Great wait staff, ambiance wad pretty good too. Over all I'd  recommend Gallaghers just based off the atmosphere and staff..

a93yBX8ZDsd9gwf47SJlnA.text: With so many options for steak houses in Vegas it really comes down to price. At Gallaghers you will get a good steak and some New York vibes.   I had their "Dry Aged New York steak"(only the New York is dry aged) with no sauce. The flavor that dry aging gives the meat is very different but at the same time suddel. I had their sateed mushrooms as my side. The portions were very reasonable for the price.   Service was excellent, our server answered all of our questions and gave us plently of attention. I swear the water guy talked like a Jersey native haha.   If you're thinking of coming here be sure to make a reservation or you most likely will wait for a table.

kTPMpdYVReNFFT14c1xQOw.text: What a disappointment. I had been wanting to try this place for years.   Walk in get sat..... Pretty full for a Sunday. Sit around for a bit before someone comes around and pours us water and walks away.   We sit some more before a server comes and asks if wed like a drink? Oh no welcome... Ok. I'll take a cucumber martini and can you bring a wine list. We Order a bottle of wine.   15 minutes later. He just opens it. No talk about it no introduction. Ok. Great wine. Then asks if were ready.   I ask about the 1 aged steak this restaurant has. [thank god I know what the aging process is because he didn't explain a thing abut it ]. I asked him if there was any feature. He said nothing except the catch of the day is mahi mahi... Which is weird because it says halibut on the board when you walk in. I asked him what was the seasoning on the fries, he asked me if I had an allergy... Then clearest bullshitted the ingredients. I responded with.... No I just wanted to the seasoning that's in the Steak Cut Seasoned Fries. I basically asked every single questioned that he could have answered had he said one sentence at the table.   Dinner:  Wedge.... Boring. Bland. Watered down blu cheese   Clam chowder.... Yummy one star  Aged strip ..... For the process that steak goes through I was expecting a ton of flavor. Disappointed.   Veal.... AMAZING ... Another star   Mushroom medley...    Bland   Puree...... Bland   I order a dirty martini for dessert.. I see it just sitting at the bar... So I got up to go get it. Then ordered another drink from the bartender since my server was no where to be found.   Then another guy closes us out... My sever had been missing since steak time.   Overall fail from this place.

JMOWkd71zhi0KGNlUMjz-g.text: I will make this short and sweet: the quality of the meat was subpar (even though the presentation outside looks amazing) and the sides were very average (some hits, some misses). Our party of 8 was also squeezed into the smallest table possible; we kept having to move plates around to try and make everything fit (with reservations!). Yes, it's cheaper than other steakhouses, but I really think steak is one of those where it's better to do it big or don't do it at all. Take your $ to Craftsteak or Bazaar Meat, I promise you won't regret it!

iQ-aFQv0bhA-J9UoUGPKpw.text: For $50+ steak I expected a knowledgeable waiter and the steak to be done right. This is not the case. The waiter told us their signature is for all steak to be served bone in. My friend ordered Filet Mignon, and there was no bone. Not the biggest deal, but when your restaurant's signature is the bone-in feature, it is kinda disappointing.  Another friend and I both ordered Porter House medium. Mine was done right, but my friend's was on the well done side. The difference was noticeable visibly. My view about steak is that while the meat quality and preparation does matter, the cooking process is most important. I understand different chefs have different interpretation of what is "medium". But when two steak which are the same cut and ordered to the same table comes out that different, it just shows that something went wrong.

M5sEevxkZjSzRxtqqRqgSg.text: My wife and I have lived in Vegas for a decade, and in that time we've tried every high-end steakhouse in the valley. Mostly, we've been slightly disappointed. Many are slightly overpriced; some are highly overpriced; and only a few deliver True value for your money. And that's the case with Gallagher's. We both had filet mignon and lobster, along with a plethora of sides and exclusive cocktails, and this place is worth every penny. It's nearly half the price of the big-name steakhouses both on the Strip and across the valley, but we felt the attention to the food and the service rocketed Gallagher's beyond the competition. Granted, this place is not cheap. It's for special occasions, but my god: The meat is aged for nearly a month (both wet and dry aging), and the chefs take special care to cook your steak precisely how you like it. These chefs know how to deliver a first-rate steak. Superb and delicious sides, first-rate drinks, and an attentive (but not hovering) wait staff make this our new Vegas favorite. And we're longtime locals. So you can trust us.  Don't spend $500 at the trendy steak places. Come to Gallagher's and see what True craftsmanship is all about. Spend half what you would at those big-name Strip steak joints, and save the other half for gambling.

TuhpeW_wLZfeYGGq-qRZUA.text: Excellent restaurant and dining experience.  I can't say enough good things about this place. I ordered the Cowboy Ribeye which was cooked to a perfect medium rare.    Obviously expect to pay a little more here than say 9 Fine Irishmen nearby, but I would say it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Talk about reasonable.

2iTE1TOVnkRHV6Q6an-Bhg.text: Very satisfied with my experience here, the price was in the range I would expect most steakhouses to be in and the service was attentive and very courteous.  The cowboy ribeye was my favorite, I will absolutely be back to have it again, New York strip however was just okay and I wasn't won over by it.  For sides we had Four Cheese Macaroni and the Yukon Gold potato puree which were super-tasty and we thoroughly enjoyed both, the caramelized onions were a perfect accompaniment for the steaks.  My only misgiving was that being on vacation and in a room with no way to preserve nor reheat leftovers we had too much food!  On our next visit we will just split one steak with the two sides (maybe also try an appetizer) and that should still be more than enough to fill us up.

d66VS3iSjfOwcegk5Hx-2g.text: This was my first visit to Gallagher's in Las Vegas. The original in Manhattan was my first NY Chophouse experience and has stuck with me for a lifetime. I had to order the exact thing I had in my first visit to the city some 25 years ago. Small filet with a salad and creamed spinach. YUM. The Las Vegas Gallagher's lives up to the reputation of it's Manhattan big brother!! Get some!!

VyPBJj4DbPREG42RiX2FfA.text: Very nice dining experience. Staff is extremely friendly, service is quick, and the mest is just fantastic. Relatively high prices, but still reasonable for a restaurant on the strip!

_KJiOpr8MUjRYoLAoKY_Vw.text: We stayed in the New york hotel, so as you pass the restaurant the display of aged steaks makes it very hard for a steak lover to pass up. We had to try it. I have to say that the service was amazing!!!! The atmosphere was perfect for a romantic evening with my wife. We ordered a couple of appetizers to start of course. The choices were Oysters Rockefellers and seared scallops with bacon. I have to say it was super tasty and cooked to perfection. For dinner i had a aged steak with some truffle parmesan steak fries, and my wife had surf and turf lobster/ filet mignon. My meal was okay i didnt care too much for the fries definitely could of did without them and my steak was just okay, it was a bit tuff but flavor was good. I think next time ill try the cowboy steak i heard its better. My wife saidbher food was perfect. So all in all we enjoyed it very much as for prices it is a little prices but the way i see it you pay for what you get. At the end we were happy and would go back.

FS0nYa0gH5TXMB0F9fK0ew.text: I've never had a bad experience here in all the years I've been coming here. I got the prime rib and it was HUGE!!!!!  Didn't get an app cause I don't even finish the steak it's that big. Cooked to order and perfect.

zfUIQIDUYrNShkvee0BEMA.text: Gave my wife and I the poops. AMAZING service, food was pretty good.  Called back and spoke with the manager, no result.

sBpY2X_rg0ZoresQSeKRnw.text: I really do love Gallagher's Steakhouse but one of my favorite things was to stop in for lunch and grab a drink and eat some calamari. But recently they've definitely downgraded their calamari and it's the biggest disappointment. The calamari is way too thin and it almost tastes chemically.  I've only eaten at this place for dinner once a year ago and it was phenomenal. I'm hoping that they haven't started to cheap out on the rest of their menu.

fa9RagELryAYhbTeW318RA.text: I ordered the bone in new york steak and it was so good that I actually finished the entire steak. I also had some asparagus and ceasar salad which were average . Service was great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious bone in new york steak.
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus

Gfqlvj1vC8UVZPDE1Wn0Ow.text: Have eaten here 4 times since 2012, it is my favourite meal every time I am in Las Vegas. The steaks are incredible but the sides make the meal,  particularly the mushrooms!!  Before you eat jump on the roller coaster to get your juices flowing.  New York New York is also a fun casino to visit.

_IOeAC8J4bUiMMBCJ0b9Ow.text: 2 people with 1 cocktail, 1 appetizer, 1 side & entree x2 came to $189. A little overwhelming for some, but completely expected if your a regular visitor to the occasional fancy steak house. This was not that...fancy I mean. It was nice, dark and overall was a nice environment but I did get the "Outback Steakhouse" vibe which would make me think twice before heading there for a birthday or anniversary occasion as I can be a bit of a snob with my environment if I'm paying a hefty price (quality over quantity right?).   Sat down and within 2-3 minutes had our drink orders taken and the drinks delivered. What I can say is the service is impeccable and when you may not see a lot of your busy server you will always have a wait staff ready and willing at any moment near by.  Great place to stop before or after a show!

3jW9I0QWmhIz-UB-s2Cw_A.text: A nice option for steak if you're in the vicinity of New York New York while in Vegas.  We shared a porterhouse which was prepared perfectly.  For sides, we opted for creamed spinach and mashed potatoes.  Both sides we're traditionally prepared without extraneous unnecessary ingredients and were excellent.    Service was prompt and efficient.  We felt the pricing was reasonable given the quality of our meal.  An enjoyable experience.

03gHY9uIsDJu7Q73kSy7Bw.text: Some friends wanted to go here and I tagged along.  We had a reservation and were seated right on time.  From what I recall, the decor was typical gaudy Las Vegas flair.  The prices are average for a steakhouse, though the food was actually very good.  If you have the deep pockets, you won't be disappointed!  The service was prompt except for when it was time for the check.  I guess the waiter must have been on a break or something.    With my hard-earned money, I'll skip this place on my next visit to Sin City.

GE9qn63VhiYCu9Qvt5Npdw.text: Great service.  Good aged steak.  Clam chowder was alright.  Mac n cheese not too bad.

4c6p4zO0aTd6yCrcPSqEDA.text: Just a word of caution, anyone giving this place low stars, regard it with a grain of salt, and most certainly be wary of any of their other reviews. I heard one person say the word bland several times. My guess is they were born without tastebuds. I can't speak enough about this restaurant. I don't write many reviews but felt compelled to do so for this one of kind authentic steak house. Everything from the drinks to the main course were absolutely mind blowing.   Our entire vegas trip was made worth it based on this restaurant alone. The waiter advised is to share a potato because they were big. Good advice. I'm can put down a lot of food but no me and my wife were perfectly satisfied with sharing the potato. The appetizer was a stuffed mushroom. Yes one mushroom. It was massive and like nothing we had ever eaten before. Not sure what all was in it, but we were sad to see that last bite go away. I came here to look up their menu because I had the best beer of my life there. Yeah they don't make the beer, but that was my first experience with one of the IPA's they had on tap that the waiter recommended when I asked. Even my wife liked it, and she isn't in to beer.  It was ballast point sculpin if you are interested. Anyway. If you want an amazing steak dinner in Vegas. Don't pass on gallaghers.

y3LvbzIA99KFzPHNApNcfw.text: Located at New York New York casino, it was a pleasant restaurant. Food was good but a bit pricey as all extras and sides are al a carte. The service was on the slower side but the waiter was pleasant. The salmon was very good and you really don't need to order sides with that. Filet was very tender but needed Bernaise so I recommend ordering that or another accompaniment separate.

eGdtUU2gd5--Zlp7v0svPw.text: What the service was excellent celebrated my friends wife's birthday dinner there I had the fillet mignon it was cooked to perfection from the appetizers to the  best experience ever.See you soon guy's have to go back thanks again for a great dinner.

AY2zpB6IYerCslPy0aQhLQ.text: We had a filet and New York strip.  Price was more than reasonable.  My only issue was our reservations were at 730.  We were seated at 745.  Even ordering right away food didn't come out until 9.  Little slower than I would have liked.  But food was amazingly good.  I will eat here again.

Cu1vBCSd2EMhCvs1z1PvOQ.text: More like 4.5 stars -- almost perfect =P  Probably one of if not the best steak I've had in Vegas. I've been here 3 times already and each time has been great!  First of all, this place is always PACKED.  Make sure you have reservations or you'll have a wait around dinner time.  I've ordered the filet mignon twice and the queen cut prime rib once, and also have tried the porterhouse and the cowboy rib-eye (GREAT FLAVOR).  All have been superb, but I will say that my favorite is still the tender filet. Each time it has been cooked precisely medium-rare as ordered...which is often a difficult task even at some of the best steakhouses.  The one time I ordered the queen cut prime rib, I was disappointed after having such a great previous visit and ordering the filet.  Although the queen cut was a sizable portion (but not too big that I couldn't finish) they served me a medium-well to well (see pic), when I had ordered medium-rare. (I didn't bother sending it back cuz I was so hungry, just decided not to order it again in the future). The prime rib cut is on the thicker side and not quite as flavorful as prime rib I've enjoyed at other establishments that primarily serve prime rib (Lawry's or SF's House of Prime Rib). After that, I stuck with only ordering filet, which has been consistently top-notch.  BEST SIDE EVER: seasonal mushroom medley!!  Unbelievable! You'll have to taste it to understand.  Their sauteed spinach and macaroni are great as well.  Don't forget to save/make room for their creme brulee -- it's amazing!!!  This place is not your typical snooty, quiet steakhouse.  It's actually very lively, as everyone seems to be enjoying themselves in great company. Service was super friendly and attentive.  They checked on us regularly and we were never low on water. Only slight inconvenience would be that the restaurant itself did not have restrooms and you have to exit through the backdoor to use NYNY hotel's restrooms instead. However, that's really minor compared to the quality of food and service that you'll get here =)

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. neato light-up dessert menu!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The queen cut prime rib. I ordered a medium-rare...this is what I got though =&#39;(

uMxSgyvY-VAxgxBNi92nnw.text: Good Strip Steak, 16 oz is a ton of food , had the creamy spinach and the garlic mash as sides , perfect for 2 or 3 people .

0EY_KaKgDNk_Mbu4q65a8g.text: Made reservations ahead of time and had no problems. Steak was THICK!  Great flavor, and I know it was Vegas prices, but I've had really similar taste/cut with a SF area steakhouse at well half the price. Sides were delicious. Split sides with someone as portions are large. I would go back if we wanted steak while in Vegas.

7uWnZYNGY8jrqJKyw2gCmA.text: Can I make this 0 stars? I have never been so appalled in my life within the first 30 seconds of entering an establishment.....I had a server named Jessica who has dark red hair and a very bad attitude. My girlfriend and I walked in to this steak house which I assumed was nice and before we ordered our wine we asked for glasses of water (with lemon) clearly she was not ready to work or excited to take care of a table of two non elders .....so as she walked over to her water boy she said "another water with lemon" in such a condescending tone I was disgusted....I immediately got up and left and will never be back

KFaa51Pv-nlW8vquwzH-gw.text: It was "alright," very expensive for the quality of food.  The server was helpful and polite, the girls working the reservations, not so much, expecially one I believed her name was Myla, she called to confirm my reservations the day before and had an attitude, then the night of the reservations I called to advise we may be 5-10 min late and she HUNG UP ON ME.    If you want a GOOD STEAK, I still stand behind Ruth's Chris steakhouse !!!! 100%

0e0CFGoK21wrbrTkCUr0qg.text: A historic night - to celebrate closing on our new house in Las Vegas!  Yes, mi amigos, after nearly 12 years of sippin' on the purple drank in Houston, it is time for me & the H-town hubby to head west and live the quiet life in boring ol' Vegas.  Hmmm... whatever will a girl do for fun??  Well, for one, it's time to get my Yelp back on, and start wining & dining out more often.  Our official landing date is November 19 - Vegas, you have been warned!  Anyway, where was I?  Oh yeah, Gallagher's.  Well, we were staying at New Yawk New Yawk while finalizing the close on our new casa (maybe you've heard of it - some might call it The Bellagio - word!), so the natural spot for a feast fit for a king & queen was their high end steakhouse.  Yes, you drop some significant coin here, but it is totally worth it.  Hubby's filet was top 10 all-time, my food (whatever the heck I ordered) was really good, and both the beer & wine selection met our approval.  Plus, the bartender was super nice to us when we finished up our post-dinner cocktails at their bar.  So, there you have it - hopefully the first of many, many Las Vegas eatery & drinkery reviews on Yelp from moi.  And remember - I don't want the five dollars in your pocket, I want your soul...

WfUBQzIkORufVlc2UUqojg.text: Steak a must. The bar, a must! Especially when Shaun is there. He's knowledgable, funny, and a mans man. You gotta belly up to this bar grab a steak, hang with Shaun crack wise and pass the night away! I love this place.

dBg-KcmA3zulw5ZRmanaKw.text: Amazing steak big enough to share, the mash potato of the day had bacon which was yummy, Cesar salad had just the right amount of dressing.. The service was great our server recommendations were on point

tdelljSD4MzKr03S7hhNQw.text: I'm getting hungry just thinking about what to write for this restaurant. Great food, great drinks, great service. I think that covers it.

RmHqOMBiHPeblSxu18VLKg.text: Service and commitment to quality and satisfaction is why I scored this place 5 Stars. The staff is super friendly. The food was mostly excellent. My wife and I had a cob salad and clam chowder. Both were wonderful. Our entrees were good (not great). It appeared that they cooked my wife's filet the way I wanted my ribeye and vice versa which meant my ribeye was over cooked and was a bit more fatty and than I like. I didn't complain but the waitress took note and asked so I told her and insisted that I was ok not looking for another steak or freebie. We ordered desert, Cheesecake, which was fantastic. (Especially the crust). When I was given the bill the waitress told me that she removed the charge for the steak. Great service and appreciate them doing what they felt was right when I clearly wasn't looking for anything. I will for sure be back!

qAa3YXXnmvNiL_0e_VExsA.text: I want to see you stand outside and take a look at all those delicious steaks dry aging in the window and tell me your stomach isnt dragging you inside.  Interior decor and vibe reminds me of NY for sure.  Small, somewhat cramped seating.  Barely room to put all your food on the table.  Let's get to the best part, I had the ribeye and it was absolutely delicious.  The glaze on that bad boy made it so delectable.  Size was big, cooked perfectly!!  Apps were just ok, nothing that really stood out to me.  Had the clam chowder, bruschetta and caprese salad.  Service was wonderful, every waiter we had was on top of what they were responsible for.  We came for our anniversary and they certainly did their best to make us feel special :) Sad, we'd venture into fancier restaurants wouldnt get the same service, so it was definitely appreciated here!  I'll definitely be back!!

KpNleqr5ND4IaQxdHGjg1g.text: VEGETARIAN REVIEW:  For appetizers we got BRUSCHETTA and it was really good!  Nicely seasoned.    I got the MUSHROOM SALAD as my first course and it was also very good.  It came with bacon so I had to ask the waitress to bring it back (which she said was a mistake because she told them it was for a vegetarian).    The only vegetarian entree were the side dishes which is usually the case with steakhouses.  I got the STEAK FRIES  and FRENCH GREEN BEANS.  The fries were okay, needed a bit more seasoning but the ketchup was spicy and went well with the fries.  The green beans were also just okay.  Dessert was the usual warm lava cake.  It came with caramel toffee ice cream.  It wasn't bad but not that memorable.  The service wasn't as good as I would expect.  They brought out butter with the menu but didn't bring any bread till I mentioned it.  Refills were very slow too.  I ordered hot tea and they brought out the tea cup and hot water but no tea bags.

photos.caption: Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butterflied steak and crab legs
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm lava cake with caramel toffee ice cream - yummy!
Photo of Gallagher's Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta - very very good

SYB0RXqDo4wks5DXPryaEg.text: We just popped in here without a reservation and were seated immediately.  We started with a great Fig and Apple salad and Mushroom soup. Both were very good.  The soup was full of fresh mushrooms and the salad was a great combination of flavors.  We ordered too much food for two people but we always want to taste a lot of different things.  We ordered both the Brussel Sprouts and the Cauliflower.  The Sprouts were firm and very smokey.  The Cauliflower was bland and missing seasoning. We ordered the Rib Eye to share.  The waiter offered to slice it for us since we were sharing.  He hacked it up into some poorly cut pieces.  It was all chewed up and ugly but it had a nice flavor and was fairly tender for rib eye. We finished with a cream burlee that was nice but nothing special.

BQip2-yy4q-clY-fmNWQ5g.text: My wife and I were in Vegas for our 1st Anniversary. We had reservations at Prime Steakhouse in Bellagio but at the last minute we figured we could just eat in the hotel we were staying in. I don't know how good Prime steakhouse is, but we feel like we made the right decision.  Everything was delicious. Even the ketchup for the giant steak fries was good. I had the porterhouse and the wife had the filet with lobster tail. We shared the fries and green beans, I can tell you that I've never had green beans in a restaurant that I would brag about but these were so good.   The steaks were the best I have had. I will definitely be back

g8C8DngnNSs8DUyYhss3Zg.text: Everything on the menu is outstanding. They consistently have the best King Crab legs. Their aged beef is amazing. The decor and feel of the place is great. The ambiance of the Denver and NY locations are even better.

1uTyeo8tleg7xN7MB2B0BQ.text: Came here with my gf for our 6 month anniversary.  We ordered fillet mignon and ribeye steak.  Definitely one of the best steaks I ever had

_Oj6gp2haPPYxGQmo_pKWw.text: So, it's 9:44pm and were sitting in the booth ex post facto. We came to Vegas for a typical quarterly california tryst and found our way to gallaghers.  This place is the neighborhood steakhouse that you just refuse to let go. The only difference is that this place is in cool casino.   I'm gonna keep this short, but make sure you get the dry-aged new York steak and get it medium (medium-well was a lil over).   Lastly, request server paul. He isn't gonna come over and butter your bread, but he is the hometown server that we all love. He's a guy's guy and you'll see when you meet him.  Enjoy! Aaron G.

QXDfR0rhFlsjCgqqC5R-7A.text: If their dry aged NY steak was their best, then they are gonna need some work. I had one medium rare - very iffy. Fried calamari---skip it. I would definitely do the creme spinach, cause it was creamy. My brother had the cowboy rib-eye which tasted way better. I forgot to add that the prices are ridiculously cheap.

56dX-de_T9G05j1Xfcpjyw.text: Best steakhouse EVER.  The decor and ambiance of the restaurant could be spruced up a bit but the steak more than makes up for the negatives.  I ordered the rib eye and that first bite was just orgasmic...  The steak was perfectly seasoned with such an amazing flavor that just melted in my mouth.  I'm salivating just thinking about it.  My friend ordered the New York and that was just as good.  Definitely a place to visit while in Vegas.  Ask for some horseradish on the side as well.  They were the strongest horseradish I've ever had in my life but so so good.

chGQHc1zAjm4xb_ygt9Eqw.text: If there's one thing you go to Vegas for other than gambling and the shows its the fine dining. The quality of the food and the service is top notch! Its the least to expect in a place where money is no object. The steaks were amazing and the waiter's knowledge of wine pairing was icing on the cake. Make reservations! And in if you're not familiar with this type of dining side dishes are extra and there is enough for at least 3 people with each order. By the way, you'll find this restaraunt in NEW YORK NEW YORK. And for a special treat end your meal with a cup of their coffee! I didn't get a chance to ask what brand it was but was to die for!

r4piWcdlAFXXCBIMXjyhXQ.text: Probably the best Cowboy Ribeye I've ever had in Vegas!

9JMJ63rYwRuDmfRRkdug3w.text: 3 Words: Aged Prime Rib. Oh my! Make sure you have reservations, otherwise you'll be eating at the bar, if you're lucky.

u9gLH027YDOlbpKQ175Lxw.text: Worst steak house I have ever been to in Vegas. Went with friends and most everything was wrong with the food that we ordered.. and cold. Took about an hour to get our (well, whosoever it was) food after we were seated. Fuck, since nothing was right they should have just made up an order for us when we got there so it would have been at least warm when we got it. Was charged for everything we originally ordered that we never got. Not going back. I would rather shove shards of glass up my ass and sit in a tub of Tabasco sauce then endure this place again.

EihenQb3r38t1W0-NmUxfg.text: 2nd visit. Had reservations and we were seated right on time. Good service. Our waiter seemed to know his stuff and recommended a few choices. I thought it was a nice restaurant that wasn't too expensive. We had the dry-aged NY Sirloin and the Prime Rib of Beef with sides of mash, fries, and a salad. Mash was okay. Nothing special. Good fries though. No complaints about our beef. Overall, it was a good  dining experience.

v9Vh2Gil_UJutdkkQBfmsw.text: We came here to celebrate my friend's birthday.  He is a huge red meat fan.. and I heard through the grapevine from some Vegas locals, that this is the best place for some good steak.  I will definitely make a stop here for an intimate dinner each time I go back to Las Vegas.  I ordered the Alaskan split King Crab legs and my date ordered the Cowboy Bone In Ribeye.  Both were amazing.  Our side was the Four cheese macaroni, it was so-so.  We glanced at the plates of our neighboring tables and noticed that everything looked yummy.  The service was superb... we never had to ask for anything and all of the workers were attentive to everyone.  There was someone making rounds for photos.. and we didn't feel hassled by her at all.  But we were celebrating a special occasion and ended up purchasing the pictures anyway, and she even threw in an extra picture at no charge.

KTgOxNdip3RfetfvBM1UuQ.text: This place was great! Everything couldn't have been better. The food and service couldn't be beat. We will definitely be going back here on our next trip!

CTktohLINVdVXFOy4lXscg.text: The original is New York, but that only makes it more fitting that this steak mecca be located in the New York, New York resort in Las Vegas. Sit down and pick out a great piece of meat at a place that will remind of the steakhouses you've eaten at back east.

8j-BBTDKctM7eSJ_gU5Lxw.text: Overly-fatty, chewy sirloin steak, a wedge salad that has seen better days, and onion rings that might have been frozen: not what I look for in a $75 meal (which included $11 -- locally a good price -- for a passable Cabernet). The service was polite if somewhat intrusively attentive. By Vegas standards the atmosphere was reasonable -- noisy but not annoying.

lRW9vh9sqJ0VKwE0Hm-N1g.text: Very good steaks (if served at proper temp), so-so sides,  average drinks, and  below-average service.    In fact, I almost gave this place a 2 stars b/c of the service.  first, we arrive on-time for our reservation but have to wait 15 minutes even though we can see 10 empty tables in the main dining room.  Then, they sit us in the doorway then act like it's a huge hassle to move us b/c we don't want to sit in the doorway (and get brushed by the servers running back and forth)    Food took forever to come out, in fact my buddy sent his steak back since it was room temperature when it arrived.  Trust me, my party consisted of three, low maintence guys, and we are generally indifferent to the service, but in this case, it was so bad tht all of us were very disappointed.  Possibly we got a bum server.  If they could guarantee better service and sides, I'd definitely go back since the steak was excellent.  In the meantime, I'll stick to Nine - IMO, the best steak joint in LV.

0gX0b2S8WRwe_Ll-SJi8bA.text: Went here a month or so ago, and i thought it was just ok. I ordered the signature steak and my girlfriend got the ribeye and we both ended up putting steak sauce on it for flavor................... the french fries are big pieces of potatoes and  we were actually  dissappointed in that as well. The service was great.

U7u4xTlPuemmYsI0eeNfWQ.text: This was my first time to Gallagher's even though I am a Gallagher and my father is from Brooklyn.  He has told me many times this restaurant would not disappoint and it certainly did not.  The steak was one of the best Porterhouse steaks I've ever had. I too am not a huge dessert fan at restaurants but was recommended the toffee pudding cake.  WOW, I still think about it today.  It was like a toffee bar in every bite. I was worried it would be like bread pudding (not a fan at all, too dry).  This dessert was tasty and gooey and definitely memorable. The wait staff was excellent and very attentive.  Great experience!    Kathy Gallagher

cbgtsJij2O6hCdsqn3zzVQ.text: Delicious steak!!  Ambiance is nice.  We came here with a party of 13 with a reservation.  The hostess was a bit stuck up telling us she needed 9 out of 13 of us to be present in order to be seated.  I understand the reasoning behind their policy but she was very rude about it.  Things were better once we were seated.  Our waiter was very attentive and informative.  Our table ordered the mussels and calamari.  I personally didn't think it was anything special.  Our entrees arrived and it made up for the apps.  I ordered prime-rib and the significant other ordered their house special which was the the aged-steak.  The entrees were HUGE and super filling and their sides were delightful.  We did not have time for desert but that will be on the list next time.

gXCT5IuqyoKP-IV6EQSTPA.text: Wonderful salmon and swordfish steaks, not to mention beef done to perfection that you can cut with the side of your fork. I took my father and stepmother here for their wedding reception and my father swears up and down that this was the best steak he's had in his life. Him and my stepmother go back to Gallagher's and enjoy it again and again. The BEST in aged beef - best food in Vegas!  If you want to love your food, remember you get what you pay for. Don't waste your time going to some POS Vegas buffet. Gallagher's is THE place.

KZe0XnXlgBsjCRr9agssRg.text: The aged sirloin, their specialty, is still the best steak I've ever had. Super convenient location right in the New York New York hotel. I'll definitely be stopping again next time I'm in Vegas.

xCWG9z52cWNiS0eOWWbNkw.text: Absolutely delicious and worth every penny! Every course we had was a great representation of perfection ;) Our server was fantastic and very knowledgeable. Every recommendation he made was delicious! The only flaw of the meal was slightly undercooked risotto, but all the proteins, greens, etc. were cooked and seasoned to perfection! We'll definitely be eating here again! Maybe even tomorrow! ;)

VnsiPLh3yumLXru9lwH9Xg.text: My husband loves red meat... I do not. They have a dress code [sort of.. men must have sleeved shirts]. My husband got the dry aged NY and seemed to really love it. I just got a baked potato.. which was HUGE and a meal in itself. The staff was very nice! The atmosphere looked like an old steakhouse. The dirty martini was delicious, but we were there and had to wait for quite awhile to get our food, even at 10pm during the week.
